original: de nyid de lta bas na 'di ni gdon bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid de lta bas na 'di ni gdon bar mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should not deny it.

original: de bas na 'di la skur pa btab na yang kha na ma tho ba yongs su rdzogs par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'di la skur pa btab na yang kha na ma tho ba yongs su rdzogs par shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, even if one denies it, one should understand that the sin is complete.

original: 'di las phyi rol pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa las phyi rol du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di las phyi rol pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa las phyi rol du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that person is outside of this, he is outside of the teaching of the Tathāgata.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says,

original: gzhan mu stegs can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan mu stegs can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “other tīrthikas, etc.”

original: mu stegs can ni gcer bu zad byed de sgren mo'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mu stegs can ni gcer bu zad byed de sgren mo'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Tīrthika means naked, one who practices annihilation, one who is naked, i.e., one who is without a spiritual practice.

original: mu stegs ni thar pa'i chu bor 'jug pa'i lam ste /
analyzed: mu stegs ni thar pa'i chu bor 'jug pa'i lam ste /
translated: Tīrtha means the path that enters the river of liberation.

original: 'di dag la de yod pas so //🔽dge sbyong ni sdom can te /🔽kun du 'tsho byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di dag la de yod pas so // dge sbyong ni sdom can te / kun du 'tsho byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because they have that, they are tīrthikas.

original: dpyod pa pa ni mu stegs can gyi rnam pa rab tu 'byung ba dag go //
analyzed: dpyod pa pa ni mu stegs can gyi rnam pa rab tu 'byung ba dag go //
translated: Śramaṇa means one who is restrained, one who is completely restrained, i.e., one who is completely restrained in body and speech.

original: kun du rgyu ba ni rab tu byung ba gos kha dog sgyur ba can dag kho na'o //
analyzed: kun du rgyu ba ni rab tu byung ba gos kha dog sgyur ba can dag kho na'o //
translated: Vratin means one who is a tīrthika in form, but who has gone forth.🔽Parivrājaka means one who has gone forth, but who is not a monk.

original: 'di las phyi rol pa rnams la pham pa'i tha snyad med mod kyi //
analyzed: 'di las phyi rol pa rnams la pham pa'i tha snyad med mod kyi //
translated: Non-Buddhists do not have the term “defeat” in this regard.

original: 'on kyang chos 'di la ltos nas bam pa'i tha snyad gdags te /🔽'og ma khyim pa la skur ba btab pa la sogs pa la yang de dang 'dra @272a * //
analyzed: 'on kyang chos 'di la ltos nas bam pa'i tha snyad gdags te / 'og ma khyim pa la skur ba btab pa la sogs pa la yang de dang 'dra @272a * //
translated: However, in relation to this Dharma, the term “defeat” is designated.

original: bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bar shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the same applies to the lower lay vows, such as when one reviles the Buddha.

original: 'di la ni ma brtags pa yin pa'i phyir nyes byas so //
analyzed: 'di la ni ma brtags pa yin pa'i phyir nyes byas so //
translated: Here, it is a minor offense because it is not analyzed.

original: za ma la sogs pa la skur pa btab na sbom por gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: za ma la sogs pa la skur pa btab na sbom por gsungs pa ni /
translated: It is said that reviling neuters and so on is a serious offense,

original: dge slong nyid med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dge slong nyid med pa'i phyir te /
translated: because they are not fully ordained monks.

original: 'di ltar ji ltar ma ning sdom pa'i zhing ma yin pa'i phyir dang / bar ma do yin pa'i phyir tha snyad du mi rung ba de dang 'dra bar za ma yang bcom ldan 'das kyis de dang de las tha snyad du mi rung ba nyid du gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar ji ltar ma ning sdom pa'i zhing ma yin pa'i phyir dang / bar ma do yin pa'i phyir tha snyad du mi rung ba de dang 'dra bar za ma yang bcom ldan 'das kyis de dang de las tha snyad du mi rung ba nyid du gsungs so //
translated: Just as neuters are not suitable as the basis of vows because they are not the middle state, the Blessed One has said that neuters are not suitable as the basis of vows in this and that context.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir dge slong gir gtogs pa'i kha na ma tho ba rnams kyi nang du yang 'di'i tshul ni de kho na yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir dge slong gir gtogs pa'i kha na ma tho ba rnams kyi nang du yang 'di'i tshul ni de kho na yin no //
translated: For this reason, the eunuch is not included among the transgressions proper to the monk.

original: gzhan dag na re ji ltar ma ning 'jig rten gyi tha snyad las 'das pa'i phyir tha snyad du mi rung ba ltar za ma ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re ji ltar ma ning 'jig rten gyi tha snyad las 'das pa'i phyir tha snyad du mi rung ba ltar za ma ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: According to other masters, the hermaphrodite is not excluded from the status of monk, because he can cultivate the path, and because he is not an object of sexual desire for either men or women.

original: de lta bas na 'di la ni tha snyad du mi rung ba nyid kyi tshul med do //🔽gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir dge slong gir gtogs pa'i kha na ma tho ba rnams kyi nang du yang de las gzhan pa'i dge slong bzhin du 'di'i kha na ma tho ba yongs su rdzogs pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pa de bzhin du
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di la ni tha snyad du mi rung ba nyid kyi tshul med do // gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir dge slong gir gtogs pa'i kha na ma tho ba rnams kyi nang du yang de las gzhan pa'i dge slong bzhin du 'di'i kha na ma tho ba yongs su rdzogs pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pa de bzhin du
translated: For this reason, the hermaphrodite is not excluded from the status of monk.🔽For this reason, the eunuch is not included among the transgressions proper to the monk, just as the other monks are not included among them.

original: khyim pa 'dir gtogs pa'i kha na ma tho ba rnams kyi nang du yang /🔽khyim pa yongs su rdzogs pa dang 'dra'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: khyim pa 'dir gtogs pa'i kha na ma tho ba rnams kyi nang du yang /🔽khyim pa yongs su rdzogs pa dang 'dra'o zhes zer ro //
translated: In the same way, the hermaphrodite is not included among the transgressions proper to the layman, just as the other laymen are not included among them.

original: de lta bas na bshad ma thag pa'i tshul gyis na 'di 'dul ba 'dzin pa ril gyi gzhung lugs ni ma yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na bshad ma thag pa'i tshul gyis na 'di 'dul ba 'dzin pa ril gyi gzhung lugs ni ma yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, you should understand that this is not the scriptural system of all the Vinaya masters.

original: kha cig ni de bzhin gshegs pa la ngan sems kyis khrag phyung ba la skur pa btab pa yang sbom por 'dod de /
analyzed: kha cig ni de bzhin gshegs pa la ngan sems kyis khrag phyung ba la skur pa btab pa yang sbom por 'dod de /
translated: Some say: The denial of the offense of drawing blood from the Tathāgata with evil intent is a serious offense.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: That is illogical.

original: 'di ltar de tsam gyis ni 'di'i dge slong nyid med pa ma yin gyi dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa'i dge slong bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar de tsam gyis ni 'di'i dge slong nyid med pa ma yin gyi dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa'i dge slong bzhin no //
translated: Because the mere fact that one is not a fully ordained monk does not mean that one is not a monk, just as the monk who causes a schism in the saṅgha is not a monk.

original: de nyid kyi phyir nye ba 'khor gang gis pha dang ma dang / dgra bcom pa gsod pas skur pa btab pa des ni pham pa'i chos kyis skur pa btab pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir nye ba 'khor gang gis pha dang ma dang / dgra bcom pa gsod pas skur pa btab pa des ni pham pa'i chos kyis skur pa btab pa yin no //
translated: Thus Upāli, if one denies the defeat of killing one’s mother or father or an arhat, one denies the Dharma.

original: gang gis dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa dang / ngan sems kyis khrag 'byin pas skur pa btab pa des ni /
analyzed: gang gis dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa dang / ngan sems kyis khrag 'byin pas skur pa btab pa des ni /
translated: If one denies the serious offense of causing a schism in the saṅgha or drawing blood with evil intent,

original: nyes pa sbom por skur pa btab pa yin te /
analyzed: nyes pa sbom por skur pa btab pa yin te /
translated: one commits a serious offense.

original: nyes pa sbom por ni dge slong ma yin par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: nyes pa sbom por ni dge slong ma yin par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: But it is not a serious offense that makes one no longer a monk.

original: de ni bshags par 'os pa yin no zhes 'chad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni bshags par 'os pa yin no zhes 'chad par 'gyur te /
translated: It is an offense that should be confessed.

original: 'dis ni de bzhin gshegs pa la ngan sems kyis khrag 'byin pa dang / dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa ni dge slong dag ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni de bzhin gshegs pa la ngan sems kyis khrag 'byin pa dang / dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa ni dge slong dag ma yin te /
translated: This passage teaches that one who draws blood with evil intent toward the Tathagata and one who causes a schism in the order are not monks.

original: de las gzhan pa'i dge slong bzhin no zhes bstan pa yin no //🔽@272b de'i phyir za ma la sogs pa'i tshan las bkar te /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i dge slong bzhin no zhes bstan pa yin no // @272b de'i phyir za ma la sogs pa'i tshan las bkar te /
translated: They are like monks who commit other offenses.

original: dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa la sogs pa'i tshan la skur pa btab na /🔽dge 'dun lhag ma kho nar 'gyur bar gdon par bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa la sogs pa'i tshan la skur pa btab na / dge 'dun lhag ma kho nar 'gyur bar gdon par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should understand that the offense of a root downfall is incurred by disparaging those who have committed a root downfall, such as a hermaphrodite, and so on, but not by disparaging those who have committed a root downfall, such as causing a schism in the order, and so on.

original: 'di man chad kyi phyogs dag tu yang 'di dge slong nyid yin par sems la bzhag nas ltung ba dag ci rigs par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di man chad kyi phyogs dag tu yang 'di dge slong nyid yin par sems la bzhag nas ltung ba dag ci rigs par shes par bya'o //
translated: From this point on, one should understand that the downfalls are incurred by those who consider themselves to be monks.

original: gzhan dag na re gang gis bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i sngon rol du khrag phyung ba de 'dir gzung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re gang gis bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i sngon rol du khrag phyung ba de 'dir gzung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Others say that this refers to one who draws blood before full ordination.

original: mtshams med pa byas pas /
analyzed: mtshams med pa byas pas /
translated: Because he has committed heinous acts,

original: bsnyen par rdzogs pa chags pa med pa'i phyir ma gsod pa la sogs pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs pa chags pa med pa'i phyir ma gsod pa la sogs pa lta bu yin no //
translated: he is not a fully ordained monk, like one who has killed his mother.

original: bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i gnas skabs ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i gnas skabs ni ma yin no //
translated: But he is not a fully ordained monk at the time of taking vows.

original: de ni de'i tshe dge slong nyid med par ma gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni de'i tshe dge slong nyid med par ma gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: Because at that time he does not become a non-monk.

original: dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa yin no //
translated: He is a schismatic of the Saṅgha.

original: dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed par yang gang gis bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i gnas skabs na dge 'dun gyi dbyen byas la phyis bslab pa phul nas bsnyen par rdzogs pa de la yang /🔽sdom pa ma chags pa kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed par yang gang gis bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i gnas skabs na dge 'dun gyi dbyen byas la phyis bslab pa phul nas bsnyen par rdzogs pa de la yang / sdom pa ma chags pa kho na yin gyi /
translated: One who commits schism of the Saṅgha is also not a fully ordained monk at the time of taking vows, but he is a fully ordained monk when he commits schism of the Saṅgha.

original: bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi ni ma yin te /
translated: But he is not a fully ordained monk at the time of schism of the Saṅgha.

original: de ni de'i tshe dge slong nyid yin par bshad mi dgos par 'grub po //
analyzed: de ni de'i tshe dge slong nyid yin par bshad mi dgos par 'grub po //
translated: Because at that time it is established that he is a monk, and it is unnecessary to explain that.

original: de'i phyir 'di gnyis ni za ma la sogs pa bzhin du /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di gnyis ni za ma la sogs pa bzhin du /
translated: Therefore, like eunuchs and so on,

original: sdom pa ma skyes pas dge slong nyid ma yin par shes par bya la /
analyzed: sdom pa ma skyes pas dge slong nyid ma yin par shes par bya la /
translated: it should be understood that these two are not monks because their vows do not arise.

original: dge slong nyid ma yin pa la ni sbom po kho nar 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dge slong nyid ma yin pa la ni sbom po kho nar 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: But if it is not a fully ordained monk, then it is only a serious violation.

original: gal te ci'i phyir gnas par mi bya ba dang / tha dad du gnas pa dang / khas blangs pa dang / bslab pa byin pa'i dge slong rnams la skur pa btab na /
analyzed: gal te ci'i phyir gnas par mi bya ba dang / tha dad du gnas pa dang / khas blangs pa dang / bslab pa byin pa'i dge slong rnams la skur pa btab na /
translated: If one denigrates the fully ordained monks who are not to be treated as a basis, who are to be treated as a basis separately, who have taken a vow, or who have received training,

original: ltung ba yongs su rdzogs pa rnam par bzhag /
analyzed: ltung ba yongs su rdzogs pa rnam par bzhag /
translated: then the complete downfall is posited.

original: 'di ltar 'di dag la skur ba btab na /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di dag la skur ba btab na /
translated: Because if one denigrates them,

original: ltung ba ni smad dgos te /
analyzed: ltung ba ni smad dgos te /
translated: one must be condemned for that downfall,

original: de las gzhan pa'i ltung ba bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i ltung ba bzhin no zhe na /
translated: like any other downfall.

original: 'dul ba 'dzin pa rnams na re de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dul ba 'dzin pa rnams na re de ni ma yin te /
translated: But the Vinaya masters say that is not so,

original: 'di ni che thad du dge sbyong gi rigs su na 'byin pa'i sgor 'gyur ba dang / shin tu tha cad yin pas 'di dag la skur pa btab na yang ltung ba 'dra ba nyid du yang rnam par bzhag go zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'di ni che thad du dge sbyong gi rigs su na 'byin pa'i sgor 'gyur ba dang / shin tu tha cad yin pas 'di dag la skur pa btab na yang ltung ba 'dra ba nyid du yang rnam par bzhag go zhes zer ro //
translated: because these are the doors for expulsion from the class of virtuous ascetics and they are the most despised. Therefore, even if one denigrates them, the downfall is posited as similar.

original: nyes byas so zhes bya ba 'di la ni phas pham pas skur pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: nyes byas so zhes bya ba 'di la ni phas pham pas skur pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: In this case, it is a misdeed because there is no denigration of the defeat.

original: kha na ma tho ba chung ngu dag la ni chung ngu'i cha nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba chung ngu dag la ni chung ngu'i cha nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and for minor offenses, it is a minor part.🔽Why is that?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba 'di ni gzhi de dag gang gi phyir yin pa'o //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba 'di ni gzhi de dag gang gi phyir yin pa'o //
translated: This is the basis for that.

original: gzhan dag na re rgyu gang gi phyir zhes bya ba yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re rgyu gang gi phyir zhes bya ba yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that it is the cause for that.

original: dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed @273a * //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed @273a * //
translated: Causing a schism in the Saṅgha,

original: pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: sbom po 'di gnyis ni go rims bzhin du /
analyzed: sbom po 'di gnyis ni go rims bzhin du /
translated: These two grave offenses should be understood as, respectively,

original: dge 'dun gyi dbyen la zhugs pa mi gtong ba dang / mi gsod pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi dbyen la zhugs pa mi gtong ba dang / mi gsod pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: not giving up engaging in a schism in the Saṅgha and being in accord with the side that kills.

original: bdag nyid khas len pas bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: bdag nyid khas len pas bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: By accepting oneself, by actions, and so on,

original: dge 'dun lhag mar gsungs pa 'dis ni pham pa byung ba la skur na yang dge 'dun lhag mar gyur pa kho na'o zhes de skad du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag mar gsungs pa 'dis ni pham pa byung ba la skur na yang dge 'dun lhag mar gyur pa kho na'o zhes de skad du bstan pa yin no //
translated: this is called a partial defeat. This teaches that even if one accuses one who has incurred a defeating offense, it is still only a partial defeat.

original: bshags par 'os pas dge 'dun gyi mdun du bshags pas ltung ba ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshags par 'os pas dge 'dun gyi mdun du bshags pas ltung ba ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is to be confessed in the presence of the Sangha, because the downfall is stopped by confession in the presence of those worthy of receiving confession.

original: so sor bshags par bgyi ba ni gnas kyi nang na 'dug pa'i dge slong gi mdun du bsgrags pa nyid kyis ltung ba ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so sor bshags par bgyi ba ni gnas kyi nang na 'dug pa'i dge slong gi mdun du bsgrags pa nyid kyis ltung ba ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is to be confessed individually, because the downfall is stopped by confessing it to a monk present in the same dwelling.

original: zhus pa la la las gzhan yang 'di skad du //
analyzed: zhus pa la la las gzhan yang 'di skad du //
translated: Some ask:

original: dge 'dun gyi dbus su mi tshangs par spyad pa byas so //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi dbus su mi tshangs par spyad pa byas so //
translated: “I have had sexual intercourse in the midst of the Sangha.”

original: ma sha ka lnga las lhag par brkus so //
analyzed: ma sha ka lnga las lhag par brkus so //
translated: “I have stolen more than five coins.”

original: mi'i srog dang phral lo //
analyzed: mi'i srog dang phral lo //
translated: “I have taken the life of a human.”🔽“I have lied about having attained exalted states.”

original: mi'i chos bla mar gyur pa yang dag pa ma yin par smras so zhes ma nges par smras kyi che ge mo zhig gis zhes ma smras na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi'i chos bla mar gyur pa yang dag pa ma yin par smras so zhes ma nges par smras kyi che ge mo zhig gis zhes ma smras na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: If one says this without specifying the action, the downfall is serious.

original: dge slong stan las longs na kho bo las bsams te smras pa yod do zhes zer na skye bo thams cad pa'i nyes byas so //
analyzed: dge slong stan las longs na kho bo las bsams te smras pa yod do zhes zer na skye bo thams cad pa'i nyes byas so //
translated: If a monk says, “I will get up from my seat and tell you,” and then says, “I have done what I intended,” all the monks present commit an offense of wrongdoing.

original: ma ning dang lhan cig skur pa 'debs na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //🔽ma ning ma dang lhan cig skur pa 'debs na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma ning dang lhan cig skur pa 'debs na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro // ma ning ma dang lhan cig skur pa 'debs na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: If one denigrates with a neuter, there is a serious offense.🔽If one denigrates with a female neuter, there is a serious offense.

original: rnam par ma ning dang lhan cig skur pa 'debs na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rnam par ma ning dang lhan cig skur pa 'debs na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: If one denigrates with a hermaphrodite, there is a serious offense.🔽The uncertain, the eunuch,

original: ma nges langs dang ma ning dang // ma ning mo rnams ma ning ste //
analyzed: ma nges langs dang ma ning dang // ma ning mo rnams ma ning ste //
translated: and the female eunuch are eunuchs.

original: zhus pa 'ga' las skur pa yin //
analyzed: zhus pa 'ga' las skur pa yin //
translated: Denigration is from some questions.

original: bsdu ba gzhan 'di 'byung ba yin //🔽zhes bya ba zhig bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: bsdu ba gzhan 'di 'byung ba yin // zhes bya ba zhig bsdu ba yin no //
translated: This other summary occurs:

original: de la don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is this.

original: ma nges pa ni ming smos pa med par ro //
analyzed: ma nges pa ni ming smos pa med par ro //
translated: The uncertain is without mentioning the name.

original: nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di la ni ming ma smos pa'i phyir skur ba yongs su rdzogs pa ma yin pa nyid pas dngos gzhi med pa'i phyir 'di yin no //
analyzed: nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di la ni ming ma smos pa'i phyir skur ba yongs su rdzogs pa ma yin pa nyid pas dngos gzhi med pa'i phyir 'di yin no //
translated: Here, in “there is a serious offense,” since the denigration is not complete because the name is not mentioned, there is no actual basis.

original: bsams te smras pa ni don gzhan las bsams te smras pa'o //
analyzed: bsams te smras pa ni don gzhan las bsams te smras pa'o //
translated: Intentional speech is from another meaning.

original: skye bo thams cad pa ni skye bo thams cad ni skye bo mang po'i dbang du byas nas zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye bo thams cad pa ni skye bo thams cad ni skye bo mang po'i dbang du byas nas zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: All beings means that it is done with respect to many beings.

original: nyes byas so zhes bya ba 'di la ni 'dir su la skur pa 'debs pa med kyi /
analyzed: nyes byas so zhes bya ba 'di la ni 'dir su la skur pa 'debs pa med kyi /
translated: Here, in this case, there is no one to whom it is spoken, but

original: 'di ni skur ba btab pa'i don du zhugs pa 'ba' zhig tu zad bas sbyor ba'i sbyor bar @273b gyur pa'i phyir 'di yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni skur ba btab pa'i don du zhugs pa 'ba' zhig tu zad bas sbyor ba'i sbyor bar @273b gyur pa'i phyir 'di yin no //
translated: it is just the act of speaking that is the basis for the offense.

original: ma ning dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ma ning skur ba btab pa'i dge slong ma la srid de /
analyzed: ma ning dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ma ning skur ba btab pa'i dge slong ma la srid de /
translated: The term eunuch and so on refers to a nun who speaks disparagingly to a monk who is a eunuch.

original: de bas na dge slong ma la pham pa spyod pa'i zla bo pho'i dbang po dang bral ba bsten du mi rung ba dang skur pa 'debs pa na kha na ma tho ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: de bas na dge slong ma la pham pa spyod pa'i zla bo pho'i dbang po dang bral ba bsten du mi rung ba dang skur pa 'debs pa na kha na ma tho ba 'di yin no //
translated: Therefore, for a nun, this is a downfall that is a basis of defeat when she relies on a male partner who engages in the act of defeat but lacks a male organ, and when she speaks disparagingly.

original: dge slong la ni ma ning mo dang / rnam par ma ning dag dang skur pa 'debs pa srid do //
analyzed: dge slong la ni ma ning mo dang / rnam par ma ning dag dang skur pa 'debs pa srid do //
translated: For a monk, it is possible to speak disparagingly to a female eunuch or a neuter.

original: dge slong dang ma ning dang rnam par ma ning dang skur pa 'debs pa la sbom por gsungs pa yang kha dang bshad pa'i lam gyi dbang du ma byas par shes par bya ste /🔽'di ltar de dag dang skur pa 'debs na pham pa kho nas skur pa btab par 'gyur la /
analyzed: dge slong dang ma ning dang rnam par ma ning dang skur pa 'debs pa la sbom por gsungs pa yang kha dang bshad pa'i lam gyi dbang du ma byas par shes par bya ste / 'di ltar de dag dang skur pa 'debs na pham pa kho nas skur pa btab par 'gyur la /
translated: Also, the statement that it is a serious transgression to lie to a fully ordained monk, a eunuch, a hermaphrodite, or one who has committed an defeating offense should be understood not to refer to the mouth or the path of the anus.🔽Because if one lies to them and to one who has committed an defeating offense, one commits only a defeating offense.

original: des skur pa btab na yang dngos gzhir 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des skur pa btab na yang dngos gzhir 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And if one lies to them, one commits a basis of defeat.

original: gzhan na re pho dang mo'i dbang po dang bral ba dang skur pa 'debs pa gang yin pa de ni pham par gtogs pa'i sbom pos skur pa 'debs pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan na re pho dang mo'i dbang po dang bral ba dang skur pa 'debs pa gang yin pa de ni pham par gtogs pa'i sbom pos skur pa 'debs pa yin te /
translated: Others say: One who is devoid of male or female organs or one who has committed a defeating offense lies with a serious transgression that is part of a defeating offense.

original: bsten du rung ba med na pham pa mi slong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsten du rung ba med na pham pa mi slong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if one is not suitable to rely upon, one does not incur a defeating offense.

original: sbom pos skur pa btab pa la sbom por 'gyur pa yang brjod par mi nus te /
analyzed: sbom pos skur pa btab pa la sbom por 'gyur pa yang brjod par mi nus te /
translated: It is also impossible to say that lying with a serious transgression is a serious transgression.

original: dge 'dun lhag mas skur pa btab pa la yang ltung byed du gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag mas skur pa btab pa la yang ltung byed du gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said that lying with a partial defeat is a downfall requiring confession.

original: de skad du yang gzhi med par nyes pa sbom por skur pa btab na nyes byas so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de skad du yang gzhi med par nyes pa sbom por skur pa btab na nyes byas so zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus, if one falsely claims that a person has a grave offense without a basis, it is a wrong action.

original: dge 'dun lhag mar gtogs pa'i sbom po 'dir gsungs so zhes brjod par yang mi nus te /
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag mar gtogs pa'i sbom po 'dir gsungs so zhes brjod par yang mi nus te /
translated: One cannot say that this is a grave offense belonging to the class of partial defeats,

original: spyir gsungs pa'i phyir dang gzhan gang las kyang pham par gtogs pa'i nyes pa sbom por skur pa btab pa la ltung ba gzhan ma gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyir gsungs pa'i phyir dang gzhan gang las kyang pham par gtogs pa'i nyes pa sbom por skur pa btab pa la ltung ba gzhan ma gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is stated in general and because no other downfall is mentioned for falsely claiming that a person has a grave offense belonging to the class of defeats.

original: de lta bas na nyes pa sbom por smos pa ni 'ga' zhig gis bshad pa'i dbang gis sgro btags pa yin pas 'dir nyes byas su gsungs pa nyid bzang ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na nyes pa sbom por smos pa ni 'ga' zhig gis bshad pa'i dbang gis sgro btags pa yin pas 'dir nyes byas su gsungs pa nyid bzang ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, the statement about a grave offense is a superimposition by the power of explanation by some. Therefore, it is best to say that this is a wrong action.

original: gzhi med par skur pa 'debs pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma gtan la dbab pa'o /
analyzed: gzhi med par skur pa 'debs pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma gtan la dbab pa'o /
translated: This is the definitive statement on the partial defeat of falsely claiming that a person has a grave offense without a basis.

original: // / gzhan gyi cha dang mthun pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: // / gzhan gyi cha dang mthun pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The partial concordance with a portion of another

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: Another refers to nirvana,

original: 'khor ba las bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba las bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the opposite of samsara.

original: de'i cha dang mthun pa ma yin pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyon mongs pa can gyi phyogs rnams so //
analyzed: de'i cha dang mthun pa ma yin pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyon mongs pa can gyi phyogs rnams so //
translated: The opposite of that is the side of the afflicted class that is not conducive to that.

original: de la yod pa ni gzhan gyi cha dang mthun pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la yod pa ni gzhan gyi cha dang mthun pa ma yin te /
translated: The opposite of that is the side of the uncontaminated class that is conducive to that.

original: pham pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: pham pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: The four defeats are the opposite of that.

original: yang na gzhan du bstan pa ni gzhan gyi cha'o //
analyzed: yang na gzhan du bstan pa ni gzhan gyi cha'o //
translated: Or else, the opposite of that is the side of another,

original: @274a * // de dang mthun pa ni gzhan gyi cha dang mthun pa ste /
analyzed: @274a * // de dang mthun pa ni gzhan gyi cha dang mthun pa ste /
translated: and that which is conducive to that is conducive to the side of another.

original: gzugs por skur pa 'debs pa'i rnam pa las gzhan pa gzugs po ma yin par skur pa 'debs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzugs por skur pa 'debs pa'i rnam pa las gzhan pa gzugs po ma yin par skur pa 'debs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is the denial of the existence of the body that is other than the denial of the aspect of the existence of the body.

original: gzhan dag na re gzhan gyi cha dang mthun pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba la gzhan zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re gzhan gyi cha dang mthun pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba la gzhan zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Others say that the opposite of that is the side of another, and that which is conducive to that is conducive to the side of another.🔽The meaning is that it is the denial of the existence of the body that is other than the denial of the aspect of the existence of the body.

original: de'i cha dang mthun pa ma yin pa ni pham pa'i chos bzhi'o zhes bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis rnam par 'byed pa las bshad pa'i phyir gzhung 'di la ma yin pa zhes bya ba kho na yod par shes par bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i cha dang mthun pa ma yin pa ni pham pa'i chos bzhi'o zhes bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis rnam par 'byed pa las bshad pa'i phyir gzhung 'di la ma yin pa zhes bya ba kho na yod par shes par bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: The four defeating offenses are not conducive to that, because the Bhagavat himself explained them in the Vinaya.

original: 'dir pham pa smos pa yod bzhin du gzhan gyi cha dang mthun pa ma yin pa zhes smos pa gang yin pa de ni pham pa'i skyon brjod pa'i phyir te /🔽pham pa'i chos ni mya ngan las 'das pa dang / 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir pham pa smos pa yod bzhin du gzhan gyi cha dang mthun pa ma yin pa zhes smos pa gang yin pa de ni pham pa'i skyon brjod pa'i phyir te / pham pa'i chos ni mya ngan las 'das pa dang / 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, the term “not conducive” is used in the context of defeating offenses, but it is also used in the context of other offenses.🔽The term “defeat” is used because the four defeating offenses are the greatest of all offenses, because they are the most shameful, and because they are the greatest obstacles to nirvana.

original: rtsod pa gzhan gyi cha dang mthun pa ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni pham pa'i ltung ba'i rgyu can las so //
analyzed: rtsod pa gzhan gyi cha dang mthun pa ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni pham pa'i ltung ba'i rgyu can las so //
translated: The term “not conducive” is used because they are the cause of downfalls.🔽The term “mere” means a small part.

analyzed: bag tsam zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bag tsam ni shan tsam mo // de las bsams pa ni mnos pa ste /

original: bag tsam las bsams pa'i thabs kyis smras pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bag tsam las bsams pa'i thabs kyis smras pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The term “from that” means from that mere part.🔽The

original: 'di la de kho na tsam gyi tshad cig yod pas na bag tsam las bsams pa tsam ste /🔽dper na dge slong btsun pa bshes gnyen dang / sa pha dag gis ri dags dag 'jug pa mthong nas tse dang ldan pa gyad bu nor yang mthong ngo //🔽dge slong ma autpa la'i mdog kyang mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'di la de kho na tsam gyi tshad cig yod pas na bag tsam las bsams pa tsam ste / dper na dge slong btsun pa bshes gnyen dang / sa pha dag gis ri dags dag 'jug pa mthong nas tse dang ldan pa gyad bu nor yang mthong ngo // dge slong ma autpa la'i mdog kyang mthong ngo //
translated: It is a mere trifle, a mere thought, because it is a mere measure of reality.🔽For example, when the virtuous monks Mitrāyaṇa and Bhūmitra saw deer enter a forest, they said, “We see the deer enter the forest, and we see the virtuous Gyadbu-nor also.

original: mi tshangs par spyod pa 'khrig pa las byung ba'i chos bsten pa yang mthong ngo zhes smras pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: mi tshangs par spyod pa 'khrig pa las byung ba'i chos bsten pa yang mthong ngo zhes smras pa lta bu ste /
translated: We see the nun Utpalavarna, and we see the practice of sexual union, the practice of impure conduct.”

original: brjod par 'dod pa'i don go bar byed na byed pa po dang bya ba 'brel pa bkar te /
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa'i don go bar byed na byed pa po dang bya ba 'brel pa bkar te /
translated: If the meaning one wishes to express is understood, then the agent and action are related.

original: ma smos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ma smos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because it is not mentioned, that is the meaning.

original: blangs par gyur pa ni yongs su bzung bar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: blangs par gyur pa ni yongs su bzung bar gyur pa ste /
translated: That which has been taken up is that which has been fully grasped.

original: de yid la bzhag par gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de yid la bzhag par gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That is the meaning of “that which is placed in the mind.”

original: gzhung lhag ma ni btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis pho nya las zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no ;🔽/ gzhan gyi cha dang mthun pa ma yin pas skur pa 'debs pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma gtan la dbab pa'o /
analyzed: gzhung lhag ma ni btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis pho nya las zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no ; / gzhan gyi cha dang mthun pa ma yin pas skur pa 'debs pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma gtan la dbab pa'o /
translated: The remaining text is: “Venerable, a monk, through a messenger, etc.”

original: // / dge 'dun ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun te /
analyzed: // / dge 'dun ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun te /
translated: The Saṅgha is the Tathāgata’s community of disciples.

original: gzhan gyi tshogs phye na ltung ba gzhan yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshogs phye na ltung ba gzhan yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If one causes a schism in another’s community, there is another downfall.

original: mthun pa ni rtags dang / las dang / @274b tshul khrims dang / lta ba dang / spyod pa dang / 'tsho ba dag gi ro gcig pa ste /
analyzed: mthun pa ni rtags dang / las dang / @274b tshul khrims dang / lta ba dang / spyod pa dang / 'tsho ba dag gi ro gcig pa ste /
translated: Harmony is the same taste in the marks, actions, morality, views, conduct, and livelihood.

original: mi mthun pa phye ba la ni ltung ba 'di med do //
analyzed: mi mthun pa phye ba la ni ltung ba 'di med do //
translated: If one causes a schism in a community that is not harmonious, there is no downfall.

original: dbye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dbye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: In the line “in order to cause a schism,”

original: 'byed pa ni ston pa dang / lam gzhan la bzod na gnyis su 'byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'byed pa ni ston pa dang / lam gzhan la bzod na gnyis su 'byed pa ste /
translated: a schism is a division into two of those who accept a different teacher and path.

original: de'i ched du'o //
analyzed: de'i ched du'o //
translated: It is for that purpose.

original: rtul bar byed pa ni rtsol bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: rtul bar byed pa ni rtsol bar byed pa ste /
translated: To instigate is to strive for that.

original: tshul shing 'drim pa'am gsol ba byed pas brtson par byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: tshul shing 'drim pa'am gsol ba byed pas brtson par byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: Or, the meaning is that one should be diligent in distributing the voting tickets or in making the announcement.

original: yid kyis ni ltung ba 'dir mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid kyis ni ltung ba 'dir mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no downfall if one does so mentally.

original: cing zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'am zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don to //
analyzed: cing zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'am zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don to //
translated: The word “or” means “or else.”

original: dbyen byed par 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: dbyen byed par 'gyur ba ni /
translated: One will cause a schism in the order

original: dbyen byed pa'i rgyu mtshan zas skom la sogs pa sbyin pa dang / grogs tshol ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: dbyen byed pa'i rgyu mtshan zas skom la sogs pa sbyin pa dang / grogs tshol ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: by giving food, drink, and so on, or by seeking allies.

original: rtsod pa ni 'gyed pa'i rtsod pa'o //🔽yang dag par blangs nas zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa nyid du 'chel nas so //🔽rab tu bzung ste zhes bya ba ni mngon par zhen par byas pa ste /
analyzed: rtsod pa ni 'gyed pa'i rtsod pa'o // yang dag par blangs nas zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa nyid du 'chel nas so // rab tu bzung ste zhes bya ba ni mngon par zhen par byas pa ste /
translated: A dispute is a dispute that leads to a division.🔽Having taken a vow means having taken a vow in all sincerity.🔽Having grasped it means having clung to it.

original: dam du 'dzin pas bzung ste zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dam du 'dzin pas bzung ste zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that one has grasped it by holding it to be true.

original: 'dug na zhes bya ba ni rtsol ba'i ngo bor 'dug par byed na'o //
analyzed: 'dug na zhes bya ba ni rtsol ba'i ngo bor 'dug par byed na'o //
translated: If one sits down means if one sits down with the intention of making an effort.

original: dge slong rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni gcugs pa rnams so //
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni gcugs pa rnams so //
translated: The monks means the monks who are on one’s own side.

original: mthun par gyis shig ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: mthun par gyis shig ces bya ba ni /
translated: “Be harmonious” means:

original: gcig tu gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: gcig tu gyis shig pa'o //
translated: “Be united.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dge 'dun mthun pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dge 'dun mthun pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is said: “Because the Saṅgha is harmonious,” etc.

original: gang gi phyir dge 'dun ma phye na 'thab pa dang / rtsod pa dri ma mi bde ba'i 'dam dang bral bas bde bar gnas pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dge 'dun ma phye na 'thab pa dang / rtsod pa dri ma mi bde ba'i 'dam dang bral bas bde bar gnas pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because the Saṅgha is free from the mud of the unpleasantness of the defilements of strife and dispute, it abides in happiness.

original: khyod dge 'dun dang lhan cig mthun par gyis shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: khyod dge 'dun dang lhan cig mthun par gyis shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, it is said: “You should be harmonious with the Saṅgha.”

original: mi phyed pa ni chos dang zang zing gi longs spyod kyis 'brel pa'o //🔽kun du dga' ba ni gcig la gcig yon tan brjod pa'am /
analyzed: mi phyed pa ni chos dang zang zing gi longs spyod kyis 'brel pa'o // kun du dga' ba ni gcig la gcig yon tan brjod pa'am /
translated: “United” means connected by the enjoyment of Dharma and material things.

original: dge ba'i phyogs 'phel ba'i rab tu dga' bas mgu bar byed pa'o //🔽mi rtsod pa ni phan tshun lta ba dang 'dod pa mi mthun pa'i rtsod pa yongs su spongs pas /
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs 'phel ba'i rab tu dga' bas mgu bar byed pa'o // mi rtsod pa ni phan tshun lta ba dang 'dod pa mi mthun pa'i rtsod pa yongs su spongs pas /
translated: “Delighted” means delighting in the increase of virtue by praising each other’s good qualities.

original: mi rtsod par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtsod par gyur pa'o //
translated: “Not disputing” means not disputing, having abandoned the disputes of different views and desires.🔽“One in doctrine” means having the same goal.

original: mchog gcig ni 'bras bu mya ngan las 'das pa gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mchog gcig ni 'bras bu mya ngan las 'das pa gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “One in the result” means having the same result of Nirvāṇa.

original: 'don pa gcig pa ni so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa 'dra ba'i phyir ro //🔽chu dang 'o ma gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa lta bu ni /
analyzed: 'don pa gcig pa ni so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa 'dra ba'i phyir ro // chu dang 'o ma gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa lta bu ni /
translated: They are of the same recitation because they recite the Pratimoksa Sūtra in the same way.

original: dgag dbye la sogs pa'i las 'dra ba'i phyir ro //🔽yang na gzhan gyis @275a * //
analyzed: dgag dbye la sogs pa'i las 'dra ba'i phyir ro // yang na gzhan gyis @275a * //
translated: They are like water and milk mixed together because they perform the same rites of the poṣadha, etc.

original: bkrir mi btub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bkrir mi btub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, they are not led by others because they are not led by others.

original: ston pa'i bstan pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi bka'o //
analyzed: ston pa'i bstan pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi bka'o //
translated: The teaching of the Master is the word of the Blessed One.

original: gsal bar byed pa ni rab tu ston pa'o //🔽bde ba dang / reg pa zhes bya ba la bde ba ni lus kyi'o //
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa ni rab tu ston pa'o // bde ba dang / reg pa zhes bya ba la bde ba ni lus kyi'o //
translated: It is made clear by the one who teaches it.

original: reg pa ni sems kyi ste /
analyzed: reg pa ni sems kyi ste /
translated: Happiness and well-being: happiness is of the body, well-being is of the mind.

original: mthong ba'i chos la lus dang sems kyi bde ba dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la lus dang sems kyi bde ba dang ldan zhing /
translated: The one who possesses happiness and well-being

original: bde bar gnas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bde bar gnas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: dwells in happiness in this very life.

original: 'byed par byed pa'i gzhi ni spyod ba dang grog tshol ba'i ngo bo /
analyzed: 'byed par byed pa'i gzhi ni spyod ba dang grog tshol ba'i ngo bo /
translated: The basis of division is the nature of the search for disputes.

original: thong shig ces bya ba ni 'or cig pa'o //🔽bsgo bar bya ba ni bzlog par bya ba'o //
analyzed: thong shig ces bya ba ni 'or cig pa'o // bsgo bar bya ba ni bzlog par bya ba'o //
translated: “Give up” means “let go”.🔽“To be given up” means “to be rejected”.

original: bsgo ba na zhes bya ba ni gcugs pas zlog pa na'o //
analyzed: bsgo ba na zhes bya ba ni gcugs pas zlog pa na'o //
translated: “When one is giving up” means “when one is rejecting through affection”.

original: legs pa ni bzang po'o //
analyzed: legs pa ni bzang po'o //
translated: Good means excellent.

original: gtang bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'dor du gzhug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtang bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'dor du gzhug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to give up means in order to abandon.

original: lan gnyis ni res gnyis so //
analyzed: lan gnyis ni res gnyis so //
translated: Twice means two times.

original: lan gsum ni res gsum ste /
analyzed: lan gsum ni res gsum ste /
translated: Three times means three times.

original: des bshes pa'i tshig gis ma log na lan gsum gyi bar du 'di la gsol ba dang bzhi'i las bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des bshes pa'i tshig gis ma log na lan gsum gyi bar du 'di la gsol ba dang bzhi'i las bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If he does not turn back from that by the words of a friend, then up to three times he should request the Saṅgha to perform the action of the four-part formal procedure.

original: yang dag par bsgo bar bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang dag par bsgo bar bya ba ni /
translated: He should be admonished means

original: dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa'i ngo bo'i sdig pa bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa'i ngo bo'i sdig pa bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to turn back from the evil of the nature of causing a schism in the Saṅgha.

original: yang dag par bstan par bya ba ni mthun pa'i ngo bo'i dge ba'i chos la sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par bstan par bya ba ni mthun pa'i ngo bo'i dge ba'i chos la sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: He should be shown means in order to connect him with the virtuous nature of harmony.

original: bshes pa'i tshig gis zhes bya ba ni mdza' ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: bshes pa'i tshig gis zhes bya ba ni mdza' ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: By the words of a friend means by the words of a friend.

original: ma bsgo bar zhes bya ba ni brda ma sprad par te /
analyzed: ma bsgo bar zhes bya ba ni brda ma sprad par te /
translated: Without being admonished means without being informed.

original: ma bzlog par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ma bzlog par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Without being turned back means without being turned back.

original: gsol ba dang bzhi'i las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: gsol ba dang bzhi'i las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go bar byed pa ste /
translated: The action of the four-part formal procedure and so on are understood.

original: las byed pa sgrogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: las byed pa sgrogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the term “to proclaim” is to announce.

original: las ni brjod pa'o //
analyzed: las ni brjod pa'o //
translated: The action is to proclaim.

original: des na las gang la bzhi pa gsol ba yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: des na las gang la bzhi pa gsol ba yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it is called “to proclaim” because it is the action of the one who proclaims.

original: bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “The Blessed One said” means

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis so //
translated: the Bhagavān said.

original: nye ba 'khor mi 'chags zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor mi 'chags zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Upāli, it is not confessed” means

original: bshes pa'i tshig gis bsgo ba ni cho ga nyid yin pas de ma byas na las 'chags pa med de /
analyzed: bshes pa'i tshig gis bsgo ba ni cho ga nyid yin pas de ma byas na las 'chags pa med de /
translated: that if one does not do it, the action is not confessed.

original: bshes pa'i tshig gis bsgo ba nyid yan lag nyid yin te /
analyzed: bshes pa'i tshig gis bsgo ba nyid yan lag nyid yin te /
translated: The proclamation by a friend is the very ritual.

original: chog las 'das na las mi 'chags so zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chog las 'das na las mi 'chags so zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it says, “If one transgresses the ritual, the action is not confessed,”🔽the proclamation by a friend is the very limb.

original: dge 'dun la yang des 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni cho ga las 'gal ba'i las byed pa des nyes byas kyi ltung ba dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge 'dun la yang des 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni cho ga las 'gal ba'i las byed pa des nyes byas kyi ltung ba dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: “The Saṅgha also becomes guilty by that” means that the one who performs the action that transgresses the ritual becomes guilty of a minor offense.

original: chos ma yin par mi bya'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos ma yin par mi bya'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it says, “One should not do what is not Dharma.”

original: ci bsgo ba bshes pa'i tshig kho nas bya ba'am /
analyzed: ci bsgo ba bshes pa'i tshig kho nas bya ba'am /
translated: Is it done only by the proclamation of a friend?

original: 'on te las kyis kyang bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te las kyis kyang bya zhe na /
translated: But if it is done by a legal procedure,

original: 'dul ba 'dzin pa rnams na re @275b khyad par du ma smos pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dul ba 'dzin pa rnams na re @275b khyad par du ma smos pa'i phyir /
translated: the Vinaya experts say:

original: bshes pa'i tshig gis bya ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi las kyis kyang byed do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bshes pa'i tshig gis bya ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi las kyis kyang byed do zhes zer ro //
translated: It is not only done by the words of a friend, but also by a legal procedure.

original: de lta bas na 'dis ni dge 'dun gyi dbyen dang / de'i rjes su phyogs pa'i dge 'dun lhag mar gtogs pa'i zhus pa dang lan gdab pa mdzad pa zhes byar bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dis ni dge 'dun gyi dbyen dang / de'i rjes su phyogs pa'i dge 'dun lhag mar gtogs pa'i zhus pa dang lan gdab pa mdzad pa zhes byar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this should be understood as a question and answer about the schism of the Saṅgha and the Saṅgha that sides with it, which belongs to the remaining offenses.

original: btsun pa bskrad pa'i las ma bgyis pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bskrad pa'i las ni bskrad pa dang mthun pa gsol ba dang bzhi'i las te /
analyzed: btsun pa bskrad pa'i las ma bgyis pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bskrad pa'i las ni bskrad pa dang mthun pa gsol ba dang bzhi'i las te /
translated: The venerable one who has not performed the act of banishment, etc. The act of banishment is the four-announcement legal procedure that corresponds to banishment.

original: khyim sun 'byin par byed pa yod pa la de dang mthun pa'i las byas pas gnas de nas skrod pa yin no //
analyzed: khyim sun 'byin par byed pa yod pa la de dang mthun pa'i las byas pas gnas de nas skrod pa yin no //
translated: When it is performed, the one who causes householders to lose faith is banished from that place.

original: bshes pa'i tshig gis bsgo bar bgyid na zhes bya ba la sogs pas dge 'dun la 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur bar gsungs pa 'dis ni bskrad pa'i las ma byas par shes pa'i tshig gis bsgo ba ni ci yang mi phan no zhes bstan par shes par bya'o
analyzed: bshes pa'i tshig gis bsgo bar bgyid na zhes bya ba la sogs pas dge 'dun la 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur bar gsungs pa 'dis ni bskrad pa'i las ma byas par shes pa'i tshig gis bsgo ba ni ci yang mi phan no zhes bstan par shes par bya'o
translated: The phrase if he is ordered with words of reconciliation, etc. indicates that he becomes guilty in the presence of the Saṅgha. One should understand that this shows that it is of no use to order him with words of knowledge without performing the act of banishing.

original: // tshar gnyis pa la bskrad pa'i las bgyis te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: // tshar gnyis pa la bskrad pa'i las bgyis te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: The second part, beginning if the act of banishing is performed, etc.,

original: bshes pa'i tshig gis bsgo ba'i dgos pa dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: bshes pa'i tshig gis bsgo ba'i dgos pa dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: shows that it is necessary to order him with words of reconciliation.

original: des na dge 'dun la yang 'gal tshabs can du mi 'gyur bar gsungs so //
analyzed: des na dge 'dun la yang 'gal tshabs can du mi 'gyur bar gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that he does not become guilty in the presence of the Saṅgha.

original: 'dun pas 'gro ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dun pas 'gro ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for going with desire,

original: 'dun pa ni rjes su chags pa'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa ni rjes su chags pa'o //
translated: desire is attachment.

original: des 'gro ba ni 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: des 'gro ba ni 'jug pa ste /
translated: Going with that is engagement,

original: dper na nyes pa 'dra ba dmar ser ba rnams la skrod par mi byed pa'i rjes su chags pas 'jug pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na nyes pa 'dra ba dmar ser ba rnams la skrod par mi byed pa'i rjes su chags pas 'jug pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: for example, like the engagement of attachment to not banishing those who are similar to oneself in fault.

original: zhe sdang gis 'gro ba ni dper na rta can dang nab so dag la zhes sdang gis kun nas dkris pa'i dbang gis 'jug pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang gis 'gro ba ni dper na rta can dang nab so dag la zhes sdang gis kun nas dkris pa'i dbang gis 'jug pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: Going by hatred is like the case of the horse-keeper and the leper, who were bound together by hatred.

original: gti mug gis 'gro ba ni bskrod par 'os pa rnams kyis de kho na nyid khong du ma chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gti mug gis 'gro ba ni bskrod par 'os pa rnams kyis de kho na nyid khong du ma chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Going by delusion is like the case of those who should be expelled, because they do not understand reality.

original: 'jigs pas 'gro ba ni lhags pa rnams kyis bred par sems pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: 'jigs pas 'gro ba ni lhags pa rnams kyis bred par sems pa'i phyir ro//
translated: Going by fear is like the case of those who are frightened, because they are afraid.

original: nyes byas so zhes bya ba 'di la ni 'dun pas 'gro ba la sogs pas rnam par rig par byed pa'i gnas skabs 'di na rgyu mtshan du gyur pa la bskrad pa'i las med pa'i phyir mngon par zhen pas ches chung bar gnas te /
analyzed: nyes byas so zhes bya ba 'di la ni 'dun pas 'gro ba la sogs pas rnam par rig par byed pa'i gnas skabs 'di na rgyu mtshan du gyur pa la bskrad pa'i las med pa'i phyir mngon par zhen pas ches chung bar gnas te /
translated: Here, in the case of the offense, the one who goes by desire, etc., is in a state of awareness. The one who is expelled is in a state of less awareness, because he is not the cause of the awareness.

original: de'i phyir 'di shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this should be understood.

original: bsgo bar mi bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni don gang zhig gzhom pa'i phyir 'di la bsgo bar bya ba dang de'i tshe 'di la bsgo bas mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: bsgo bar mi bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni don gang zhig gzhom pa'i phyir 'di la bsgo bar bya ba dang de'i tshe 'di la bsgo bas mi 'grub ste /
translated: As for the phrase, “he should not be ordered around,” etc., the one who is to be subdued is not to be ordered around, because he is not established in the order.

original: 'di ltar 'jug pa 'di ni gnas skabs de na tshul 'chos kyi spyod pa tsam du zad pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jug pa 'di ni gnas skabs de na tshul 'chos kyi spyod pa tsam du zad pas /
translated: Thus, this engagement is merely the conduct of hypocrisy at that time.

original: de'i phyir 'di yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is it.

original: 'di ni bka' blo mi bde ba la yang ci rigs par bya'o //🔽de lta bas na 'dis ni khyim sun 'byin pa'i dge 'dun lhag @276a * //
analyzed: 'di ni bka' blo mi bde ba la yang ci rigs par bya'o // de lta bas na 'dis ni khyim sun 'byin pa'i dge 'dun lhag @276a * //
translated: This should also be applied as appropriate to the unpleasant speech.

original: ma zhus pa dang lan btab pa mdzad par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ma zhus pa dang lan btab pa mdzad par shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that this is the answer to the question about the Saṅgha schismatic who has not confessed his offense.

original: nyes byas so zhes bya ba 'dir ni sbom po'i sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyes byas so zhes bya ba 'dir ni sbom po'i sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, it is a grave offense because it is the preparation for a grave offense.

original: 'di ni bka' blo bde ba la yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bka' blo bde ba la yang shes par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as pleasant speech.

original: ma glengs ba la ni nyes pa ma bsgrags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma glengs ba la ni nyes pa ma bsgrags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no fault in not mentioning it, because the fault has not been proclaimed.

original: dran par ma bgyis pa ni yul dang dus dang grogs ma bsgrags pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dran par ma bgyis pa ni yul dang dus dang grogs ma bsgrags pa'i phyir te /
translated: Not remembering means not proclaiming the place, time, and companion.

original: glengs pa ni phyogs gcig par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: glengs pa ni phyogs gcig par gyur pa'o //
translated: Mentioning is becoming partial.

original: dran par byas pa ni rdzogs par gyur pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dran par byas pa ni rdzogs par gyur pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Remembering is becoming complete. This is the meaning.

original: bka' blo mi bde ba ni tshig mi bzod pa nyid de bdag nyid kyi yul la phan pa dang mi phan pa'i tshig bzlog pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bka' blo mi bde ba ni tshig mi bzod pa nyid de bdag nyid kyi yul la phan pa dang mi phan pa'i tshig bzlog pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Disagreeable speech is the speech that one cannot bear to hear, that is, speech that is not beneficial to oneself or to others.

original: gzhan las ni bka' blo mi bde ba can nyid ces 'byung ste /
analyzed: gzhan las ni bka' blo mi bde ba can nyid ces 'byung ste /
translated: Another text says, “He has disagreeable speech.”

original: des ni gang la bka' blo mi bde ba yod pa de ni bka' blo mi bde ba can no //
analyzed: des ni gang la bka' blo mi bde ba yod pa de ni bka' blo mi bde ba can no //
translated: The one who has disagreeable speech is the one who has disagreeable speech.

original: de'i ngo bo ni bka' blo mi bde ba can nyid de /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni bka' blo mi bde ba can nyid de /
translated: The nature of that is disagreeable speech.

original: bka' blo mi bde ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽gal te re zhig glengs pa med na rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir sdig pa'i bsam pa ches chung ba yod par ni 'gyur grang na dran par byas pa med pa la go ji ltar /
analyzed: bka' blo mi bde ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // gal te re zhig glengs pa med na rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir sdig pa'i bsam pa ches chung ba yod par ni 'gyur grang na dran par byas pa med pa la go ji ltar /
translated: The meaning of disagreeable speech is the same as the meaning of disagreeable speech.🔽If one does not speak, then there is no cause for the arising of a slight sinful intention.

original: 'di la sdig pa'i bsam pa ches chung ba yod ce na smras pa /
analyzed: 'di la sdig pa'i bsam pa ches chung ba yod ce na smras pa /
translated: How can there be a slight sinful intention in one who is not reminded of it?

original: gleng bar bya ba'i gang zag gis dran pa ma rnyed na yin la bdag nyid kha na ma tho ba med pa nyid dang / gleng ba yang nyes par gleng ba nyid du sems te /
analyzed: gleng bar bya ba'i gang zag gis dran pa ma rnyed na yin la bdag nyid kha na ma tho ba med pa nyid dang / gleng ba yang nyes par gleng ba nyid du sems te /
translated: If the person being accused does not remember, he thinks, “I am not guilty, and I am being accused falsely.”

original: des na dran pa med na 'di'i bka' blo mi bde ba la /
analyzed: des na dran pa med na 'di'i bka' blo mi bde ba la /
translated: Therefore, if he does not remember, he is unhappy about the accusation.

original: sdig pa'i bsam pa ches chung ba yod do zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sdig pa'i bsam pa ches chung ba yod do zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that he has a very small amount of sinful thoughts.

original: kha cig ni 'di gnyis la nyes ba sbom por 'gyur bar brjod de /
analyzed: kha cig ni 'di gnyis la nyes ba sbom por 'gyur bar brjod de /
translated: Some say that these two are serious offenses.

original: btsun pa bskrad pa'i las bgyis nas 'dun pas 'gro ba'o zhes mchi zhing /
analyzed: btsun pa bskrad pa'i las bgyis nas 'dun pas 'gro ba'o zhes mchi zhing /
translated: If a monk is expelled and then returns to the order, is this a serious offense?

original: zhe sdang gis 'gro ba dang / gti mug gis 'gro ba dang / 'jigs pas 'gro ba'o zhes mchi na cir 'gyur lags /
analyzed: zhe sdang gis 'gro ba dang / gti mug gis 'gro ba dang / 'jigs pas 'gro ba'o zhes mchi na cir 'gyur lags /
translated: If he returns out of hatred, out of confusion, or out of fear, what is it?

original: nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: It is a serious offense.

original: bsgo bar bgyi ba'am 'on te bsgo bar mi bgyid lags /
analyzed: bsgo bar bgyi ba'am 'on te bsgo bar mi bgyid lags /
translated: Should he be ordered to do something or not?

original: bsgo bar bya'o //
analyzed: bsgo bar bya'o //
translated: He should be ordered.

original: bsgo ba 'chags sam 'on te mi 'chags lags /
analyzed: bsgo ba 'chags sam 'on te mi 'chags lags /
translated: If he does not do what he is ordered to do, what is it?

original: nye ba 'khor 'chags so //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor 'chags so //
translated: Upāli, it is a serious offense.

original: glengs shing dran par bgyis pa las bdag nyid bka' blo mi bde ba la gnas par bgyid na cir 'gyur lags /
analyzed: glengs shing dran par bgyis pa las bdag nyid bka' blo mi bde ba la gnas par bgyid na cir 'gyur lags /
translated: If, having been reminded and having been accused, I persist in my course, what will happen?

original: nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: “You will commit a serious offense.”

original: bsgo bar bgyi ba'am 'on te bsgo bar mi bgyi lags /
analyzed: bsgo bar bgyi ba'am 'on te bsgo bar mi bgyi lags /
translated: “Should I be ordered to do so or not?”

original: bsgo bar bya'o //
analyzed: bsgo bar bya'o //
translated: “You should be ordered.”

original: bsgo ba 'chags lags sam /
analyzed: bsgo ba 'chags lags sam /
translated: “Is the order reversible or not?”

original: nye ba 'khor 'chags so zhe 'o //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor 'chags so zhe 'o //
translated: “Upāli, it is reversible.”

original: 'dis ni bskrad pa'i las byas nas 'dun pas 'gro'o @276b zhes bya ba la sogs pa zer na nyes pa sbom por byed pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'dis ni bskrad pa'i las byas nas 'dun pas 'gro'o @276b zhes bya ba la sogs pa zer na nyes pa sbom por byed pa nyid yin la /
translated: This teaches that if, having performed the act of banishing, one goes away with the intention to return, one commits a serious offense.

original: de bzhin du glengs shing dran par byas pa las brjod par bya ba ma yin par byed na yang sbom por byed pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du glengs shing dran par byas pa las brjod par bya ba ma yin par byed na yang sbom por byed pa kho na ste /
translated: Similarly, if, having been reminded and having been accused, one persists in one’s course, one commits a serious offense.

original: khyim sun 'byin pa dang / bka' blo mi bde ba'i dge 'dun lhag ma dag gi sbyor bar gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: khyim sun 'byin pa dang / bka' blo mi bde ba'i dge 'dun lhag ma dag gi sbyor bar gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is because one becomes engaged in the remaining offenses of the Saṅgha for causing a layperson to lose faith and for disobeying an order.

original: 'di ni 'dul ba 'dzin pa gzhan dag mi 'dod da /
analyzed: 'di ni 'dul ba 'dzin pa gzhan dag mi 'dod da /
translated: Other masters of the Vinaya do not accept this.

original: 'di las 'gro'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa dang / brjod par bya ba ma yin par byed pa ni tshig kyal pa nyid kyis nyes byas slong ba'i phyir 'dun pas 'gro ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa dang / brjod par bya ba ma yin bar byed pa la ni nyes byas pa'i sbyor ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di las 'gro'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa dang / brjod par bya ba ma yin par byed pa ni tshig kyal pa nyid kyis nyes byas slong ba'i phyir 'dun pas 'gro ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa dang / brjod par bya ba ma yin bar byed pa la ni nyes byas pa'i sbyor ba nyid yin no //
translated: When one says, I will go from here, and so on, and then does not do what one has said, one incurs an offense of wrong speech by idle chatter. When one says, I will go with the intention, and so on, and then does not do what one has said, one incurs an offense of wrong speech by idle chatter. When one says, I will go with the intention, and so on, and then does not do what one has said, one incurs an offense of wrong speech by idle chatter. When one says, I will go with the intention, and so on, and then does not do what one has said, one incurs an offense of wrong speech by idle chatter.

original: sbom po la ni nyes byas pa'i sbyor ba la sbom po nyid du rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sbom po la ni nyes byas pa'i sbyor ba la sbom po nyid du rung ba ma yin te /
translated: In the case of a serious offense, it is not appropriate for the preparation to be serious,

original: sbyor ba ni chung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni chung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the preparation is minor.

original: de lta bas na 'dir nyes byas kho na bzang gi sngom po ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dir nyes byas kho na bzang gi sngom po ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, here only wrong speech is good, not serious.

original: mtshams kyi nang na mchis ba dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas bsgo ba ma yin par gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: mtshams kyi nang na mchis ba dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas bsgo ba ma yin par gsungs pa ni /
translated: The statement that it is not an order, beginning with those who are within the boundary,

original: mtshams gzhan na gnas pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mtshams gzhan na gnas pa'i phyir te /
translated: is because one is dwelling in another boundary.

original: mtshams gzhan na gnas pa ni gang gi yang yan lag nyid ma yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshams gzhan na gnas pa ni gang gi yang yan lag nyid ma yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: One who dwells in another boundary is not a limb of anyone, as it is stated.

original: las bgyid ba ni gsol ba dang bzhi'i las la sogs pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: las bgyid ba ni gsol ba dang bzhi'i las la sogs pa byed pa'o //
translated: One who performs actions is one who performs the four types of actions such as proposal.

original: mtshams mnan pa ni mtshams kyi bar shing la sogs pas gcig tu byas pa'o //
analyzed: mtshams mnan pa ni mtshams kyi bar shing la sogs pas gcig tu byas pa'o //
translated: One who presses the boundary is one who makes the boundary between two monasteries into one by means of a single wooden object and so on.

original: non par bgyis pa ni gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las kyis mtshams bcad pa ste /
analyzed: non par bgyis pa ni gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las kyis mtshams bcad pa ste /
translated: One who presses down is one who divides the boundary by means of the two actions of proposal and proclamation,

original: mnan pa kun la 'dug pa ni non pa la ma yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mnan pa kun la 'dug pa ni non pa la ma yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said, “One who presses down is not one who presses down on all.”

original: yang na gzhan dag na re mtshams mnan pa ni rkang pa gnyis kyis te /🔽lugs las gcig la rkang pa dang / gzhan la cig shos gzhag pa ni gnyi ga na 'dug pa nyid yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na gzhan dag na re mtshams mnan pa ni rkang pa gnyis kyis te / lugs las gcig la rkang pa dang / gzhan la cig shos gzhag pa ni gnyi ga na 'dug pa nyid yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, others say: One who presses the boundary is one who presses down with both feet.🔽Because it is said, “One who presses down with one foot on one boundary line and the other foot on the other is one who presses down on both.”

original: non par byas pa ni shing la sogs pas gcig tu byas pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: non par byas pa ni shing la sogs pas gcig tu byas pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: One who presses down is one who makes the boundary into one by means of a single wooden object and so on.

original: ma bskos pa ni byed du ma bcug pa'o //
analyzed: ma bskos pa ni byed du ma bcug pa'o //
translated: One who is not appointed is one who is not permitted to perform actions.

original: bskrad pa ni ltung ba ma mthong ba la sogs pas bskrad pa'i las byed pa ste /
analyzed: bskrad pa ni ltung ba ma mthong ba la sogs pas bskrad pa'i las byed pa ste /
translated: One who is expelled is one who performs the action of expulsion due to not seeing downfalls and so on.

original: dge slong gi tshogs las 'byin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dge slong gi tshogs las 'byin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of “expulsion from the assembly of monks” is the same.

original: nye ba 'khor ma yin no zhes bya ba 'dis ni las ni dge 'dun la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor ma yin no zhes bya ba 'dis ni las ni dge 'dun la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Upāli, it is not so” means that the action depends on the Saṅgha.

original: ma bskos pa las byed pa ni cha ma yin pa nyid do zhes bstan par shes par bya'o //🔽gal te des re re dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gcig dang gnyis @277a * //
analyzed: ma bskos pa las byed pa ni cha ma yin pa nyid do zhes bstan par shes par bya'o // gal te des re re dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gcig dang gnyis @277a * //
translated: It should be understood that the performance of an action by one who has not been appointed is not a part of the procedure.

original: dang ; gsum po dag la cig car las byed pa ni /
analyzed: dang ; gsum po dag la cig car las byed pa ni /
translated: If he performs the action in unison with each of them, one, two, or three,

original: tshogs med pa'i phyir nyes par mi 'gyur ro //🔽tshogs la las byed pa ni dgag pa nyid kyi 'og nas 'byung ba'i gzhung las /
analyzed: tshogs med pa'i phyir nyes par mi 'gyur ro // tshogs la las byed pa ni dgag pa nyid kyi 'og nas 'byung ba'i gzhung las /
translated: he does not commit a fault, because there is no assembly.🔽The performance of an action by an assembly is prohibited by the following passage:

original: tshogs kyis tshogs kyi las dag byer mi rung bas so zhes bya ba 'dir 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshogs kyis tshogs kyi las dag byer mi rung bas so zhes bya ba 'dir 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: “It is not proper for one assembly to perform the actions of another assembly.”

original: mtshungs par gnas pa ni tshul khrims dang lta ba mtshungs pa dag go //
analyzed: mtshungs par gnas pa ni tshul khrims dang lta ba mtshungs pa dag go //
translated: Those who are in agreement are those who have the same morality and views.

original: mchis pa dag gis zhes bya ba ni 'khod pa dag gis so //
analyzed: mchis pa dag gis zhes bya ba ni 'khod pa dag gis so //
translated: “Those who are present” means those who are assembled.

original: 'og ma dag la yang de dang 'dra bar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'og ma dag la yang de dang 'dra bar shes par bya ste /
translated: The same should be understood for the other cases.

original: 'khod nas las bya'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khod nas las bya'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And because it is said, “Having assembled, one should perform the rite.”

original: ltung ba yang gang du yang mi 'gyur ba ni mthun pa'i las byed pa las byung ba'o //🔽mtshams kyi nang na gnas pa 'dus par ma zhugs pa dag gis de las gzhan pa mi mthun pa nyid du 'gyur bas de'i phyir 'di yin te /
analyzed: ltung ba yang gang du yang mi 'gyur ba ni mthun pa'i las byed pa las byung ba'o // mtshams kyi nang na gnas pa 'dus par ma zhugs pa dag gis de las gzhan pa mi mthun pa nyid du 'gyur bas de'i phyir 'di yin te /
translated: If there is no downfall, it arises from performing the rite in harmony.🔽If those who are within the boundary do not enter the assembly, they become non-harmonious. Therefore it is said:🔽If those who are within that boundary are worthy of being added to the assembly, but do not enter the assembly, they are non-harmonious.

original: mtshams de'i nang na 'dug pa kha skong bar 'os pa'i lus sam 'dun par 'dus par ma zhugs pa nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas mi mthun pa nyid du bshad pa'i phyir ro //🔽phan tshun 'dun pa byin pas zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyis phrin las chos dang mthun pa dbul lo zhes phan tshun dad pa sbyin pa ste /
analyzed: mtshams de'i nang na 'dug pa kha skong bar 'os pa'i lus sam 'dun par 'dus par ma zhugs pa nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas mi mthun pa nyid du bshad pa'i phyir ro // phan tshun 'dun pa byin pas zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyis phrin las chos dang mthun pa dbul lo zhes phan tshun dad pa sbyin pa ste /
translated: And so on.🔽If they give each other their consent, the saṅgha should give a Dharma-concordant message.

original: 'dun pa byin na des mthun pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dun pa byin na des mthun pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If they give each other their consent, they become harmonious.

original: tshogs kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: tshogs kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The phrase in the assembly and so on.

original: tshogs ni dge 'dun te las rnams la ni dge 'dun dbang ba'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: tshogs ni dge 'dun te las rnams la ni dge 'dun dbang ba'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
translated: The assembly is the Saṅgha, because the Saṅgha has authority over the rites.

original: las thams cad ni gsol ba dang brjod pa dang so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa dang / dgag dbye zhes bya ba rnams so //
analyzed: las thams cad ni gsol ba dang brjod pa dang so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa dang / dgag dbye zhes bya ba rnams so //
translated: All the rites are the proposal, the proclamation, the recitation of the Prātimokṣa Sūtra, and the invitation ceremony.

original: khri ni khri chen po'o //
analyzed: khri ni khri chen po'o //
translated: A platform is a large platform.

original: re lde ni smyag ma la sogs pa las lhas pa gru bzhi'o //
analyzed: re lde ni smyag ma la sogs pa las lhas pa gru bzhi'o //
translated: A shed is a structure made of bamboo and so on with four sides.

original: 'am zhes bya ba'i sgra ni so sor tshig rkya thub par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'am zhes bya ba'i sgra ni so sor tshig rkya thub par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word or indicates that each of these is a separate topic.

original: re lde ljongs rings ni de nyid chu rings su 'dug pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: re lde ljongs rings ni de nyid chu rings su 'dug pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: A shed in the open air is one that is not enclosed on all sides.

original: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba ni nye bar ston pa'i tshig yin no //🔽bzhi'i tshogs kyis bya ba ni pham par gyur pa'i nyes pa sbom po yang ba bshags pa'am /
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba ni nye bar ston pa'i tshig yin no // bzhi'i tshogs kyis bya ba ni pham par gyur pa'i nyes pa sbom po yang ba bshags pa'am /
translated: The phrase in this way indicates that this is an example.🔽The four-member assembly performs the rite of confession for a serious offense of a monk who has committed a defeating offense,

original: gso sbyong byed pa'o //
analyzed: gso sbyong byed pa'o //
translated: or the rite of purification.

original: lnga'i tshogs kyis bya ba ni dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ba'i nyes po sbom po lci ba bshags pa'am dgag dbye byed pa'o //
analyzed: lnga'i tshogs kyis bya ba ni dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ba'i nyes po sbom po lci ba bshags pa'am dgag dbye byed pa'o //
translated: The five-member group does the act of confessing the serious and heavy offense that is a partial defeat of the Saṅgha, or of performing the rehabilitation.

original: bcu'i tshogs kyis bya ba ni bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i las so //
analyzed: bcu'i tshogs kyis bya ba ni bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i las so //
translated: The ten-member group does the act of full ordination.

original: nyi shu'i tshogs kyis bya ba @277b ni dbyung ba'o //
analyzed: nyi shu'i tshogs kyis bya ba @277b ni dbyung ba'o //
translated: The twenty-member group does the act of readmission.

original: de de dag kha cig gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bdag nyid las byed pa'i phyir las byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de de dag kha cig gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bdag nyid las byed pa'i phyir las byed pa yin no //
translated: “Some of them” and so on means that the act is performed by them because they do it themselves.

original: gzhan dag gis las nyams su myong ba'i phyir tshogs skong ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis las nyams su myong ba'i phyir tshogs skong ba yin no //
translated: The group is fulfilled because the act is experienced by others.

original: nam mkha' la mchis pa ni nam mkha' la 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' la mchis pa ni nam mkha' la 'dug pa'o //
translated: “In the sky” means in the sky.

original: nye ba 'khor ma yin no zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' mtshams gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor ma yin no zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' mtshams gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Upāli, it is not so, because the sky is a different boundary.

original: de lta bas na 'dis ni las thams cad kyi spyi'i cho ga bshad do zhes bstan par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dis ni las thams cad kyi spyi'i cho ga bshad do zhes bstan par shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that this teaches the general procedure for all acts.

original: bslab pa byin pa dang dge slong ma yang dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa ni dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa'i rjes su phyogs pa ma log na las kyi mtha' la 'di yin no //
analyzed: bslab pa byin pa dang dge slong ma yang dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa ni dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa'i rjes su phyogs pa ma log na las kyi mtha' la 'di yin no //
translated: This is the conclusion of the action.

original: dge slong ma la sogs pa la yang las kyi mtha' kho na yin mod kyi /
