analyzed: dge slong ma la sogs pa la yang las kyi mtha' kho na yin mod kyi /
translated: But even though bhikṣuṇīs and so on also have this conclusion of the action,

original: 'on kyang 'di dag gis thos pa dang bcas par las mi bya'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir 'di dag las chung ba med do //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di dag gis thos pa dang bcas par las mi bya'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir 'di dag las chung ba med do //
translated: they do not have a lesser offense than this, because it is said, “They should not perform actions with listening.”

original: sngar ltung ba byung ba la sogs pa la yang tshul 'di nyid yin te /
analyzed: sngar ltung ba byung ba la sogs pa la yang tshul 'di nyid yin te /
translated: This is also the rule for those who have previously incurred a downfall and so on.

original: sogs pa zhes smos pa ni rku thabs su gnas pa la sogs pa 'phangs so //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes smos pa ni rku thabs su gnas pa la sogs pa 'phangs so //
translated: The phrase “and so on” refers to those who live by stealing and so on.

original: snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni mdor sdud par byed pa rnams kyis bsgre bar bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni mdor sdud par byed pa rnams kyis bsgre bar bshad pa yin no //
translated: “As before” means that the compilers of the scriptures should explain this as they did above.

original: de ltar na gzhung 'di ni dge 'dun lhag ma gsum la yang zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi dbyen gyi grogs bsgrub pa nyid dang / khyim sun 'byin pa dang / bka' blo mi bde ba zhes bya ba dag la yang btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis bshes pa'i tshig gis ma bsgo ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa thams cad brjod par bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na gzhung 'di ni dge 'dun lhag ma gsum la yang zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi dbyen gyi grogs bsgrub pa nyid dang / khyim sun 'byin pa dang / bka' blo mi bde ba zhes bya ba dag la yang btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis bshes pa'i tshig gis ma bsgo ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa thams cad brjod par bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: The three remaining offenses are: (1) assisting in the schism of the Saṅgha, (2) causing a layperson to lose faith, and (3) disobeying a Saṅgha decree.

original: ci rigs pa ni gang la gang rigs pa ste /🔽'di lta ste rjes su phyogs pa la ni btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis bshes pa'i tshig gis ma bsgo bar zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //🔽khyim sun 'byin pa la ni btsun pa bskrad pa'i las ma bgyis par zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: ci rigs pa ni gang la gang rigs pa ste / 'di lta ste rjes su phyogs pa la ni btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis bshes pa'i tshig gis ma bsgo bar zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no // khyim sun 'byin pa la ni btsun pa bskrad pa'i las ma bgyis par zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The phrase “as is appropriate” means that whatever is appropriate for a particular case should be applied.🔽For example, in the case of assisting in the schism of the Saṅgha, the phrase “Venerable, without first being asked by a monk who is a friend” should be used.🔽In the case of causing a layperson to lose faith, the phrase “Venerable, without first performing the act of banishing” should be used.

original: bka' blo mi bde ba la ni btsun pa re zhig ma glengs dran pa ma bgyis par zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: bka' blo mi bde ba la ni btsun pa re zhig ma glengs dran pa ma bgyis par zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: In the case of disobeying a Saṅgha decree, the phrase “Venerable, without first being reminded” should be used.

original: mdor sdud par byed pa rnams kyis dge 'dun lhag ma bzhi po khyad par med par bsdu ba brjod pa smos mod kyi /
analyzed: mdor sdud par byed pa rnams kyis dge 'dun lhag ma bzhi po khyad par med par bsdu ba brjod pa smos mod kyi /
translated: In brief, those who summarize the four remaining offenses of a monk without distinction say that they are to be confessed.

original: 'on kyang de dag gi rang gi ngo bo gdon mi za bar brjod dgos te /🔽rang gi ngo bo yongs su shes @278a * //
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag gi rang gi ngo bo gdon mi za bar brjod dgos te / rang gi ngo bo yongs su shes @278a * //
translated: However, it is necessary to definitely state their individual natures.

original: na ltung ba rnam par dbye ba gtan la dbab par nus so //
analyzed: na ltung ba rnam par dbye ba gtan la dbab par nus so //
translated: If one completely understands their individual natures, one can ascertain the analysis of downfalls.🔽I have also placed in my mind the texts of the three that are mentioned in the Sūtra on Monastic Discipline:

original: bdag gis kyang dge 'dun 'byed pa'i rjes su phyogs pa dang / khyim sun 'byin pa dang / bka' blo mi bde ba so sor thar pa'i mdo las smos pa gsum po 'di dag gi gzhung blo la bzhag nas tshig rnam par dbye ba nye bar bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: bdag gis kyang dge 'dun 'byed pa'i rjes su phyogs pa dang / khyim sun 'byin pa dang / bka' blo mi bde ba so sor thar pa'i mdo las smos pa gsum po 'di dag gi gzhung blo la bzhag nas tshig rnam par dbye ba nye bar bstan par bya ste /
translated: those who side with those who create a schism in the saṅgha, those who scandalize householders, and those who are disobedient.

original: de bas na 'di la skabs su ma bab par smras pa nyid du mngon par zhen par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'di la skabs su ma bab par smras pa nyid du mngon par zhen par mi bya'o //
translated: I will explain the analysis of their words, but since this is not the appropriate occasion for that, one should not insist on it.

original: de yang dge slong de'i grogs byed pa'i dge slong zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni tshig gi rgyan gyi don tam gal te zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yang dge slong de'i grogs byed pa'i dge slong zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni tshig gi rgyan gyi don tam gal te zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Moreover, the word “also” in “the monk who is his companion, etc.” has the sense of an ornament to the sentence or the sense of “if.🔽”

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi dbyen la zhugs pa'i 'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi dbyen la zhugs pa'i 'o //
translated: “His” refers to the one who has entered into a schism in the Saṅgha.

original: grogs byed pa ni 'khor ngan pa rnams so //
analyzed: grogs byed pa ni 'khor ngan pa rnams so //
translated: “Companion” refers to the bad retinue.

original: de dag ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: de dag ji lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: What are they like?🔽It says “who agree with him.

original: rjes su phyogs pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rjes su phyogs pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The term “subsequent” is stated.🔽

original: mthun par bya ba byed pa ste /
analyzed: mthun par bya ba byed pa ste /
translated: They do what is agreeable.

original: bsams pa'i don yongs su rdzogs kyi bar du rjes su 'jug pa'i zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bsams pa'i don yongs su rdzogs kyi bar du rjes su 'jug pa'i zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They follow him until the intended purpose is fulfilled.

original: ci'i ched du zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i ched du zhe na /
translated: For what purpose?🔽It says “because they have a disagreement.

original: mi mthun par smra ba nyid kyi zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: mi mthun par smra ba nyid kyi zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: “Speaking in discord” is stated.🔽

original: ston pa dang lam gzhan la bzhag pa'i 'o //
analyzed: ston pa dang lam gzhan la bzhag pa'i 'o //
translated: They are those who have been placed in another teaching and path.

original: 'di ni rgyu mtshan gyi bdun pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni rgyu mtshan gyi bdun pa ste /
translated: This is the seventh reason.

original: mi mthun par smra ba ched du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi mthun par smra ba ched du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that they have a disagreement for the purpose of.

original: gcig nyid la sogs pas byas pa'i khyad par med par bstan pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: gcig nyid la sogs pas byas pa'i khyad par med par bstan pa'i phyir ;
translated: In order to teach that there is no distinction made by the one, etc.,

original: gcig gam zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs te /
analyzed: gcig gam zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs te /
translated: he says, “whether one, etc.”

original: mang po ni gnyis kyi gong ma gsum la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mang po ni gnyis kyi gong ma gsum la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Many is the opposite of two, three, etc.

original: dge ba ni phan pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba ni phan pa'o //
translated: Virtue is beneficial.

original: sdig pa ni mi phan pa'o //
analyzed: sdig pa ni mi phan pa'o //
translated: Sin is not beneficial.

original: ma smra cig ces bya ba ni ma brjod cig pa'o //
analyzed: ma smra cig ces bya ba ni ma brjod cig pa'o //
translated: Do not speak means do not say.

original: smrar mi ster pa'i rgyu chos smra ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: smrar mi ster pa'i rgyu chos smra ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The reason for not speaking is “the Dharma-preacher, etc.”

original: chos ni lam gyi yan lag lnga'o //
analyzed: chos ni lam gyi yan lag lnga'o //
translated: The Dharma is the five branches of the path.

original: 'dul ba ni yang dag pa'i ngag la sogs pa gsum mo //
analyzed: 'dul ba ni yang dag pa'i ngag la sogs pa gsum mo //
translated: The Vinaya is the three, right speech, etc.

original: yang na gzhan dag na re tshig 'bru bzad po dang don bzang po brjod pa'i phyir go rims bzhin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: yang na gzhan dag na re tshig 'bru bzad po dang don bzang po brjod pa'i phyir go rims bzhin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Or, according to others, it is because of the good words and good meaning, respectively.

original: la la gzhan dag la smra ba'i bdag nyid mi dpyod pa la yang yod pas de'i phyir 'di ni chos dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: la la gzhan dag la smra ba'i bdag nyid mi dpyod pa la yang yod pas de'i phyir 'di ni chos dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Some say that there is no analysis of the nature of speech to others, and therefore he says, “this is the Dharma, etc.”

original: shes bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i de kho na nyid khong du chud pa bzhin du'o //
analyzed: shes bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i de kho na nyid khong du chud pa bzhin du'o //
translated: “With full awareness” means in accordance with the realization of the reality of things.

original: 'dod pa ni rtsol ba'i dus na'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa ni rtsol ba'i dus na'o //
translated: “Desire” is at the time of striving.

original: bzod pa ni yongs su gyur pa na bde ba 'dren pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzod pa ni yongs su gyur pa na bde ba 'dren pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Patience” is at the time of transformation, because it leads to happiness.

original: yang na 'dod pa ni yid dang 'thad pas so//
analyzed: yang na 'dod pa ni yid dang 'thad pas so//
translated: Or else, “desire” is mental satisfaction,

original: @278b bzod pa ni rigs pas nges par brtags pas so //
analyzed: @278b bzod pa ni rigs pas nges par brtags pas so //
translated: and “patience” is the investigation by reason.

original: 'di ni chos smra ba yin pa zhes bya ba ni 'di ni ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di ni chos smra ba yin pa zhes bya ba ni 'di ni ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: “This is the Dharma preacher” means that this is not the case at all.

original: dge slong rab tu mang po dag ces bya ba la sogs pa la dge slong rab tu mang po zhes bya ba 'dir mang po'i tshig smras pa ni tshegs mi che ste /
analyzed: dge slong rab tu mang po dag ces bya ba la sogs pa la dge slong rab tu mang po zhes bya ba 'dir mang po'i tshig smras pa ni tshegs mi che ste /
translated: “Many monks” and so on. Here, the word “many” is used for monks, because it is not difficult.

original: byung ba'i dbang gis re lde ri ba'i dge slong rnams kyi dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byung ba'i dbang gis re lde ri ba'i dge slong rnams kyi dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said under the influence of the Jātakas, with reference to the monks of the Rājagṛha.

original: grong ni skye ba'i tshogs kyi gnas phyir dang / nyo tshong la sogs pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: grong ni skye ba'i tshogs kyi gnas phyir dang / nyo tshong la sogs pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: A “town” is a place of assembly for the people, and is free from buying and selling, and so on.

original: grong rdal ni nyo tshong la sogs pa yod pa'o //🔽gcig nas zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag las ches khyad par du 'phags pa'am /
analyzed: grong rdal ni nyo tshong la sogs pa yod pa'o // gcig nas zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag las ches khyad par du 'phags pa'am /
translated: A town is a place where buying and selling are done.🔽One is a place that is superior to others.

original: ming ma bstan pa yin no ;
analyzed: ming ma bstan pa yin no ;
translated: Or else, it is a place that is not named.

original: / nye bar brten pa ni de la brten nas chos dang bsod snyoms la sogs pa 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / nye bar brten pa ni de la brten nas chos dang bsod snyoms la sogs pa 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a place of dependence because the Dharma, alms, and so on are obtained there.

original: gnas par gyur pa'i ni mngon par dga' bas gnas par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gnas par gyur pa'i ni mngon par dga' bas gnas par byed pa'o //
translated: It is a place of dwelling because one dwells there with delight.

original: khyim sun 'byin pa ni bram ze dang / khyim bdag gi khyim bud med dang bcas pa rnams ma dad par byed pa dag go //
analyzed: khyim sun 'byin pa ni bram ze dang / khyim bdag gi khyim bud med dang bcas pa rnams ma dad par byed pa dag go //
translated: Those who cause scandal in the houses are those who cause lack of faith in the houses of Brahmins and householders, together with their wives.

original: de dag tu ni rnam pa gnyis kyis sun 'byin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag tu ni rnam pa gnyis kyis sun 'byin par 'gyur te /
translated: They cause scandal in those places in two ways:

original: bud med dang lhan cig khyim gcig dang mal cha dang stan gcig la 'dug pa'i phyir dang / snod gcig tu char 'thung ba dang zan za ba la sogs pas longs spyod par byed pa las so //
analyzed: bud med dang lhan cig khyim gcig dang mal cha dang stan gcig la 'dug pa'i phyir dang / snod gcig tu char 'thung ba dang zan za ba la sogs pas longs spyod par byed pa las so //
translated: by sitting on the same seat, on the same bed, with a woman, and by using the same vessels, drinking water, eating food, and so on.

original: 'bras bu'i sgo nas bstan nas rgyu'i sgo nas bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i sgo nas bstan nas rgyu'i sgo nas bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Having taught the fruits, he teaches the causes.

original: sdig pa'i chos kun du spyod pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: sdig pa'i chos kun du spyod pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: He says, “who are engaged in evil conduct.”

original: sdig pa'i chos ni nyes par spyod pa smad pa'i chos te /
analyzed: sdig pa'i chos ni nyes par spyod pa smad pa'i chos te /
translated: Evil conduct is reprehensible conduct.

original: sdig pa can gyi las zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sdig pa can gyi las zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means “having evil karma.”

original: gang dag de kun du spyod cing byed pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag de kun du spyod cing byed pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Those who are engaged in and do that are called “those who are engaged in evil conduct.”

original: gzhan dag na re khyim sun 'byin pa'i gzhis nyin re bzhin kha na ma tho ba 'phen pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re khyim sun 'byin pa'i gzhis nyin re bzhin kha na ma tho ba 'phen pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: because they cause daily offenses for householders by being a source of trouble for householders.

original: de dag gis ni bdag nyid kyang sdig pa spyod pas khyim bdag sun phyung la gzhan dag la yang mi snyan pa smras pa'i phyir spyod pa ngan pas khyim bdag sun 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis ni bdag nyid kyang sdig pa spyod pas khyim bdag sun phyung la gzhan dag la yang mi snyan pa smras pa'i phyir spyod pa ngan pas khyim bdag sun 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are called “those who are engaged in evil conduct” because they cause trouble for householders by engaging in evil conduct themselves and by speaking unpleasantly to others.

original: mthong pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pas so //
analyzed: mthong pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pas so //
translated: “Seen” means by the eye consciousness.

original: thos pa ni rna ba'i rnam par shes pas so //
analyzed: thos pa ni rna ba'i rnam par shes pas so //
translated: “Heard” means by the ear consciousness.

original: rab tu shes pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pas so //🔽'am zhes bya ba'i sgra ni tshig kyal pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: rab tu shes pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pas so // 'am zhes bya ba'i sgra ni tshig kyal pa'i phyir ram /
translated: One fully knows by means of the mental consciousness.

original: lan cig ma yin par byed pa brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: lan cig ma yin par byed pa brjod pa yin no //
translated: The word or indicates that one is idle talker, or that one does it more than once.

original: de lta bas na 'dis ni mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / dogs pa nyid bstan pa yin no //🔽dge slong rnams kyis zhes @279a * //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dis ni mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / dogs pa nyid bstan pa yin no // dge slong rnams kyis zhes @279a * //
translated: Therefore, this shows that one is seeing, hearing, and suspecting.

original: bya ba ni skrod par bskos pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: bya ba ni skrod par bskos pa rnams kyis so //
translated: The monks are those who have been appointed to expel.

original: de skad ces bya ba ni blo la gnas pa'o //🔽de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de skad ces bya ba ni blo la gnas pa'o // de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The phrase in this way means in this manner.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In order to demonstrate that, it says venerable ones, etc.,

original: khyed kyis zhes bya ba ni de lta bu khyed kyis so //
analyzed: khyed kyis zhes bya ba ni de lta bu khyed kyis so //
translated: The phrase by you means in this manner by you.

original: khyed kyis zhes bya ba ni khyed cag gis te /
analyzed: khyed kyis zhes bya ba ni khyed cag gis te /
translated: The phrase by you means by you all.

original: khyim gang dag ngan par spyad pa ma yin pa'i gnas de dag khyed kyis sun phyung bas de'i phyir deng shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: khyim gang dag ngan par spyad pa ma yin pa'i gnas de dag khyed kyis sun phyung bas de'i phyir deng shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since you have defiled those households that are not places of misconduct, therefore, go away is the meaning.

original: gnas par zhes bya ba ni 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: gnas par zhes bya ba ni 'dug pa'o //
translated: The phrase to dwell means to stay.

original: gnas 'di nas zhes bya ba ni grong ngam grong rdal nas so //
analyzed: gnas 'di nas zhes bya ba ni grong ngam grong rdal nas so //
translated: From this place means from a village or town.

original: deng shig ces bya ba ni song cig pa ste /
analyzed: deng shig ces bya ba ni song cig pa ste /
translated: Go away means go.

original: de lta bas na 'dis ni bskrad par bya ba'i las bsnyad do //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dis ni bskrad par bya ba'i las bsnyad do //
translated: Therefore, this explains the action of expulsion.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir ro //
translated: Thus means because.

original: 'dra ba kho na las zhes bya ba ni de dang 'dra ba las so //
analyzed: 'dra ba kho na las zhes bya ba ni de dang 'dra ba las so //
translated: From one who is similar means from one who is like him.

original: tshig gi lam ni tshig nyid lam yin te /
analyzed: tshig gi lam ni tshig nyid lam yin te /
translated: The path of speech is the path that is speech itself,

original: de kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems pa de'i sgo nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems pa de'i sgo nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is engaged in through the intention that motivates it.

original: yang na gzhan dag na re tshig gi lam yin te /
analyzed: yang na gzhan dag na re tshig gi lam yin te /
translated: Or, according to others, it is the path of speech,

original: 'dun pas 'gro ba nyid la sogs pa'i bsam pa de'i sgo nas tshig 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'dun pas 'gro ba nyid la sogs pa'i bsam pa de'i sgo nas tshig 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: because speech is engaged in through the intention of going by desire and so on.

original: yang 'di na dge slong zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'di la zhes bya ba ni bstan pa pa'o //
analyzed: yang 'di na dge slong zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'di la zhes bya ba ni bstan pa pa'o //
translated: Here, this refers to the one who is being taught.

original: 'ga' zhes bya ba'i sgra ni grogs med pa rjod par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' zhes bya ba'i sgra ni grogs med pa rjod par byed pa yin no //
translated: The word any expresses being without a companion.

original: bka' blo mi bde ba nyid kyis rang bzhin can ni 'di la tshig ngan pa 'bras bu med pa yod pas na bka' blo mi bde ba ste /
analyzed: bka' blo mi bde ba nyid kyis rang bzhin can ni 'di la tshig ngan pa 'bras bu med pa yod pas na bka' blo mi bde ba ste /
translated: This is the nature of the one who is disagreeable to talk to, because he has useless harsh speech.

original: nyan du mi btub pa'o //🔽de'i ngo bo ni bka' blo mi bde ba nyid do //
analyzed: nyan du mi btub pa'o // de'i ngo bo ni bka' blo mi bde ba nyid do //
translated: He is disagreeable to talk to, because he is not fit to be talked to.🔽Its nature is being disagreeable to talk to.

original: de lta bu ni bka' blo mi bde ba nyid kyi rang bzhin can te /
analyzed: de lta bu ni bka' blo mi bde ba nyid kyi rang bzhin can te /
translated: This is the nature of the one who is disagreeable to talk to.

original: tshig mi bzod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshig mi bzod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he is intolerant of words.

original: gdon par gtogs pa ni so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa rnam pa bzhir gtogs pa dag go //
analyzed: gdon par gtogs pa ni so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa rnam pa bzhir gtogs pa dag go //
translated: Those who are included in the recitation are those who are included in the four types of recitation of the Prātimokṣa Sūtra.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i mdor gtogs pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i mdo ril du gtogs pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i mdor gtogs pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i mdo ril du gtogs pa rnams kyis so //
translated: Those who are included in the Sūtras of the Well-Gone One means those who are included in the entire Prātimokṣa Sūtra.

original: tshig gnyis smos pa ni 'don pa'i dus na bka' blo mi bde bar byed pa na yang nyes par 'gyur la /
analyzed: tshig gnyis smos pa ni 'don pa'i dus na bka' blo mi bde bar byed pa na yang nyes par 'gyur la /
translated: The mention of two phrases is to show that when one is disagreeable to talk to at the time of recitation, there is an offense,

original: gzhan na byed na yang 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan na byed na yang 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and also when one does it elsewhere, there is an offense.

original: gzhan dag na re 'don par gtogs pa ni so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa rnam pa lngar gtogs pa dag yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'don par gtogs pa ni so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa rnam pa lngar gtogs pa dag yin no //
translated: Others say: Those belonging to the recitation are those belonging to the five types of recitation of the Pratimokṣa Sūtra.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i mdor gtogs pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni bde bar gshegs pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan @279b 'das rnams kyis mdor gsungs pa mdo sde'i sde snod gang yin pa der gtogs pa rnams kyis so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i mdor gtogs pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni bde bar gshegs pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan @279b 'das rnams kyis mdor gsungs pa mdo sde'i sde snod gang yin pa der gtogs pa rnams kyis so zhes zer ro //
translated: Those belonging to the sūtras of the Sugata are those belonging to the sūtra piṭaka taught by the Sugata, the Bhagavān Buddhas.

original: chos dang mthun pa ni mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / dogs pas so //
analyzed: chos dang mthun pa ni mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / dogs pas so //
translated: In accordance with the Dharma means by seeing, hearing, and suspecting.

original: 'dul ba dang mthun pa zhes bya ba ni dus su dang / yang dag par dang / don dang ldan par dang / bshes pa nyid du ste /
analyzed: 'dul ba dang mthun pa zhes bya ba ni dus su dang / yang dag par dang / don dang ldan par dang / bshes pa nyid du ste /
translated: In accordance with the Vinaya means at the proper time, correctly, with a purpose, and with affection.

original: zhe sdang gi khyad par gyis ma yin no //🔽brjod par bya ba ma yin par zhes bya ba ni gdams ngag la sogs pa'i snod ma yin par te /
analyzed: zhe sdang gi khyad par gyis ma yin no // brjod par bya ba ma yin par zhes bya ba ni gdams ngag la sogs pa'i snod ma yin par te /
translated: It is not out of a specific hatred.🔽Not to be spoken means not being a vessel for instruction and so on.

original: smra bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: smra bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means not to be spoken.

original: ji ltar bdag nyid brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid du byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag nyid brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid du byed ce na /
translated: How does he make himself not an object of expression?

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says, “Venerable ones,” and so on.

original: cang ma smra cig ces bya ba la sogs pas ni da ltar 'dems pa 'gog par smras pa yin no //
analyzed: cang ma smra cig ces bya ba la sogs pas ni da ltar 'dems pa 'gog par smras pa yin no //
translated: By saying, “Do not speak,” and so on, he prohibits the present selection.

original: tshig gi zhes bya ba ni smras pa gang yin pa des chog gi kho bo la lhag pa cung zad kyang ma smra cig pa'o //
analyzed: tshig gi zhes bya ba ni smras pa gang yin pa des chog gi kho bo la lhag pa cung zad kyang ma smra cig pa'o //
translated: By saying, “Enough of the words,” he says, “Enough of the speech that is going on. Do not say anything more to me.”

original: thog shig ces bya ba 'dis ni ma 'ongs pa 'gog par smras pa yin no zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bka' blo mi bde ba yongs su rdzogs par ston to //
analyzed: thog shig ces bya ba 'dis ni ma 'ongs pa 'gog par smras pa yin no zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bka' blo mi bde ba yongs su rdzogs par ston to //
translated: By saying, “Stop,” he prohibits the future. The word “also” indicates the completion of the unpleasant command.

original: de la dge slong rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la brjod par bya ba nyid la phan yon ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: de la dge slong rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la brjod par bya ba nyid la phan yon ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: There, by saying, “The monks,” and so on, what benefit is there in being an object of expression?

original: 'di lta ste gcig la gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste gcig la gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says, “For example, one to another,” and so on.

original: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba 'di ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'am nye bar ston pa'i tshig yin na //
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba 'di ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'am nye bar ston pa'i tshig yin na //
translated: Thus is a term that indicates in this way or like this.

original: gcig la gcig brjod pa nyid du byed pa ni phan tshun gleng ba'i phyir ro //🔽gcig la gcig 'doms shing rjes su ston pa ni phan tshun slob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig la gcig brjod pa nyid du byed pa ni phan tshun gleng ba'i phyir ro // gcig la gcig 'doms shing rjes su ston pa ni phan tshun slob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Mutual exhortation is because of mutual instruction. 🔽Mutual instruction is because of mutual teaching.

original: gcig la gcig ltung ba las slong ba nyid ni phan tshun ltung ba sbyong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig la gcig ltung ba las slong ba nyid ni phan tshun ltung ba sbyong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Mutual confession of downfalls is because of mutual purification of downfalls.

original: 'phel bar gyur gyi zhes bya ba ni dar ba'am yang dag pa'i 'phel bas rgyas par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'phel bar gyur gyi zhes bya ba ni dar ba'am yang dag pa'i 'phel bas rgyas par gyur pa'o //
translated: It is said that it has increased because of flourishing or because of correct increase.

original: brjod par bya ba ma yin par byed pa'i las kyi mtha' ni gleng bar bya ba ma yin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ma yin par byed pa'i las kyi mtha' ni gleng bar bya ba ma yin par byed pa'o //
translated: The limit of action that should not be spoken of is that which should not be spoken of.

original: ltung ba rnam par dbye ba ni bslab pa'i gzhi snga ma'i rjes su 'brangs te ci rigs pa rnam par bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: ltung ba rnam par dbye ba ni bslab pa'i gzhi snga ma'i rjes su 'brangs te ci rigs pa rnam par bshad par bya'o //
translated: The classification of downfalls should be explained according to the previous bases of training, as is appropriate.

original: dge 'dun gyi dbyen dang rjes su phyogs pa dang / bka' blo mi bde ba'i dge 'dun lhag ma gtan la dbab pa'o /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi dbyen dang rjes su phyogs pa dang / bka' blo mi bde ba'i dge 'dun lhag ma gtan la dbab pa'o /
translated: The schism of the Sangha and its aftermath, and the remaining offenses of the Sangha that are to be determined.

original: // / gzhung bla ma'i tshig dka' ba rnam par bshad pa'i rigs pa dang ldan pa slob dpon mdo sde 'dzin pa dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bkod pa las lhag ma rnams rdzogs so /
analyzed: // / gzhung bla ma'i tshig dka' ba rnam par bshad pa'i rigs pa dang ldan pa slob dpon mdo sde 'dzin pa dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bkod pa las lhag ma rnams rdzogs so /
translated: The remainder of the arrangement by the spiritual friend, the teacher, the upadhyaya, the holder of the sutras, who is endowed with the reasoning that explains the difficult points of the root text, is complete.

original: // / @280a * //  gcig pu gcig dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: // / @280a * //  gcig pu gcig dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The verse beginning with “alone, together” and so on.

original: gcig dang gcig ni gcig pu gcig dang ngo //🔽bya ba gang la de dag yod pa de la de skad ces bya ba de dang ste /
analyzed: gcig dang gcig ni gcig pu gcig dang ngo // bya ba gang la de dag yod pa de la de skad ces bya ba de dang ste /
translated: “Alone, together” means alone, together.

original: gzhan med pa nyid du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan med pa nyid du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That which has those is so called, and that means “without another.”

original: dpen ba ni skye bo 'du ba dang phral ba'i phyogs so //
analyzed: dpen ba ni skye bo 'du ba dang phral ba'i phyogs so //
translated: “Isolated” means a place free from crowds.

original: skyabs yong pa na zhes bya ba rtsig pa la sogs pas bskor ba na'o //
analyzed: skyabs yong pa na zhes bya ba rtsig pa la sogs pas bskor ba na'o //
translated: “In a shelter” means surrounded by walls and so on.

original: mngon par bya zhes bya ba ni mi tshangs par spyod du'o //
analyzed: mngon par bya zhes bya ba ni mi tshangs par spyod du'o //
translated: “To engage in” means to engage in sexual activity.

original: rung bar bya zhes bya ba ni btub par ro //
analyzed: rung bar bya zhes bya ba ni btub par ro //
translated: “To be suitable” means to be able.

original: stan las zhes bya ba ni khri la sogs pa 'dom gang khor yug gi nang na'o //
analyzed: stan las zhes bya ba ni khri la sogs pa 'dom gang khor yug gi nang na'o //
translated: “From a seat” means from a seat that is one cubit in size.

original: 'dug par ni 'khod par ro //
analyzed: 'dug par ni 'khod par ro //
translated: “To sit” means to be seated.

original: byed cing zhes bya ba ni byed pa la'o //
analyzed: byed cing zhes bya ba ni byed pa la'o //
translated: “To do” means to do.

original: dag bsnyen ma ni thar ba dang nye bar bde 'gro 'thob pa dang nye bar gnas shing 'dug pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: dag bsnyen ma ni thar ba dang nye bar bde 'gro 'thob pa dang nye bar gnas shing 'dug pa'i phyir ro /
translated: “A female lay practitioner” is one who is close to liberation and is close to attaining a happy rebirth.

original: yid ches pa'i tshig dang ldan pas zhes bya ba ni bden pa mthong ba nyid kyis ma 'khrul ba'o zhes rab tu grags pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yid ches pa'i tshig dang ldan pas zhes bya ba ni bden pa mthong ba nyid kyis ma 'khrul ba'o zhes rab tu grags pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Possessing trustworthy speech” means that she is not confused because she has seen the truth. This is well known, as the phrase “well known” indicates.

original: don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is as follows.

original: ltung ba khas len pas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni med do //
analyzed: ltung ba khas len pas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni med do //
translated: There is no presentation of downfalls by way of admitting downfalls.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What then is it?

original: dge bsnyen ma'i tshig las te /
analyzed: dge bsnyen ma'i tshig las te /
translated: It is from the words of a female lay practitioner.

original: dge bsnyen ma'i yang bden ba mthong ba'i phyir brdzun mi smra'o //
analyzed: dge bsnyen ma'i yang bden ba mthong ba'i phyir brdzun mi smra'o //
translated: A female lay practitioner does not lie because she has seen the truth.

original: gang dang gang gis zhes bya ba ni nyes pa spom po la sogs pa gzhan gyis so //🔽byed du gzhug pa ni sgrub tu gzhug pa ste /
analyzed: gang dang gang gis zhes bya ba ni nyes pa spom po la sogs pa gzhan gyis so // byed du gzhug pa ni sgrub tu gzhug pa ste /
translated: “By whom and by what” means by others, such as the great offense.🔽“To make confess” means to make confess and so on, to make amends.

original: bshags pa la sogs pa bcos pa byed du gzhug ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: bshags pa la sogs pa bcos pa byed du gzhug ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: This is the meaning of “to make confess and so on.”

original: lung las khas len pa bzhin du 'di las nges par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lung las khas len pa bzhin du 'di las nges par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said in the scriptures, “One should definitely understand this from this text, as one accepts the scriptures.”

original: ma nges pa ni ltung ba nges pa med pas che bzhis phye ba'i sgo nas phas pham pa la sogs pa rnam par bzhag pa'i phyir ma nges pa'i ngo bo yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ma nges pa ni ltung ba nges pa med pas che bzhis phye ba'i sgo nas phas pham pa la sogs pa rnam par bzhag pa'i phyir ma nges pa'i ngo bo yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Indeterminate” means that the nature of the offense is indeterminate, because the four defeats and so on are posited by way of the four classes of offense.

original: 'dod pa byar mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni mi tshangs par spyad pa byar mi rung ba ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa byar mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni mi tshangs par spyad pa byar mi rung ba ste /
translated: “It is not suitable to engage in sexual intercourse” means it is not suitable to engage in impure conduct.

original: yul thag ring po na gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul thag ring po na gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the object is far away.

original: de'i phyir 'di la mi tshangs par spyod pa'i pham pa'i dogs pa med pas dge 'dun lhag ma dang ltung byed ces bya ba'i chos gnyis kyis gleng bar bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la mi tshangs par spyod pa'i pham pa'i dogs pa med pas dge 'dun lhag ma dang ltung byed ces bya ba'i chos gnyis kyis gleng bar bshad do //
translated: Therefore, since there is no fear of a defeat through sexual misconduct, it is explained that the two rules called “defeat of the Saṅgha” and “offense of expiation” are to be discussed.

original: de skad du yang chos gnyis po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de skad du yang chos gnyis po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said, “The two rules, etc.”

original: btsun pa dag ces bya ba mang po'i tshig 'di ni bod pa yin no //
analyzed: btsun pa dag ces bya ba mang po'i tshig 'di ni bod pa yin no //
translated: The word “honorable sirs” is a salutation.

original: mtha' dang po ni mi tshangs par spyod pa'i pham ba ste /
analyzed: mtha' dang po ni mi tshangs par spyod pa'i pham ba ste /
translated: The first alternative is defeat through sexual misconduct.

original: de ni btsun pa bzang sbyin gyis bstan pa la pham pa 'byung @280b ba'i tshe dang por gyur pas so //
analyzed: de ni btsun pa bzang sbyin gyis bstan pa la pham pa 'byung @280b ba'i tshe dang por gyur pas so //
translated: That is the first to occur when a defeat occurs in the teaching of the honorable Bhadradatta.

original: bgyid du stsal tam zhes bya ba ni zhu ba'o //
analyzed: bgyid du stsal tam zhes bya ba ni zhu ba'o //
translated: “To have done” is a request.

original: byed du mi gzhug go zhes bya ba ni lan to //
analyzed: byed du mi gzhug go zhes bya ba ni lan to //
translated: “Do not have done” is the reply.

original: de la byed du gzhug pa ni ci rigs par bcos pa bsgrub tu gzhug pa ste /
analyzed: de la byed du gzhug pa ni ci rigs par bcos pa bsgrub tu gzhug pa ste /
translated: There, “to have done” is to have done what is appropriate, to have accomplished the correction.

original: de bzhin du 'og ma dag la yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'og ma dag la yang shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus it should be understood for the rest.

original: de la byed du mi gzhug go zhes bya ba ni zla la rma ba'i phyir ro //🔽de'i ngo bo nyid tshol du stsal ba ni dran pa brjed pa rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ltung ba 'di'i rigs ni ci yin pa ltung ba 'di gang yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ngo bo nyid du gzhug pa'i phyir spong ba las rdzogs par rtogs
analyzed: de la byed du mi gzhug go zhes bya ba ni zla la rma ba'i phyir ro // de'i ngo bo nyid tshol du stsal ba ni dran pa brjed pa rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ltung ba 'di'i rigs ni ci yin pa ltung ba 'di gang yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ngo bo nyid du gzhug pa'i phyir spong ba las rdzogs par rtogs
translated: One should not make him do it means that he should not be made to confess his transgression.🔽The one who is seeking the nature of the offense is the one who has forgotten the downfall.  This type of downfall, what is this downfall? and so forth, is to make him understand the nature of the offense.

original: pa'i chad pa'i las byed du gzhug pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i chad pa'i las byed du gzhug pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The one who is seeking the completion of the confession is the one who has committed the downfall but has not yet confessed it. One should not make him do it means that he should not be made to do the action of the penalty. One should not make him do it means that he should not be made to do the action of the penalty.

original: mi gzhug ste zhes bya ba ni da dung che bzhi rma ba la sogs pa'i cho ga ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi gzhug ste zhes bya ba ni da dung che bzhi rma ba la sogs pa'i cho ga ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the rite of confession, etc., has not yet been performed. One should not make him do it means that he should not be made to do the action of the penalty.

original: 'di la ni gang gi tshe che bzhi rma ba la sogs pas ni nges pa nyid yin la gleng bar bya ba de ni phyir nyes pa ni khas mi len gyi /
analyzed: 'di la ni gang gi tshe che bzhi rma ba la sogs pas ni nges pa nyid yin la gleng bar bya ba de ni phyir nyes pa ni khas mi len gyi /
translated: In this case, when the confession, etc., is certain, but the one who is to be accused does not accept the fault, one should not make him do it means that he should not be made to do the action of the penalty.

original: bud med dang lhan cig 'dug pa la sogs pa ni khas len na de'i tshe 'di gsungs te ;
analyzed: bud med dang lhan cig 'dug pa la sogs pa ni khas len na de'i tshe 'di gsungs te ;
translated: But when he accepts the fault of sitting with a woman, etc., then this is said: One should make him do it.🔽 🔽One should not make him do it means that he should not be made to do the action of the penalty.

original: khas mi len na 'de la de'i ngo bo nyid tshol du gzhug pa sbyin pa bya'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khas mi len na 'de la de'i ngo bo nyid tshol du gzhug pa sbyin pa bya'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If he does not admit it, he should be made to search for its intrinsic reality.

original: yod dam zhes bya ba ni yod par gyur tam zhes pa'o //
analyzed: yod dam zhes bya ba ni yod par gyur tam zhes pa'o //
translated: If he says, “It exists,” he should be asked, “Does it exist as existent?”

original: mthun pa zhes bya ba la ni mthun par gyur na ste /
analyzed: mthun pa zhes bya ba la ni mthun par gyur na ste /
translated: If he says, “It is similar,” he should be asked, “Is it similar as similar?”

original: kha mthun na zhes gal te ci'i phyir cig shos la 'dri bar bya zhes zer na /
analyzed: kha mthun na zhes gal te ci'i phyir cig shos la 'dri bar bya zhes zer na /
translated: If he says, “It is the same,” he should be asked, “Why do you ask the other?”

original: 'dul ba 'dzin pa rnams na re rma ba 'di nges pa mi g-yo ba rnyed na 'khrul pa med par shes par bya ba'i phyir dang / mi g-yo ba'i chos ma rnyed na g-yo ba srid pa shes par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'dul ba 'dzin pa rnams na re rma ba 'di nges pa mi g-yo ba rnyed na 'khrul pa med par shes par bya ba'i phyir dang / mi g-yo ba'i chos ma rnyed na g-yo ba srid pa shes par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: Vinaya experts say: “If he finds a fixed, unmoving response, he should be understood to be without error. If he does not find an unmoving response, he should be understood to be moving.

original: sngar sdig pa la ma zhugs pa mi 'jug pas so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: sngar sdig pa la ma zhugs pa mi 'jug pas so zhes zer ro //
translated: He should not engage in evil that he has not previously engaged in.”

original: gleng bar byed pa dge bsnyen ma yid ches pa'i tshig dang ldan pa dang / bud med che bzhir gyur pa ni yon tan phul du byung ba'i dpe'o //
analyzed: gleng bar byed pa dge bsnyen ma yid ches pa'i tshig dang ldan pa dang / bud med che bzhir gyur pa ni yon tan phul du byung ba'i dpe'o //
translated: The trustworthy laywoman who speaks is an example of one with excellent qualities.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bden pa mthong ba nyid kyang yin la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bden pa mthong ba nyid kyang yin la /
translated: Therefore, they see the truth.

original: phul du byung ba nyid kyang yin na smra ba po 'di khyim pa'ang rung yon tan gyi sgo nas tshad mar bya'o zhes bshad do //🔽de'i phyir 'dul ba 'dzin pa rnams na re 'dir lugs ni bden pa ma mthong ba rnam pas bden pa mthong ba dang / yon tan phul du byung ba ma yin pas yon tan phul du byung ba dang / gnyi ga bden pa mthong ba nyid yin na bden pa mthong ba'i yon tan phul du byung ba tshad mar bya'o zhes bya ba 'di yin par shes par bya'o zhes @281a * //
analyzed: phul du byung ba nyid kyang yin na smra ba po 'di khyim pa'ang rung yon tan gyi sgo nas tshad mar bya'o zhes bshad do // de'i phyir 'dul ba 'dzin pa rnams na re 'dir lugs ni bden pa ma mthong ba rnam pas bden pa mthong ba dang / yon tan phul du byung ba ma yin pas yon tan phul du byung ba dang / gnyi ga bden pa mthong ba nyid yin na bden pa mthong ba'i yon tan phul du byung ba tshad mar bya'o zhes bya ba 'di yin par shes par bya'o zhes @281a * //
translated: Therefore, if one sees the truths and is distinguished, then even if this speaker is a layperson, he should be taken as an authority on the basis of his qualities.

original: zer ro // 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs ba la /🔽de zhes bya ba ni dge bsnyen ma'o //
analyzed: zer ro // 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs ba la / de zhes bya ba ni dge bsnyen ma'o //
translated: Thus the Vinaya masters say, “Here, the system should be understood in this way: If one does not see the truths, one does not see the truths; if one is not distinguished, one is not distinguished; if one sees the truths and is distinguished, one should be taken as an authority on the basis of seeing the truths and being distinguished.”

original: the tshom za bar gyur na don de shes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: the tshom za bar gyur na don de shes pa ma yin te /
translated: If one has doubt, one does not know the meaning,

original: 'di ltar nges pa'i shes pa ma skyes ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar nges pa'i shes pa ma skyes ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one does not generate the knowledge of certainty.

original: de bas na 'dis ni don 'dra ba smra ba'i sgo nas gleng bar byed pa'am che bzhi gang la yang rung ba la dge 'dun the tshom du gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'dis ni don 'dra ba smra ba'i sgo nas gleng bar byed pa'am che bzhi gang la yang rung ba la dge 'dun the tshom du gyur ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is the way to understand the statement: “The Saṅgha is in doubt about the matter that is the basis for the dispute, whether it is a matter that is the basis for a dispute or a matter that is the basis for a grave offense.”

original: de nas dge 'dun la shes par brjod pa gang yin pa de med pa nyid du shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas dge 'dun la shes par brjod pa gang yin pa de med pa nyid du shes par bya ste /
translated: “Then, the Saṅgha should understand that the statement of what is known is nonexistent.”

original: des shes pa de la rtsong pa rnam par gzhag par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de bstan par shes bar bya'o //
analyzed: des shes pa de la rtsong pa rnam par gzhag par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de bstan par shes bar bya'o //
translated: “The Saṅgha should understand that the statement of what is known is nonexistent” means that the statement of what is known should not be used to establish the dispute.

original: 'di ltar gang gi tshe gleng bar byed ba'am che bzhir dang bor 'di skad ces bdag gis mtha' dang po 'byin ba mthong ngo zhes smras la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi tshe gleng bar byed ba'am che bzhir dang bor 'di skad ces bdag gis mtha' dang po 'byin ba mthong ngo zhes smras la /
translated: “When the one who is disputing first says, ‘I see the beginning of the matter,’

original: des kyang dge 'dun de'i yul la 'di ni pham par gyur to zhes snyam pa'i nges pa'i shes pa las gang gi tshe phyis bdag gis mtha' gnyis pa la sogs pa 'byin par mthong ngo zhes smra na /
analyzed: des kyang dge 'dun de'i yul la 'di ni pham par gyur to zhes snyam pa'i nges pa'i shes pa las gang gi tshe phyis bdag gis mtha' gnyis pa la sogs pa 'byin par mthong ngo zhes smra na /
translated: and the Saṅgha has the definite knowledge that the matter is a defeat, then later, when he says, ‘I see the middle of the matter,’ and so on,

original: de'i tshe 'dis dran pa smra ba'i sgo nas gnas gzhan du sbed par dge 'dun la the tshom skul bar byed de /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'dis dran pa smra ba'i sgo nas gnas gzhan du sbed par dge 'dun la the tshom skul bar byed de /
translated: At that time, he causes doubt to arise in the Saṅgha regarding the concealment of downfalls in other abodes through the act of reminding.

original: des ni rtsong pa la rnam par gzhag pa mi 'grub bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: des ni rtsong pa la rnam par gzhag pa mi 'grub bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: This means that the establishment of the rite is not accomplished.

original: lugs la the tshom zad par gyur na shes pa nyid ma yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //🔽rmed du gzhug pa ni bdag ltung ba 'byung ngo zhes sam /
analyzed: lugs la the tshom zad par gyur na shes pa nyid ma yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro // rmed du gzhug pa ni bdag ltung ba 'byung ngo zhes sam /
translated: Because it is said, “If one doubts the system, it is not knowledge.”🔽One should not be made to confess downfalls by asking, “Did you commit a downfall?”🔽Or, “Did you not commit a downfall?”

original: 'on te ma yin no zhes de ltar khas len du gzhug pa'i ltung ba bcos byed du gzhug pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te ma yin no zhes de ltar khas len du gzhug pa'i ltung ba bcos byed du gzhug pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Because it is said, “One should not be made to confess downfalls by asking, ‘Did you commit a downfall?’”

original: 'di ltar gnas gzhan du sbed ba dang 'khrugs par gyur pa la ni gleng ba mi 'chags so zhes 'byung ba'i phyir 'dra ba smra ba nyid kyis gnas gzhan du sbed pas gleng ba ma chags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gnas gzhan du sbed ba dang 'khrugs par gyur pa la ni gleng ba mi 'chags so zhes 'byung ba'i phyir 'dra ba smra ba nyid kyis gnas gzhan du sbed pas gleng ba ma chags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said, “One should not confess downfalls in other abodes or in a disturbed state,” and because one does not confess downfalls in other abodes through the act of reminding, which is similar to that.

original: de bas na gleng bar byed pa'am che bzhi la the tshom za na gleng bar bya ba de nyid na ci 'di khyod kyis byas sam 'on te ma yin zhes dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na gleng bar byed pa'am che bzhi la the tshom za na gleng bar bya ba de nyid na ci 'di khyod kyis byas sam 'on te ma yin zhes dri bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, if one doubts the four great matters, one should ask, “Is this your doing or not?”

original: bdag ltung ba 'byung ngo zhe 'am /
analyzed: bdag ltung ba 'byung ngo zhe 'am /
translated: If he says, “I have fallen,”

original: ma yin no zhes zer na thos pa dang tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'i yon tan phul du byung bas tshang ma nyid yod du zin kyang rtsod pa de nye bar zhi bar bya ste /🔽'di ltar rtsod pa de'i rgyu mtshan can gyi the tshom dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: ma yin no zhes zer na thos pa dang tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'i yon tan phul du byung bas tshang ma nyid yod du zin kyang rtsod pa de nye bar zhi bar bya ste / 'di ltar rtsod pa de'i rgyu mtshan can gyi the tshom dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: or “I have not,” then even if he is replete with the best qualities of learning, morality, and concentration, the dispute should be pacified,🔽because he is free from doubt about the reason for the dispute.

original: glengs pas khas blangs pa ni mthar thug pa'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: glengs pas khas blangs pa ni mthar thug pa'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is the conclusion, because it is said, “The conclusion is acceptance through discussion.”

original: gzhan las ni khas @281b len pas byed du gzhug go zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gzhan las ni khas @281b len pas byed du gzhug go zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: But another text says, “One should make him accept through another.”

original: de la don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows.

original: bdag nyid kyi khas len pas ltung ba bcos pa byed du gzhug go //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi khas len pas ltung ba bcos pa byed du gzhug go //
translated: One should make him accept through another, because he himself has fallen.

original: gleng bar byed par ma gtogs pa'am che bzhir gtogs ba'i tshig gis ma yin te /
analyzed: gleng bar byed par ma gtogs pa'am che bzhir gtogs ba'i tshig gis ma yin te /
translated: It is not by words that are not included in the topics of discussion or that are included in the four great topics.

original: 'di ltar the tshom za bar gyur na nges pa ma grub ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar the tshom za bar gyur na nges pa ma grub ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if one has doubts, certainty is not established.

original: tshul 'di nyid ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i gzhung 'og ma dag la ni ci rigs par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: tshul 'di nyid ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i gzhung 'og ma dag la ni ci rigs par shes par bya'o //
translated: This very method should be understood in the following passages of the treatise as appropriate.

original: gnyis ba ni ma byin par len ba'i pham pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis ba ni ma byin par len ba'i pham pa'o //
translated: The second is the defeat of taking what is not given.

original: gsum pa ni gsod pa'i pham pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni gsod pa'i pham pa'o //
translated: The third is the defeat of killing.

original: bzhi pa ni smra ba'i pham ba'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni smra ba'i pham ba'o //
translated: The fourth is the defeat of speaking.

original: sngo bsangs mo ni pi yang ku'i mdog ltar sngo bsangs su 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: sngo bsangs mo ni pi yang ku'i mdog ltar sngo bsangs su 'dug pa'o //
translated: Sini means having a complexion as blue as a peacock's neck.

original: sdu gu ma ni lus mdzes ba'o //
analyzed: sdu gu ma ni lus mdzes ba'o //
translated: Sundari means having a beautiful body.

original: tshon mo ni lus sbom po'o //
analyzed: tshon mo ni lus sbom po'o //
translated: Pichilā means having a plump body.

original: rgyas par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di ni mdor bsdus pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: rgyas par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di ni mdor bsdus pa'i tshig go //
translated: To be explained extensively is a word of summary.

original: mtha' dang po'i phung po ni pham pa'i ris so //
analyzed: mtha' dang po'i phung po ni pham pa'i ris so //
translated: The first part of the aggregates is the class of defeats.

original: mthun na zhes bya ba ni kha mthun na ste /
analyzed: mthun na zhes bya ba ni kha mthun na ste /
translated: If they agree means if they agree.

original: 'di ltar gzhi bden pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhi bden pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in this way the basis is true.

original: gnyis pa ni dge 'dun lhag ma'i ris so //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni dge 'dun lhag ma'i ris so //
translated: The second is the class of offenses entailing suspension.

original: gsum pa ni ltung byed kyi ris so //
analyzed: gsum pa ni ltung byed kyi ris so //
translated: The third is the class of offenses of wrongdoing.

original: bzhi pa ni so sor bshags pa'i ris so //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni so sor bshags pa'i ris so //
translated: The fourth is the class of offenses that must be confessed and repaid.

original: lnga pa ni nyes byas kyi ris so //
analyzed: lnga pa ni nyes byas kyi ris so //
translated: The fifth is the class of minor infractions.

original: dge 'dun lhag ma dang po ni khu ba 'byin pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma dang po ni khu ba 'byin pa las byung ba'o //
translated: The first offense entailing suspension is committed by emitting semen.

original: gnyis pa ni reg pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni reg pa las byung ba'o //
translated: The second is committed by touching.

original: gsum pa ni 'khrig pa dang ldan pa smra ba las byung ba'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni 'khrig pa dang ldan pa smra ba las byung ba'o //
translated: The third is committed by speaking of sexual intercourse.

original: bzhi pa ni bsnyen bkur bsngags pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni bsnyen bkur bsngags pa las byung ba'o //
translated: The fourth is committed by praising service.

original: lnga pa ni smyan byed pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: lnga pa ni smyan byed pa las byung ba'o //
translated: The fifth is committed by acting as a matchmaker.

original: drug pa ni khang pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: drug pa ni khang pa las byung ba'o //

analyzed: dgung bcu 'das pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni zhag bcu'i spang ba bshad do //

analyzed: dgung gcig bral ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni bral ba'i spang ba bshad do //

original: skya rengs 'char bar byed ces bya ba la /
analyzed: skya rengs 'char bar byed ces bya ba la /
translated: The dawn is breaking.

original: gtso bo yin pa'i phyir shar phyogs nas nyi ma'i mgo rtsom par gyur pa skya rengs dang po gsal ba'i ngo bo 'char zhing byung gi bar du ldog pa ste /

analyzed: dus de srid 'da' bar byed na zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: de lta bas na 'dis ni zhag bcu 'das pa'i chos gos kyis 'bral ba'i spang ba slong bar bshad do //

analyzed: 'di ltar byin gyis ma brlabs pa'i chos gos ni 'bral ba'i ltung ba mi slong ngo //

analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa ni dgos pa la rnam par nges par sbyor ba yin na spang ba la dgos pa rnam par nges par sbyar du mi rung ba ni med de //
translated: A consecrated robe is applied to a purpose, but it is not suitable to apply a transgression to a purpose.

original: nyams par gyur pa ni brjod pa dang ltung ba dang / mi snang ba la sogs pas mthong ba'i lam las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: nyams par gyur pa ni brjod pa dang ltung ba dang / mi snang ba la sogs pas mthong ba'i lam las 'das pa'o //
translated: One who has fallen away is beyond the path of seeing through expression, downfall, invisibility, and so on.

analyzed: 'ba' zhig pa ni spang bar bya ba'i nor med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the wealth to be abandoned does not exist.

analyzed: 'di ltar spang ba'i nor dang bral ba'i phyir spong bar byed na nor med pa kho nas kyang spang ba'i nor dang bral ba grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If one abandons it because one is free from the wealth to be abandoned, then one is established as free from the wealth to be abandoned just by the nonexistence of wealth.

analyzed: 'dir 'ba' zhig pa'i ltung ba bshags par bya'o zhes gsungs pas ni spang ba'i nor med pa nyid du bshad pa yin no //
translated: Here, it is explained that the wealth to be abandoned does not exist because it is said, “The downfalls of the solitary should be confessed.”

original: de lta ma yin na spang bar ma byas pa'i phyir ji ltar ltung ba bshags pa legs par byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na spang bar ma byas pa'i phyir ji ltar ltung ba bshags pa legs par byas par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: gal te ltung ba bshags lags nas slar rnyed na spang bar bgyi 'am /
translated: If one obtains again after confessing a downfall, should it be abandoned?

analyzed: nye ba 'khor ma yin no zhes bya ba 'dis ni nyams pa'i dus nyid na rang nyid yin pa dang bral bar 'gyur ba las kyang phyir rnyed pa ni sngon med pa'i gos shig rnyed pa dang 'dra bas spang bar 'os pa nyid med do snyam du dgongs
translated: This passage shows that when one degenerates, one is separated from being a monk and that it is not proper to think that one is worthy of being expelled because one has obtained a robe that one did not have before.🔽

original: pa yin no //
analyzed: pa yin no //
translated: This passage Upali, it is not so indicates that when one degenerates, one is separated from being a monk, and that it is not proper to abandon the vows, thinking I will obtain them again, like obtaining a robe that I did not have before.

original: zhus pa la la las ni /
analyzed: zhus pa la la las ni /

analyzed: 'di btsun pa dge slong gis chos gos spang ba nyams par gyur na ltung ba bshags par bgyi'am /

analyzed: 'ba' zhig pa'i bshags par bya'o zhes gzhan du 'byung ste /
