analyzed: der don ni 'di kho nar zad de 'on kyang tshig 'bru tha dad pa nyid yin no //
translated: The meaning is just this, but the words are different.

original: lhag ma ni gal te ltung ba bshags nas slar rnyed na zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba yod do //
analyzed: lhag ma ni gal te ltung ba bshags nas slar rnyed na zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba yod do //
translated: The remainder is as follows: If one confesses a downfall and then obtains the vows again, and so on.

original: dum bu ni dam dum dag go //
analyzed: dum bu ni dam dum dag go //
translated: A piece is a small piece.

original: 'ba' zhig pa'i ltung ba bshags par bya ba ni gos yongs su rdzogs pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'ba' zhig pa'i ltung ba bshags par bya ba ni gos yongs su rdzogs pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: A mere downfall is confessed because the complete robe is not present.

original: 'di ltar gos la spang ba'i ltung ba bcas na chos gos kyi tshad med pa'i @283b phyir dum bu rnams la ni gos nyid med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar gos la spang ba'i ltung ba bcas na chos gos kyi tshad med pa'i @283b phyir dum bu rnams la ni gos nyid med do //
translated: Thus, if a robe is a downfall, then the robe is not a robe because the measure of a robe is not established.

original: spang ba rnams kyi nang na kun nas mtho gang ba'i gos gang yin pa ni phyi ma med pa yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spang ba rnams kyi nang na kun nas mtho gang ba'i gos gang yin pa ni phyi ma med pa yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Among the downfalls, the robe that is one cubit in size is the one without a remainder.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: Or, the phrase “or else” is a consideration.

original: kun nas khru gang ba zhes bya ba la khru ni lag pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas khru gang ba zhes bya ba la khru ni lag pa'o //
translated: A cubit is a span.

original: des na gal te gos kun nas khru gang ba'i tshad cig yin na de ni spang bar 'os pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: des na gal te gos kun nas khru gang ba'i tshad cig yin na de ni spang bar 'os pa'i phyir te /
translated: Therefore, if a robe is the measure of one cubit in size, then it is a downfall because it is a downfall that should be abandoned.

original: spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: spang bar bya'o //
translated: It should be abandoned.

original: zhus pa'i gzhung la la las ni /
analyzed: zhus pa'i gzhung la la las ni /
translated: In some recensions of the text of the questions,

original: btsun pa dge slong gis chos gos spang ba tshig gam srog chags dag gam sril dag gis 'tshal bar gyur na de la lhag rol dam dum gang dag mchis pa de dag spang bar bgyi 'am /
analyzed: btsun pa dge slong gis chos gos spang ba tshig gam srog chags dag gam sril dag gis 'tshal bar gyur na de la lhag rol dam dum gang dag mchis pa de dag spang bar bgyi 'am /
translated: “Reverend, if a monk has abandoned a robe, and it is lost, burned, or destroyed by worms, should he abandon the remainder, or not?”

original: nye ba 'khor ma yin te /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor ma yin te /
translated: Upāli, it should not be abandoned.

original: 'ba' zhig pa'i ltung ba bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig pa'i ltung ba bshags par bya'o //
translated: I confess the offense of eating alone.

original: byin gyis brlab par bgyi 'am /
analyzed: byin gyis brlab par bgyi 'am /
translated: Should I consecrate it?

original: nye ba 'khor ma yin te de nyid de dag byin gyis brlabs pa yin no zhes gzhan du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor ma yin te de nyid de dag byin gyis brlabs pa yin no zhes gzhan du 'byung ngo //
translated: Upāli, it is not so; that very thing is consecrated for them.

original: de la don ni 'di yin te 'tshal ba zhes bya ba ni zos pa'o //
analyzed: de la don ni 'di yin te 'tshal ba zhes bya ba ni zos pa'o //
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: “To eat” means to consume.

original: gang gis zos she na /
analyzed: gang gis zos she na /
translated: By whom is it consumed?

original: srog chags dag gam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: srog chags dag gam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The text says “living beings,” and so on.

original: srog chags ni gos za bar byed pa ba dang be'u rnams so //
analyzed: srog chags ni gos za bar byed pa ba dang be'u rnams so //
translated: “Living beings” are those that consume clothing, such as cows and calves.

original: sril ni srin bu dag go //
analyzed: sril ni srin bu dag go //
translated: “Worms” are insects.

original: dam du ma ni chung du dag pas kyang chung ba ste /
analyzed: dam du ma ni chung du dag pas kyang chung ba ste /
translated: “Small creatures” are even smaller than small.

original: kun nas mtho gang du mi chog pa rnams so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽de nyid de byin gyis rlob pa yin pa ni rang gi yin pa dang ma bral ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: kun nas mtho gang du mi chog pa rnams so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // de nyid de byin gyis rlob pa yin pa ni rang gi yin pa dang ma bral ba'i phyir te /
translated: They are those that cannot be seen without a magnifying glass.🔽“That very thing is consecrated” means that it is not separated from its owner.

original: 'di ltar dam dum du gyur pas rang gi yin par med par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di ltar dam dum du gyur pas rang gi yin par med par mi 'gyur la /
translated: In this way, it is not the case that it is not owned by its owner because it has become a small piece.

original: byin gyis rlob pa yang rang gi yin pa la brten pas 'di shes par bya'o //
analyzed: byin gyis rlob pa yang rang gi yin pa la brten pas 'di shes par bya'o //
translated: And the consecration is to be done by one’s own self, so this should be understood.

original: rnyed nas dgung lnga lon pa dang zhes bya ba ni rnyed nas zhag lnga lon pa dang ngo //
analyzed: rnyed nas dgung lnga lon pa dang zhes bya ba ni rnyed nas zhag lnga lon pa dang ngo //
translated: “Having obtained it, after five days” means having obtained it, after five days have passed.

original: sems 'khrugs pa ni las dang / skrag pa dang / gnod pa dang / ma snyoms pa dang / mya ngan dag gis so //
analyzed: sems 'khrugs pa ni las dang / skrag pa dang / gnod pa dang / ma snyoms pa dang / mya ngan dag gis so //
translated: “Disturbed mind” means by action, fear, harm, imbalance, and sorrow.

original: gang nas bzung ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rang bzhin las nyams na sngon gyi ngo bo dang khyad par yod pa'i ngo bo gzhan lta bu zhig 'byung bas 'di shes par bya'o//
analyzed: gang nas bzung ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rang bzhin las nyams na sngon gyi ngo bo dang khyad par yod pa'i ngo bo gzhan lta bu zhig 'byung bas 'di shes par bya'o//
translated: “From which time on” and so forth: if one falls away from the natural state, it is as if one has a different nature with a different essence, so this should be understood.

original: byin gyis ma brlabs pa ni rang gi nyid yin par rnam par nges par ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: byin gyis ma brlabs pa ni rang gi nyid yin par rnam par nges par ma byas pa'o //
translated: “Not consecrated” means not ascertained as one’s own.

original: nyin re zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa byung ste zhes bya ba ni rang gi yin par byin gyis brlabs par byas pa spangs te'o //
analyzed: nyin re zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa byung ste zhes bya ba ni rang gi yin par byin gyis brlabs par byas pa spangs te'o //
translated: “Every day” and so forth: “having obtained it” means having given up what has been consecrated as one’s own.

original: 'di la chos gos brgyad dam dgu'i nang nas re zhig nyi ma gcig la gos gsum @284a * //
analyzed: 'di la chos gos brgyad dam dgu'i nang nas re zhig nyi ma gcig la gos gsum @284a * //
translated: From among the eight or nine Dharma robes, he consecrates three robes for one day and passes the night in them.

original: zhig byin gyis brlabs nas mtshan mo 'das par byas te yang nyi ma gnyis pa la chos gos de gsum las phyung na /
analyzed: zhig byin gyis brlabs nas mtshan mo 'das par byas te yang nyi ma gnyis pa la chos gos de gsum las phyung na /
translated: Then, on the second day, he takes out those three robes.

original: de'i chos gos lhag ma rnams rung ba ma byas par 'dug pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i chos gos lhag ma rnams rung ba ma byas par 'dug pa nyid do //
translated: The remaining robes are not consecrated.

original: 'on kyang nyi ma gnyis pa la rung bar ma byas pa'i chos gos de dag gi nang nas chos gos gsum zhig byin gyis brlabs na sngar byin gyis brlabs te phyung ba'i chos gos gang dag yin pa dang / rung bar ma byas pa gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad rung bar ma byas pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang nyi ma gnyis pa la rung bar ma byas pa'i chos gos de dag gi nang nas chos gos gsum zhig byin gyis brlabs na sngar byin gyis brlabs te phyung ba'i chos gos gang dag yin pa dang / rung bar ma byas pa gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad rung bar ma byas pa nyid yin no //
translated: However, if he consecrates three robes from among those robes that are not consecrated on the second day, then all the robes that he consecrated and took out earlier and those that are not consecrated are not consecrated.

original: de ltar na tshul 'dis 'di'i chos gos byin gyis brlabs pa'i chos gos dag gi lhag ma rnams ni rung bar ma byas pa yang yin la rnam grangs kyis ma brlabs pa yang yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na tshul 'dis 'di'i chos gos byin gyis brlabs pa'i chos gos dag gi lhag ma rnams ni rung bar ma byas pa yang yin la rnam grangs kyis ma brlabs pa yang yin no //
translated: Thus, by this method, the remaining robes of the one who consecrates the robes are not made suitable and are not consecrated by category.

original: spun ni gang gis na gos 'thag par byed pa'o //
analyzed: spun ni gang gis na gos 'thag par byed pa'o //
translated: The thread is that by which the cloth is woven.

original: rgyu ni skud pa chur bres pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyu ni skud pa chur bres pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The material is the essence of the warp and weft, that is, the yarn.

original: thags su ma btags pa'i rgyu spun gyis ma btags pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: thags su ma btags pa'i rgyu spun gyis ma btags pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The material that is not woven is that which is not woven with thread.

original: dpag bsam gyi gos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dpag bsam gyi gos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is called the cloth of the wish-fulfilling tree.

original: rin po che ni k'ar sh'a pa na nyi shu la sogs pa ri ba'o //
analyzed: rin po che ni k'ar sh'a pa na nyi shu la sogs pa ri ba'o //
translated: The price is the value of twenty karshapana coins and so on.

original: ltung ba med ces bya ba'i chos gos rin po che 'chang ba'i ltung ba ma bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ltung ba med ces bya ba'i chos gos rin po che 'chang ba'i ltung ba ma bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: There is no downfall because no downfall is declared for possessing the price of a robe.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i bsam pas rab tu byung zhing tshul khrims dang ldan pa la ni gos brgya stong ri ba yang 'os so zhes 'byung bas khyad par du gnang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i bsam pas rab tu byung zhing tshul khrims dang ldan pa la ni gos brgya stong ri ba yang 'os so zhes 'byung bas khyad par du gnang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But it is appropriate for those who have the intention of attaining nirvana, who have gone forth and possess ethical discipline, to have robes worth hundreds of thousands of gold coins.

original: ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni spang ba'i ltung byed du ste /
analyzed: ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni spang ba'i ltung byed du ste /
translated: One commits an infraction means a downfall that requires confession.

original: 'di ltar dge slong ma rnams la gos rin po che 'chang na spang ba'i ltung byed du bstan pa'i phyir ro //🔽zhag bcu la zhag bcur 'du shes pa la spang ba'i ltung byed du gsungs pa ni sbyor ba yod pa'i phyir dang / bsams pa'i don grub pa'i phyir ro //🔽zhag bcu la zhag bcu ma yin par 'du shes pa la ltung pa med par gsungs pa ni sbyor ba med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar dge slong ma rnams la gos rin po che 'chang na spang ba'i ltung byed du bstan pa'i phyir ro // zhag bcu la zhag bcur 'du shes pa la spang ba'i ltung byed du gsungs pa ni sbyor ba yod pa'i phyir dang / bsams pa'i don grub pa'i phyir ro // zhag bcu la zhag bcu ma yin par 'du shes pa la ltung pa med par gsungs pa ni sbyor ba med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Thus, it is taught that if a nun accepts a valuable robe, it is a downfall that requires confession.🔽It is said that if one keeps a robe for more than ten days, thinking that it is more than ten days, it is a downfall that requires confession because the action is complete and the intended purpose is fulfilled.🔽It is said that if one keeps a robe for more than ten days, but thinks that it is less than ten days, there is no downfall because the action is not complete.

original: zhag bcur 'du shes te 'jug pa ni sbyor ba yin la zhag bcu ma yin pa la shes pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: zhag bcur 'du shes te 'jug pa ni sbyor ba yin la zhag bcu ma yin pa la shes pas ni ma yin te /
translated: Thinking that it is more than ten days and keeping it is the action, but thinking that it is less than ten days is not.

original: sbyar ba la ni 'du shes yan lag yin na de yang de la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyar ba la ni 'du shes yan lag yin na de yang de la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But it is not, because if discernment were a limb, it would not exist there.🔽

original: dngos gzhi la ni ltung ba med de bsams pa'i don ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la ni ltung ba med de bsams pa'i don ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is the actual basis, there is no offense because the intended purpose is not accomplished.

original: zhag bcu ma yin pa la zhag bcur 'du shes pa la nyes byas su gsungs pa ni sbyor ba yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: zhag bcu ma yin pa la zhag bcur 'du shes pa la nyes byas su gsungs pa ni sbyor ba yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: If it is not ten days, but one perceives it as ten days, it is said to be a misdeed because the preparation exists.

original: zhag bcu ma yin pa la zhag bcur 'du @284b shes pas 'jug pa ni sbyor ba yin la de yang de la yod pas so //
analyzed: zhag bcu ma yin pa la zhag bcur 'du @284b shes pas 'jug pa ni sbyor ba yin la de yang de la yod pas so //
translated: If it is not ten days, but one engages in it perceiving it as ten days, that is the preparation, and that exists for him.

original: dgung bcu ma lags pa la dgung bcur lags par 'du shes na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ltung ba med par gsungs pa ni bsams pa'i don ma grub pa'i phyir dang / sbyor ba med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dgung bcu ma lags pa la dgung bcur lags par 'du shes na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ltung ba med par gsungs pa ni bsams pa'i don ma grub pa'i phyir dang / sbyor ba med pa'i phyir te /
translated: If it is not ten days, but one perceives it as ten days, etc., it is said that there is no offense because the intended purpose is not accomplished and there is no preparation.

original: de bzhi tshan 'og ma dag la'ang ci rigs par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhi tshan 'og ma dag la'ang ci rigs par shes par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as appropriate for the remaining sets of four.

original: 'di la ltung ba med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tshig lhag ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di la ltung ba med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tshig lhag ma yin no //
translated: The remainder of the sentence is that there is no offense.

original: spang pa ni ltung ba bshags pa'i dus mi lta bar bsam pa thag pa nas rang bzhin du gnas pa'i dge slong la yongs su gtong ba'o //
analyzed: spang pa ni ltung ba bshags pa'i dus mi lta bar bsam pa thag pa nas rang bzhin du gnas pa'i dge slong la yongs su gtong ba'o //
translated: Abandoning is completely giving up to a natural monk, with a sincere attitude, without looking at the time of confessing a downfall.

original: bral ba la ni bar bar du chad par byed pa ste /
analyzed: bral ba la ni bar bar du chad par byed pa ste /
translated: Separation is interrupted from time to time.

original: chos gos de med par nub gcig 'da' ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos gos de med par nub gcig 'da' ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that one night passes without that Dharma robe.

original: chos gos gzhan zhig rnyed na'o zhes bya ba'i chos gos snga ma spang bas bsngags pa'i dbang gis chos gos phi ma gzhan yang spang bar 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: chos gos gzhan zhig rnyed na'o zhes bya ba'i chos gos snga ma spang bas bsngags pa'i dbang gis chos gos phi ma gzhan yang spang bar 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
translated: If one obtains another Dharma robe, thinking that by abandoning the previous Dharma robe, the later Dharma robe will also be abandoned by the power of praise,

original: dge slob ma zhes bya ba la sogs pas ltung ba med bar gsungs pa ni dge slob ma la sogs pa la 'chang ba'i bslab pa'i gzhi rnam par ma bzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge slob ma zhes bya ba la sogs pas ltung ba med bar gsungs pa ni dge slob ma la sogs pa la 'chang ba'i bslab pa'i gzhi rnam par ma bzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement that there is no downfall for probationary nuns and so on is because the basis of training for wearing is not established for probationary nuns and so on.

original: mdor bsdus pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: mdor bsdus pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the summary:

original: chos gso dang ltung bzed lhag pa 'chang pa dang / 'bral ba dang / me la reg pa dang / bzlog pa za ba dang / sa bon 'joms pa dang / rtsva sngon dang bcas pa'i phyogs su mi gtsang ba dor ba dang / shing la 'dzeg pa dang zhes bya ba bslab pa'i gzhi 'di brgyad ni dge slob ma la ma gsungs so //
analyzed: chos gso dang ltung bzed lhag pa 'chang pa dang / 'bral ba dang / me la reg pa dang / bzlog pa za ba dang / sa bon 'joms pa dang / rtsva sngon dang bcas pa'i phyogs su mi gtsang ba dor ba dang / shing la 'dzeg pa dang zhes bya ba bslab pa'i gzhi 'di brgyad ni dge slob ma la ma gsungs so //
translated: The eight bases of training not mentioned to probationary nuns are: to not accept gold and silver, to not plant the roots of trees, to not dig the earth, to not cut grass, to not taste food in the vicinity of a monastery, to not keep extra bowls, to not separate the seams of a robe, to not touch treasure, to not eat while facing away from the teacher, to not destroy seeds, to not discard urine and excrement on grass, and to not climb trees.

original: dge tshul dang dge tshul ma dag la ni de rnams kyang ma gsungs la /
analyzed: dge tshul dang dge tshul ma dag la ni de rnams kyang ma gsungs la /
translated: The bases of training for novice monks and nuns do not mention these.

original: de bzhin du rin po che la reg pa dang / 'dus shing za ba dang / byin len ma byas par za ba dang / sa rko ba dang / shing la 'dzeg pa zhes bya ba yang ma gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rin po che la reg pa dang / 'dus shing za ba dang / byin len ma byas par za ba dang / sa rko ba dang / shing la 'dzeg pa zhes bya ba yang ma gsungs te /
translated: Similarly, they do not mention touching precious substances, eating in a group, eating without having been offered food, digging the earth, and climbing trees.

original: de ltar na 'di ltar bslab pa'i gzhi bcu gsum po 'di rnams ma smos so //
analyzed: de ltar na 'di ltar bslab pa'i gzhi bcu gsum po 'di rnams ma smos so //
translated: Thus, these thirteen bases of training are not mentioned.

original: lhag ma rnams ni ci rigs par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni ci rigs par shes par bya ste /
translated: The rest should be understood as appropriate.

original: tshig mngas pas yang bshad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: tshig mngas pas yang bshad par mi bya'o //
translated: I will not explain them here because it would require too many words.

original: zhus pa la la las 'di skad du /🔽dge slong gi chos gos 'di nyid dgung bcu 'das pa yang lags la /
analyzed: zhus pa la la las 'di skad du / dge slong gi chos gos 'di nyid dgung bcu 'das pa yang lags la /
translated: Some ask:

original: de nyid dgung gcig bral ba yang lags pa lta mchis sam /
analyzed: de nyid dgung gcig bral ba yang lags pa lta mchis sam /
translated: Is it the case that this robe of a fully ordained monk is beyond ten days and also is not separated from him for one day?🔽It is said that it is possible,

original: yod de 'di ltar chos gos bdog pa'i rgyun ma chad pas zhag bcu pa la chos gos shig rnyed la /🔽de chos @285a * //🔽gos byin gyis brlabs nas chos gos de med par mtshams kyi phyi rol du skya rengs 'da' bar byed na chos gos 'di nyid zhag bcu 'das pa yang yin la /
analyzed: yod de 'di ltar chos gos bdog pa'i rgyun ma chad pas zhag bcu pa la chos gos shig rnyed la / de chos @285a * // gos byin gyis brlabs nas chos gos de med par mtshams kyi phyi rol du skya rengs 'da' bar byed na chos gos 'di nyid zhag bcu 'das pa yang yin la /
translated: because a robe is obtained on the tenth day without the stream of possessing a robe being severed.

original: de nyid zhag bcu bral ba yang yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de nyid zhag bcu bral ba yang yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: If he consecrates that robe and the dawn passes beyond the boundary while that robe is not present, then this robe is beyond ten days and also is not separated from him for ten days.

original: de la don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: chos gos bdog pa rgyun ma chad par zhes bya bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos gos bdog pa rgyun ma chad par zhes bya bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase without the stream of possessing a robe being severed means

original: chos gos la rang gir byed pa rjes su 'jug pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: chos gos la rang gir byed pa rjes su 'jug pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: that the possession of a robe continues.

original: rang gi yin pa'i rgyun dang ma bral ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang gi yin pa'i rgyun dang ma bral ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that the stream of being his is not severed.

original: de rgyun ma chad cing ma bral bar chos gos shig rnyed na ste /
analyzed: de rgyun ma chad cing ma bral bar chos gos shig rnyed na ste /
translated: If one obtains a Dharma robe without interruption and without separation from that,

original: gzhan zhig ces bya ba'i tha tshig kho nar drang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan zhig ces bya ba'i tha tshig kho nar drang ngo //
translated: one should understand that it is only another.

original: des byin gyis brlabs nas zhes bya ba ni de'i chos gos phyis rnyed pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: des byin gyis brlabs nas zhes bya ba ni de'i chos gos phyis rnyed pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: Having consecrated it, means that later one obtains a Dharma robe.

original: stod g-yogs la sogs pa nyid du yid kyis sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid kyis slob pas byin gyis brlabs nas so //
analyzed: stod g-yogs la sogs pa nyid du yid kyis sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid kyis slob pas byin gyis brlabs nas so //
translated: Having consecrated it by mentally applying it as an upper robe and so on, one should train.

original: chos gos 'di ni zhag bcu 'das pa yin la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: chos gos 'di ni zhag bcu 'das pa yin la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: This Dharma robe has passed ten days and so on means that

original: 'di'i chos gos byin gyis ma brlabs pa'i gzhan byin gyis brlabs pa'i sngon rol du rang gis byas pa'i khri ni byas pa'i gang yin pa de nas bzung ste /
analyzed: 'di'i chos gos byin gyis ma brlabs pa'i gzhan byin gyis brlabs pa'i sngon rol du rang gis byas pa'i khri ni byas pa'i gang yin pa de nas bzung ste /
translated: if one has made a bed oneself prior to consecrating another Dharma robe that has not been consecrated,

original: zhag bcu rjes su 'jug pa'i rang gi yin par byin gyis brlabs pa'i chos gos kyi yul can yod na /
analyzed: zhag bcu rjes su 'jug pa'i rang gi yin par byin gyis brlabs pa'i chos gos kyi yul can yod na /
translated: then from that time onward, if one has a Dharma robe that is one’s own, that has been consecrated, and that has passed ten days,

original: zhag bcu gnyis 'das pa yin par shes par bya'i chos gos byin gyis brlabs pa'i khri nas bzung ste ma yin no //
analyzed: zhag bcu gnyis 'das pa yin par shes par bya'i chos gos byin gyis brlabs pa'i khri nas bzung ste ma yin no //
translated: It should be understood that twelve days have passed, not from the time of consecrating the robe.

original: 'di ltar 'dir ni de'i tshe rang gir byed pa nyes pa byed pa yin gyi 'di ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dir ni de'i tshe rang gir byed pa nyes pa byed pa yin gyi 'di ni ma yin gyi /
translated: For at that time, the one who commits the offense is the one who appropriates it, but not this one.

original: de ni byin gyis brlabs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni byin gyis brlabs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not consecrated.

original: de lta bas na de'i tshe rang gir byed pa'i dus nyid kyis 'dir ltung ba slong gi /'di'i tshe bas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bas na de'i tshe rang gir byed pa'i dus nyid kyis 'dir ltung ba slong gi /'di'i tshe bas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, at that time, the offense is confessed here by the very time of appropriation, not by the time of this one.

original: de nyid zhag gcig bral ba yang yin pa ni bla gos la sogs pa nyid du byin gyis brlabs nas de'i mtshams kyi nang du bzhag ste /
analyzed: de nyid zhag gcig bral ba yang yin pa ni bla gos la sogs pa nyid du byin gyis brlabs nas de'i mtshams kyi nang du bzhag ste /
translated: That very one is also separated by one day, because after consecrating the upper robe and so on, it is placed inside the boundary.

original: mtshams kyi phyi rol du skya rengs 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshams kyi phyi rol du skya rengs 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the dawn passes outside the boundary.

original: zhus pa la la las ni gzhan yang /
analyzed: zhus pa la la las ni gzhan yang /
translated: Some ask:

original: dge slong gis chos gos gang gi gdugs kho na la rnyed pa de'i gdugs kho na la spong bar 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
analyzed: dge slong gis chos gos gang gi gdugs kho na la rnyed pa de'i gdugs kho na la spong bar 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
translated: Is it possible for a fully ordained monk to abandon a robe on the very day that he obtains it?

original: de lta yin te rgyun chags par gyur cing spang ba gzhan yod bzhin du rnyed pa dang / ltung ba ma bshags pa'am /
analyzed: de lta yin te rgyun chags par gyur cing spang ba gzhan yod bzhin du rnyed pa dang / ltung ba ma bshags pa'am /
translated: It is possible if it is a continuous possession, and if there is another robe to abandon, and if he does not confess the downfall,

original: chos gos byin gyis brlabs pa gsum dang zhag gcig bral ba na /
analyzed: chos gos byin gyis brlabs pa gsum dang zhag gcig bral ba na /
translated: or if he is separated from the three robes for one day,

original: rnyed pa ni spang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnyed pa ni spang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then the possession is abandoned.

original: de la don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:

original: de ltar @285b zhes bya ba 'dis ni zhus pa'i lan yin no //
analyzed: de ltar @285b zhes bya ba 'dis ni zhus pa'i lan yin no //
translated: Thus refers to the answer to the question.

original: rgyun chags pa ni gyur cing spang ba gzhan gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: rgyun chags pa ni gyur cing spang ba gzhan gang yin pa ste /
translated: Continuous possession means that it is not a continuous possession, and if there is another robe to abandon,

original: de ltar ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin no //
translated: it is not like that.

original: spang ba gzhan pa yod bzhin du rnyed pa ni snga ma'i bsngags pa'i dbang gis 'dir spang bar bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: spang ba gzhan pa yod bzhin du rnyed pa ni snga ma'i bsngags pa'i dbang gis 'dir spang bar bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: If there is another robe to abandon, the possession is abandoned by the power of praising the former robe.

original: ltung ba ma bshags par zhes bya ba ni spang ba'i ltung ba bcos par ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: ltung ba ma bshags par zhes bya ba ni spang ba'i ltung ba bcos par ma byas pa'o //
translated: If he does not confess the downfall means that he does not make amends for the downfall of abandoning the robe.

original: chos gos byin gyis brlabs ba gsum dang bral ba na rnyed pa ni snam sbyar dang / bla gos dang mthang gos gsum dang bral ba'i spang ba byung na'o //🔽'chang ba'i spang ba gtan la dbab pa'o /
analyzed: chos gos byin gyis brlabs ba gsum dang bral ba na rnyed pa ni snam sbyar dang / bla gos dang mthang gos gsum dang bral ba'i spang ba byung na'o // 'chang ba'i spang ba gtan la dbab pa'o /
translated: The downfall is accrued by the one who is separated from any one of the three robes consecrated as the lower, upper, or patched robe.

original: // / nub gcig ni nyin zhag gcig go //
analyzed: // / nub gcig ni nyin zhag gcig go //
translated: One night means one day and night.

original: kyang zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa la sogs pa yang ngo //
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa la sogs pa yang ngo //
translated: Also means the second and so forth.

original: gsum las zhes bya ba ni snam sbyar dang bla gos dang mthang gos byin gyis brlabs pa rnams so //
analyzed: gsum las zhes bya ba ni snam sbyar dang bla gos dang mthang gos byin gyis brlabs pa rnams so //
translated: From three means from the three robes consecrated as the patched robe, the upper robe, and the lower robe.

original: gang yang rung ba dang zhes gang yang rung ba smos pa ni spyi'i ngo bo dgag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang yang rung ba dang zhes gang yang rung ba smos pa ni spyi'i ngo bo dgag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Any one means any one of the three.

original: mtshams kyi phyi rol du 'bral bar byed na zhes bya ba gnas gang la chos gos 'dug pa de nas chos gos bor te gzhan du skya rengs 'char bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshams kyi phyi rol du 'bral bar byed na zhes bya ba gnas gang la chos gos 'dug pa de nas chos gos bor te gzhan du skya rengs 'char bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If one separates from any one of the three robes consecrated as the lower, upper, or patched robe, and if one does not sew it or make effort to obtain it, and if one allows the sun to rise while separated from any one of the three, one commits a downfall.🔽If one separates from any one of the three robes consecrated as the lower, upper, or patched robe, and if one does not sew it or make effort to obtain it, and if one allows the sun to rise while separated from any one of the three, one commits a downfall.

original: dge 'dun gyi gnang ba ma gtogs par ni dge 'dun gyi khrims su bca' ba ma gtogs pa gzhan la ltung ba 'dir 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi gnang ba ma gtogs par ni dge 'dun gyi khrims su bca' ba ma gtogs pa gzhan la ltung ba 'dir 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Except with the permission of the Saṅgha, means except when it is a rule of the Saṅgha.

original: dper na 'phags pa 'od srungs chen po dang / sh'a ri'i bu rgas shing nad bu can du gyur pa dag gi phyir dge 'dun gyi rnam sbyar lci ba nyid dang mi 'bral ba'i sbyor ba 'byin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'phags pa 'od srungs chen po dang / sh'a ri'i bu rgas shing nad bu can du gyur pa dag gi phyir dge 'dun gyi rnam sbyar lci ba nyid dang mi 'bral ba'i sbyor ba 'byin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, for the sake of the noble Mahākāśyapa and Śāriputra, who were old and sick, the Saṅgha allowed the use of heavy bedding and the use of woolen blankets.

original: de lta bu'i rkyen ni tshem rkun pas phrogs pa la sogs pa'i rkyen yod na byin gyis brlabs pa'i chos gos dang bral ba'i skya rengs 'char ba'i nyes pa yongs su spong ba'i bdag nyid kyi rgyu'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rkyen ni tshem rkun pas phrogs pa la sogs pa'i rkyen yod na byin gyis brlabs pa'i chos gos dang bral ba'i skya rengs 'char ba'i nyes pa yongs su spong ba'i bdag nyid kyi rgyu'o //
translated: Such conditions are the cause for the abandonment of the offense of dawn breaking while separated from the consecrated robe, when there are conditions such as having one's robe stolen.

original: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this passage beginning with First, a monk... is as follows.

original: dge 'dun ni gang zag rnam par chad pa'i bdag nyid dang gang zag rnam par ma chad pa'i bdag nyid dang rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: dge 'dun ni gang zag rnam par chad pa'i bdag nyid dang gang zag rnam par ma chad pa'i bdag nyid dang rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: The Saṅgha is twofold: the Saṅgha of individuals who are separate entities and the Saṅgha of individuals who are not separate entities.🔽First, the wealth of the Saṅgha of individuals who are separate entities is to be restored if it is lost through the causes of holding, separation, or storage.

original: de la re zhig gang zag rnam par chad pa'i bdag nyid kyi dge 'dun gyi nor la ni 'chang ba dang / 'bral ba dang / 'jog pa'i rgyu can gyi spang ba'i ltung ba rnams kyang slong bar 'gyur la /🔽ltung byed 'ba' zhig pa rnams kyang slong bar 'gyur ro //🔽'di ltar gang zag rnam par ma chad pa'i bdag nyid kyi dge 'dun du @286a * //
analyzed: de la re zhig gang zag rnam par chad pa'i bdag nyid kyi dge 'dun gyi nor la ni 'chang ba dang / 'bral ba dang / 'jog pa'i rgyu can gyi spang ba'i ltung ba rnams kyang slong bar 'gyur la / ltung byed 'ba' zhig pa rnams kyang slong bar 'gyur ro // 'di ltar gang zag rnam par ma chad pa'i bdag nyid kyi dge 'dun du @286a * //
translated: Also, the wealth of the Saṅgha of individuals who are separate entities is to be restored if it is lost through the causes of holding, separation, or storage.🔽The wealth of the Saṅgha of individuals who are not separate entities is to be restored if it is lost through the causes of holding, separation, or storage.🔽The wealth of the Saṅgha of individuals who are not separate entities is to be restored if it is lost through the causes of holding, separation, or storage.

original: gtogs pa'i gang zag de dag thams cad nor de la gang zag re re zhig bdag gir byed pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: gtogs pa'i gang zag de dag thams cad nor de la gang zag re re zhig bdag gir byed pa'i gnas so //
translated: The wealth of the Saṅgha of individuals who are not separate entities is to be restored if it is lost through the causes of holding, separation, or storage.

original: gang zag rnam par ma chad pa'i dge 'dun gyi la ni 'ga' yang rang gir byed pa med pa nyid de de'i phyir 'chang pa dang / 'jog pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi spang ba'i ltung byed dag dang 'bral ba'i rgyu mtshan can yang mi srid do //
analyzed: gang zag rnam par ma chad pa'i dge 'dun gyi la ni 'ga' yang rang gir byed pa med pa nyid de de'i phyir 'chang pa dang / 'jog pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi spang ba'i ltung byed dag dang 'bral ba'i rgyu mtshan can yang mi srid do //
translated: There is no one who appropriates the Saṅgha’s property of an undivided Saṅgha. Therefore, it is impossible that there would be a reason for the downfall of abandoning the Saṅgha, or a reason for the downfall of separating from the Saṅgha.

original: gal te 'bral ba'i rgyu mtshan can ci ltar mi srid ce na /
analyzed: gal te 'bral ba'i rgyu mtshan can ci ltar mi srid ce na /
translated: How is it impossible that there would be a reason for separating from the Saṅgha?

original: gang zag rnam par ma chad pa'i bdag nyid kyi dge 'dun gyi de la byin gyis rlob pa mi srid la byin gyis ma brlabs pa dang 'bral ba'i nyes pa dang mi ldan te /
analyzed: gang zag rnam par ma chad pa'i bdag nyid kyi dge 'dun gyi de la byin gyis rlob pa mi srid la byin gyis ma brlabs pa dang 'bral ba'i nyes pa dang mi ldan te /
translated: It is impossible to consecrate the Saṅgha’s property of an undivided Saṅgha. If it is not consecrated, there is no fault in separating from it.

original: gang zag rnam par ma chad pa'i bdag nyid kyis dge 'dun gyi chos gos la gang zag gcig cig gis byin gyis brlabs pa nyid yin na 'bral bar 'gyur na 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi spang ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zag rnam par ma chad pa'i bdag nyid kyis dge 'dun gyi chos gos la gang zag gcig cig gis byin gyis brlabs pa nyid yin na 'bral bar 'gyur na 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi spang ba ni ma yin no //
translated: If the Saṅgha’s robe of an undivided Saṅgha is consecrated by a single person, then it is possible to separate from it, but it is not possible to abandon it.

original: gal te yang ji ltar 'dir spang ba nyid du mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yang ji ltar 'dir spang ba nyid du mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it is not consecrated, how could it be possible to abandon it?

original: 'bral ba ni rang gir byed pa 'dor ba la bya la /
analyzed: 'bral ba ni rang gir byed pa 'dor ba la bya la /
translated: Separation is the relinquishing of appropriation.

original: de yang rang gi yin pa dam pa nyid du mngon par zhen pa las bskyod pa'i don du byed kyang gang la rang ge yin pa dam po nyid du mngon bar zhen pa med pa de la ni spang ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi bral ba mi dgos pa
analyzed: de yang rang gi yin pa dam pa nyid du mngon par zhen pa las bskyod pa'i don du byed kyang gang la rang ge yin pa dam po nyid du mngon bar zhen pa med pa de la ni spang ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi bral ba mi dgos pa
translated: Even though it is said that the purpose of separation is to shake off the attachment to the sacredness of appropriation, there is no need for the essential nature of relinquishment to be separation for one who has no attachment to the sacredness of appropriation.

original: nyid bas 'di la spang ba nyid med do //
analyzed: nyid bas 'di la spang ba nyid med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no relinquishment in this system.

original: 'di ni 'dul ba 'dzin pa gzhan dag mi 'dod do //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dul ba 'dzin pa gzhan dag mi 'dod do //
translated: Other upholders of the vinaya do not accept this.

original: 'di ltar rnam par chad pa'i dge 'dun gyi yang rung /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par chad pa'i dge 'dun gyi yang rung /
translated: They say that the Sangha is either a collective or an individual.

original: rnam par ma chad pa'i dge 'dun gyi yang rung ste /🔽shas tsam zhig dbang gi phyir la /🔽shas tsam la ni rang gir byed pa 'byung gi thams cad la ni ma yin no //

translated: The Sangha is a collective because it is a group of many individuals.🔽The Sangha is an individual because it is the basis for the arising of the appropriation of a portion of the Sangha.

original: shas tsam la rang gir byed pa la lhag ma rnams kyang ltung ba slong bar rung ba ma yin no //🔽de la rang gir byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shas tsam la rang gir byed pa la lhag ma rnams kyang ltung ba slong bar rung ba ma yin no //🔽de la rang gir byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Sangha is an individual because it is the basis for the arising of the appropriation of a portion of the Sangha.🔽The Sangha is an individual because it is the basis for the arising of the appropriation of a portion of the Sangha.

original: de tsam kho nas kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: de tsam kho nas kyang ma yin te /

analyzed: rnam par ma chad pa nyid kyis rang gir byed pa khyad par med par 'byung bas dge 'dun gyis ni gnyi ga las kyang spang ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro // dge 'dun gyis bskyis pa 'am gzhan du 'ang rung ba ci zhig ltar dus re zhig pa nyid du bdag gir byas nas 'chang ngam /
translated: The Sangha would not be the owner of the robe by the mere fact of its being uncut.🔽The Sangha would not be the owner of the robe by the mere fact of its being cut.

original: 'jog pa 'am /
analyzed: 'jog pa 'am /
translated: The Sangha would not be the owner of the robe by the mere fact of its being uncut.

original: byin gyis rlob pa gang yin pa de la ni thams cad du dus re zhig pa'i rang ger byed pa'i phyir de las ni ltung ba ni ldang bar 'gyur ro //🔽de lta bas na rnam par chad pa'i dge 'dun gyi'ang rung //
analyzed: byin gyis rlob pa gang yin pa de la ni thams cad du dus re zhig pa'i rang ger byed pa'i phyir de las ni ltung ba ni ldang bar 'gyur ro // de lta bas na rnam par chad pa'i dge 'dun gyi'ang rung //
translated: The Sangha would not be the owner of the robe by the mere fact of its being cut.🔽The Sangha would not be the owner of the robe by the mere fact of its being uncut.🔽The Sangha would not be the owner of the robe by the mere fact of its being cut.🔽The Sangha would not be the owner of the robe by the mere fact of its being uncut.🔽The Sangha would not be the owner of the robe by the mere fact of its being cut.

analyzed: rnam par ma chad pa'i dge @286b 'dun gyi'ang rud /
translated: The Sangha would not be the owner of the robe by the mere fact of its being uncut.

original: gcig gis rang gir byas nas 'chang ba spang bar gyur na yod do //
analyzed: gcig gis rang gir byas nas 'chang ba spang bar gyur na yod do //
translated: The Sangha would not be the owner of the robe by the mere fact of its being cut.🔽The Sangha would not be the owner of the robe by the mere fact of its being uncut.🔽The Sangha would not be the owner of the robe by the mere fact of its being cut.🔽The Sangha would not be the owner of the robe by the mere fact of its being uncut.🔽The Sangha would not be the owner of the robe by the mere fact of its being cut.🔽The Sangha would not be the owner of the robe by the mere fact of its being uncut.🔽The Sangha would not be the owner of the robe by the mere fact of its being cut.🔽The Sangha would not be the owner of the robe by the mere fact of its being uncut.🔽The Sangha would not be the owner of the robe by the mere fact of its being cut.🔽The Sangha would not be the owner of the robe by the mere fact of its being uncut.🔽The Sangha would not be the owner of the robe by the mere fact of its being cut.

original: 'dir ni dge 'dun gyi chos gos byin gyis brlabs nas mtshams kyi phyi rol du 'gro na zhes 'phags pa nye ba 'khor gyis dge 'dun gyi chos gos la spyir rten pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dir ni dge 'dun gyi chos gos byin gyis brlabs nas mtshams kyi phyi rol du 'gro na zhes 'phags pa nye ba 'khor gyis dge 'dun gyi chos gos la spyir rten pa yin la /
translated: Ārya Upāli relied on the Saṅgha’s robes in general.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang chos gos dang 'bral ba zhes bya'o zhes spyir lan gdab par mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang chos gos dang 'bral ba zhes bya'o zhes spyir lan gdab par mdzad pa yin no //
translated: The Blessed One replied in general, “One should be called one who is separated from one’s robe.”

original: dge 'dun gyi zhes smos pa ni ji ltar chos gos dang bral ba zhes bya'o zhes chos gos dang bral ba smos pa 'chang ba la sogs pa'i dpe yin ba ltar gzhan gyi gos gzhan dag gi yang dpe yang yin no //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi zhes smos pa ni ji ltar chos gos dang bral ba zhes bya'o zhes chos gos dang bral ba smos pa 'chang ba la sogs pa'i dpe yin ba ltar gzhan gyi gos gzhan dag gi yang dpe yang yin no //
translated: The term “Saṅgha’s” is an example of “one who is separated from one’s robe,” just as “one who is separated from one’s robe” is an example of “one who possesses.”

original: de ltar gyi ni gzhan gyi yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ltar gyi ni gzhan gyi yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is like that because it belongs to another.

original: dus re zhig pa nyid kyis rang gir byed pa mi dam pa'i phyir dang / spang ba yang rang gir byed pa dam po gcad pa'i don du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus re zhig pa nyid kyis rang gir byed pa mi dam pa'i phyir dang / spang ba yang rang gir byed pa dam po gcad pa'i don du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is temporary, it is not a pledge to make it one’s own, and because relinquishment is done in order to sever the pledge to make it one’s own.

original: 'di ni thams cad du 'dra bas dge 'dun gyi zhes smos pa 'di ni gzhan gyi thams cad smos pa nyid du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni thams cad du 'dra bas dge 'dun gyi zhes smos pa 'di ni gzhan gyi thams cad smos pa nyid du shes par bya'o //
translated: Since this is the same in all cases, the phrase “of the Saṅgha” is to be understood as referring to all the rest.

original: mnan pa ni rkang pa gnyis so //
analyzed: mnan pa ni rkang pa gnyis so //
translated: “Stomping” is with both feet.

original: gzung ba ni shing la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzung ba ni shing la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Holding” is with a stick, etc.

original: 'greng ba ni langs pa'o //
analyzed: 'greng ba ni langs pa'o //
translated: “Standing” is standing up.

original: mchis pa ni 'gro ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mchis pa ni 'gro ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Sitting” is sitting down, etc.

original: mtshams kyi bar ni mtshams dag gi bar ro //
analyzed: mtshams kyi bar ni mtshams dag gi bar ro //
translated: “Between the boundaries” is between the boundaries.

original: mtshams kyi nang na mchis la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: mtshams kyi nang na mchis la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /

analyzed: mtshams gcad pa byas su zin kyang chos gos rnams dang mi 'bral ba'i sdom pa ma byin pa gang yin pa de'i 'di dang bral bar 'gyur te /

analyzed: gal te langs na zhes bya ba ni gal te des chos gos kyi bya ba byed na ste /

translated: He should keep it: he should keep it.

original: de'i phyir gang gi byin gyis brlabs pa'i chos gos gsum med pa des dus ma yin pa'i chos gos rnyed pa de zla ba gcig kho nar 'chang bar bya'i gzhan gyi ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gi byin gyis brlabs pa'i chos gos gsum med pa des dus ma yin pa'i chos gos rnyed pa de zla ba gcig kho nar 'chang bar bya'i gzhan gyi ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, if he does not have the three robes that have been blessed, then he should keep the out-of-season robe that he has obtained for only one month, and not for any longer. This is the meaning.

original: ci de yang gyi na 'chang bar bya ba'am zhe na /
analyzed: ci de yang gyi na 'chang bar bya ba'am zhe na /
translated: Should he also keep it for a year?

original: gal te mi langs la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te mi langs la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If it does not increase, etc.

original: bdag gis slob dpon dang mkhan po la sogs pa las gdon mi za bar chos gos su langs pa rnyed par 'gyur ro snyam pa'i bsam pa 'di yod na gzhan gyi na ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag gis slob dpon dang mkhan po la sogs pa las gdon mi za bar chos gos su langs pa rnyed par 'gyur ro snyam pa'i bsam pa 'di yod na gzhan gyi na ni ma yin te /
translated: If one thinks, “I will certainly obtain a robe from my preceptor, teacher, etc.,” then one does not commit an offense, but if one does not obtain it, one must seek it from others.

original: gzhan du zhag bcu nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du zhag bcu nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If one does not obtain it from others, one must seek it for ten days.

original: kha ma langs pa'i kha skong ba zhes bya ba'i snam sbyar dang / bla gos dang / mthang gos rnams kyi kha ma langs pa kha skongs pa'i ched du'o //
analyzed: kha ma langs pa'i kha skong ba zhes bya ba'i snam sbyar dang / bla gos dang / mthang gos rnams kyi kha ma langs pa kha skongs pa'i ched du'o //
translated: The phrase “to mend a robe” means to mend a patched robe, an upper robe, or a lower robe that has not been mended.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dir 'dul ba 'dzin pa kha cig na re snon pa nyid du shes par bya ste /
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dir 'dul ba 'dzin pa kha cig na re snon pa nyid du shes par bya ste /
translated: The word “also” in the verse means that some vinaya masters say that one should understand that it is an extension of the previous rule.

original: 'di ltar rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir 'di la don ni 'ga' yang mi rmongs so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir 'di la don ni 'ga' yang mi rmongs so zhes zer ro //
translated: They say that in this case, the meaning is not confused at all, because it is not a matter of speculation.

original: @288b gzhan dag ni'am zhes bya ba'i sgra nges par gzung ba'i don nyid du brjod de /
analyzed: @288b gzhan dag ni'am zhes bya ba'i sgra nges par gzung ba'i don nyid du brjod de /
translated: Others say that the word “also” has the meaning of restriction.

original: tshig gi phrad ni dus ma yin pas so //
analyzed: tshig gi phrad ni dus ma yin pas so //
translated: The phrase “at an improper time” means “at the wrong time.”

original: de bas na tshig gi don ni chos gos gsum kha skong ba kho na'i phyir gos re ba de gos de tshad du mi ldang ba zla ba thal bar 'chang ba nyes byas so zhes bgyi ba chos gos ji lta bu zhig gzhag par bgyi ba lags /
analyzed: de bas na tshig gi don ni chos gos gsum kha skong ba kho na'i phyir gos re ba de gos de tshad du mi ldang ba zla ba thal bar 'chang ba nyes byas so zhes bgyi ba chos gos ji lta bu zhig gzhag par bgyi ba lags /
translated: What kind of robe should one keep?

original: 'khor phyed khebs pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'khor phyed khebs pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the half-covering cloak.

original: 'di ni chos gos gzhag par bya ba'i phyi ma med pa yin no zhes bya ba dag 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ni chos gos gzhag par bya ba'i phyi ma med pa yin no zhes bya ba dag 'byung ngo //
translated: This is the robe to be kept without a subsequent limit.

original: de la don ni 'di yin te 'dul ba 'dzin pa kha cig na re gos kyi tshad du mi ldang ba ni kun nas khru gang bas chung ba'o //
analyzed: de la don ni 'di yin te 'dul ba 'dzin pa kha cig na re gos kyi tshad du mi ldang ba ni kun nas khru gang bas chung ba'o //
translated: The meaning of this is that some Vinaya masters say that if a robe does not meet the standard, it is less than one cubit in any direction.

original: nyes byas so zhes bya ba 'dir nyes byas 'di zhag bcu 'das pa nyid kyi yin par shes par bya'i /
analyzed: nyes byas so zhes bya ba 'dir nyes byas 'di zhag bcu 'das pa nyid kyi yin par shes par bya'i /
translated: Here, one should understand that this wrong conduct is for keeping it beyond ten days.

original: zla ba 'das pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zla ba 'das pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not for keeping it beyond one month.

original: 'di ltar chos gos kyi tshad du mi ldang ba la ni mtshar gcig kha skong ba'i re ba rdzogs pa nyid du mi gnas te /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos gos kyi tshad du mi ldang ba la ni mtshar gcig kha skong ba'i re ba rdzogs pa nyid du mi gnas te /
translated: Thus, if a robe does not meet the standard, the hope of supplementing it does not remain complete.

original: mchod sbyin gyi don du dal gyis 'gro ba'i yul gzhan du phyin pa dang 'dra bas de'i phyir de lta bur shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mchod sbyin gyi don du dal gyis 'gro ba'i yul gzhan du phyin pa dang 'dra bas de'i phyir de lta bur shes par bya'o //
translated: It is like a place where one slowly goes for the purpose of making offerings and giving.

original: 'khor phyed khebs pa ni lte ba'i mtshams nas bzung ste /
analyzed: 'khor phyed khebs pa ni lte ba'i mtshams nas bzung ste /
translated: The robe that covers half the sitting mat is from the navel to the two knees.

original: bus mo'i lha nga gnyis kyi bar du las kyi cha ni 'dir 'khor zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bus mo'i lha nga gnyis kyi bar du las kyi cha ni 'dir 'khor zhes bya ste /
translated: The part of the action is called the sitting mat here.

original: 'khor de lta bu'i de zhing du brkyang ba dang chur brkyang bas mi khebs pa'i chos gos gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor de lta bu'i de zhing du brkyang ba dang chur brkyang bas mi khebs pa'i chos gos gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That robe which does not cover that sitting mat when extended in the field and extended in the water is called that.

original: 'di ni 'khor phyed khebs pa gang yin pa de zla ba gcig gi bar du gzhag par bya'o //🔽mi khebs pa gang yin pa de ni gcig tu zhag bcu pa nyid yin pa de ltar shes par bya'i /
analyzed: 'di ni 'khor phyed khebs pa gang yin pa de zla ba gcig gi bar du gzhag par bya'o // mi khebs pa gang yin pa de ni gcig tu zhag bcu pa nyid yin pa de ltar shes par bya'i /
translated: This is the one that covers half the sitting mat, which should be kept for one month.🔽That which does not cover should be known as just the ten-day robe, not as a month.

original: zla ba nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya bar rab tu bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: zla ba nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya bar rab tu bstan pa yin te /
translated: It is taught that way.

original: kha skongs su re ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro//
analyzed: kha skongs su re ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro//
translated: Because there is no hope of making up the deficiency.

original: 'di ni 'dul ba 'dzin ba gzhan ngag mi 'dod do //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dul ba 'dzin ba gzhan ngag mi 'dod do //
translated: This is not the opinion of other Vinaya masters.

original: kun nas khru gang du mi chog pa'i gos thams cad ni ltung ba med pa nyid ma yin te /🔽spang ba rnams kyi nang du kun nas khru gang ba'i gos ni phyi ma med pa'o zhes 'byung pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas khru gang du mi chog pa'i gos thams cad ni ltung ba med pa nyid ma yin te / spang ba rnams kyi nang du kun nas khru gang ba'i gos ni phyi ma med pa'o zhes 'byung pa'i phyir ro //
translated: All robes that are less than a cubit in size are not necessarily free from downfall.🔽Because it says in the chapter on relinquishment, “A robe that is less than a cubit in size is not to be relinquished.”

original: 'di ni phyi ma med pas zhes smos pas ni kun nas khru gang ba'i man chad kyi gos gang yin pa de ni spang ba rnams kyi nang du ma gtogs pa nyid du bsam par bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni phyi ma med pas zhes smos pas ni kun nas khru gang ba'i man chad kyi gos gang yin pa de ni spang ba rnams kyi nang du ma gtogs pa nyid du bsam par bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The phrase “because it is not to be relinquished” indicates that any robe that is less than a cubit in size is not to be included among the things to be relinquished.

original: gzhan yang grub nas khru gang du mi chog pa la gos kyi blo mi gnas pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang grub nas khru gang du mi chog pa la gos kyi blo mi gnas pa ste /
translated: Moreover, if a robe is less than a cubit in size, the idea of it being a robe does not occur.

original: ras ros nyid du snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ras ros nyid du snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it appears to be just a piece of cloth.

original: ltung ba med pa nyid ni gos 'chang ba dang 'jog @289a * //🔽pa yin te /
analyzed: ltung ba med pa nyid ni gos 'chang ba dang 'jog @289a * //🔽pa yin te /
translated: It is free from downfall if one wears it and keeps it.

original: de lta bas na nyes byas su brjod pa gang yin pa 'di ni rigs pa dang lung gis gnod pa'i phyir 'dod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na nyes byas su brjod pa gang yin pa 'di ni rigs pa dang lung gis gnod pa'i phyir 'dod par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, since this is contradicted by reasoning and scripture, it should not be accepted.

original: zhus pa la la las gzhan yang yo byad kyi gos byin gyis ma brlabs pa zhag bcu 'das pa ni spang ba'o //
analyzed: zhus pa la la las gzhan yang yo byad kyi gos byin gyis ma brlabs pa zhag bcu 'das pa ni spang ba'o //
translated: Some ask: Moreover, if one does not consecrate a robe as an article, it is abandoned after ten days.

original: gdong phyis dang / chu tshags dang / gding ba dang par cang dag byin gyis mi rlob na ltung ba med do zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gdong phyis dang / chu tshags dang / gding ba dang par cang dag byin gyis mi rlob na ltung ba med do zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: If one does not consecrate a face-cloth, a water-strainer, a sitting mat or a chest-band, there is no offense.

original: 'di la don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di la don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: yo byad kyi gos ni phongs pa'i dus su mkho ba'i gos rin po che byin gyis brlabs pa ni ji ltar gos gsum byin gyis rlob pa ltar 'di 'ang de dang 'dra ste /🔽rang rang gi ming gis byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yo byad kyi gos ni phongs pa'i dus su mkho ba'i gos rin po che byin gyis brlabs pa ni ji ltar gos gsum byin gyis rlob pa ltar 'di 'ang de dang 'dra ste / rang rang gi ming gis byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: A robe as an article is a precious robe required in times of need. Consecrated robes are like the three robes, which are consecrated by their own names.

original: gang la de ma byas ba de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang la de ma byas ba de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which is not consecrated by those is called that.

original: chu tshags ni chu btsags pa'o //
analyzed: chu tshags ni chu btsags pa'o //
translated: A water-strainer is a strainer for water.

original: gding ba ni gding bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: gding ba ni gding bar bya ba'o //
translated: The spread is that which is spread out.

original: bar cang gi gos ni rigs lnga khra bor 'dug pa zhig go //
analyzed: bar cang gi gos ni rigs lnga khra bor 'dug pa zhig go //
translated: The patchwork is a cloth of five different colors.

original: byin gyis brlab pa ni bshad ma thag pa'i gzhung lta bur rang rang gi ming gis so//
analyzed: byin gyis brlab pa ni bshad ma thag pa'i gzhung lta bur rang rang gi ming gis so//
translated: The blessing is the consecration with one's own name, as explained in the text.

original: ltung ba med pa ni zhag bcu 'das pa'i spang ba'i ltung byed med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni zhag bcu 'das pa'i spang ba'i ltung byed med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The non-offense is because there is no offense of discarding after ten days.

original: gdod phyis dang chu tshags kun nas khru gang gi tshad du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gdod phyis dang chu tshags kun nas khru gang gi tshad du shes par bya'o //
translated: The measure is to be understood as one cubit all around.

original: bar cang yad bya bar 'dod pa'i chos gos dang / mthun pa'i ngo bo nyid yin gyi rigs mi mthun pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bar cang yad bya bar 'dod pa'i chos gos dang / mthun pa'i ngo bo nyid yin gyi rigs mi mthun pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The cloth is the cloth that is suitable for the robe that one wishes to make, and not of a different type.

original: kha dog la sogs pa'i rigs mi mthun pa ni zla ba gcig gi bar du gzhag bar bya'o //
analyzed: kha dog la sogs pa'i rigs mi mthun pa ni zla ba gcig gi bar du gzhag bar bya'o //
translated: The different color is that which is of a different color, etc.

original: de seng ba la sogs pa'i kha skong pa'i phyir ma yin la /
analyzed: de seng ba la sogs pa'i kha skong pa'i phyir ma yin la /
translated: It is not for the sake of replenishing that which is torn, etc.

original: gzhan gyi ched du yang ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ched du yang ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: It is not for the sake of another.

original: de las 'das par zhes bya ba ni sum cu rtsa gcig la sogs par ro //
analyzed: de las 'das par zhes bya ba ni sum cu rtsa gcig la sogs par ro //
translated: The exceeding is beyond thirty-one, etc.

original: de lta bas na 'dis tshig gi don du 'di 'byung ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dis tshig gi don du 'di 'byung ste /
translated: Therefore, the meaning of this rule is as follows.

original: dge slong gang zhig dus ma yin par chos gos kyi bya ba byed nus pa rnyed la byin gyis brlabs pa'i chos gos kyang med na /
analyzed: dge slong gang zhig dus ma yin par chos gos kyi bya ba byed nus pa rnyed la byin gyis brlabs pa'i chos gos kyang med na /
translated: If a monk is able to make a robe at an inappropriate time, but does not have a robe to consecrate,

original: chos gos kha bskang ba'i re ba yang med pa de ni chos gos de'i mod kho na la byin gyis brlabs pa can du byas nas bcad bar bya'i /
analyzed: chos gos kha bskang ba'i re ba yang med pa de ni chos gos de'i mod kho na la byin gyis brlabs pa can du byas nas bcad bar bya'i /
translated: and he has no hope of obtaining robe-cloth to supplement his old robe, then he should consecrate the old robe right then and there and cut it up.

original: zla ba gcig gi bar du bcang bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: zla ba gcig gi bar du bcang bar mi bya ste /
translated: He should not keep it for a month.

original: gal te 'chang na de'i tshe spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'chang na de'i tshe spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: If he does keep it, then he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: 'on te des chos gos mi ldang la chos gos kyi kha skong ba rnyed pa'i bsam pa'ang yod de //🔽chos gos gsum pa yang mtshang na de'i chos gos gsum gyi ched du de zla ba gcig gi bar du bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'on te des chos gos mi ldang la chos gos kyi kha skong ba rnyed pa'i bsam pa'ang yod de // chos gos gsum pa yang mtshang na de'i chos gos gsum gyi ched du de zla ba gcig gi bar du bcang bar bya'o //
translated: But if he does not have enough robe-cloth, and he has the intention of obtaining robe-cloth to supplement his old robe,🔽and he has lost his three robes, then he may keep the old robe for a month in order to make three robes.

original: zla ba las thal bar @289b 'chang na ni zla ba'i spang ba nye bar gnas so //
analyzed: zla ba las thal bar @289b 'chang na ni zla ba'i spang ba nye bar gnas so //
translated: If he keeps it longer than that, then the offense entailing relinquishment is an immediate offense.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhus pa las /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhus pa las /
translated: Therefore, the Questions of Revata Sutra declares:

original: gang la chos gos gsum tshang bar gyur pa des ni chos gos zla ba gcig gi bar du gzhag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gang la chos gos gsum tshang bar gyur pa des ni chos gos zla ba gcig gi bar du gzhag par mi bya'o //
translated: If one has a complete set of three robes, one should not keep extra robes for more than one month.

original: ci ste 'jog na spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ci ste 'jog na spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: If one does, one commits a wrong action of expiation.

original: bdun po dag las brtags pa gang yang rung bar ni bal gos dang / sha na'i ras dang / zar ma'i ras dang / du gu la'i ras dang / ras gos dang / ko tam pa'i ras dang / nyi 'og pa'i gos zhes bya ba rnams kyi nang nas so //🔽chos gos gsum du ma tshang na zhes bya ba ni snam sbyar dang / bla gos dang / mthang gos rnams las gang yang rung ba zhig ma tshang na'o //
analyzed: bdun po dag las brtags pa gang yang rung bar ni bal gos dang / sha na'i ras dang / zar ma'i ras dang / du gu la'i ras dang / ras gos dang / ko tam pa'i ras dang / nyi 'og pa'i gos zhes bya ba rnams kyi nang nas so // chos gos gsum du ma tshang na zhes bya ba ni snam sbyar dang / bla gos dang / mthang gos rnams las gang yang rung ba zhig ma tshang na'o //
translated: From among the seven, any one is analyzed as wool, linen, cotton, silk, coarse wool, fine wool, and foreign cloth.🔽If one does not have a complete set of three robes, then one does not have any one of the three robes: the patched robe, the upper robe, or the lower robe.

original: chos gos mi langs pa zhig rnyed na zhes bya ba ni 'khor gsum khebs pa'i mthar phyin pa'i tshad du mi chog pa ste /
analyzed: chos gos mi langs pa zhig rnyed na zhes bya ba ni 'khor gsum khebs pa'i mthar phyin pa'i tshad du mi chog pa ste /
translated: If one finds a robe that is not suitable to be worn, then it is not suitable to be the size that covers the three areas.

original: kun nas khru gang pa'i tshad dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: kun nas khru gang pa'i tshad dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the phrase “one cubit in height” is that it is one cubit in size.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhus pa la las ni bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gi chos gos zla ba gcig gi bar du gzhag par bya'o zhes gsungs pa gang lags pa chos gos ji lta bu zhig lags /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhus pa la las ni bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gi chos gos zla ba gcig gi bar du gzhag par bya'o zhes gsungs pa gang lags pa chos gos ji lta bu zhig lags /
translated: Therefore, it is asked: “What is the robe that the Bhagavān said should be kept by a bhikṣu for one month?”

original: 'khor gsum mi khebs pa gang yin pa'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'khor gsum mi khebs pa gang yin pa'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is said: “That which does not cover the three areas.”

original: 'khor gsum khebs pa chos gos kyi bya ba byed pa nyid las chos gos ni de ci ste gzhag cing de nyid chos gos su bya bar mi sbyar /
analyzed: 'khor gsum khebs pa chos gos kyi bya ba byed pa nyid las chos gos ni de ci ste gzhag cing de nyid chos gos su bya bar mi sbyar /
translated: If a robe that covers the three areas performs the function of a robe, why is it not applied as a robe?

original: gal te byin pas de 'jog par byed na yang de'i tshe zhag bcu pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te byin pas de 'jog par byed na yang de'i tshe zhag bcu pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is kept because it is given, then it would be the tenth day.

original: de nyid kyi gal te chos gos su langs pa zhig rnyed na de yang zhag bcu ba nyid yin no zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi gal te chos gos su langs pa zhig rnyed na de yang zhag bcu ba nyid yin no zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is explained that if a robe that is not a robe is obtained, it would be the tenth day.

original: kun nas khru gang tsam gyi tshad dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni gzhag pa dang rigs pa dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: kun nas khru gang tsam gyi tshad dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni gzhag pa dang rigs pa dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: If it is one cubit in height, it is appropriate to keep it.

original: de tsam gyis chos gos kyi bya ba mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de tsam gyis chos gos kyi bya ba mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the purpose of the Dharma robe is not accomplished by that much.🔽Upali, if you have the complete three Dharma robes, if you have the complete Dharma robes, you should keep them for ten days.🔽Because it is said that you should keep them for ten days if you have the complete Dharma robes in order to complete the Dharma robes, and because it is said, “If you have hope for a Dharma robe to make up a deficiency, you should keep it for ten days.”🔽If you have the complete Dharma robes, you should keep them for ten days.

original: nye ba 'khor chos gos gsum tshang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni chos gos ma tshang ba tshang bar bya ba'i phyir gzhag par gsungs na de yang tshang bas de'i phyir zhag bcur gsungs te /🔽kha ma langs pa kha skong ba'i chos gos la re ba zhes bya ba sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //🔽langs pa ni 'khor gsum khebs pa'i mthar thug pa'i tshad de tsam gyis chos gos kyi bya ba 'grub ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor chos gos gsum tshang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni chos gos ma tshang ba tshang bar bya ba'i phyir gzhag par gsungs na de yang tshang bas de'i phyir zhag bcur gsungs te / kha ma langs pa kha skong ba'i chos gos la re ba zhes bya ba sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro // langs pa ni 'khor gsum khebs pa'i mthar thug pa'i tshad de tsam gyis chos gos kyi bya ba 'grub ba'i phyir te /

original: gal te langs na myur ba kho nar chos gus su byas te bcang par bya'o zhes @290a * //
analyzed: gal te langs na myur ba kho nar chos gus su byas te bcang par bya'o zhes @290a * //
translated: If you have the complete Dharma robes, you should keep them for ten days.

original: 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If you have

original: 'on te ma langs pa zhig ces bya ba ni kun nas khru gang ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te ma langs pa zhig ces bya ba ni kun nas khru gang ba'o //
translated: Or else, it is not raised, that is, it is one cubit in height.

original: de tsam 'di'i chos gos kyi bya ba mi 'grub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de tsam 'di'i chos gos kyi bya ba mi 'grub pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because that much is not sufficient for the purpose of the robe.

original: gal te de la mi langs na zla ba gcig gi bar du gzhag par bya'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te de la mi langs na zla ba gcig gi bar du gzhag par bya'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is not raised, it should be kept for one month.

original: zhus pa la la'i gzhung gi ni rnam pa gzhan kha skong ba nyid ma yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro /
analyzed: zhus pa la la'i gzhung gi ni rnam pa gzhan kha skong ba nyid ma yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro /
translated: In the text of some reciters, it is not a supplement to the other types.

original: 'di rnams byin gyis rlob pa ni dpe ste /
analyzed: 'di rnams byin gyis rlob pa ni dpe ste /
translated: The consecration of these is an example.

original: rung bar bya ba la yang tshul 'di rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rung bar bya ba la yang tshul 'di rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because this method is also established for what is suitable.

original: de bas na yod byad kyi gos la sogs pa la zhag bcu pa nyid dang zla ba nyid yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na yod byad kyi gos la sogs pa la zhag bcu pa nyid dang zla ba nyid yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, one should understand that the ten days and the month refer to the robe and so on that are owned.

original: de la re ba ni med la byin gyis brlabs pa can ni yod na zhag bcu pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: de la re ba ni med la byin gyis brlabs pa can ni yod na zhag bcu pa nyid yin la /
translated: If there is no hope for it, but it is consecrated, it is ten days.

original: re ba ni yod na byin gyis brlabs pa can med na zla ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: re ba ni yod na byin gyis brlabs pa can med na zla ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If there is hope, but it is not consecrated, it is a month.

original: zla ba sbyar ba gtan la dbab pa'o /
analyzed: zla ba sbyar ba gtan la dbab pa'o /
translated: The application of the term “month” is the conclusion.

original: // / nye du ma lags pa la zhes bya ba ni gang la pha dang ma'i rigs bdun rgyud tshun chad las de dag kho na las ma yin gyi /
analyzed: // / nye du ma lags pa la zhes bya ba ni gang la pha dang ma'i rigs bdun rgyud tshun chad las de dag kho na las ma yin gyi /
translated: “Not a relative” means that one is not a relative of someone from whom the seven generations of ancestors on the mother’s and father’s side have come, but rather one is born from someone else,

original: de dag gang yang rung ba snga ma 'ga' zhig skyes pa las /
analyzed: de dag gang yang rung ba snga ma 'ga' zhig skyes pa las /
translated: from one of those ancestors.

original: ma las skyes pa nyid dang pha las skyes pa nyid gang la yod pa de ni nye du'o //
analyzed: ma las skyes pa nyid dang pha las skyes pa nyid gang la yod pa de ni nye du'o //
translated: One who is born from a mother and a father is a relative.

original: de las gzhan pa ni nye du ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ni nye du ma yin pa'o //
translated: One who is not that is not a relative.

original: nye du ma yin pa nyid nye du ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: nye du ma yin pa nyid nye du ma yin pa ste /
translated: “Not a relative” means not a relative.

original: de la'o // yang dang yang reg pa'i rkyen gyis 'dod chags skye bar gyur / na mi rung bas nye du ma yin pa smos pa'o //
analyzed: de la'o // yang dang yang reg pa'i rkyen gyis 'dod chags skye bar gyur / na mi rung bas nye du ma yin pa smos pa'o //
translated: Since desire arises again and again through the condition of contact, it is not suitable to have intercourse with a relative.

original: de bas na khyo shug dag ni nye du ma yin te /
analyzed: de bas na khyo shug dag ni nye du ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, a husband and wife are not relatives,

original: nye du'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye du'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not have the characteristics of relatives.

original: chos gos ni bal gos la sogs pa rung ba'o //
analyzed: chos gos ni bal gos la sogs pa rung ba'o //
translated: “A robe” means a suitable robe made of wool, and so on.

original: rnyings pa ni dus tshigs gsum las dus tshigs gang yang rung ba zhig tu spyad pa'o //
analyzed: rnyings pa ni dus tshigs gsum las dus tshigs gang yang rung ba zhig tu spyad pa'o //
translated: Old means used at any time of the three seasons.

original: 'khrur 'jug pa ni chu'i nang du stsol bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'khrur 'jug pa ni chu'i nang du stsol bar byed pa'o //
translated: Washing means to have it washed in water.🔽Boiling means to have it boiled in dye.

original: 'tshed du 'jug pa ni tshon gyi nang du bsgre ba'o//'chag tu 'jug pa ni chung du na thal mos kyang ngo //
analyzed: 'tshed du 'jug pa ni tshon gyi nang du bsgre ba'o//'chag tu 'jug pa ni chung du na thal mos kyang ngo //
translated: Rubbing means to have it rubbed even with the palm of the hand.

original: de bzhin du dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa sems 'khrugs pa zhes bya ba la sogs par kha cig lkug mar smos par 'don to //
analyzed: de bzhin du dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa sems 'khrugs pa zhes bya ba la sogs par kha cig lkug mar smos par 'don to //
translated: Similarly, some recite that a non-relative nun with a disturbed mind, etc. is mentioned in the case of a mute.

original: de ni gzhan dag mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de ni gzhan dag mi 'dod de /
translated: But others do not accept that.

original: gal te lkug ma la 'khrur 'jug pa la yang nyes byas su 'dod na rgas pa dang 'theng ba la sogs pa 'ang de dang 'dra bar thal bar 'gyur bas de dag la 'khrur bcug na yang nyes byas su thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te lkug ma la 'khrur 'jug pa la yang nyes byas su 'dod na rgas pa dang 'theng ba la sogs pa 'ang de dang 'dra bar thal bar 'gyur bas de dag la 'khrur bcug na yang nyes byas su thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is accepted that even having a mute wash is a minor offense, then it would follow that being old, crippled, etc. would be similar, so it would follow that even having them wash would be a minor offense.

original: de 'ang mi 'dod de rnam par rig par bya ba la @290b rtogs pa tsam yan lag yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'ang mi 'dod de rnam par rig par bya ba la @290b rtogs pa tsam yan lag yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But that is unacceptable because mere understanding of what is to be known is a branch.

original: de lta bas na 'di ni gdon par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ni gdon par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this should not be removed.

original: khas len pa la 'khrur 'jug na nyes byas su bstan pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: khas len pa la 'khrur 'jug na nyes byas su bstan pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is taught that there is an offense for one who causes another to wash it, because it is a contrary position.

original: 'di ltar gzhan gyi phyogs la log par grub pa ni rang gi phyogs la ji lta ba de bzhin du smad pa nyid ma yin bas de'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan gyi phyogs la log par grub pa ni rang gi phyogs la ji lta ba de bzhin du smad pa nyid ma yin bas de'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
translated: Thus, a false establishment in the position of another is not the same as in one's own position, and therefore it is condemned.

original: bsgrub par bgyi ba ni thun mong gi'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bgyi ba ni thun mong gi'o //
translated: The thing to be washed is common to all.

original: bkrus pa ni cung zad bkrus pa'o //
analyzed: bkrus pa ni cung zad bkrus pa'o //
translated: The word washed means washed a little.

original: yongs su spyad de dri ma can du gyur pa zhes bya ba ni yongs su spyad pa ni gal te na de tsam du zad pas de'i phyir dri ma can du gyur pas khyad par can du smos so //
analyzed: yongs su spyad de dri ma can du gyur pa zhes bya ba ni yongs su spyad pa ni gal te na de tsam du zad pas de'i phyir dri ma can du gyur pas khyad par can du smos so //
translated: The phrase having used it, it becomes soiled means that if one uses it, it becomes soiled. Therefore, it is said to be soiled in order to distinguish it.

original: gnas mal gyi dngos po zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi gnas mal dri ma can du gyur ba 'di bkru'o snyam pa'i bsam pas so //
analyzed: gnas mal gyi dngos po zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi gnas mal dri ma can du gyur ba 'di bkru'o snyam pa'i bsam pas so //
translated: The phrase the bedding means the bedding of the Saṅgha. With the thought I will wash this soiled bedding, one should wash it.

original: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa mtshan gyur na nyes byas su gsungs pa ni 'khrur 'jug par gtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa mtshan gyur na nyes byas su gsungs pa ni 'khrur 'jug par gtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The Venerable Sariputra says, “If a fully ordained monk changes sex, he commits an offense of wrong conduct,” because he is included in the category of one who makes another wash.

original: 'di ltar ltung ba ni 'phags pa 'char kas sbed ma la smad g-yogs su khu bas gos pa 'khrur bcug la de las rnam par bzhag ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar ltung ba ni 'phags pa 'char kas sbed ma la smad g-yogs su khu bas gos pa 'khrur bcug la de las rnam par bzhag ste /
translated: Thus, the offense of the noble Ananda is established in the case of washing the lower robe of a woman who was in love with him.

original: kun du 'dod chags pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽dge slong ma de yang nye du ma yin pa mtshan mthun pa la 'khrur 'jug na ma brtags pa'i phyogs la brten pa'i nyes byas su gsungs so ;
analyzed: kun du 'dod chags pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro // dge slong ma de yang nye du ma yin pa mtshan mthun pa la 'khrur 'jug na ma brtags pa'i phyogs la brten pa'i nyes byas su gsungs so ;
translated: Because it is the cause of complete attachment.🔽If a fully ordained nun makes a non-relative who has the same gender wash, it is said to be an offense based on the category of non-examination.

original: / btsun pa re zhig dge slong mas zhes bya ba la sogs pas mtshan gyur na de kho na bzhin nyes byas su gsungs pa ni ma brtags pa'i phyogs la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / btsun pa re zhig dge slong mas zhes bya ba la sogs pas mtshan gyur na de kho na bzhin nyes byas su gsungs pa ni ma brtags pa'i phyogs la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Venerable Sariputra says, “If a fully ordained nun changes sex, she commits an offense of wrong conduct,” because it is based on the category of non-examination.

original: spang ba zhig dge slong mas nye du ma lags pa 'khrur stsol na zhes bya ba la sogs pas spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur bar gsungs pa ni rang gi yod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spang ba zhig dge slong mas nye du ma lags pa 'khrur stsol na zhes bya ba la sogs pas spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur bar gsungs pa ni rang gi yod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement that it is a downfall to make a nun who is not a relative wash your clothes, etc., is because it is your own.
