original: 'on te spangs pa zhig 'khrur 'jug na zhes bya ba la nyes byas su gsungs pa ni sngar rang gi yin pa skyes pa nyams pa'i phyir dang / byin gyis brlabs pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on te spangs pa zhig 'khrur 'jug na zhes bya ba la nyes byas su gsungs pa ni sngar rang gi yin pa skyes pa nyams pa'i phyir dang / byin gyis brlabs pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement that it is an offense of wrong conduct to make a nun who is not a relative wash your clothes, etc., is because it is your own, but you have given it up, and because you have not consecrated it.

original: bshang ba ni phyi sa'o /🔽gci ba ni gcin no //
analyzed: bshang ba ni phyi sa'o / gci ba ni gcin no //
translated: Feces are excrement.🔽Urine is the liquid waste of the body.

original: 'dam rdzab ni rdzab bo //
analyzed: 'dam rdzab ni rdzab bo //
translated: Mud is mire.

original: ljan ljin ni stor khung du gtogs pa mi gtsang ba'o //
analyzed: ljan ljin ni stor khung du gtogs pa mi gtsang ba'o //
translated: Filth is the impurity that is in a latrine.

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni khrag la sogs pas so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni khrag la sogs pas so //
translated: Others refers to blood, etc.

original: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa 'khrur stsol ba'i sbyor ba bgyis la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa'i gnas skabs na bdag nyid kyis 'khrur 'jug pa'i sbyor ba byas nas dus @291a * //
analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa 'khrur stsol ba'i sbyor ba bgyis la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa'i gnas skabs na bdag nyid kyis 'khrur 'jug pa'i sbyor ba byas nas dus @291a * //
translated: The phrase one who has not yet completed the novitiate refers to a novice monk. The phrase the performance of the act of bathing refers to the act of bathing oneself.

original: phyis de'i sbyor ba'i dbang kho nas chud pa yin gyi /
analyzed: phyis de'i sbyor ba'i dbang kho nas chud pa yin gyi /
translated: The phrase later, by the power of that act alone means that the novice monk becomes guilty by the power of the act of bathing alone,

original: pho nya la sogs pa la 'chol ba'i dbang gis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽bsnyen par ma rdzogs par 'du shes na zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyes byas su gsungs pa ni bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa ni 'khrur 'jug pa na yang nyes byas su gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pho nya la sogs pa la 'chol ba'i dbang gis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // bsnyen par ma rdzogs par 'du shes na zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyes byas su gsungs pa ni bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa ni 'khrur 'jug pa na yang nyes byas su gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and not by the power of requesting another to bathe him.🔽The phrase if he has the perception that the other is not yet a novice refers to the fact that if the novice monk has the perception that the other is not yet a novice, he is guilty of a minor offense.

original: nye dur 'du shes na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ltung ba med par gsungs pa ni nye du la ltung ba med par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye dur 'du shes na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ltung ba med par gsungs pa ni nye du la ltung ba med par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase if he has the perception that the other is a relative refers to the fact that if the novice monk has the perception that the other is a relative, he is not guilty of an offense.

original: nye du ma yin pa la yin pa ni spel ba dang lhung bzed dag ma yin pa nye du la nyes pa med do zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: nye du ma yin pa la yin pa ni spel ba dang lhung bzed dag ma yin pa nye du la nyes pa med do zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: But if one who is not a relative is mistaken for a relative, there is no offense in giving a relative a needle or a begging bowl.

original: / de lta bas na 'dir nye du ma yin pa la 'du shes pa la spang bar gsungs pa ni sbyor ba yod pa'i phyir dang / bsams pa'i don grub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: / de lta bas na 'dir nye du ma yin pa la 'du shes pa la spang bar gsungs pa ni sbyor ba yod pa'i phyir dang / bsams pa'i don grub pa'i phyir te /
translated: Therefore, the statement here that there is an offense if one has the perception that the recipient is not a relative is because the preparation exists and the intended purpose is accomplished.

original: lugs las sbyor ba la ni 'du shes yan lag nyid do zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lugs las sbyor ba la ni 'du shes yan lag nyid do zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For it is said, “In the system of preparation, perception is a branch.”

original: nye du ma yin pa la nye dur shes pa la ltung ba med par gsungs pa ni sbyor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye du ma yin pa la nye dur shes pa la ltung ba med par gsungs pa ni sbyor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement that there is no offense if one who is not a relative is known to be a relative is because the preparation does not exist.

original: dngos gzhi la yang ltung ba med de /
analyzed: dngos gzhi la yang ltung ba med de /
translated: There is also no offense in the actual basis.

original: bsams pa'i don ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsams pa'i don ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the intended purpose is not accomplished.

original: 'di ltar nye du ma yin pa'i 'du shes kyis 'jug pa ni sbyor ba yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar nye du ma yin pa'i 'du shes kyis 'jug pa ni sbyor ba yin gyi /
translated: Thus, the engagement with the perception that the recipient is not a relative is the preparation.

original: nye du'i 'du shes kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nye du'i 'du shes kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the engagement with the perception that the recipient is a relative.

original: de lta bas na nye du ma yin pa la nye dur 'du shes pas 'khrur 'jug pa la ltung ba med par gsungs pa ni sbyor ba la 'du shes pa yan lag rnam par gzhag na de yang de la med pas so //
analyzed: de lta bas na nye du ma yin pa la nye dur 'du shes pas 'khrur 'jug pa la ltung ba med par gsungs pa ni sbyor ba la 'du shes pa yan lag rnam par gzhag na de yang de la med pas so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that there is no offense if one makes a nonrelative wash clothes, thinking that he is a relative, because if the branch of perception is posited in terms of preparation, then that nonrelative does not have the perception of being a relative.

original: nye du la nye du ma yin par 'du shes pa la nyes byas su gsungs pa ni sbyor ba yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: nye du la nye du ma yin par 'du shes pa la nyes byas su gsungs pa ni sbyor ba yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is said that there is an offense if one makes a relative wash clothes, thinking that he is not a relative, because preparation exists.

original: nye du la nye du ma yin par 'du shes par 'jug pa sbyor ba yin gyi nye du'i 'du shes kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nye du la nye du ma yin par 'du shes par 'jug pa sbyor ba yin gyi nye du'i 'du shes kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: The preparation is to engage in the action thinking that a relative is not a relative, but it is not to engage in the action thinking that a nonrelative is a relative.

original: de yang de la yod pas lung las sbyor ba la ni 'du shes yan lag nyid do zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang de la yod pas lung las sbyor ba la ni 'du shes yan lag nyid do zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That preparation exists for that nonrelative, because it is said in the scriptures that perception is a branch of preparation.

original: nye du la nye dur 'du shes pa la ltung ba med par gsungs pa ni ma bsams pa'i phyir dang sbyor ba'ang med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: nye du la nye dur 'du shes pa la ltung ba med par gsungs pa ni ma bsams pa'i phyir dang sbyor ba'ang med pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is said that there is no offense if one makes a relative wash clothes, thinking that he is a relative, because there is no thought and no preparation.

original: de bzhin du 'og ma dag la yang ci rigs par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'og ma dag la yang ci rigs par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the same is true of the latter cases in accordance with the former.

original: rnam par 'byed pa las dge slong gis dge slong ma nye du ma yin par 'du shes pas chos gos ring pa 'khrur 'jug na nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rnam par 'byed pa las dge slong gis dge slong ma nye du ma yin par 'du shes pas chos gos ring pa 'khrur 'jug na nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa ma yin nam /
translated: If a fully ordained monk makes a nonrelative nun wash his long ceremonial upper garment, he commits an offense of wrong conduct?

original: de ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: If you ask how that is,

original: 'dul ba 'dzin pa rnams na re der yang sbyor ba las byung ba'i nyes @291b byas yin par ston par shes par bya'i gzhan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dul ba 'dzin pa rnams na re der yang sbyor ba las byung ba'i nyes @291b byas yin par ston par shes par bya'i gzhan ni ma yin te /
translated: those who uphold the vinaya know that this teaches that it is an offense of wrong conduct that arises from preparation, not otherwise.

original: 'di pa'i don ma grub pas dngos gzhi mi slong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di pa'i don ma grub pas dngos gzhi mi slong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the meaning of this is not established, it does not induce the actual basis.

original: 'di ltar nye du ma yin par 'du shes kyis 'jug pa ni sbyor ba yin gyi nye du'i 'du shes kyi sa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar nye du ma yin par 'du shes kyis 'jug pa ni sbyor ba yin gyi nye du'i 'du shes kyi sa ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, engaging with the perception that she is not a relative is preparation, but the basis of the perception that she is a relative is not.

original: 'di ni mi shes par byas pa las ltung ba gang yang mi 'gyur te ;
analyzed: 'di ni mi shes par byas pa las ltung ba gang yang mi 'gyur te ;
translated: If one does not know this, one does not commit any downfall.

original: 'di ltar ched du ma bsams pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don 'di bstan pa'i phyir 'du shes smos kyi ltung ba med pa la gtso bo nyid du shes par bya ba'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar ched du ma bsams pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don 'di bstan pa'i phyir 'du shes smos kyi ltung ba med pa la gtso bo nyid du shes par bya ba'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: Because it is not intentional, the term perception is mentioned to indicate this meaning, but it should be understood that it is not the primary factor in the absence of downfall.

original: de nyid kyi phyir don du 'du shes dang ldan pa la ni dngos gzhi'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir don du 'du shes dang ldan pa la ni dngos gzhi'o //
translated: Therefore, it is explained that the actual basis is for one who has the perception of the object,

original: gzhan nyid la ni sbyor ba'o zhes bshad do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan nyid la ni sbyor ba'o zhes bshad do zhes zer ro //
translated: and the preparation is for another.

original: don 'di ni bshad zin pa yin mod kyi yang ches gsal bar bya ba'i phyir bshad do //
analyzed: don 'di ni bshad zin pa yin mod kyi yang ches gsal bar bya ba'i phyir bshad do //
translated: This meaning has already been explained, but it is explained again for greater clarity.

original: gzhan mu stegs can zhes bya ba la sogs pa bram ze ni sdom brtson can du gyur pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan mu stegs can zhes bya ba la sogs pa bram ze ni sdom brtson can du gyur pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: The brahmin is to be understood as one who has become an ascetic, and so on.

original: de lta ma yin te sdom pa med pa yin na khyim pa mo dang zhes 'byung ba dang zlos pas khyad par yod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin te sdom pa med pa yin na khyim pa mo dang zhes 'byung ba dang zlos pas khyad par yod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, if he were not one who has taken vows, there would be no difference from the statement, “with a householder woman,” and the repetition would be meaningless.

original: kha cig ni gzhan mu stegs can dang / dge sbyong dang / spyod pa dang kun du rgyu rnams la zhes de skad du 'don par byed do //
analyzed: kha cig ni gzhan mu stegs can dang / dge sbyong dang / spyod pa dang kun du rgyu rnams la zhes de skad du 'don par byed do //
translated: Some read, “to other non-Buddhists, ascetics, practitioners, and wanderers.”

original: de la ni lan gang yang med la lan gdab kyang mi dgos te /
analyzed: de la ni lan gang yang med la lan gdab kyang mi dgos te /
translated: There is no reply to that, nor is it necessary to reply.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang ci rigs par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang ci rigs par shes par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should understand the rest as appropriate.

original: dge slong mas dge slong dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyes byas gsungs pa ni der gtogs par gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge slong mas dge slong dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyes byas gsungs pa ni der gtogs par gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement of a minor offense by the line “a nun to a monk,” and so on, is because she is included there.

original: 'on kha cig dge slong gi chos gos 'khrur 'jug na dge slong ma rnams la spang bar 'gyur bar 'dod pa de ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kha cig dge slong gi chos gos 'khrur 'jug na dge slong ma rnams la spang bar 'gyur bar 'dod pa de ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: But what if someone asserts that if a nun makes a monk wash his robes, it would be a downfall for the nun?

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not correct.

original: dge slong gi chos gos kyis dge slong ma la spang ba 'byung bar ni rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dge slong gi chos gos kyis dge slong ma la spang ba 'byung bar ni rung ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not appropriate that a nun would incur a downfall for a monk’s Dharma robe.

original: 'di ltar spang bar bya ba'i nor las spang ba byung na gzhan gyi yang rang gir ma byas pa kho nas spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar spang bar bya ba'i nor las spang ba byung na gzhan gyi yang rang gir ma byas pa kho nas spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, if a renunciate arises from the wealth that is to be abandoned, it is abandoned by merely not appropriating it as one’s own.

original: gzhan yang dge slong ma rnams la ni gang las kyang 'khru ba bstan pa med pas 'di ni gyi na'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang dge slong ma rnams la ni gang las kyang 'khru ba bstan pa med pas 'di ni gyi na'o //
translated: Moreover, since nuns are not allowed to wash anything, this is impossible.

original: khyim pa mo'i khyim pa'i thad du 'gro zhing nyan pa ste /
analyzed: khyim pa mo'i khyim pa'i thad du 'gro zhing nyan pa ste /
translated: They go to the homes of laypeople and listen to them.

original: gus par nyan pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gus par nyan pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that they do not listen respectfully.

original: zhus pa gzhung la la las ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: zhus pa gzhung la la las ni 'di skad du /
translated: In some texts, it is asked:

original: dge 'dun gyis 'khrur 'jug pa dang / ltang ltong du 'dug pa 'khrur 'jug na thams cad du nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes 'byung @292a * //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis 'khrur 'jug pa dang / ltang ltong du 'dug pa 'khrur 'jug na thams cad du nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes 'byung @292a * //
translated: If the saṅgha makes one wash and if one makes a lay person wash a robe that is to be dyed, then in all cases there is an offense.

original: ngo ; ; de la don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: ngo ; ; de la don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: dge 'dun gyi chos gos 'khrur 'jug na nyes byas su 'gyur pa ni rang gi yin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi chos gos 'khrur 'jug na nyes byas su 'gyur pa ni rang gi yin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If one makes the saṅgha wash a Dharma robe, there is an offense because it is not one’s own.

original: gzhan dag na re dge 'dun gyi la ni thun mong ba nyid kyis gzhan gyi yin pa'i phyir gyi rang gi yin pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re dge 'dun gyi la ni thun mong ba nyid kyis gzhan gyi yin pa'i phyir gyi rang gi yin pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Others say: It is not one's own because it belongs to others through the commonality of the Saṅgha.

original: ma yin te 'di ltar res 'ga' gang gi tshe brnyas nas byin gyis brlabs pa can du byed na dge 'dun gyi la yang rang gi yin pa nyid du ni 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: ma yin te 'di ltar res 'ga' gang gi tshe brnyas nas byin gyis brlabs pa can du byed na dge 'dun gyi la yang rang gi yin pa nyid du ni 'gyur gyi /
translated: That is not so, because sometimes when one is despised, it becomes one's own even in the Saṅgha.

original: de'i tshe yang gzhan gyi yin pa nyid med na ni ma yin no zer ro //🔽rung ba 'khrur 'jug pa ni sngar nas rang gi yin ba la mi brten pa'i phyir ro //🔽ltong ltong du 'dug pa ni bar bar na shog shig tu 'dug pa brtags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe yang gzhan gyi yin pa nyid med na ni ma yin no zer ro // rung ba 'khrur 'jug pa ni sngar nas rang gi yin ba la mi brten pa'i phyir ro // ltong ltong du 'dug pa ni bar bar na shog shig tu 'dug pa brtags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But if it did not belong to others at that time, it would not be so.🔽One should not have another wash one's bowl because one does not rely on one's own.🔽One should not have another wash one's robes because one should examine them from time to time.

original: 'tshed pa dang 'chag pa dag gi gzhung gzhan chos gos bag tsam kha bsgyur ba 'tshed du 'jug / chos gos bag tsam bcags pa 'chag tu 'jug na thams cad du nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'tshed pa dang 'chag pa dag gi gzhung gzhan chos gos bag tsam kha bsgyur ba 'tshed du 'jug / chos gos bag tsam bcags pa 'chag tu 'jug na thams cad du nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: If one has another cook or wash one's robes, one commits an offense for each action.

original: de la don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la don ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the meaning.

original: bag tsam kha bsgyur ba ni cung zad kha bsgyur ba'o //
analyzed: bag tsam kha bsgyur ba ni cung zad kha bsgyur ba'o //
translated: A little change means a slight change.

original: bag tsam bcags pa ni cung zad bcags pa ste /
analyzed: bag tsam bcags pa ni cung zad bcags pa ste /
translated: A little break means a slight break.

original: phyed byas pa byed pa la phyed nyid yin no zhes 'byung pa'i phyir nyes byas su gsungs so //
analyzed: phyed byas pa byed pa la phyed nyid yin no zhes 'byung pa'i phyir nyes byas su gsungs so //
translated: It is said to be a minor offense because it is said that half is half of the action.

original: dus ma gtogs pa ni phongs pa'i dus ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: dus ma gtogs pa ni phongs pa'i dus ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: Except in times of need means except in times of poverty.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni nye du ma yin pa la slong ba la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni nye du ma yin pa la slong ba la'o //
translated: In that case means in the case of asking someone who is not a relative.

original: dus ni bslang du rung pa'i dus so //
analyzed: dus ni bslang du rung pa'i dus so //
translated: Time means a time suitable for asking.

original: yang dus ni tshul te nyes pa mi 'byung bar gyur pa'i gnas skabs ni 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang dus ni tshul te nyes pa mi 'byung bar gyur pa'i gnas skabs ni 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Or time means a situation in which there is no fault, that is, a time when there is no fault.

original: yang na gzhan dag na re 'du shes 'byung ba'i phyir nyes pa mi slong ba'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pa'i dus dang gnas skabs gzhan gang yin pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: yang na gzhan dag na re 'du shes 'byung ba'i phyir nyes pa mi slong ba'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pa'i dus dang gnas skabs gzhan gang yin pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Or others say that any other time or situation that is a reason for not asking is a time when there is no fault, because the perception arises.

original: chos gos phrogs pa ni chom rkun la sogs pas so //
analyzed: chos gos phrogs pa ni chom rkun la sogs pas so //
translated: Robbed of robes means by thieves and so on.

original: chos gos nyams pa ni brjed pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: chos gos nyams pa ni brjed pa la sogs pas so //
translated: The robe is damaged by forgetting it and so on.

original: chos gos tshig pa ni mes so //🔽chos gos ded pa ni rlung gis so //
analyzed: chos gos tshig pa ni mes so // chos gos ded pa ni rlung gis so //
translated: The robe is burned by fire.🔽The robe is carried away by wind.

original: chos gos khyer ba ni chus so //
analyzed: chos gos khyer ba ni chus so //
translated: The robe is carried away by water.

original: de la 'di ni dus yin no zhes smos pa ni nges par bzung ba ste /
analyzed: de la 'di ni dus yin no zhes smos pa ni nges par bzung ba ste /
translated: Here, the phrase “this is the proper time” is a definite statement.

original: 'di ni dus yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di ni dus yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means “this is the proper time, not another.”

original: gzhan dag na re mjug bsdu ba'i ngo bos brtsal par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re mjug bsdu ba'i ngo bos brtsal par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that it is stated in order to make it clear that it is to be sought.

original: bsnyen par ma rdzogs par zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bdag nyid kyis bslangs pa'i rgyu dus phyis sngon gyi sbyor ba kho nas @292b grub na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs par zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bdag nyid kyis bslangs pa'i rgyu dus phyis sngon gyi sbyor ba kho nas @292b grub na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase “if one who is not fully ordained” and so on means that if the robe is made by the previous application of one who has solicited it, it is completed later by oneself.

original: de bzhin du 'og ma dag la yang ci rigs par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'og ma dag la yang ci rigs par shes par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood in the same way for the following.

original: za ma zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyes byas su gsungs pa ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: za ma zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyes byas su gsungs pa ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement that it is a minor offense for a eunuch and so on is because it transgresses worldly convention.

original: 'di ltar 'di'i lus ni sems can gyi blo nyams pa lta bur 'dug go //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di'i lus ni sems can gyi blo nyams pa lta bur 'dug go //
translated: Thus, his body is like the mind of a degenerated sentient being.

original: de'i phyir gdon gyis zin pa dang 'dra bar mi ma yin pa nyid du snang ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir gdon gyis zin pa dang 'dra bar mi ma yin pa nyid du snang ste /
translated: Therefore, he appears to be a non-human, like one possessed by a spirit.

original: ma ning dang ma ning mo dang mtshan gnyis pa rnams la yang tshul 'di nyid yin la /
analyzed: ma ning dang ma ning mo dang mtshan gnyis pa rnams la yang tshul 'di nyid yin la /
translated: This is also the case for a eunuch, a hermaphrodite, and a person with two sex organs.

original: khyim par gtogs pa'i kha na ma tho ba 'og ma dag la yang de kho na bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: khyim par gtogs pa'i kha na ma tho ba 'og ma dag la yang de kho na bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood in the same way for the remaining offenses that are related to householders.🔽Similarly, the statement that “a eunuch, a hermaphrodite, and a person with two sex organs are not fully ordained” is a statement that is made in relation to the term bhikṣu.

original: de bzhin du ma ning dang ma ning mo nas dge slong zhes bya ba 'dis dge slong la sogs pa la slong pa la nyes byas su gsungs pa ni slong bar gtogs par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du ma ning dang ma ning mo nas dge slong zhes bya ba 'dis dge slong la sogs pa la slong pa la nyes byas su gsungs pa ni slong bar gtogs par gyur pa ste /
translated: The statement that “a person who begs from bhikṣus and so on commits an offense of wrong conduct” is a statement that is made in relation to begging.

original: 'di ltar chos gos kyis bgos pa ma gtogs par tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams la slong na yang mi mdzes so //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos gos kyis bgos pa ma gtogs par tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams la slong na yang mi mdzes so //
translated: Thus, it is not proper to beg from those who are celibate, except for begging for Dharma robes.

original: slong ba'i spang ba gtan la dbab pa'o /
analyzed: slong ba'i spang ba gtan la dbab pa'o /
translated: This is the determination of the offense of begging.

original: // / dus kyi zhes bya ba ni mngon par zhen pa bstan bas so //
analyzed: // / dus kyi zhes bya ba ni mngon par zhen pa bstan bas so //
translated: The term “in a timely manner” is stated in order to teach that one should not be attached to the time.

original: stobs pa ni mgron du byed pa'o //🔽stod g-yogs smad g-yogs bcas pa zhes bya ba la stod g-yogs ni stod du bgo ba'o //
analyzed: stobs pa ni mgron du byed pa'o // stod g-yogs smad g-yogs bcas pa zhes bya ba la stod g-yogs ni stod du bgo ba'o //
translated: The word to beg means to request alms.

original: smad g-yogs ni sham thabs so //
analyzed: smad g-yogs ni sham thabs so //
translated: Wearing the upper and lower robes means wearing the upper robe on the upper body and the lower robe on the lower body.

original: mthar thug pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mchog tu brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: mthar thug pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mchog tu brjod pa yin te /
translated: The word only means at most.

original: des na dge slong slong mo pa des po zos na stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa de kho na bslang par bya'i lhag par ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: des na dge slong slong mo pa des po zos na stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa de kho na bslang par bya'i lhag par ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, the monk who begs for alms should beg for only the upper and lower robes, not more than that.

original: tha dad du bya ba ci yod ces bya ba ni khyad par ci yod pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad du bya ba ci yod ces bya ba ni khyad par ci yod pa'o //
translated: What is the difference between the two?

original: khyim pa'i stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa ni stod g-yogs khru bcu gnyis pa dang / smad g-yogs khru bdun dang gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: khyim pa'i stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa ni stod g-yogs khru bcu gnyis pa dang / smad g-yogs khru bdun dang gnyis pa'o //
translated: The upper and lower robes of a layperson are twelve cubits and seven and a half cubits respectively.

original: de tsam gyi cha lugs 'grub pa'i phyir te 'og ma la yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de tsam gyi cha lugs 'grub pa'i phyir te 'og ma la yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Because that much is sufficient for attire. The same applies to the lower robe.

original: dge slong gi stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa ni dus su ma spyad pa'i gos la ni snam sbyar ni nyis rim du bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong gi stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa ni dus su ma spyad pa'i gos la ni snam sbyar ni nyis rim du bya'o //
translated: The upper and lower robes of a fully ordained monk are to be worn at the proper time. The outer robe is to be made in two layers.

original: smad g-yogs ni khru lnga dang gnyis par bya'o //
analyzed: smad g-yogs ni khru lnga dang gnyis par bya'o //
translated: The lower robe is to be made five and a half cubits long.

original: dus su spyad pa las ni snam sbyar dang smad g-yogs dag de'i nyis 'gyur du bya'o //
analyzed: dus su spyad pa las ni snam sbyar dang smad g-yogs dag de'i nyis 'gyur du bya'o //
translated: The outer robe and lower robe are to be worn at the proper time, and are to be made twice the size of the lower robe.

original: dge slong gis khyim pa'i stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas gal te mi ldad bar gyur na yang bslang bar mi bya @293a * //
analyzed: dge slong gis khyim pa'i stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas gal te mi ldad bar gyur na yang bslang bar mi bya @293a * //
translated: If a fully ordained monk is not able to wear the upper and lower robes of a layperson, he should not accept them.

original: ba ni sbyin pa pos khas blangs la thob pas mi chog na lhag par blang bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: ba ni sbyin pa pos khas blangs la thob pas mi chog na lhag par blang bar mi bya ste /
translated: If the donor does not accept the gift, he should not accept the excess.

original: khyim pa'i stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa ni byin zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyim pa'i stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa ni byin zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The upper and lower robes of a layperson are already given.

original: gal te lhag na yang sbyin par mi bya ste /
analyzed: gal te lhag na yang sbyin par mi bya ste /
translated: If there is an excess, it should not be given.

original: sngar las blangs pa khyim pa'i stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa tsam nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar las blangs pa khyim pa'i stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa tsam nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the previously accepted upper and lower robes of a layperson are just that.

original: dge slong gi stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas gal te mi ldang bar gyur na bslang bar bya ba ni dge slong gi stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa la tshad nges pa yod do /
analyzed: dge slong gi stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas gal te mi ldang bar gyur na bslang bar bya ba ni dge slong gi stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa la tshad nges pa yod do /
translated: The phrase together with the upper and lower robes of a fully ordained monk and so forth indicates that if one does not rise, one should rise, and that the upper and lower robes of a fully ordained monk have a fixed size.

original: de bas na dge slong gi stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa khas blangs la thob pas ni mi ldang na blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na dge slong gi stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa khas blangs la thob pas ni mi ldang na blang bar bya ste /
translated: Therefore, if one does not rise by accepting the upper and lower robes of a fully ordained monk, one should rise by accepting them.

original: dge slong gi stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa ma byin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge slong gi stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa ma byin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the upper and lower robes of a fully ordained monk are not given.

original: gal te lhag par gyur na sbyin par bya ba ni lhag par thob na sbyin par bya ste /
analyzed: gal te lhag par gyur na sbyin par bya ba ni lhag par thob na sbyin par bya ste /
translated: If there is an excess, it should be given. If one obtains an excess, it should be given.

original: khas blangs pa las lhag pa'i phyir ro; ;
analyzed: khas blangs pa las lhag pa'i phyir ro; ;
translated: Because it is an excess of what was accepted.

original: 'dul ba 'dzin pa kha cig ni 'di gnyis la spang ba'i ltung byed du 'dod de /
analyzed: 'dul ba 'dzin pa kha cig ni 'di gnyis la spang ba'i ltung byed du 'dod de /
translated: Some vinaya masters assert that these two are offenses of wrong conduct.

original: dge slong khyim pa'i stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa las lhag par slong ba dang / dge slong gi stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa las lhag pa'i sbyin pa mi byed na thams cad du spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong khyim pa'i stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa las lhag par slong ba dang / dge slong gi stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa las lhag pa'i sbyin pa mi byed na thams cad du spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: If one asks for more than a monk's upper and lower robes, or if one gives more than a monk's upper and lower robes, then there is an offense entailing relinquishment and confession in all cases.

original: 'di ni 'dul ba 'dzin pa gzhan dag mi 'dod de /
analyzed: 'di ni 'dul ba 'dzin pa gzhan dag mi 'dod de /
translated: Other masters of the Vinaya do not accept this.

original: dge slong gi stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa lhag par slong na zhes bya ba 'di la 'ang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge slong gi stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa lhag par slong na zhes bya ba 'di la 'ang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that if one asks for more than a monk's upper and lower robes, then there would be an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: 'di ltar khyim pa'i stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa las lhag par slong ba ni spang ba'i sbyor ba yin na spang ba'i sbyor ba la spang bar 'gyur ba mi 'thad de /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyim pa'i stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa las lhag par slong ba ni spang ba'i sbyor ba yin na spang ba'i sbyor ba la spang bar 'gyur ba mi 'thad de /
translated: Because if one asks for more than a layperson's upper and lower robes, then it is preparation for relinquishment, but it is not tenable that preparation for relinquishment is relinquishment.

original: 'di ltar de'i sbyor ba la ni nyes byas su bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i sbyor ba la ni nyes byas su bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is taught that the preparation for that is a minor offense.

original: de lta bas na gnyi ga la nyes byas su 'don pa bzang ste lhag par slong ba'i phyir dang lhag par 'chang pa'i phyir ro zhes bya pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de lta bas na gnyi ga la nyes byas su 'don pa bzang ste lhag par slong ba'i phyir dang lhag par 'chang pa'i phyir ro zhes bya pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, it is better to declare both to be offenses, because of the excess of asking and the excess of keeping.

original: lhag ma ni pho nya'i yi ge lag brda dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni pho nya'i yi ge lag brda dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The rest is the written message, the sign with the hand, and so on.

original: bslab pa'i gzhi snga ma zhes bya ba la slong ba'i bslab pa'i gzhi'o //
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi snga ma zhes bya ba la slong ba'i bslab pa'i gzhi'o //
translated: The former training precept is the training precept of asking.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa la'o //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa la'o //
translated: Here means with the upper robe and the lower robe.

original: stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa slong ba'i @293b spang ba gtan la dbab pa'o /
analyzed: stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa slong ba'i @293b spang ba gtan la dbab pa'o /
translated: The determination of the prohibition of asking for the upper robe and the lower robe together is finished.

original: // / yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba ste /
analyzed: // / yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba ste /
translated: The word again is for emphasis.

original: gang kho na de las grub par bya ba'i dge slong de kho na'i zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang kho na de las grub par bya ba'i dge slong de kho na'i zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means that the very same monk who is to make it is the one who asks for it.

original: yang na gal te zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang na gal te zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Or it means if.

original: phyir zhes bya bas ni ched du byas nas so //
analyzed: phyir zhes bya bas ni ched du byas nas so //
translated: The word for the sake of means on purpose.

original: chos gos kyi rin dag ni chos gos kyi zong dbyig dang gser la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: chos gos kyi rin dag ni chos gos kyi zong dbyig dang gser la sogs pa ste /
translated: The price of the robe is the money and gold that are the materials for the robe.

original: 'di dag gis chos gos grub cing nyo bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di dag gis chos gos grub cing nyo bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are used to make and buy the robe.

original: spags pa ni so sor nges pa'i ngo bor gzhag pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: spags pa ni so sor nges pa'i ngo bor gzhag pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The word “or” indicates that the robe is established as having a specific nature.

original: 'di dang 'di lta bu ni rnam pa 'di lta bu ste tshad dang kha dog ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di dang 'di lta bu ni rnam pa 'di lta bu ste tshad dang kha dog ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Like this” means “in this way,” and “like that” means “in that way.”

original: dang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gnyi ga'i chos gos shig dang sbyar bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gnyi ga'i chos gos shig dang sbyar bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “and” indicates that both are connected with the robe.

original: nyos la zhes bya ba ni nyos nas so //
analyzed: nyos la zhes bya ba ni nyos nas so //
translated: “Having bought” means having purchased.

original: rung ba ni dge slong dang mthun ba rnga bal gyi snam bu la sogs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rung ba ni dge slong dang mthun ba rnga bal gyi snam bu la sogs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: “Suitable” means suitable for a monk, not like a woolen blanket.

original: dus su zhes bya ba ni mkho ba'i dus so //
analyzed: dus su zhes bya ba ni mkho ba'i dus so //
translated: “In a timely manner” means at a time when it is needed.

original: sngar ma bstabs par zhes bya ba ni sngar mgron du ma byas pas so //
analyzed: sngar ma bstabs par zhes bya ba ni sngar mgron du ma byas pas so //
translated: “Without having been invited” means without having been invited before.

original: rnam par rtog pa 'ga' zhig rig ste zhes bya ba'i rgyu mtshan 'ga' zhig rig nas te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa 'ga' zhig rig ste zhes bya ba'i rgyu mtshan 'ga' zhig rig nas te /
translated: Having understood some reason for some thought,

original: mthong ba dang thos pa dang / dogs pa nyid kyi bsam pa khong du chud nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mthong ba dang thos pa dang / dogs pa nyid kyi bsam pa khong du chud nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: having understood the intention of what is seen, heard, or suspected.🔽Because of desiring the good,

original: bzang po 'dod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i ches khyad par du 'phags pa 'dod pa rgyur byas nas so //
analyzed: bzang po 'dod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i ches khyad par du 'phags pa 'dod pa rgyur byas nas so //
translated: having made the desire for something very special the cause.

original: tha gas ni bzang po'o//
analyzed: tha gas ni bzang po'o//
translated: The good is the end.

original: grub na zhes bya ba ni lag tu thob na'o //
analyzed: grub na zhes bya ba ni lag tu thob na'o //
translated: If it is accomplished, if it is obtained in the hand.

original: de las gzhan pa'i yo byad rnams ni ltung bzed la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i yo byad rnams ni ltung bzed la sogs pa'o //
translated: The other requisites are the begging-bowl, etc.

original: nyes byas 'di ni spags pa las lhag par slong ba'i bslang bar gtogs par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: nyes byas 'di ni spags pa las lhag par slong ba'i bslang bar gtogs par gyur pa yin no //
translated: This offense is included in the prohibition against begging more than once.

original: dge slong gi slad ces bya ba la sogs pa la nyes byas su gsungs pa 'di ni gzhan gyi ched yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge slong gi slad ces bya ba la sogs pa la nyes byas su gsungs pa 'di ni gzhan gyi ched yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The offense is said to be for the sake of the monk, etc., because it is for the sake of others.

original: spags pa las lhag par slong ba'i spang ba gtan la dbab pa'o /
analyzed: spags pa las lhag par slong ba'i spang ba gtan la dbab pa'o /
translated: This concludes the analysis of the prohibition against begging more than once.

original: // / gnyi ga 'dus te zhes bya ba ni chos gos khyad par du 'phags pa bya bar sems te'o //
analyzed: // / gnyi ga 'dus te zhes bya ba ni chos gos khyad par du 'phags pa bya bar sems te'o //
translated: The phrase both together means that they think of making a special robe.

original: lhag ma ni pho nya la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni pho nya la sogs pa'o //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: 'das ma thag pa nas zhes bya ba ni spags pa las lhag par slong pa ba'o //
analyzed: 'das ma thag pa nas zhes bya ba ni spags pa las lhag par slong pa ba'o //
translated: The phrase immediately after means that they ask for more than what was agreed upon.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni so so nas spags pa las lhag par slong ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni so so nas spags pa las lhag par slong ba'o //
translated: The phrase in this case means that they ask for more than what was individually agreed upon.

original: de lta bas na yang 'dir smos pa ni sbyin par byed pa'i dus ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de lta bas na yang 'dir smos pa ni sbyin par byed pa'i dus ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Therefore, it is said here that it is not the time to give.

original: 'di gnyis kyi tha dad pa nyid ni de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: 'di gnyis kyi tha dad pa nyid ni de lta bu yin no //
translated: This is the difference between the two.

original: so so nas spags pa las lhag par slong ba'i spang ba gtan la dbab @294a * //
analyzed: so so nas spags pa las lhag par slong ba'i spang ba gtan la dbab @294a * //
translated: This is the determination regarding the prohibition against asking for more than what was individually agreed upon.

original: pa'o / // / yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gal te zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: pa'o / // / yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gal te zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word “also” means “if.”

original: bram ze ni yon gnas su bkur bar ston pa yin no //
analyzed: bram ze ni yon gnas su bkur bar ston pa yin no //
translated: It shows that a Brahmin is honored as a recipient of gifts.

original: khyim bdag ni rje rigs dang dmangs rigs kyis mtshon pa'i sbyin pa bsten pa'o //
analyzed: khyim bdag ni rje rigs dang dmangs rigs kyis mtshon pa'i sbyin pa bsten pa'o //
translated: A householder is an example of a person of the warrior class and the laborer class who is devoted to giving.

original: rigs dang mthun pa'i khyad par bstan nas bsam pa'i khyad par bstan pa grong rdal gyi mi ni grong sna'o //
analyzed: rigs dang mthun pa'i khyad par bstan nas bsam pa'i khyad par bstan pa grong rdal gyi mi ni grong sna'o //
translated: the townspeople are the town chief,

original: yul mi ni yul dpon no //
analyzed: yul mi ni yul dpon no //
translated: the country people are the country chief.

original: rdzas dang mchod pa'i khyad par bstan pa /
analyzed: rdzas dang mchod pa'i khyad par bstan pa /
translated: He teaches the distinctions of wealth and worship:

original: nor can ni byed pa'i bdag po ste /
analyzed: nor can ni byed pa'i bdag po ste /
translated: the wealthy are the masters of work,

original: rdzas bsags pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas bsags pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have accumulated wealth.

original: tshong dpon ni mgo rgyan thob pa ste //
analyzed: tshong dpon ni mgo rgyan thob pa ste //
translated: The guild masters are the crown-jewel holders,

original: rgyal pos bkur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyal pos bkur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are honored by the king.

original: zho sha bstan pa'i ded dpon ni lan gnyis gsum 'gron po'i 'das pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: zho sha bstan pa'i ded dpon ni lan gnyis gsum 'gron po'i 'das pa'i phyir te /
translated: The caravan leaders are the caravan leaders, because they have gone on the journey twice or three times.

original: 'gron po'i khang dpon zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'gron po'i khang dpon zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the term “caravan leader.”

original: yang 'phags pa mkhyen par mdzod cig ces bya ba yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni tshig gi rgyan gyi don to //
analyzed: yang 'phags pa mkhyen par mdzod cig ces bya ba yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni tshig gi rgyan gyi don to //
translated: Again, the Blessed One said, “Noble sirs, understand this!” The term “again” is for the sake of ornamenting the sentence.

original: mkhyen par mdzod cig ces bya ba ni khong du chud par gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: mkhyen par mdzod cig ces bya ba ni khong du chud par gyis shig pa'o //
translated: “Understand this” means “comprehend this.”

original: thugs brtse ba'i slad du zhes bya ba ni snying brtse pa rgyur byas nas te /
analyzed: thugs brtse ba'i slad du zhes bya ba ni snying brtse pa rgyur byas nas te /
translated: “Out of compassion” means taking compassion as the cause.

original: lan sbyin pa'i blos ma sbyin par zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lan sbyin pa'i blos ma sbyin par zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “without giving in return” is “without giving in return with the thought of giving.”

original: mi rung ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis rang gir byed pa bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rung ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis rang gir byed pa bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Inappropriate” means that the Blessed One has prohibited appropriation.

original: ni zhes bya ba ni yang zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don to //
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba ni yang zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don to //
translated: “Also” means the meaning of the word “also.”

original: zhal ta bgyid pa ni zhal ta pa'o //🔽zhal ta ni las so //
analyzed: zhal ta bgyid pa ni zhal ta pa'o // zhal ta ni las so //
translated: “Attendant” means one who attends.🔽“Attending” means action.

original: nyams su len pa ni byed pa'o //
analyzed: nyams su len pa ni byed pa'o //
translated: “Practice” means doing.

original: chos gos 'dod pa ni chos gos re ba'o //
analyzed: chos gos 'dod pa ni chos gos re ba'o //
translated: “Desiring Dharma robes” means hoping for Dharma robes.

original: kun dga'i rab pa ni gsum la skyabs su song zhing rung ba byed pa'o //
analyzed: kun dga'i rab pa ni gsum la skyabs su song zhing rung ba byed pa'o //
translated: “Joyful” means one who has gone for refuge to the Three Jewels and is suitable.

original: dge bsnyen ni bslab pa'i gzhi lnga ba can no //
analyzed: dge bsnyen ni bslab pa'i gzhi lnga ba can no //
translated: “Lay practitioner” means one who has the five precepts.

original: bstan par bya ba ni ngo bstan par bya ba'o //
analyzed: bstan par bya ba ni ngo bstan par bya ba'o //
translated: “To be shown” means to be shown the essence.

original: legs par zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: legs par zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “Well” and so on.

original: ji ltar yang dag par bsgo na legs par zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: ji ltar yang dag par bsgo na legs par zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: When asked how to properly instruct, “well” is stated.

original: ji skad bstan pa bzhin byed du 'jug pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa bzhin byed du 'jug pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it causes one to engage in practice according to the teaching,

original: khyod kyis 'di'i tshad 'di tsam du gyis shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: khyod kyis 'di'i tshad 'di tsam du gyis shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: it means “You should make its measure just this much.”

original: ji ltar yang dag par bstan ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar yang dag par bstan ce na /
translated: How is it taught?

original: shin tu zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: shin tu zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: It is said, “very well.”

original: 'di skad smras pa bzhin brjod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di skad smras pa bzhin brjod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is spoken just as it is said.

original: 'dir rung bar gyis shig / nyo tshong dag la te por mkhas par gyis shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dir rung bar gyis shig / nyo tshong dag la te por mkhas par gyis shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Here, “make it suitable” means “be skilled in buying and selling.”

original: bstan pa ni ngo bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa ni ngo bstan pa'o //
translated: Teaching is the teaching of the essence.

original: yang dag par bstan pa ni phan pa la sbyar ba dang mi phan pa bzlog pas so //
analyzed: yang dag par bstan pa ni phan pa la sbyar ba dang mi phan pa bzlog pas so //
translated: Correct teaching is by applying benefit and averting harm.

original: lan gsum du zhes bya ba ni lan gnyis lan gsum du @294b zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lan gsum du zhes bya ba ni lan gnyis lan gsum du @294b zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Three times means two or three times.

original: bskul bar bya ba ni chos gos kyi ched du gzhan gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: bskul bar bya ba ni chos gos kyi ched du gzhan gdab par bya'o //
translated: One should request others for the sake of the Dharma robes.

original: dran par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dran par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should remind.

original: dran pa ni bskul ba'i 'khor du gyur pa kho na ste /🔽des na lan gnyis lan gsum du bskul bar bya /
analyzed: dran pa ni bskul ba'i 'khor du gyur pa kho na ste / des na lan gnyis lan gsum du bskul bar bya /
translated: Here, reminding is only for those who are in the assembly of those who are requested.🔽Therefore, one should request two or three times.

original: lan gnyis lan gsum du dran par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lan gnyis lan gsum du dran par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means one should remind two or three times.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir bdag chos gos 'dod do zhes bya ba la sogs ba smos te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir bdag chos gos 'dod do zhes bya ba la sogs ba smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says, “I want a Dharma robe,” etc.

original: bzlas pa'i don du gnyer ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzlas pa'i don du gnyer ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is taught that he is seeking to repeat the request.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni ci ste'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni ci ste'o //
translated: “If” means “when.”

original: grub na zhes bya ba ni grub par gyur na'o //
analyzed: grub na zhes bya ba ni grub par gyur na'o //
translated: “If he succeeds” means “if he succeeds in getting it.”

original: lan bzhi lan lnga lan drug gi bar du zhes bya ni sngar bskul ba gtogs par lan bzhi dang lan lnga dang lan drug gi par du ste /
analyzed: lan bzhi lan lnga lan drug gi bar du zhes bya ni sngar bskul ba gtogs par lan bzhi dang lan lnga dang lan drug gi par du ste /
translated: “Up to four times, five times, six times” means up to four times, five times, and six times, excluding the previous urging.

original: des na re zhig lan gsum gyi bar du bskul bar bya'o //
analyzed: des na re zhig lan gsum gyi bar du bskul bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, he should urge up to three times.

original: des ma grub na lan gsum gyi bar du phyogs su bsdad par bya'o //
analyzed: des ma grub na lan gsum gyi bar du phyogs su bsdad par bya'o //
translated: If he does not succeed, he should wait in a secluded place up to three times.

original: de las thal na ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de las thal na ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Beyond that, there is an offense. This is the meaning.

original: gnas ni gnas so //
analyzed: gnas ni gnas so //
translated: “Place” means a place.

original: de'i dus dang / khang pa dang / las kyi mtha' pa dang / las la ngag gi bye brag gis rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de'i dus dang / khang pa dang / las kyi mtha' pa dang / las la ngag gi bye brag gis rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four types of time, room, work, and speech.

original: 'jig rten ni phal cher 'di dag tu gnas par 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten ni phal cher 'di dag tu gnas par 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
translated: The world will mostly live in these.

original: de'i 'og tu zhes bya ba ni bskul ba dang bcas par phyogs su bsdad pa ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu zhes bya ba ni bskul ba dang bcas par phyogs su bsdad pa ste /
translated: After that, means after sitting in the direction of the invitation.

original: bslang ba lan drug pa'i 'og rol du zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bslang ba lan drug pa'i 'og rol du zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is after the sixth invitation.

original: 'di la 'dul ba 'dzin pa rnams kyi blo tha dad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la 'dul ba 'dzin pa rnams kyi blo tha dad par 'gyur te /
translated: Here, the minds of the Vinaya holders differ.

original: 'dul ba 'dzin pa kha cig na re bskul ba lan gsum pa'i bskul ba bzhi pa'i dngos gzhi byed pa nyid do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'dul ba 'dzin pa kha cig na re bskul ba lan gsum pa'i bskul ba bzhi pa'i dngos gzhi byed pa nyid do zhes zer ro //
translated: Some Vinaya holders say that after the third invitation, the fourth invitation is the actual ceremony.

original: 'di ni 'dul ba 'dzin pa gzhan dag mi 'dod de /
analyzed: 'di ni 'dul ba 'dzin pa gzhan dag mi 'dod de /
translated: Other Vinaya holders do not accept this.

original: 'di ltar mjug thogs kho nar /
analyzed: 'di ltar mjug thogs kho nar /
translated: Because immediately after that,🔽it says that after the sixth invitation, the act of accepting becomes a downfall:

original: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gi chos gos bsgrub pa'i slad du lan bzhi lan lnga lan drug gi bar du slong bar bgyid cing zhes slong ba la lan drug pa'i 'og ma ltung ba byed pa nyid du gsungs so //
analyzed: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gi chos gos bsgrub pa'i slad du lan bzhi lan lnga lan drug gi bar du slong bar bgyid cing zhes slong ba la lan drug pa'i 'og ma ltung ba byed pa nyid du gsungs so //
translated: Venerable, for the sake of completing the monk's robes, one should beg up to four, five, or six times.

original: gal te bzhi pa yang dngos gzhi byed pa nyid yin na de lta na btsun pa re zhig dge slong gi chos gos bsgrub pa'i slad du lan gnyis lan gsum bskul ba'i 'og tu slong bar bgyid cing zhes de ni 'di skad du brjod dgos par 'gyur te
analyzed: gal te bzhi pa yang dngos gzhi byed pa nyid yin na de lta na btsun pa re zhig dge slong gi chos gos bsgrub pa'i slad du lan gnyis lan gsum bskul ba'i 'og tu slong bar bgyid cing zhes de ni 'di skad du brjod dgos par 'gyur te
translated: For the sake of a fully ordained monk acquiring his robes, he should request them a second and third time.

original: / gnyi yang rang gi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽gang yang lan gnyis lan gsum du bskul zhing dran par byas pa na gal te chos gos @295a * //
analyzed: / gnyi yang rang gi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro // gang yang lan gnyis lan gsum du bskul zhing dran par byas pa na gal te chos gos @295a * //
translated: Because both are the actual basis.

original: de grub na de lta na legs /
analyzed: de grub na de lta na legs /
translated: If the robe is acquired when he is reminded and urged a second and third time, then it is good.🔽If it is not acquired, he should remain silent for up to four, five or six times.

original: gal te ma grub na lan bzhi lan lnga lan drug gi bar du phyogs su cang mi smra bar bsdad par bya'o zhes bskul ba gsum pa'i 'og tu cang mi smra bar sdod du gnang gi / bskul bar lhag par ma gsungs ba de ni yang dang yang
analyzed: gal te ma grub na lan bzhi lan lnga lan drug gi bar du phyogs su cang mi smra bar bsdad par bya'o zhes bskul ba gsum pa'i 'og tu cang mi smra bar sdod du gnang gi / bskul bar lhag par ma gsungs ba de ni yang dang yang
translated: This permits remaining silent after the third urging, but does not permit additional urgings.

original: du bskul bar smras na skyo ba skyes nas mi rung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: du bskul bar smras na skyo ba skyes nas mi rung ba yin gyi /
translated: If he speaks again and again, it is not suitable because he would become weary.

original: bskul ba bzhi pa spong bar byed pa nyid kyi lan ni ma yin no //🔽de lta bas na 'di ni bskul ba lan gsum las thal ba ni nyes byas byed pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: bskul ba bzhi pa spong bar byed pa nyid kyi lan ni ma yin no // de lta bas na 'di ni bskul ba lan gsum las thal ba ni nyes byas byed pa nyid yin la /
translated: The fourth exhortation is not the one that causes the offense of forsaking.🔽Therefore, it should be understood that the offense of wrongdoing is incurred by the third exhortation,

original: phyogs su bsdad pa la lan gsum gyi 'og tu ni spong bar byed pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba de ltar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs su bsdad pa la lan gsum gyi 'og tu ni spong bar byed pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba de ltar shes par bya'o //
translated: and the offense of forsaking is incurred by the fourth exhortation.

original: yid brtan pa na yid chos pa ste /
analyzed: yid brtan pa na yid chos pa ste /
translated: One who is trustworthy is one who is faithful.

original: slob ma la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: slob ma la sogs pa'o //
translated: A disciple and so on are those who are being taught.

original: don cir yang ma grub pa ni dgos pa ci yang mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: don cir yang ma grub pa ni dgos pa ci yang mi byed pa'o //
translated: One who is without any purpose is one who does not perform any function.

original: shes par gyis shig ces bya ba ni ltos shig pa'o //
analyzed: shes par gyis shig ces bya ba ni ltos shig pa'o //
translated: The phrase you should understand means you should see.

original: rang gi nor ni bdag nyid kyi rdzas so //
analyzed: rang gi nor ni bdag nyid kyi rdzas so //
translated: One's own wealth is one's own property.

original: btsun pa re zhig dge slong chos gos las ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyes byas su gsungs pa ni skur ba'i spang bar gtogs par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: btsun pa re zhig dge slong chos gos las ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyes byas su gsungs pa ni skur ba'i spang bar gtogs par gyur pa yin no //
translated: The statement in the sutra that the offense is a wrongdoing when a monk does not give up his view after being exhorted up to the third time in the section on the downfall of pārājika offenses is a reference to the downfall of slandering.

original: skur ba'i spang ba gtan la dbab pa'o /
analyzed: skur ba'i spang ba gtan la dbab pa'o /
translated: This concludes the explanation of the downfall of slandering.

original: // / srin bal ni dar gyi srin bu las byung ba'o //
analyzed: // / srin bal ni dar gyi srin bu las byung ba'o //
translated: Cotton is that which comes from cotton plants.

original: stan ni nang tshangs can dang / blings pa'o //
analyzed: stan ni nang tshangs can dang / blings pa'o //
translated: A mattress is a mattress of cotton or wool.

original: kha cig na re stan rnam pa gnyis yin mod kyis /
analyzed: kha cig na re stan rnam pa gnyis yin mod kyis /
translated: Some say: Although there are two kinds of mattresses,

original: 'on kyang re zhig 'dir ni nang tshangs can la dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang re zhig 'dir ni nang tshangs can la dgongs pa yin no //
translated: here the Buddha intends a mattress of cotton,

original: blings pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: blings pa ni ma yin te /
translated: not a mattress of wool,

original: de ni phyid pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de ni phyid pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: because the latter is the nature of a blanket.

original: srin bal kyang phyid pa'i ngo bo nyid du bling du mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: srin bal kyang phyid pa'i ngo bo nyid du bling du mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: And cotton is not suitable as a blanket, because it is the nature of a mattress.

original: 'dul ba 'dzin pa rnams na re de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dul ba 'dzin pa rnams na re de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: The Vinaya masters say: That is not correct,

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis stan ni gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis stan ni gnyis te /
translated: because the Blessed One himself said: There are two kinds of mattresses:

original: nang tshang dang / blings pa'o //
analyzed: nang tshang dang / blings pa'o //
translated: mattresses of cotton and mattresses of wool.

original: dan 'di la ni gnyi ga yin par dgongs so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dan 'di la ni gnyi ga yin par dgongs so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Buddha intended both here.

original: byed na zhes bya ba ni rang ngam gzhan la mngon sum du bya'o //
analyzed: byed na zhes bya ba ni rang ngam gzhan la mngon sum du bya'o //
translated: If one makes it oneself or through others, it is clear.

original: 'dir nang tshangs can smos pas ni g-yogs ma'i gos de lta bu nyid du 'chang ba ni spang par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir nang tshangs can smos pas ni g-yogs ma'i gos de lta bu nyid du 'chang ba ni spang par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Since this refers to an inner mattress, it is not abandoned by wearing a garment that is like a mattress,

original: gos nyid yin ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gos nyid yin ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not a garment.

original: stan gang zhig 'dir stan nyid yin du zin kyang gos nyid yin pa yod pa de ni 'chang na 'chang ba'i spang bar 'gyur ba kho na ste /
analyzed: stan gang zhig 'dir stan nyid yin du zin kyang gos nyid yin pa yod pa de ni 'chang na 'chang ba'i spang bar 'gyur ba kho na ste /
translated: If a mat is a mat and it is a garment, then wearing it is abandoned by wearing.

original: gos su gyur pa'i phyir gding ba bzhin no zer ro //
analyzed: gos su gyur pa'i phyir gding ba bzhin no zer ro //
translated: Because it is a garment, it is like a mat.

original: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis gzhan las srin bal gyi stan sar ba bgyid du stsal na zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyes @295b byas su gsungs pa ni rang gi mig sngar ma byas pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis gzhan las srin bal gyi stan sar ba bgyid du stsal na zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyes @295b byas su gsungs pa ni rang gi mig sngar ma byas pa'i phyir te /
translated: The Venerable states that if a monk asks another to make a new mat of shellac wool, etc., it is a fault because it is not made in his presence.

original: rang gi mig sngar ma byas pas ni rang gi mig sngar byas /
analyzed: rang gi mig sngar ma byas pas ni rang gi mig sngar byas /
translated: If it is not made in his presence, it is made in his presence.

original: de 'dra ba'i mngon par zhen pa dam po'i 'dod pa yang mi 'byung la /
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i mngon par zhen pa dam po'i 'dod pa yang mi 'byung la /
translated: Such strong attachment and desire does not occur,

original: de 'dra ba'i lus ni mi 'byung bas de'i phyir 'di shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i lus ni mi 'byung bas de'i phyir 'di shes par bya'o //
translated: and such a body does not occur. Therefore this should be understood.

original: kha cig mdun du khyim pa la bgyid du stsal na zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyes byas su brjod do //
analyzed: kha cig mdun du khyim pa la bgyid du stsal na zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyes byas su brjod do //
translated: Some say that the first is a minor offense, since it is said, “If one has a layperson do it in front of oneself.🔽”

original: 'di ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not correct,

original: 'di ltar byed pa dang byed pa nyid yin gyi khyim pa nyid la sogs pa'i khyad par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar byed pa dang byed pa nyid yin gyi khyim pa nyid la sogs pa'i khyad par ni ma yin te /
translated: because it is the act of doing that is the basis, not the specific quality of being a layperson.

original: de ni 'dir 'brel pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'dir 'brel pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not relevant here.

original: de lta bas na 'di la lhung bzed kho na bzang ste /🔽logs shig tu smos pa ni gsal pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir gcod pa la sogs pa yang tshul ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di la lhung bzed kho na bzang ste / logs shig tu smos pa ni gsal pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir gcod pa la sogs pa yang tshul ni 'di yin no //
translated: Therefore, the bowl itself is excellent.🔽The separate mention is to clarify that cutting and so on are also like this.

original: sbun zhes bya ba la sogs pas spang ba'i ltung byed du smras te /
analyzed: sbun zhes bya ba la sogs pas spang ba'i ltung byed du smras te /
translated: The line “if one uses wool” and so on states that it is a downfall to use wool that has not been woven.

original: dkon pa'i phyir dang / rin che ba'i phyir te de skad du gsungs so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dkon pa'i phyir dang / rin che ba'i phyir te de skad du gsungs so zhes zer ro //
translated: It is rare and valuable, and so it is said.

original: bal lam zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'dres pa las byas na nyes byas su gsungs pa ni rdzas zung dang 'brel ba la 'di shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bal lam zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'dres pa las byas na nyes byas su gsungs pa ni rdzas zung dang 'brel ba la 'di shes par bya'o //
translated: The line “if one uses a mixed cloth” and so on states that it is a minor offense to use a cloth that is a mixture of wool and cotton. This should be understood to apply to a mixture of two substances.

original: kha cig ni srin pal ni dul ma dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa las 'dir khyad par rnams ni yan lag dbye ba nyid kyis rgyu dang spun dag tu rig par bya'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni srin pal ni dul ma dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa las 'dir khyad par rnams ni yan lag dbye ba nyid kyis rgyu dang spun dag tu rig par bya'o //
translated: Some say: The distinctions are due to the divisions of the branches, such as the rakshasa vow, the vow of the female gandharva, and so on.

original: gzhan dag ni de ltar mi 'dod de /🔽'di ltar gal te gang dag ches dkon zhing ches rin che ba de spong bar byed pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni de ltar mi 'dod de / 'di ltar gal te gang dag ches dkon zhing ches rin che ba de spong bar byed pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Others do not accept that,

original: 'dod na de lta na ni dpag bsam gyi gos la sogs pa'i spong ba byed pa nyid du shin tu dkon pa dang / shin tu rin che ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod na de lta na ni dpag bsam gyi gos la sogs pa'i spong ba byed pa nyid du shin tu dkon pa dang / shin tu rin che ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because if it were so, then it would follow that the vows of the wish fulfilling tree and so on would be vows because they are extremely rare and precious.

original: de bas na mjug thogs kho nar ma brtags pa las bgyid du stsal na cir 'gyur lags /
analyzed: de bas na mjug thogs kho nar ma brtags pa las bgyid du stsal na cir 'gyur lags /
translated: Therefore, what would be the point of the statement, “If one engages in sexual union without first examining the circumstances, what happens?”

original: nyes byas so zhes khyad med par ma brtags pa thams cad nyes byas byed pa nyid du 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes byas so zhes khyad med par ma brtags pa thams cad nyes byas byed pa nyid du 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be meaningless to say, “One commits an offense,” because it would explain that all unanalyzed actions are offenses.

original: de lta bas na ston pas bcas pa'i dbang kho nas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na ston pas bcas pa'i dbang kho nas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, downfalls are posited only through the power of the Teacher’s decree.

original: 'di lta spang ba'i ltung byed du rnam par gzhag par brjod par yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di lta spang ba'i ltung byed du rnam par gzhag par brjod par yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not correct to say that this is established as a downfall that requires relinquishment,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that would lead to absurd consequences.

original: de lta bas na 'dres pa 'di thams cad la ni nyes byas kho nar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dres pa 'di thams cad la ni nyes byas kho nar rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, all of these mixed offenses should be understood as being only wrong actions.

original: ma brtags pa ni dpag bsam gyi gos la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ma brtags pa ni dpag bsam gyi gos la sogs pa'o //
translated: Unconsidered means such things as wish-granting garments.

original: kha cig ni dge slong ma rnams la srin bal gyi spang ba mi 'dod do //
analyzed: kha cig ni dge slong ma rnams la srin bal gyi spang ba mi 'dod do //
translated: Some say that the prohibition against using kapok is not for fully ordained nuns.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /🔽yang dge @296a * //
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te / yang dge @296a * //
translated: That is not correct,🔽because it is stated in the fully ordained nuns’ text on the distinctions that:

original: slong ma gang zhig srin bal gyi stan sar pa byed na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes 'byung bas dge slong ma'i rnam par 'byed pa dag las de rnams las ni rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: slong ma gang zhig srin bal gyi stan sar pa byed na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes 'byung bas dge slong ma'i rnam par 'byed pa dag las de rnams las ni rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Any fully ordained nun who makes a new kapok cushion commits a downfall that requires relinquishment.”

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni chos gos gang la chu dang zheng dag tu tshad dang ldan pa'i khru bco lnga dang dgu'i tshad yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni chos gos gang la chu dang zheng dag tu tshad dang ldan pa'i khru bco lnga dang dgu'i tshad yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The phrase of the Sugata refers to the robe that has the dimensions of the Sugata, that is, the robe that is fifteen cubits long and nine cubits wide.

original: tshad de la ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshad de la ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The term dimensions means measures.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi yan lag ni skyes bu gsum gyi tshad yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi yan lag ni skyes bu gsum gyi tshad yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the Blessed One's body was three times the size of an ordinary man's body.

original: 'di ni tshad las lhag nam brtags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽zhus pa la la las ni gzhung 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di ni tshad las lhag nam brtags pa yin pa'i phyir ro // zhus pa la la las ni gzhung 'di skad du /
translated: Because this is a case of exceeding the proper dimensions.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i tshad kyis bgyid na cir 'gyur lags /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i tshad kyis bgyid na cir 'gyur lags /
translated: In some recitations of the scriptures, this rule is stated as follows: What is the offense for making a robe with the dimensions of the Sugata?

original: spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes 'byung ste /🔽de lta bas na 'dis ni chung ba ni na smad par byed pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes 'byung ste / de lta bas na 'dis ni chung ba ni na smad par byed pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: It is a downfall.🔽 Therefore, this rule shows that a robe that is smaller than the proper size is not a downfall,

original: lhag pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: lhag pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: but a robe that is larger is.

original: kha cig ni spang bar smos pa mi 'dod de /
analyzed: kha cig ni spang bar smos pa mi 'dod de /
translated: Some do not accept the statement that a robe that is smaller than the proper size is not a downfall.

original: ji lta ji ltar bcos pas tshad chung ngu rab tu byung ba'i rdzas ma yin pa'i phyir ltung ba chung ngu byed pa nyid yin pa ltar tshad chen po yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar bcos pas tshad chung ngu rab tu byung ba'i rdzas ma yin pa'i phyir ltung ba chung ngu byed pa nyid yin pa ltar tshad chen po yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Just as a small size is a small offense, so too a large size is a large offense.🔽For this reason, the sutra says:

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'og nas btsun pa dge slong gis dge 'dun gyi khri'am khri 'u bkram ste ma byung bar mchis la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'og nas btsun pa dge slong gis dge 'dun gyi khri'am khri 'u bkram ste ma byung bar mchis la /
translated: “Venerable, is it the case that a monk may use a seat or bed belonging to the saṅgha without permission?

original: ltung byed du'ang mi 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
analyzed: ltung byed du'ang mi 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
translated: Is it the case that he does not commit an offense?”

original: nye ba 'khor yod de /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor yod de /
translated: “Upāli, it is possible.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i sor brgyad pas chung pa'am che bar 'gyur na nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes 'chad par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i sor brgyad pas chung pa'am che bar 'gyur na nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes 'chad par 'gyur bas /
translated: If it is smaller or larger than the eight standard fingerbreadths of the Sugata, then he commits an offense of wrong conduct.”

original: tshad las lhag pa yang nyes byas su gsungs so //
analyzed: tshad las lhag pa yang nyes byas su gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said that exceeding the size is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: de bzhin du tshad las lhag pa'i lhung bzed 'chang pa la yang nyes byas su gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshad las lhag pa'i lhung bzed 'chang pa la yang nyes byas su gsungs te /
translated: Similarly, it is said that holding a begging bowl that exceeds the size is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: de lta bas na 'di la ni nyes byas kho nar bzang ngo //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di la ni nyes byas kho nar bzang ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is best to say that this is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de'i zheng gi tshad ni 'dul ba 'dzin pa rnams gding ba dang 'dra bar brjod do //
analyzed: chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de'i zheng gi tshad ni 'dul ba 'dzin pa rnams gding ba dang 'dra bar brjod do //
translated: The term large is used in the Vinaya to refer to the size of a mat.

original: de la gding pa'i tshad ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la gding pa'i tshad ni 'di yin te /
translated: The size of a mat is as follows:

original: srid du bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho'i mtho do'o //
analyzed: srid du bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho'i mtho do'o //
translated: In length, it is the length of four cubits of the Sugata.

original: zheng du phyed dang do'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zheng du phyed dang do'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In width, it is one and a half cubits.

original: bsnyen par ma rdzogs par zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs par zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: If one who is not fully ordained, etc.

original: stan bgyi bar sbyor ba bgyis la zhes bya ba ni mngon sum kho nar sbyor ba byed kyi pho nya la sogs pa'i ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: stan bgyi bar sbyor ba bgyis la zhes bya ba ni mngon sum kho nar sbyor ba byed kyi pho nya la sogs pa'i ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: One who is preparing a mat means one who is preparing it directly, not through an intermediary such as a messenger, etc.

original: 'di la sbyor ba'i dbang gis kyang ltung ba 'dra ba nyid do snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di la sbyor ba'i dbang gis kyang ltung ba 'dra ba nyid do snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
translated: The intention is that even by the power of preparation, the downfall is similar.

original: zhus pa @296b la la las ni 'di skad du btsun pa re zhig dge slong srin bal nyams pa las stan bgyid na cir 'gyur lags nyes byas so zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhus pa @296b la la las ni 'di skad du btsun pa re zhig dge slong srin bal nyams pa las stan bgyid na cir 'gyur lags nyes byas so zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: In some recitations, it is said, Venerable, what if a fully ordained monk prepares a mat from spoiled silk? It becomes a wrong action.

original: de la don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:

original: nyams pa ni srog chags kyis zos pa la sogs pa ma rung bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: nyams pa ni srog chags kyis zos pa la sogs pa ma rung bar gyur pa'o //
translated: Defective means that it has become unusable, such as being eaten by insects, and so on.

original: nyams pa nyid la ni rdzas yongs su rdzogs pa med pas de'i phyir tshul 'di yin no //
analyzed: nyams pa nyid la ni rdzas yongs su rdzogs pa med pas de'i phyir tshul 'di yin no //
translated: Since there is no complete substance in the defective, therefore, this is the rule.

original: srin bal gyi spang ba gtan la dbab pa'o /
analyzed: srin bal gyi spang ba gtan la dbab pa'o /
translated: The determination of the wool of the silk worm

original: // / lug bal ni lug gi bal lo //
analyzed: // / lug bal ni lug gi bal lo //
translated: Sheep's wool is the wool of sheep.

original: nag po 'ba' zhig ni nag po nyi tshe ste /
analyzed: nag po 'ba' zhig ni nag po nyi tshe ste /
translated: Only black means only black.

original: lding nag ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lding nag ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is a synonym for entirely black.

translated: Whether or not he has a load, if he carries wool more than three krośas, it is an offense if he goes beyond one krosa.

original: bdag nyid khyer pa las nyes byas gzhan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid khyer pa las nyes byas gzhan du 'gyur ro //
translated: If he has a load, then from the very beginning, it is an offense other than a mere offense for carrying it himself.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyis khyer na zhes bya ba la rdzu 'phrul smos pa ni 'dir gtso bo yin pa'i phyir mngon par shes pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyis khyer na zhes bya ba la rdzu 'phrul smos pa ni 'dir gtso bo yin pa'i phyir mngon par shes pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If he carries it by means of his magical power, the mention of magical power is because it is the main point here, because it is the nature of supernormal knowledge.

original: des khyer ba ni dge ba'i sems yin pa'i phyir ltung ba med pas de'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: des khyer ba ni dge ba'i sems yin pa'i phyir ltung ba med pas de'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
translated: Since he carries it with a virtuous mind, there is no downfall. Therefore, this is stated.

original: 'on te rnam pa gzhan gyi zhes bya ba ni gsang sngags la sogs pa'i rnam pas te /
analyzed: 'on te rnam pa gzhan gyi zhes bya ba ni gsang sngags la sogs pa'i rnam pas te /
translated: Or, if it is by another method, by means of a mantra and so forth,

original: khur khyer ba med pa'i phyir nyes byas yin no //
analyzed: khur khyer ba med pa'i phyir nyes byas yin no //
translated: it is an offense because he does not carry the load.

original: rung bar bgyid pas sprul pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rung bar byed na ni nye gnas la sogs pa'i khur tsa'o; ;
analyzed: rung bar bgyid pas sprul pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rung bar byed na ni nye gnas la sogs pa'i khur tsa'o; ;
translated: If one makes it suitable, then it is the burden of a disciple and so on.
