original: sbrul pas zhes smos pas 'di ni rung ba byed pa'i khyad par yin no //
analyzed: sbrul pas zhes smos pas 'di ni rung ba byed pa'i khyad par yin no //
translated: Since it is said that one should make it suitable, this is a special case of making it suitable.🔽If one carries it by means of supernatural power, there is no offense.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyis khyer na ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pas 'dir smos pa don med pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyis khyer na ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pas 'dir smos pa don med pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Since this is stated, is it not meaningless to mention it here?

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: mngon par shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi sems mnyam par gzhag pa dge ba kho nas de khyer ba'i phyir dang / @298b dge ba'i sems kyis kyang ltung ba mi slong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi sems mnyam par gzhag pa dge ba kho nas de khyer ba'i phyir dang / @298b dge ba'i sems kyis kyang ltung ba mi slong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one carries it only by means of the virtuous mind of meditative equipoise that is the nature of higher perception and because one does not incur an offense by means of a virtuous mind.

original: 'di la ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa la lung du ma bstan par skabs su lus kyi las kun nas bslang ba'i phyir mngon du byed pas kyang khyer ba bsgrub pa'i phyir dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sems la yang ltung ba 'byung bas khyad par shin tu chen po yod do //
analyzed: 'di la ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa la lung du ma bstan par skabs su lus kyi las kun nas bslang ba'i phyir mngon du byed pas kyang khyer ba bsgrub pa'i phyir dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sems la yang ltung ba 'byung bas khyad par shin tu chen po yod do //
translated: And, since a downfall occurs even with a neutral mind, there is a very great difference.

original: 'di la yang sprul pa'i phyir sprul pa po'i lus kyi rnam par rig byed kun nas slong bar byed pa'i mngon par brtson pa rgyun chags pa yang yod na skad cig pa yang yod do //🔽des na yid kyis yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di la yang sprul pa'i phyir sprul pa po'i lus kyi rnam par rig byed kun nas slong bar byed pa'i mngon par brtson pa rgyun chags pa yang yod na skad cig pa yang yod do // des na yid kyis yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Here, the manifestation of a magical creation is sometimes continuous, as when a magician creates a magical body, and sometimes momentary.🔽Therefore, it is said, “Because it is mental, it is a fault that is to be restrained.”

original: 'dir bsdam par bya ba'i nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ltar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir bsdam par bya ba'i nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ltar shes par bya ste /
translated: This is how it should be understood.

original: pho nya la sogs pa las bskur ba la yang tshul 'di kho na yin no //
analyzed: pho nya la sogs pa las bskur ba la yang tshul 'di kho na yin no //
translated: This is also the rule for sending a messenger, and so on.

original: des yang lug bal gzhan cig ces bya ba la sogs pa ni rtsom pa tha dad pa'i phyir spang ba'i ltung byed mi slong gi sbyor bar gtogs pa'i nyes byas su ni 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go//
analyzed: des yang lug bal gzhan cig ces bya ba la sogs pa ni rtsom pa tha dad pa'i phyir spang ba'i ltung byed mi slong gi sbyor bar gtogs pa'i nyes byas su ni 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go//
translated: The phrase another's wool and so forth means that because the composition is different, it is a fault belonging to the preparation for a downfall that is not reversible.

original: dge slong mar red nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mtshams ni dpag chad gsum gyi bar ro //
analyzed: dge slong mar red nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mtshams ni dpag chad gsum gyi bar ro //
translated: The phrase if a nun and so forth means that the boundary is three krosas.

original: mtshan gyur pa 'di la nyes byas su gsungs pa ni ma brtags pa'i phyogs la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan gyur pa 'di la nyes byas su gsungs pa ni ma brtags pa'i phyogs la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase if the gender changes and so forth means that a fault is declared for those who rely on an untested position.

original: rgyang grags zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rgyang grags las spang bar gsungs pa'i phyir ro //🔽rgyang grags ma lags pa ni rgyang grags phyed la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rgyang grags zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rgyang grags las spang bar gsungs pa'i phyir ro // rgyang grags ma lags pa ni rgyang grags phyed la sogs pa ste /
translated: The phrase a krosa and so forth means that it is declared to be a downfall for more than a krosa.

original: de la ni nyes byas su gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la ni nyes byas su gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase not a krosa and so forth means that it is declared to be a fault for half a krosa and so forth.

original: lug bal khyer ba'i spang ba gtan la dbab pa'o /
analyzed: lug bal khyer ba'i spang ba gtan la dbab pa'o /
translated: The determination of the downfall of carrying wool.

original: // / rmel du 'jug pa ni byed du 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: // / rmel du 'jug pa ni byed du 'jug pa ste /
translated: The phrase to make and so forth means to cause to spin.

original: lcig par byed du 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lcig par byed du 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: “he makes it weighed.”

original: bal rmel ba'i spang ba gtan la dbab pa'o /
analyzed: bal rmel ba'i spang ba gtan la dbab pa'o /
translated: The prohibition against spinning wool is finished.

original: // / rang gi lag gis zhes bya ba ni rang gi lag pa ste /
analyzed: // / rang gi lag gis zhes bya ba ni rang gi lag pa ste /
translated: “With his own hands” means: with his own hands.

original: 'di ni lan byed kyi bya ba 'di dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni lan byed kyi bya ba 'di dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This is the action of the agent, which is to be connected with this.

original: gser ni gser nyid do //
analyzed: gser ni gser nyid do //
translated: “Gold” means: gold itself.

original: dngul ni dngul nyid de /
analyzed: dngul ni dngul nyid de /
translated: “Silver” means: silver itself.

original: 'di gnyis kyang nor bu la sogs pa rin po che gzhan gyi dpe yin no //
analyzed: 'di gnyis kyang nor bu la sogs pa rin po che gzhan gyi dpe yin no //
translated: These two are examples of other precious substances such as jewels.

original: len pa ni rang gis so //
analyzed: len pa ni rang gis so //
translated: “To take” means: to take with one’s own hands.

original: 'am zhes bya bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'am zhes bya bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: “Or” indicates an alternative.

original: yang na khyad par ston pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na khyad par ston pa yin te /
translated: Or it shows a distinction.

original: des na rang gi la reg pa dang reg tu 'jug pa dag la spang ba nyid 'dir gsungs kyi gzhan gyi la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: des na rang gi la reg pa dang reg tu 'jug pa dag la spang ba nyid 'dir gsungs kyi gzhan gyi la ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, this prohibition is stated here for touching and causing to touch with one’s own hands, but not for those of others.

original: de la ni ltung byed 'ba' zhig tu 'chad par 'gyur ro //🔽'di ltar gzhan gyi rin po che ni spang bar 'os pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i @299a * //
analyzed: de la ni ltung byed 'ba' zhig tu 'chad par 'gyur ro // 'di ltar gzhan gyi rin po che ni spang bar 'os pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i @299a * //
translated: For that, it is explained as only a downfall.

original: zhing ma yin te /
analyzed: zhing ma yin te /
translated: Thus, it is not a field that is worthy of being abandoned, a precious substance of others.

original: gzhan gyi yin pa nyid kyis sngon nyid nas spang ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi yin pa nyid kyis sngon nyid nas spang ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is already abandoned by the very fact that it belongs to another.

original: de'i phyir gzhan gyi la spang par byed pa nyid med par shugs kyis na 'di ltung ba 'ba' zhig byed par rnam par gzhag go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan gyi la spang par byed pa nyid med par shugs kyis na 'di ltung ba 'ba' zhig byed par rnam par gzhag go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, since it is not abandoned by the other, it is established that this is only a downfall.

original: len du 'jug pa ni rang gi mig sngar gzhan la'o //
analyzed: len du 'jug pa ni rang gi mig sngar gzhan la'o //
translated: Engaging in taking up is in the presence of another.

original: lkog gi phyogs ni smra ba po lkog tu gyur pa ste /
analyzed: lkog gi phyogs ni smra ba po lkog tu gyur pa ste /
translated: The hidden side is the speaker who is hidden.

original: de la ni rang gi mig sngar bab ba nyid med pas nyes byas kho nar rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de la ni rang gi mig sngar bab ba nyid med pas nyes byas kho nar rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: Since there is no direct presence of that, it is established as only a misdeed.

original: 'am zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rnam par rtog pa'i don te /🔽des na yo byad gzhan yin par 'du shes pa la ni ltung ba med la /
analyzed: 'am zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rnam par rtog pa'i don te / des na yo byad gzhan yin par 'du shes pa la ni ltung ba med la /
translated: The word “or” has the meaning of a choice.🔽Therefore, it should be understood that this means that there is no downfall for one who perceives that the articles belong to another,

original: lkog gi phyogs nas len du 'jug pa la ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba'i don 'dir 'gyur bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: lkog gi phyogs nas len du 'jug pa la ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba'i don 'dir 'gyur bar shes par bya'o //
translated: but there is a misdeed for engaging in taking up from the hidden side.

original: yo byad gzhan du 'du shes na ltung ba med pa kho na 'di la bsam pa nyams pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yo byad gzhan du 'du shes na ltung ba med pa kho na 'di la bsam pa nyams pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If one perceives the articles as belonging to another, there is no offense, because there is no impairment of the attitude.

original: gser gyi ma sha ni mngon mtshan btab ba nyid kyis nyo ba la sogs pa las 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan du gyur pa'o ;
analyzed: gser gyi ma sha ni mngon mtshan btab ba nyid kyis nyo ba la sogs pa las 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan du gyur pa'o ;
translated: The golden maśaka is a cause for the conventions of the world, such as buying and selling, because it is well known.

original: ; khar ba'i ma sha yang de dang 'dra mod kyi 'on kyang rin po che bas ngan pa'i phyir nyes byas su gsungs so //
analyzed: ; khar ba'i ma sha yang de dang 'dra mod kyi 'on kyang rin po che bas ngan pa'i phyir nyes byas su gsungs so //
translated: The silver maśaka is similar, but because it is inferior to a precious substance, it is said to be a minor offense.🔽As for the line “if not fully ordained,” there is no offense for a fully ordained monk who touches or causes another to touch the articles of a non-fully-ordained monk.

original: bsnyen par ma rdzogs par zhes bya ba ni 'di la bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dge sbyong la reg pa dang reg tu 'jug pa dag gi ltung ba 'ga' yang med mod kyi 'on kyang rang gir byed pa sngon du 'gro ba'i reg pa la nyes byas su🔽'gyur ba kho na ste /
analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs par zhes bya ba ni 'di la bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dge sbyong la reg pa dang reg tu 'jug pa dag gi ltung ba 'ga' yang med mod kyi 'on kyang rang gir byed pa sngon du 'gro ba'i reg pa la nyes byas su 'gyur ba kho na ste /
translated: However, if he appropriates them, he commits a minor offense.

original: nye ba 'khor ngas len pa las dgongs te gsungs kyi /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor ngas len pa las dgongs te gsungs kyi /
translated: Upāli, I taught this with regard to accepting,

original: rang gir byed pa las ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gir byed pa las ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: not with regard to appropriating.”

original: yang na gzhan dag na re 'di ni dge slob ma'i dbang du mdzad de gsungs pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: yang na gzhan dag na re 'di ni dge slob ma'i dbang du mdzad de gsungs pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that this is stated from the perspective of a probationary nun.

original: dben pa la dben par 'du shes pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyes byas su gsungs pa ni sbyor bar gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: dben pa la dben par 'du shes pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyes byas su gsungs pa ni sbyor bar gtogs pa ste /
translated: The statement of a wrong action in the verse, “if she perceives solitude as solitude and so on” refers to the preparatory stage.

original: de bzhin du 'di dang 'dra ba gzhan dag la'ang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di dang 'dra ba gzhan dag la'ang shes par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood in the same way for other similar cases.

original: lus kyi rnam par rig byed kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'di dag la rag lus pa'i phyir 'dir na smad pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par rig byed kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'di dag la rag lus pa'i phyir 'dir na smad pa nyid yin no //
translated: The verse, “if she does not generate the thought of ownership through physical expression and so on” explains that the actual basis of the offense is the physical expression of the act of sexual intercourse.

original: rang gir byed pa'i sems kyang mi skyed cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dis ni byin gyis brlab pa'i dus na rang gir bya ba bskyed par mi bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gir byed pa'i sems kyang mi skyed cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dis ni byin gyis brlab pa'i dus na rang gir bya ba bskyed par mi bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The verse, “she does not generate the thought of ownership and so on” explains that at the time of the consecration, the thought of ownership should not be generated.

original: tshig tu smra na'o zhes bya ba ni byin gyis brlab pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: tshig tu smra na'o zhes bya ba ni byin gyis brlab pa'i don du'o //
translated: The verse, “if she speaks” explains that the consecration is for the purpose of sexual intercourse.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mi rung ba'i dngos po las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mi rung ba'i dngos po las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: For that reason, the verse, “if it is an unsuitable object and so on” explains that the consecration is not for the purpose of sexual intercourse if the object is a hermaphrodite or a eunuch.

original: de ltar yang bram ze'i @299b bu pa'i gzhung las /
analyzed: de ltar yang bram ze'i @299b bu pa'i gzhung las /
translated: Thus, the text of the son of the Brahmin states:

original: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bya ba'i dngos po rung ba ma yin pa 'di grub ste /
analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bya ba'i dngos po rung ba ma yin pa 'di grub ste /
translated: “I, the fully ordained monk named so-and-so, have obtained this unsuitable object.

original: dngos po rung ba ma yin pa 'di las rung ba grub pa gang yin pa de rang gir bya'o zhes byin gyis brlab par gtogs pa'i gzhung 'ga' zhig gsal rab tu 'byung ngo //🔽rang gir ma byas na yang gzhan gyi yin pa'i phyir ji ltar byin gyis brlab tu rung /
analyzed: dngos po rung ba ma yin pa 'di las rung ba grub pa gang yin pa de rang gir bya'o zhes byin gyis brlab par gtogs pa'i gzhung 'ga' zhig gsal rab tu 'byung ngo // rang gir ma byas na yang gzhan gyi yin pa'i phyir ji ltar byin gyis brlab tu rung /
translated: I will take possession of that suitable object that is obtained from this unsuitable object.”🔽If one does not take possession of it, how can it be consecrated, since it belongs to another?

original: 'on te rang gir byas na yang rung ba ma byas pa'i phyir ji ltar byin gyis brlab tu rung zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rang gir byas na yang rung ba ma byas pa'i phyir ji ltar byin gyis brlab tu rung zhe na /
translated: If one does take possession of it, how can it be consecrated, since it is not consecrated?

original: 'di ni 'og nas bram ze'i bu ba las rgyas par bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'og nas bram ze'i bu ba las rgyas par bshad par bya'o //
translated: This will be explained extensively below in the section on the son of the Brahmin.

original: lhung byed do zhes bya ba 'di la ni gzhan gyi rin po che la reg na ltung byed du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhung byed do zhes bya ba 'di la ni gzhan gyi rin po che la reg na ltung byed du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “One commits a downfall” is stated here because it is taught that one commits a downfall if one touches another’s precious substance.

original: dge slob ma gser dang dngul 'dzin pa la nyes byas su gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: dge slob ma gser dang dngul 'dzin pa la nyes byas su gsungs pa ni /
translated: The statement that a female novice who holds gold and silver commits an offense

original: gser dang dngul la gzung mi bya //
analyzed: gser dang dngul la gzung mi bya //
translated: is because of the rule that states, “One should not hold gold and silver,”

original: zhes 'byung bas reg pa bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes 'byung bas reg pa bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: since it prohibits contact with them.

original: zhus pa la las 'di skad du nor gser dang dngul rkang pa'i drung du 'jog pa nyams su myong bar byed pa dang / lkog gi gnas na yod pa rang gir byed na spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhus pa la las 'di skad du nor gser dang dngul rkang pa'i drung du 'jog pa nyams su myong bar byed pa dang / lkog gi gnas na yod pa rang gir byed na spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The Questions of Revata states, “If one experiences gold and silver being placed at one’s feet, or if one appropriates them when they are in a hidden place, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.”

original: de la don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this passage is as follows.

original: rkang pa'i drung ni rkang pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: rkang pa'i drung ni rkang pa'i phyogs so //
translated: “At one’s feet” means in the vicinity of one’s feet.

original: 'dir ni lag tu thob pa nyid ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'dir ni lag tu thob pa nyid ston par byed do //
translated: Here, it teaches that one should not take them into one’s hand.

original: nyams su myong bar byed pa ni rang gir byed pa skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyams su myong bar byed pa ni rang gir byed pa skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “To experience” means to generate appropriation.

original: de ci zhig ce na nor zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de ci zhig ce na nor zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: What is that? It is wealth.

original: nor yang rnam pa du ma yod pas gser dang dngul zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: nor yang rnam pa du ma yod pas gser dang dngul zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Since there are many types of wealth, it states “gold and silver.”

original: de'i phyir gser dang dngul gyi ngo bo nyid kyi nor gang de zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i phyir gser dang dngul gyi ngo bo nyid kyi nor gang de zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the verse is that whatever wealth is the nature of gold and silver is to be relinquished.

original: rang gir byed pa ni 'dul ba 'dzin pa rnams na re lag pa la sogs pas rang gir sgrub pa yin gyi /🔽yid la rang gir byed pas sbyin par byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gir byed pa ni 'dul ba 'dzin pa rnams na re lag pa la sogs pas rang gir sgrub pa yin gyi / yid la rang gir byed pas sbyin par byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: As for making it one’s own, those who uphold the vinaya say that it is made one’s own through the body, such as through the hands.

original: 'gal bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not made one’s own through the mind, because that would lead to a contradiction.

original: 'di ltar gal te rang gir byed pa las kyang spang bar 'gyur na de lta na ni lhung bzed 'chang ba dang / lhung bzed tshol bar byed ba dag yul lhung bzed mtshungs pa nyid yin yang spyod pa'i bye brag gis ltung ba tha dad pa byed pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te rang gir byed pa las kyang spang bar 'gyur na de lta na ni lhung bzed 'chang ba dang / lhung bzed tshol bar byed ba dag yul lhung bzed mtshungs pa nyid yin yang spyod pa'i bye brag gis ltung ba tha dad pa byed pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: If it were relinquished through making it one’s own, then the difference in downfalls would be made by the difference in conduct, even though the place and the alms bowl are the same.

original: rin po che rang gir byed pa dang / rin po che la reg par byed pa yang /
analyzed: rin po che rang gir byed pa dang / rin po che la reg par byed pa yang /
translated: Similarly, making a precious substance one’s own and touching a precious substance

original: yul rin po che mtshungs pa nyid yin yang spyod pa'i bye brag gis ltung ba tha dad pa byed pa nyid du 'gyur dgos so //
analyzed: yul rin po che mtshungs pa nyid yin yang spyod pa'i bye brag gis ltung ba tha dad pa byed pa nyid du 'gyur dgos so //
translated: Even though the object is the same, it would be necessary to commit a different downfall due to the specific action.

original: de'i phyir spyod pa'i ltung byed kyi ltung ba sum cu rtsa gcig tu thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir spyod pa'i ltung byed kyi ltung ba sum cu rtsa gcig tu thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, it would follow that there would be thirty-one downfalls of indulging in sense objects.

original: sum cu nyid ni nyams pa @300a * //🔽kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sum cu nyid ni nyams pa @300a * // kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: The thirty would be downfalls alone.

original: thub pas ni so sor thar pa dang / rnam par 'byed pa dang / nye ba 'khor gyis zhus pa thams cad las reg pa dang / reg tu 'jug pa dag kho na spang ba'i ltung ba byed pa nyid du gsungs kyi /
analyzed: thub pas ni so sor thar pa dang / rnam par 'byed pa dang / nye ba 'khor gyis zhus pa thams cad las reg pa dang / reg tu 'jug pa dag kho na spang ba'i ltung ba byed pa nyid du gsungs kyi /
translated: The Sage declared in the Prātimokṣa, the Vibhaṅga, and the Upāliparipṛcchā that only touching and causing to touch are downfalls.

original: rang gir byed pa las kyang 'gyur bar ni ma gsungs so //
analyzed: rang gir byed pa las kyang 'gyur bar ni ma gsungs so //
translated: He did not declare that there is a downfall from possessing.

original: don 'di ni lkog gi phyogs smos pas dngos su khong du chud par zad do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: don 'di ni lkog gi phyogs smos pas dngos su khong du chud par zad do zhes zer ro //
translated: This point is directly understood through the statement of the hidden position.🔽If there is no difference between a downfall and the prohibition against gold and silver,

original: gal te spang ba'i ltung ba dang / gser dang dngul gyi spang ba dag la ni khyad par ci yod ce na /
analyzed: gal te spang ba'i ltung ba dang / gser dang dngul gyi spang ba dag la ni khyad par ci yod ce na /
translated: what is the difference between them?

original: chos gos kyi ched du gser la sogs pa rnyed pa gang yin pa de len na der gtogs pa'i kha na ma tho ba yin no //
analyzed: chos gos kyi ched du gser la sogs pa rnyed pa gang yin pa de len na der gtogs pa'i kha na ma tho ba yin no //
translated: If one accepts gold and so on for the sake of Dharma robes, then that is a fault belonging to that.

original: de las gzhan pa gang yin pa de ni 'dir gtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa gang yin pa de ni 'dir gtogs pa yin no //
translated: That which is other than that is included here.

original: de la yang chos gos kyi rin gser la sogs pa rung bar byas pa la mi spong bar len pa la ni ltung ba 'gar yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de la yang chos gos kyi rin gser la sogs pa rung bar byas pa la mi spong bar len pa la ni ltung ba 'gar yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar shes par bya ste /
translated: Also, with regard to that, if one accepts gold and so on for the price of Dharma robes without rejecting it, one should understand that it is not a downfall.

original: 'di skad du yang /
analyzed: 'di skad du yang /
translated: Also, this is stated:

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di snyam du dgongs te /
translated: The Bhagavān thought this:

original: kye ma bram ze dang khyim bdag dad pa can rnams kyang chos gos kyi zong dag kyang ster la /
analyzed: kye ma bram ze dang khyim bdag dad pa can rnams kyang chos gos kyi zong dag kyang ster la /
translated: “Alas, the faithful brahmins and householders give goods for Dharma robes,

original: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyang chos gos kyi zong dag 'dod pas ma langs dge slong rnams la rung ba 'ga' zhig gnang bar bya'o snyam nas /
analyzed: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyang chos gos kyi zong dag 'dod pas ma langs dge slong rnams la rung ba 'ga' zhig gnang bar bya'o snyam nas /
translated: and my śrāvakas do not want goods for Dharma robes. I should allow some that is suitable for the bhikṣus.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said:🔽“Monks, I allow you to accept gold and so on for the price of Dharma robes, but not to keep it.”

original: blang bar bya zhing blangs nas kyang sbyin bdag de nyid la yid brtan pas bcang bar bya'o zhes chos gos kyi zong gser la sogs pa mi rung bar byas pa rnams blang bar bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pas 'di nyid kyi khyad par ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: blang bar bya zhing blangs nas kyang sbyin bdag de nyid la yid brtan pas bcang bar bya'o zhes chos gos kyi zong gser la sogs pa mi rung bar byas pa rnams blang bar bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pas 'di nyid kyi khyad par ni 'di yin no //
translated: The Blessed One taught that one should accept the goods for robes, such as gold, etc., which are not proper. This is the exception.

original: gser dang dngul gyi spang ba gtan la dbab pa'o /
analyzed: gser dang dngul gyi spang ba gtan la dbab pa'o /
translated: The prohibition against gold and silver is settled.

original: // / mngon mtshan can zhes bya ba ni 'di mngon mtshan can te /
analyzed: // / mngon mtshan can zhes bya ba ni 'di mngon mtshan can te /
translated: Having a sign means having a sign of a sign.

original: mtshan nyid rtags yod pas na mngon mtshan can te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid rtags yod pas na mngon mtshan can te /
translated: Because it has a sign, it has a sign.

original: k'ar sh'a pa na la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: k'ar sh'a pa na la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is a kārṣāpaṇa, etc.

original: 'di yang nas dang 'dras la sogs pa'i dpe ste /
analyzed: 'di yang nas dang 'dras la sogs pa'i dpe ste /
translated: This is an example of barley, etc.

original: 'di ltar rnam par 'byed pa las dge slong rnyed pa 'dod pa nas 'bras skyed 'gyed cing de de na bre bo che tshol bar byed /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par 'byed pa las dge slong rnyed pa 'dod pa nas 'bras skyed 'gyed cing de de na bre bo che tshol bar byed /
translated: Thus, in the Vinaya, a monk who desires gain sows barley, and while there, seeks a large winnowing basket.

original: bre'u chung dang / phul dang / dbang po dang / shog shog dang / ram phyis dang / smyu gu tshol bar byed na /
analyzed: bre'u chung dang / phul dang / dbang po dang / shog shog dang / ram phyis dang / smyu gu tshol bar byed na /
translated: If one seeks a small cup, a ladle, a water strainer, a water filter, a pen,

original: ji srid du rnyed pa rang gir mi byed pa de srid du nyes byas so //
analyzed: ji srid du rnyed pa rang gir mi byed pa de srid du nyes byas so //
translated: as long as one does not make it one's own, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: rnyed pa bdag gir byed na spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes 'byung bas 'bras bu spyod na yang spang ba'i ltung byed du gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnyed pa bdag gir byed na spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes 'byung bas 'bras bu spyod na yang spang ba'i ltung byed du gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If one makes it one's own, one commits a downfall of forsaking the training.

original: spyod pa @300b ni 'phel bar sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: spyod pa @300b ni 'phel bar sbyor ba ste /
translated: The term to use means to increase it.

original: brgyad dam phyed la sogs pa'i bed kyis rnyed pa grub pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: brgyad dam phyed la sogs pa'i bed kyis rnyed pa grub pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The term to increase means to increase it by means of eight or half of them, and so on.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs ni kun du sbyor ba dang / rab tu sbyor ba dang / spel ba bskyed pa'i bye brag gi rnam pa sna tshogs pa'o //🔽de byed na zhes bya ba ni lhag par spyod na ste /
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs ni kun du sbyor ba dang / rab tu sbyor ba dang / spel ba bskyed pa'i bye brag gi rnam pa sna tshogs pa'o // de byed na zhes bya ba ni lhag par spyod na ste /
translated: The term various means various types of increase, such as by means of a combination, application, and multiplication.🔽 The term if one does it means if one uses it excessively.

original: byed par 'gyur na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byed par 'gyur na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The term if one does it means if one uses it.

original: de bas na rin po che la sogs pa'i zong kun du sbyor ba la sogs pa'i bye brag gis rab tu sbyor nas /
analyzed: de bas na rin po che la sogs pa'i zong kun du sbyor ba la sogs pa'i bye brag gis rab tu sbyor nas /
translated: Therefore, having engaged in the various activities of business, such as buying and selling precious substances,

original: rnyed pa grub na ni mngon mtshan can gyi spyod pa'i spang par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnyed pa grub na ni mngon mtshan can gyi spyod pa'i spang par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: if one obtains a profit, one should give up the conduct that is characterized by ostentation.

original: 'di la ni gang gi tshe drung bas sngar ram phyis bed thob pa de'i bed du gyur pa'i nor de spang bar bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di la ni gang gi tshe drung bas sngar ram phyis bed thob pa de'i bed du gyur pa'i nor de spang bar bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: In this regard, when one obtains a profit either before or after the wealth, that wealth which is the object of the profit should be given up.

original: gang gi tshe bed dang drung cig car du thob pa de'i tshe ni nor de thams cad spang bar bya ba kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bed dang drung cig car du thob pa de'i tshe ni nor de thams cad spang bar bya ba kho na yin gyi /
translated: When one obtains the profit and the wealth simultaneously, then all that wealth should be given up.

original: 'di ltar rnam par ma phye ba nyid kyis ngo bo gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par ma phye ba nyid kyis ngo bo gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not differentiated, it is of one nature.

original: 'di ni stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa las lhag par slong na chos gos de thams cad rnam par ma phye ba nyid kyis ngo bo gcig pa'i phyir spang bar bya ba nyid yin pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba de ltar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa las lhag par slong na chos gos de thams cad rnam par ma phye ba nyid kyis ngo bo gcig pa'i phyir spang bar bya ba nyid yin pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba de ltar shes par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as follows: Just as when one asks for more than an upper and lower robe, all those robes are to be relinquished because they are of the same nature, without being divided.

original: mngon mtshan can gyi spyod pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyi sbyor pa bgyis la zhes bya ba ni kun du sbyor ba dang / rab tu sbyor ba dang / spel ba la sogs ba'o //
analyzed: mngon mtshan can gyi spyod pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyi sbyor pa bgyis la zhes bya ba ni kun du sbyor ba dang / rab tu sbyor ba dang / spel ba la sogs ba'o //
translated: The phrase one should apply oneself to various kinds of ostentatious behavior refers to the various kinds of ostentatious behavior, such as association, close association, and frequent association.

original: nye du dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di ni mngon mtshan can gyi spyod pa la gnas pa'i phyir gal te zla bo nye du ma yin par gyur na ni de las dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nye du dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di ni mngon mtshan can gyi spyod pa la gnas pa'i phyir gal te zla bo nye du ma yin par gyur na ni de las dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The phrase if one's companion is not a relative, etc., indicates that if one's companion is not a relative, then one commits an offense entailing expulsion for engaging in ostentatious behavior.

original: gal te yin na ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba'i don to zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te yin na ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba'i don to zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The phrase if he is a relative, then it is an offense of wrong conduct indicates the meaning of the rule.

original: 'dra bas 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni mnyam pas mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: 'dra bas 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni mnyam pas mnyam pa ste /
translated: The phrase one who is similar to one who is similar means one who is equal to one who is equal.

original: skyed mi 'dod na ni brje pa la ltung ba med par gsungs so //
analyzed: skyed mi 'dod na ni brje pa la ltung ba med par gsungs so //
translated: If one does not wish to generate it, then there is no offense in exchanging it.

original: skyed 'dod na ni brjen yang ltung bar 'gyur ba kho na ste /
analyzed: skyed 'dod na ni brjen yang ltung bar 'gyur ba kho na ste /
translated: If one wishes to generate it, then there is an offense in exchanging it.

original: 'di ltar rnam par 'byed pa las /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par 'byed pa las /
translated: Thus the Vinaya Verses says:

original: rnyed pa bsgrub pa'i phyir skyed pa zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba rnam grangs gzhan du na brje zhes bya ba gsungs pa de la sbyor ba yang spang par bshad do //
analyzed: rnyed pa bsgrub pa'i phyir skyed pa zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba rnam grangs gzhan du na brje zhes bya ba gsungs pa de la sbyor ba yang spang par bshad do //
translated: “In order to obtain profit, one who generates it is said to exchange it. In another enumeration, it is said that the application is also abandoned.”

original: mngon mtshan can gyi spyod pa'i spang ba gtan la dbab pa'o /
analyzed: mngon mtshan can gyi spyod pa'i spang ba gtan la dbab pa'o /
translated: The rule on the offense of ostentatious behavior.

original: // / nye tshong ni nyo nas 'tshong ngo //
analyzed: // / nye tshong ni nyo nas 'tshong ngo //
translated: Selling is buying and then selling.

original: des na don ni rnyed pa 'dod pas zong rin po che dang s'a lu dang gos la sogs pa'i nor nyos nas phyis khyim pa nye du ma yin pa dang lhan cig 'tshong zhing skyed phyin na nyo tshong gi spang bar 'gyur @301a * //
analyzed: des na don ni rnyed pa 'dod pas zong rin po che dang s'a lu dang gos la sogs pa'i nor nyos nas phyis khyim pa nye du ma yin pa dang lhan cig 'tshong zhing skyed phyin na nyo tshong gi spang bar 'gyur @301a * //
translated: Therefore, the meaning is that if one who desires profit buys goods such as precious gems, rice, cloth and so on and later sells them together with a layman who is not a relative and one makes a profit, then there is an offense of selling.

original: ro zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: ro zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du bslab pa'i gzhi 'di la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang zhig rin po che la sogs pa'i zong rab tu sbyar nas /🔽rnyed pa grub par byed pa de la ni mngon mtshan can gyi nyo tshong gi zhing skyed phyin na nyo tshong gi spang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du bslab pa'i gzhi 'di la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang zhig rin po che la sogs pa'i zong rab tu sbyar nas / rnyed pa grub par byed pa de la ni mngon mtshan can gyi nyo tshong gi zhing skyed phyin na nyo tshong gi spang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: Just as in the case of the basis of training that states, “One should not engage in buying and selling,” if one engages in buying and selling in a manner that is obvious to others, then one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: ji lta ba de bzhin du bslab pa'i gzhi 'di la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang zhig rin po che la sogs pa'i zong rab tu sbyar nas rnyed pa sgrub par byed pa de la ni mngon mtshan can gyi spang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji lta ba de bzhin du bslab pa'i gzhi 'di la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang zhig rin po che la sogs pa'i zong rab tu sbyar nas rnyed pa sgrub par byed pa de la ni mngon mtshan can gyi spang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as in the case of the basis of training that states, “One should not engage in buying and selling,” if one engages in buying and selling in a manner that is obvious to others, then one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: gang zhig nyos nas 'tshong bar byed pa rnyed bsgrub pa de la ni nyo tshong gi spang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang zhig nyos nas 'tshong bar byed pa rnyed bsgrub pa de la ni nyo tshong gi spang bar 'gyur te /
translated: If one acquires goods by paying the proper price and then sells them, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: 'di gnyis kyi yul gyi khyad par ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: 'di gnyis kyi yul gyi khyad par ni 'di yin no //
translated: This is the difference between the two.

original: gzhung lhag ma rgyas par brjod par bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhung lhag ma rgyas par brjod par bya ba ni /
translated: The remainder of the text should be explained in an extensive way.

original: pho nya yi ge lag brda dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: pho nya yi ge lag brda dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The messenger is one who conveys a message, a sign, or a letter.

original: nyo tshong gi spang ba gtan la dbab pa'o /
analyzed: nyo tshong gi spang ba gtan la dbab pa'o /
translated: The rule on buying and selling is finished.

original: // / lhung bzed lhag pa ni byin gyis brlabs pa can las lhag pa'o //
analyzed: // / lhung bzed lhag pa ni byin gyis brlabs pa can las lhag pa'o //
translated: An extra alms-bowl is one that is more than the one that is consecrated.

original: ltung bar yang mi 'gyur ro zhes ltung ba med par gsungs pa 'di ni spang ba'i yul can yin no //
analyzed: ltung bar yang mi 'gyur ro zhes ltung ba med par gsungs pa 'di ni spang ba'i yul can yin no //
translated: It is said that there is no offense if one does not give it away, but this refers to a case where the monk has no intention of keeping the extra bowl.

original: de lta ma yin na nyes byas su gsungs pa 'chad par 'gyur ba dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //🔽lhung bzed chen po ni gang du 'bras thug po che'i chan yul ma ga dh'a'i bre'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na nyes byas su gsungs pa 'chad par 'gyur ba dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro // lhung bzed chen po ni gang du 'bras thug po che'i chan yul ma ga dh'a'i bre'o //
translated: Otherwise, it would contradict the explanation that it is a minor offense.🔽A large alms-bowl is one that can hold one Magadha doṇa of boiled rice.

original: spang ba tshod ma dang bcas par blugs na mthe bo'i sor gcig gi bar gyis lhung bzed kyi khar ma sleb pa'o //
analyzed: spang ba tshod ma dang bcas par blugs na mthe bo'i sor gcig gi bar gyis lhung bzed kyi khar ma sleb pa'o //
translated: If one puts vegetables and rice into the bowl, it is an offense if the bowl is filled up to the extent of one finger-width of the thumb.

original: dge slong mar red nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dge slong mas dge slong gi chung du las lhag pa mi 'chang ngo zhes 'byung bas de las lhung bzed chung ngu rjes su gnang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge slong mar red nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dge slong mas dge slong gi chung du las lhag pa mi 'chang ngo zhes 'byung bas de las lhung bzed chung ngu rjes su gnang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase if he is a fully ordained monk and so on means that a fully ordained nun should not possess a begging bowl that is larger than the one possessed by a fully ordained monk. Therefore, a smaller begging bowl is permitted for her.

original: de bas na lhung bzed chen po ni de las ni 'chang na yang nyes byas su gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na lhung bzed chen po ni de las ni 'chang na yang nyes byas su gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that if a fully ordained monk possesses a large begging bowl, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: des lhung bzed de yun shin tu ring por bcangs nas kyang zhes bya ba ni de yin no snyam nas 'chang ba ste /
analyzed: des lhung bzed de yun shin tu ring por bcangs nas kyang zhes bya ba ni de yin no snyam nas 'chang ba ste /
translated: The phrase if he possesses that begging bowl for a very long time means that he possesses it with the thought This is it.

original: bdag nyid kyis rang gir byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis rang gir byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: He does not make it his own.

original: spang ba la ni rang gi yin pa gtso bo yin te /
analyzed: spang ba la ni rang gi yin pa gtso bo yin te /
translated: In the case of abandonment, it is the one that belongs to him that is primary.

original: de la nge yang med pas de'i phyir 'di'i yin no //🔽zhus pa la la las ni /
analyzed: de la nge yang med pas de'i phyir 'di'i yin no // zhus pa la la las ni /
translated: Since he does not have that, it is his.🔽In some recitations, the following is stated:

original: gzhan 'di ltar dge slong gis dge slong la pho nya las bskur na zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gzhan 'di ltar dge slong gis dge slong la pho nya las bskur na zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: If a fully ordained monk sends a messenger to a fully ordained nun... and so on.

original: gzhan las kyang 'di skad du 'di ltar dge slong gis dge slong zhig la lhung bzed kyi phyir pho nya btang nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: gzhan las kyang 'di skad du 'di ltar dge slong gis dge slong zhig la lhung bzed kyi phyir pho nya btang nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ste /
translated: Also, it is stated in other sūtras: “In this way, a monk sends a messenger to another monk for the sake of a begging bowl.”

original: gnyi ga la don 'di 'byung ste /
analyzed: gnyi ga la don 'di 'byung ste /
translated: Both sūtras state the same meaning.

original: 'di la pho nya @301b zhes smos pa lhag pa kho nar zad do //
analyzed: 'di la pho nya @301b zhes smos pa lhag pa kho nar zad do //
translated: Here, the word “messenger” is merely an addition.

original: mu stegs can gyi snod ni thod pa la sogs pa'i snod do //
analyzed: mu stegs can gyi snod ni thod pa la sogs pa'i snod do //
translated: The vessel of tīrthikas is a skull cup and so on.

original: lhung bzed so ma btang ba ni ma bsregs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhung bzed so ma btang ba ni ma bsregs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: An unbaked begging bowl is one that has not been fired.

original: lhag pa ni ji skad bshad pa'i tshad las lhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag pa ni ji skad bshad pa'i tshad las lhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: An extra is one that exceeds the prescribed size.

original: tshad las lhag pa'ang mi rung pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: tshad las lhag pa'ang mi rung pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
translated: The intention is that it is also unsuitable to exceed the prescribed size.

original: de ltar yang stan las lhag par byed na nyes byas su bshad do //
analyzed: de ltar yang stan las lhag par byed na nyes byas su bshad do //
translated: Thus it explains that if one exceeds the prescribed sitting mat, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: lhung bzed skya bo ni kha ma bsgyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhung bzed skya bo ni kha ma bsgyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: A gray begging bowl is one that has not been dyed.

original: gal te rnam par 'byed pa las lhung bzed chung ba la sogs pa la ltung ba med par gsungs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te rnam par 'byed pa las lhung bzed chung ba la sogs pa la ltung ba med par gsungs pa ma yin nam /
translated: If it is said in the Vinaya that there is no offense for a small begging bowl and so on,

original: de ji ltar 'dir nyes byas su bshad ce na /
analyzed: de ji ltar 'dir nyes byas su bshad ce na /
translated: How is this explained as a wrong doing here?

original: de ni nyes pa med do//🔽de ni sman phor du spyad par 'chang ba'i dbang du mdzad nas ltung ba med par gsungs la /
analyzed: de ni nyes pa med do// de ni sman phor du spyad par 'chang ba'i dbang du mdzad nas ltung ba med par gsungs la /
translated: There is no fault.

original: 'dir ni lhung bzed du spyad pas nyes byas te /
analyzed: 'dir ni lhung bzed du spyad pas nyes byas te /
translated: That is stated to be a downfall in the context of using a medicine bowl, but here it is a wrong doing because it is used as a begging bowl.

original: 'di gnyis kyi bye brag ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: 'di gnyis kyi bye brag ni 'di yin no //
translated: This is the difference between the two.🔽If a fully ordained nun keeps it,

original: dge slong mar red nas 'chang na'o zhes bya ba ni dge slong ma la ni lhung bzed zhag gcig las 'das par 'chang na spang ba'i ltung byed du bstan pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: dge slong mar red nas 'chang na'o zhes bya ba ni dge slong ma la ni lhung bzed zhag gcig las 'das par 'chang na spang ba'i ltung byed du bstan pa'i phyir la /
translated: it is because for a fully ordained nun, keeping a begging bowl for more than one day is taught to be a downfall that requires giving up the article.

original: 'dis zhag gcig kyang da rung ma yin pas so //
analyzed: 'dis zhag gcig kyang da rung ma yin pas so //
translated: But this is not even one day.🔽If a fully ordained monk keeps it for one winter,

original: dgun gcig zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dge slong 'chang ba la 'di'i zhag bcur da dung ma lon pas de'i phyir 'di ma yin no //
analyzed: dgun gcig zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dge slong 'chang ba la 'di'i zhag bcur da dung ma lon pas de'i phyir 'di ma yin no //
translated: it is because for a fully ordained monk, the period for keeping it is ten days, but this is not even one day.

original: zhus pa las ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: zhus pa las ni 'di skad du /
translated: The Questions of Paramiti Sutra states:

original: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis lhung bzed rnyed pa las mtshan gyur te dge slong mar red nas dgung gcig las 'das par 'chang na cir 'gyur lags /
analyzed: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis lhung bzed rnyed pa las mtshan gyur te dge slong mar red nas dgung gcig las 'das par 'chang na cir 'gyur lags /
translated: “Lord, if a monk finds a begging bowl and then, after the change of sex, as a nun, keeps it for more than one day, what does he or she become?”

original: spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: “He or she becomes guilty of a pāyattika offense.”

original: btsun pa dge slong gis lhung bzed lhag pa dgung gcig las 'das par bcangs na spang pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam ;
analyzed: btsun pa dge slong gis lhung bzed lhag pa dgung gcig las 'das par bcangs na spang pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam ;
translated: “Lord, is there a case where a monk who keeps an extra begging bowl for more than one day does not become guilty of a pāyattika offense?”

original: yod de 'di ltar dge slong gis lhung bzed rnyed ma thag tu mtshan gyur te /
analyzed: yod de 'di ltar dge slong gis lhung bzed rnyed ma thag tu mtshan gyur te /
translated: “There is. It is when a monk finds a begging bowl and then, immediately after the change of sex,

original: dge slong mar reng nas zhag gcig las 'das par 'chang ba spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes gzhan du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dge slong mar reng nas zhag gcig las 'das par 'chang ba spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes gzhan du 'byung ngo //
translated: as a nun, keeps it for more than one day. He or she becomes guilty of a pāyattika offense.”

original: don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is as follows.

original: rnyed ma thag tu zhes bya ba ni rnyed pa'i mjug thogs su'o //
analyzed: rnyed ma thag tu zhes bya ba ni rnyed pa'i mjug thogs su'o //
translated: “Immediately after finding” means immediately after finding it.

original: de las mtshan gzhan nyid kyi tshe dngos gzhi'i dus ma gtogs pa'i lhung bzed 'chang ba de mtshan gyur na nyams par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de las mtshan gzhan nyid kyi tshe dngos gzhi'i dus ma gtogs pa'i lhung bzed 'chang ba de mtshan gyur na nyams par shes par bya ste /
translated: Other than that, it should be understood that when a bhikshu who has held a begging bowl for more than nine days changes sex, he commits an infraction when he changes sex,

original: 'di ltar rten gnyis nyams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rten gnyis nyams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because both the basis and the support have changed.

original: 'di ltar dge slong zhag dgu'i bar du 'chang ba las dge slong ma nyid du gyur na zhag bcu pa nyid las @302a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar dge slong zhag dgu'i bar du 'chang ba las dge slong ma nyid du gyur na zhag bcu pa nyid las @302a * //
translated: Thus, if a bhikshu who has held a begging bowl for nine days changes sex, he commits an infraction when he changes sex, because he has become a bhikshunī.

original: spang ba rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: spang ba rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: The rule is established in this way.

original: 'di dang sbyar na 'di lta bur yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di dang sbyar na 'di lta bur yang 'gyur te /
translated: If applied in this way, it would also be like this:

original: dge slong ma lhung bzed zhag gcig 'chang ba las skya rengs 'char ba'i skad cig ma la dge slong nyid du gyur na dge slong nyid du gyur ba'i zhag bcu pas ltung ba slong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ltar shes /
analyzed: dge slong ma lhung bzed zhag gcig 'chang ba las skya rengs 'char ba'i skad cig ma la dge slong nyid du gyur na dge slong nyid du gyur ba'i zhag bcu pas ltung ba slong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ltar shes /
translated: If a bhikshunī who has held a begging bowl for one day changes sex at the moment of dawn, she commits an infraction when she changes sex, because she has become a bhikshu.🔽It should be understood in this way.

original: par bya'o // yun shin tu ring mi zhig tu zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngar ni zhag bcu'i bar du zhes smos pas dus nges par gsungs so //
analyzed: par bya'o // yun shin tu ring mi zhig tu zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngar ni zhag bcu'i bar du zhes smos pas dus nges par gsungs so //
translated: In the previous passage, for up to ten days was stated, so the time limit was specified.

original: 'di la ni nges pa med de 'di gnyis kyi bye brag ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: 'di la ni nges pa med de 'di gnyis kyi bye brag ni 'di yin no //
translated: There is no certainty here. This is the distinction between these two.

original: bdog pa ni bdog pa tsam du yod pa'o //
analyzed: bdog pa ni bdog pa tsam du yod pa'o //
translated: Possession means merely having it.

original: mchis pa ni bya ba byed nus pa'o //
analyzed: mchis pa ni bya ba byed nus pa'o //
translated: Having means being able to use it.

original: byin gyis ma brlabs par 'chang ba'o zhes bya ba 'dis ni ji ltar chos gos byin gyis ma brlabs pa zhag bcu 'das na yang spong bar byed pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du lhung bzed gcig po byin gyis ma brlabs pa yang zhag bcu 'das na spang🔽ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: byin gyis ma brlabs par 'chang ba'o zhes bya ba 'dis ni ji ltar chos gos byin gyis ma brlabs pa zhag bcu 'das na yang spong bar byed pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du lhung bzed gcig po byin gyis ma brlabs pa yang zhag bcu 'das na spang ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This means that just as one commits an offense by keeping an unblessed robe for more than ten days, so too one commits an offense by keeping an unblessed alms-bowl for more than ten days.

original: so sor thar pa dang de'i rnam par 'byed pa dang zhus pa las bcom ldan 'das kyis lhung bzed lhag pa kho na byin gyis brlabs pa ni sogs par 'chang na ltung byed nyid du gsungs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: so sor thar pa dang de'i rnam par 'byed pa dang zhus pa las bcom ldan 'das kyis lhung bzed lhag pa kho na byin gyis brlabs pa ni sogs par 'chang na ltung byed nyid du gsungs pa ma yin nam /
translated: Didn't the Blessed One say in the Pratimoksha, its commentary, and the questions, that if one keeps an extra alms-bowl that has not been blessed, it is a downfall?

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis rnam par 'byed pa las lhung bzed lhag pa zhes bya ba ni byin gyis brlabs pa can las lhag pa'o zhes gsungs kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis rnam par 'byed pa las lhung bzed lhag pa zhes bya ba ni byin gyis brlabs pa can las lhag pa'o zhes gsungs kyi /
translated: The term extra bowl refers to an extra consecrated bowl.

original: lhung bzed gcig kho na byin gyis ma brlabs pa spang ba nyid du ni ma gsungs na de ji ltar 'dir lhung bzed gcig kho na byin gyis ma brlabs pa zhag bcu 'das na spang bar bshad ce na /
analyzed: lhung bzed gcig kho na byin gyis ma brlabs pa spang ba nyid du ni ma gsungs na de ji ltar 'dir lhung bzed gcig kho na byin gyis ma brlabs pa zhag bcu 'das na spang bar bshad ce na /
translated: But he does not state that one must discard a single unconsecrated bowl. So how is it that here a single unconsecrated bowl is explained as discarded after ten days?

original: 'di ni nges pa med de /🔽'di ltar gang la lhung bzed byin gyis brlabs pa can yod bzhin du lhung bzed lhag pa 'chang ba de la ni zhag bcu 'das nas spang ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni nges pa med de / 'di ltar gang la lhung bzed byin gyis brlabs pa can yod bzhin du lhung bzed lhag pa 'chang ba de la ni zhag bcu 'das nas spang ba yin no //
translated: This is not definite.🔽Thus, if one has a consecrated bowl and keeps an extra bowl, it is discarded after ten days.

original: gang la byin gyis brlabs pa can med pa de la ni lhung bzed grub kyi byin gyis ma brlabs pa yin na zhag bcu 'das nas spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang la byin gyis brlabs pa can med pa de la ni lhung bzed grub kyi byin gyis ma brlabs pa yin na zhag bcu 'das nas spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: If one does not have a consecrated bowl and keeps an unconsecrated bowl, it is discarded after ten days.

original: chos gos byin gyis brlabs pa can gsum yod kyang rung med kyang rung zhag bcu 'das pa'i spang bar 'gyur ba dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: chos gos byin gyis brlabs pa can gsum yod kyang rung med kyang rung zhag bcu 'das pa'i spang bar 'gyur ba dang 'dra'o //
translated: It is like the case where one has three robes that have been blessed, whether one has them or not, there is the fault of keeping an extra robe for more than ten days.

original: de lta bas na 'dir yul gyi khyad par ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dir yul gyi khyad par ni 'di yin no //
translated: Therefore, in this case, this is the difference in the object.

original: lhung bzed lhag pa 'chang ba'i spang ba gtan la dbab pa'o /
analyzed: lhung bzed lhag pa 'chang ba'i spang ba gtan la dbab pa'o /
translated: The determination of the fault of keeping an extra alms bowl.

original: // / lhan pa lnga med pa ni gang la lhan rings dang / tham phran dang / lhan pa dang / chu @302b srin gyi so lta bu dang / phye ma las byas pa zhes bya ba'i lhan pa lngar ma tshang ba yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: // / lhan pa lnga med pa ni gang la lhan rings dang / tham phran dang / lhan pa dang / chu @302b srin gyi so lta bu dang / phye ma las byas pa zhes bya ba'i lhan pa lngar ma tshang ba yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Not having five patches means that it is called that when it does not have the five patches called a large patch, a small patch, a patch, a crocodile tooth patch, and a patch made of flour.

original: spyad bzod pa ni spyad du bzod pa ste /
analyzed: spyad bzod pa ni spyad du bzod pa ste /
translated: Withstand use means that it can be used.

original: 'dis ni gal te ltung bzed de lhan pa bzhis glan la spyad bzod pa yang yin na de'i tshe ltung bzed gzhan btsal bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni gal te ltung bzed de lhan pa bzhis glan la spyad bzod pa yang yin na de'i tshe ltung bzed gzhan btsal bar mi bya'o //
translated: This means that if that alms bowl is mended with four patches and can be used, then one should not seek another alms bowl.

original: gang gi tshe lhan pa lnga glan par gyur pa de'i tshe ni lhung bzed gzhan tshol ba la nyes pa med de /
analyzed: gang gi tshe lhan pa lnga glan par gyur pa de'i tshe ni lhung bzed gzhan tshol ba la nyes pa med de /
translated: When it has been patched five times, then there is no offense in seeking another alms bowl,

original: de'i tshe lhung bzed de shin tu mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe lhung bzed de shin tu mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because at that time that alms bowl is completely unfit.

original: yod bzhin du zhes bya ba ni bdog bzhin du'o //
analyzed: yod bzhin du zhes bya ba ni bdog bzhin du'o //
translated: “While one has” means while one possesses.

original: bzang po 'dod pa ni tshad dang kha dog dang rgyu la sogs pas phul du 'byung ba 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: bzang po 'dod pa ni tshad dang kha dog dang rgyu la sogs pas phul du 'byung ba 'dod pa'o //
translated: “Desiring a good one” means desiring one that is excellent in size, color, material, and so on.

original: phyir zhes bya ba ni rgyur byas nas te longs spyod pa'i sems kyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phyir zhes bya ba ni rgyur byas nas te longs spyod pa'i sems kyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “In exchange” means in return, in other words, with the thought of using it.

original: dge slong gi 'khor la zhes bya ba ni dge slong gi dge 'dun la'o //
analyzed: dge slong gi 'khor la zhes bya ba ni dge slong gi dge 'dun la'o //
translated: “To the assembly of monks” means to the saṅgha of monks.

original: dbul bar bya ba ni yongs su btang ba'o //🔽lhung bzed tha mar gyur pa ni lhung bzed kyi tha chad du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: dbul bar bya ba ni yongs su btang ba'o // lhung bzed tha mar gyur pa ni lhung bzed kyi tha chad du gyur pa ste /
translated: “Should offer” means should give up.🔽“The last alms bowl” means the worst alms bowl.

original: lhung bzed ngan ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lhung bzed ngan ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means a bad alms bowl.

original: de la zhes bya ba ltung ba 'byin pa'i dge slong la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ltung ba 'byin pa'i dge slong la'o //
translated: “In regard to that” refers to the monk who commits the offense.

original: phyis zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mjug gi don te /
analyzed: phyis zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mjug gi don te /
translated: The word “later” means “at the end.”

original: des na brims pa'i dus su mjug tu sbyin bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des na brims pa'i dus su mjug tu sbyin bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is to be given at the end, at the time of distribution.

original: chag pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar du zhes bya ba ni gang la chag pa'i mthar thug pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: chag pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar du zhes bya ba ni gang la chag pa'i mthar thug pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: Up to the end of the rains residence means that which has the end of the rains residence.

original: chag nas ni mi mkho bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽chag pa'i mthar thug pa kho na mtsham nyid du khas blangs nas lhung bzed de bcang bar bya ste /
analyzed: chag nas ni mi mkho bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // chag pa'i mthar thug pa kho na mtsham nyid du khas blangs nas lhung bzed de bcang bar bya ste /
translated: After the rains residence, it becomes useless.🔽That almsbowl should be kept until the end of the rains residence.

original: cho ga 'di kho nas 'di lhung bzed lhag pa 'chang bar gtogs pa'i nyes pa slong bar byed bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: cho ga 'di kho nas 'di lhung bzed lhag pa 'chang bar gtogs pa'i nyes pa slong bar byed bar shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that this very procedure is the way to clear away the fault of keeping an extra almsbowl.

original: de skad du yang zhus pa la la'i gzhung las /
analyzed: de skad du yang zhus pa la la'i gzhung las /
translated: In the same way, the text of the Questions of Paramārthasamudgata says:

original: dge slong 'ga' zhig ji srid 'tsho'i bar du ltung bzed lhag pa 'chang bar bgyid la ltung bar yang mi 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
analyzed: dge slong 'ga' zhig ji srid 'tsho'i bar du ltung bzed lhag pa 'chang bar bgyid la ltung bar yang mi 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
translated: “Lord, is it the case that a monk may keep an extra almsbowl for as long as he lives, and not be at fault?”

original: bka' stsal ba de lta yin te /
analyzed: bka' stsal ba de lta yin te /
translated: The Lord said, “That is so.

original: dge slong gi 'khor la phul na'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dge slong gi 'khor la phul na'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: and to the assembly of monks.

original: khad kyis nes bye ba ni mi drag par ro //
analyzed: khad kyis nes bye ba ni mi drag par ro //
translated: Gradually means not quickly.

original: spyad pa'i tshe dga' mgur dus thams cad du yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: spyad pa'i tshe dga' mgur dus thams cad du yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is it always at one’s leisure to enjoy the use of the requisites?

original: dal bu dal bus zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: dal bu dal bus zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The text says, “slowly, slowly.”

original: skabs skabs su yin gyi dus thams cad du ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: skabs skabs su yin gyi dus thams cad du ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that it is not always at one’s leisure, but only at certain times.

original: yo byad dag gam rim gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas ltung ba med par gsungs pa ni slong ba lta bu'i tshol ba med pa'i @303a * //
analyzed: yo byad dag gam rim gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas ltung ba med par gsungs pa ni slong ba lta bu'i tshol ba med pa'i @303a * //
translated: The text says that there is no offense if one does so “gradually, etc.,” because one is not seeking, like a beggar.

original: phyir dngos gzhi las shes bar bya ste /
analyzed: phyir dngos gzhi las shes bar bya ste /
translated: This should be understood from the root text,

original: gtso bo nyid kyis de'i dbang du mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtso bo nyid kyis de'i dbang du mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the Buddha, the principal one, taught it from his own perspective.

original: sbyor ba la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba la ni ma yin te /
translated: But not in the preparatory act,

original: lhung bzed lhag ma rnyed pa'i ched du zhugs pa las gdon mi za bar sbyor ba'i kha na ma tho bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhung bzed lhag ma rnyed pa'i ched du zhugs pa las gdon mi za bar sbyor ba'i kha na ma tho bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one who has begun the preparatory act for the sake of obtaining a surplus alms-bowl will certainly commit the offense of wrong conduct.

original: de bas na 'di la nyes byas kho nar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bas na 'di la nyes byas kho nar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, the text says that there is only an offense of wrong conduct.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhus pa la la las 'di kho na skad du /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhus pa la la las 'di kho na skad du /
translated: Therefore, the Questions of Revata Sutra declares:

original: rang gi yo byad kyis lhung bzed gzhan 'tshol na nyes byas so //
analyzed: rang gi yo byad kyis lhung bzed gzhan 'tshol na nyes byas so //
translated: If a monk who has his own requisites seeks another alms bowl, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: rang gi yo byad yod bzhin du lhung bzed slong na nyes byas so zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rang gi yo byad yod bzhin du lhung bzed slong na nyes byas so zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: If a monk who has his own requisites seeks an alms bowl, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: 'di gnyis kyi don ni go rims bzhin du 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di gnyis kyi don ni go rims bzhin du 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of these two is as follows:

original: bdag nyid kyi zong du gyur pa'i yo byad dag gis tshol na na smad pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi zong du gyur pa'i yo byad dag gis tshol na na smad pa yin no //
translated: If a monk who has his own requisites seeks another alms bowl, he is censured.

original: bdag nyid kyi yang rung gzhan thob kyang rung /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi yang rung gzhan thob kyang rung /
translated: Whether it is his own or obtained from another,

original: lhung bzed kyi zong du gyur pa rung ba bdog la lhung bzed ni med na na smad pa yin no //
analyzed: lhung bzed kyi zong du gyur pa rung ba bdog la lhung bzed ni med na na smad pa yin no //
translated: if he has requisites that are suitable to be exchanged for an alms bowl but does not have an alms bowl, he is censured.🔽In other questions of Revata it says:

original: zhus pa gzhan dag las gzhan yang dge slong 'ga' zhig ltung bzed mchis bzhin du ltung bzed gzhan slong bar bgyid la ltung bar mi 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sma /
analyzed: zhus pa gzhan dag las gzhan yang dge slong 'ga' zhig ltung bzed mchis bzhin du ltung bzed gzhan slong bar bgyid la ltung bar mi 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sma /
translated: “Is it the case that a monk who has an alms bowl but seeks another commits an offense?”

original: bka' stsal pa de lta yin te /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa de lta yin te /
translated: “That is so.”

original: gal te slong ba na snga ma yang med phyi ma yang med pa'i lhung bzed chag na ltung ba med do zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gal te slong ba na snga ma yang med phyi ma yang med pa'i lhung bzed chag na ltung ba med do zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: If one begs and the begging bowl breaks, there is no offense if there is no other begging bowl, neither a former one nor a later one.

original: de la don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: snga ma yang med phyi ma yang med pa ni 'di'i lhung bzed snga ma gzhan yang med /
analyzed: snga ma yang med phyi ma yang med pa ni 'di'i lhung bzed snga ma gzhan yang med /
translated: Neither a former one nor a later one means that there is no other former begging bowl and there is no other later one.

original: phyis phyi ma gzhan yang med pa gcig kho nar zad pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phyis phyi ma gzhan yang med pa gcig kho nar zad pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that there is only one.

original: 'dir yang ltung ba med par gsungs ba ni spang ba'i ltung ba med pa las dgongs te gsungs par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang ltung ba med par gsungs ba ni spang ba'i ltung ba med pa las dgongs te gsungs par shes par bya ste /
translated: Here, the statement that there is no offense should be understood as referring to the absence of a downfall of transgression,

original: de ni gtso bo yin pas de'i dbang du mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni gtso bo yin pas de'i dbang du mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is the main point and it is made from that perspective.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba las ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not from the perspective of the downfall of preparation,

original: de ni yod pa'i blos zhugs pa la gdon mi za bar yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni yod pa'i blos zhugs pa la gdon mi za bar yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because if one enters with the thought that it exists, then it is definitely existent.

original: de bas na lhung bzed med pas na brtsal ba byas par gyur bas de'i phyir lhung bzed lhag pa nyid med pas tshig 'og mar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na lhung bzed med pas na brtsal ba byas par gyur bas de'i phyir lhung bzed lhag pa nyid med pas tshig 'og mar shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, since there is no begging bowl, one should not seek one. Therefore, since there is no extra begging bowl, it should be understood from the following passage.

original: zhus ba la la las gzhan gyi phyir slong na nyes byas so zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: zhus ba la la las gzhan gyi phyir slong na nyes byas so zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Some Vinaya texts say that if one begs for another, it is an offense.

original: der na smad pa gsungs ba 'di ni gzhan gyi don yin ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der na smad pa gsungs ba 'di ni gzhan gyi don yin ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, this is criticized because it is for the sake of others.

original: zhus pa la la las gzhan yang dge slong gang zhig gis lhung bzed rab tu mang po zhig btsal la ci lags pa de thams cad dge slong gi 'khor la dbul bar bgyi 'am /
analyzed: zhus pa la la las gzhan yang dge slong gang zhig gis lhung bzed rab tu mang po zhig btsal la ci lags pa de thams cad dge slong gi 'khor la dbul bar bgyi 'am /
translated: Some Vinaya texts say that if a monk seeks many begging bowls, should he offer all of them to the assembly of monks?

original: nye ba 'khor ma yin te /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor ma yin te /
translated: Upāli, no.

original: 'on kyang gcig cig dbul bar @303b bya ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang gcig cig dbul bar @303b bya ste /
translated: However, one should offer one.

original: lhag ma rnams ni grogs dang mdza' ba rnams la bgo bar bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni grogs dang mdza' ba rnams la bgo bar bya'o //
translated: The rest should be shared with friends and relatives.

original: ci lags lhung bzed rnyed pa thams cad dge 'dun la brim par bgyi 'am /
analyzed: ci lags lhung bzed rnyed pa thams cad dge 'dun la brim par bgyi 'am /
translated: Should all the obtained begging bowls be offered to the Saṅgha?

original: nye ba 'khor ma yin te /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor ma yin te /
translated: Upāli, no.

original: 'on kyang gcig cig brim par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang gcig cig brim par bya'o //
translated: However, one should offer one.

original: ji lta ba zhig brim par bgyi lags /
analyzed: ji lta ba zhig brim par bgyi lags /
translated: How should they be distributed?

original: gang bdag gi yid la bab pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gang bdag gi yid la bab pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: They should be distributed to those who are agreeable to me.

original: de la don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this passage is as follows.

original: grogs ni cung zad mdza' ba'o //
analyzed: grogs ni cung zad mdza' ba'o //
translated: A friend is one who is slightly friendly.

original: mdza' ba ni te por mdza' ba'o //
analyzed: mdza' ba ni te por mdza' ba'o //
translated: A friend is one who is very friendly.

original: grogs zhes smos pas ni zhus pa gzhan las 'byung ba mthong ba'i phyir rab tu byung ba 'di pa rnams gzung bar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: grogs zhes smos pas ni zhus pa gzhan las 'byung ba mthong ba'i phyir rab tu byung ba 'di pa rnams gzung bar shes par bya ste /
translated: Since the term “friend” is mentioned, it should be understood that those who have gone forth in this religion are meant, because it is seen in other sūtras that they are the ones who are asked.

original: lhung bzed lhag ma rnams ni dge slong rnams la bgo bar bya'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhung bzed lhag ma rnams ni dge slong rnams la bgo bar bya'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The remaining alms bowls should be distributed to the monks.

original: 'dir yang dge slong smos pa ni dge slong dge slong ma la sogs pa rab tu 'byung ba 'di pa rnams kyi dpe'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dge slong smos pa ni dge slong dge slong ma la sogs pa rab tu 'byung ba 'di pa rnams kyi dpe'o //
translated: Here, the term “monk” is an example for those who have gone forth in this religion, including nuns and so on.

original: dge 'dun la brim par bgyi 'am zhes bya ba ni ltung bzed ngan pa bsnyigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge 'dun la brim par bgyi 'am zhes bya ba ni ltung bzed ngan pa bsnyigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The question, “Should they be distributed to the saṅgha?” is asked because the alms bowls are inferior and poor.

original: ltung bzed yid la bab pa ni shin tu 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: ltung bzed yid la bab pa ni shin tu 'dod pa'o //
translated: An agreeable alms bowl is one that is very desirable.

original: lhung bzed tshol ba'i spang ba gtan la dbab pa'o /
analyzed: lhung bzed tshol ba'i spang ba gtan la dbab pa'o /
translated: This is the determination of the prohibition against seeking an alms bowl.

original: // / zhe nga che ba ni rgyar che ba nyid du mdzes par btags pa'o //
analyzed: // / zhe nga che ba ni rgyar che ba nyid du mdzes par btags pa'o //
translated: The word “great” is used to indicate that it is beautiful because of its vastness.

original: khrun ring ba ni srid du ring ba nyid du bsrings pa'o //
analyzed: khrun ring ba ni srid du ring ba nyid du bsrings pa'o //
translated: “Long” means that it is extended in length.

original: thar gyis zhag pa zhes bya ba ni 'jur mdud med pa'o //
analyzed: thar gyis zhag pa zhes bya ba ni 'jur mdud med pa'o //
translated: “Without knots” means that it is without constrictions.

original: dang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: dang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bsdu ba'o //
translated: The word “and” is used to include.

original: thag ran bzang ba ni legs par btags pa'o //
analyzed: thag ran bzang ba ni legs par btags pa'o //
translated: “Good warp and woof” means that it is well woven.

original: tshe dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni shis par brjod pa smra bas mngon par spro bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni shis par brjod pa smra bas mngon par spro bar byed pa yin no //
translated: “Venerable” is a term of endearment used by one who is eager to please.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni ci nas kyang ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni ci nas kyang ngo //
translated: “In this way” means “in whatever way.”

original: gla rngan ni rngan pa ste /
analyzed: gla rngan ni rngan pa ste /
translated: “Wages” means “payment.”

original: gsug ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gsug ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means “salary.”

original: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba ni nye bar ston pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba ni nye bar ston pa'i tshig go //
translated: “For example” is a term that introduces an illustration.

original: yang na khyad par ston pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na khyad par ston pa yin no //
translated: Or it indicates a distinction.

original: bza' ba ni bza' ba lnga'o //
analyzed: bza' ba ni bza' ba lnga'o //
translated: “Food” refers to the five kinds of food.

original: bca' ba ni bca' ba lnga ste /
analyzed: bca' ba ni bca' ba lnga ste /
translated: “Drink” refers to the five kinds of beverages.

original: bza' ba dang 'dra ba'i phyir blon po lta bu'o //
analyzed: bza' ba dang 'dra ba'i phyir blon po lta bu'o //
translated: Because it is like food, it is like a minister.

original: bza' rgyu ni ste 'bras thug po che dang zong la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bza' rgyu ni ste 'bras thug po che dang zong la sogs pa'o //
translated: Food is rice, barley, wheat, and so on.

original: bza' ba la sogs pa sbyin pa smos pa ni byung ba'i dbang gis gsungs kyi /
analyzed: bza' ba la sogs pa sbyin pa smos pa ni byung ba'i dbang gis gsungs kyi /
translated: The mention of giving food and so on is stated from the perspective of what is available.

original: 'di'i yan lag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i yan lag ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not a branch of the training.

original: 'on kyang tshe dang ldan pa tha ga pa chos gos 'di zheng che ba dang / khrun ring bar gyis shig ces bya ba la sogs pa chu zheng gab pa dang bzang po'i bdag nyid du sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang tshe dang ldan pa tha ga pa chos gos 'di zheng che ba dang / khrun ring bar gyis shig ces bya ba la sogs pa chu zheng gab pa dang bzang po'i bdag nyid du sbyor ba yin no //
translated: However, the elder Tagpa said, “Make this Dharma robe wider and longer,” and so on, and he applied himself to making it well-fitting and of good quality.

original: lhag pa 'thag tu 'jug pa ni chos gos 'thag pa phul du byung bar sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: lhag pa 'thag tu 'jug pa ni chos gos 'thag pa phul du byung bar sgrub pa'o //
translated: To have it woven by another is to have an excellent robe woven.

original: brjod par bya ba ni pho nya dang yi ge la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ni pho nya dang yi ge la sogs pa'o //
translated: To have it made by a messenger is to have it made by a messenger, a letter, and so on.

original: kha cig ni pho nya la sogs pa las 'thag tu 'jug na dngos gzhi'i ltung bar @304a * //
analyzed: kha cig ni pho nya la sogs pa las 'thag tu 'jug na dngos gzhi'i ltung bar @304a * //
translated: Some say that if one has it woven by a messenger and so on, it is a downfall of a partially concordant act.

original: brjod de 'di ni gleng gzhi las shes pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: brjod de 'di ni gleng gzhi las shes pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: This is known from the nidana.

original: 'di ni 'dul ba 'dzin pa gzhan dag mi 'dod de /
analyzed: 'di ni 'dul ba 'dzin pa gzhan dag mi 'dod de /
translated: Other vinaya masters do not accept this.

original: zhus pa'i gzhung 'di nyid ni tshad mar byas pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: zhus pa'i gzhung 'di nyid ni tshad mar byas pa'i phyir ro /
translated: Because this very text that is being questioned is authoritative.

original: gang yang 'di ni gleng gzhi las shes so zhes brjod pa de yang 'dir yan lag ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang yang 'di ni gleng gzhi las shes so zhes brjod pa de yang 'dir yan lag ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: And what is said, “This is known from the nidana,” is not a part of this.

original: gleng gzhi'i dbang gis rang gis blangs pa'i dog pa yang yan lag nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gleng gzhi'i dbang gis rang gis blangs pa'i dog pa yang yan lag nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that what is taken up by oneself through the power of the nidana would also be a part.

original: de yan lag nyid yin par mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de yan lag nyid yin par mi 'dod de /
translated: But that is not accepted as a part.

original: de lta bas na pho nya la sogs pa'i 'thag tu 'jug pa la nyes byas kho na bzang ngo zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na pho nya la sogs pa'i 'thag tu 'jug pa la nyes byas kho na bzang ngo zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that it is only a misdeed to have a messenger, etc. weave.

original: zhus pa la la las ni gzhung 'di skad du /
analyzed: zhus pa la la las ni gzhung 'di skad du /
translated: In some questioned texts, this text is found:

original: dge slong gi phyir khyim pa dag gi chos gos 'thag tu bcug pa la dge slong de 'ang nye bar 'gro zhing bye brag tu 'byed par byed na nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ngo //
