analyzed: dge slong gi phyir khyim pa dag gi chos gos 'thag tu bcug pa la dge slong de 'ang nye bar 'gro zhing bye brag tu 'byed par byed na nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: “If householders have a monk’s robes woven, and that monk also goes near and specifies the details, it is a misdeed.”

original: de la don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: bdag nyid kyir sgrub pa'i ched du ma yin par mdza' ba tsam gyis nye bar 'gro ba gang yin pa de las 'dir nyes byas su gsungs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyir sgrub pa'i ched du ma yin par mdza' ba tsam gyis nye bar 'gro ba gang yin pa de las 'dir nyes byas su gsungs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not for the purpose of making it one’s own, but one goes to it merely out of affection.

original: gzhan dag na re 'di ni rigs pa ma yin te /🔽'di ltar yang bsams pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'di ni rigs pa ma yin te / 'di ltar yang bsams pa'i phyir la /
translated: Others say: This is illogical,🔽because it is not a downfall even if one does it intentionally,

original: ma bsams pa'i phyir yang ltung ba mi slong ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ma bsams pa'i phyir yang ltung ba mi slong ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: and it is not a downfall even if one does it unintentionally.

original: 'dir yang bye brag tu 'byed pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni khyad par te /
analyzed: 'dir yang bye brag tu 'byed pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni khyad par te /
translated: Here, the term “distinction” means a difference.

original: chos gos kyis tha dad pa yin par shes par bya ba'i bdag gi phyir chos gos 'thag go snyam pa'i kun du rtog pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: chos gos kyis tha dad pa yin par shes par bya ba'i bdag gi phyir chos gos 'thag go snyam pa'i kun du rtog pa ni ma yin te /
translated: One should understand that it is not the case that one thinks, “I will weave cloth for the sake of my own robes,” because it is not a downfall if one does it for the sake of a distinction,

original: de med na bsams pa'i phyir nyes byas su smos pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med na bsams pa'i phyir nyes byas su smos pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not proper to say that it is a minor offense if one does it intentionally.

original: de bas na bye brag tu 'byed pa mi byed pa zhes bya ba 'dir bdag gi phyir chos gos 'thag gi kye ma bdag der son dang chos gos de shin tu bzang por 'grub par 'gyur ro snyam nas /
analyzed: de bas na bye brag tu 'byed pa mi byed pa zhes bya ba 'dir bdag gi phyir chos gos 'thag gi kye ma bdag der son dang chos gos de shin tu bzang por 'grub par 'gyur ro snyam nas /
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the term “not to discriminate” is as follows: “For my sake, please weave this robe. Oh, if I go there, that robe will be very well made.”

original: de'i don du song la bye brag tu 'byed par mi byed de /
analyzed: de'i don du song la bye brag tu 'byed par mi byed de /
translated: But he does not go for that purpose and does not discriminate.

original: chos gos khyad par du bya ba'i phyir mi 'jug cing chos gos tha dad pa nyid du bya ba dang / chos gos phul du dbyung bar bya ba'i phyir mi slong ngo zhes bya ba'i don 'di ni rnam par gnas pas nyes byas 'di ni sbyor ba las byung bar bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: chos gos khyad par du bya ba'i phyir mi 'jug cing chos gos tha dad pa nyid du bya ba dang / chos gos phul du dbyung bar bya ba'i phyir mi slong ngo zhes bya ba'i don 'di ni rnam par gnas pas nyes byas 'di ni sbyor ba las byung bar bshad pa yin no //
translated: He does not request for the sake of making a special robe, for the sake of making a different robe, or for the sake of making an excellent robe. This is the meaning of the rule.

original: 'di ni de kho na ltar yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni de kho na ltar yin no //
translated: This is the way it is.

original: de lta ma yin na len pa ltung ba slong bar yang thal bar 'gyur la bsod snyoms la rgyu ba la sogs pa la ltung bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na len pa ltung ba slong bar yang thal bar 'gyur la bsod snyoms la rgyu ba la sogs pa la ltung bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow that the downfall would be incurred by accepting, and it would follow that the downfall would be incurred by going for alms.

original: lhag par slong ba'i spang ba gtan la dbab pa'o /
analyzed: lhag par slong ba'i spang ba gtan la dbab pa'o /
translated: This concludes the determination of the precept concerning excessive requests.

original: // / chos gos byin nas bya ba la @304b sogs ba 'di la rang gis byin pa nyid ni yan lag ma yin te /
analyzed: // / chos gos byin nas bya ba la @304b sogs ba 'di la rang gis byin pa nyid ni yan lag ma yin te /
translated: The giving of the robe is not a factor in the offense of taking back what one has given, etc.

original: 'dir gal te rang gis byin ba yan lag nyid yin par gyur na de'i tshe rang gis ma byin pa 'phrog na shin tu yang nyes pa 'dir 'gyur dgos so //
analyzed: 'dir gal te rang gis byin ba yan lag nyid yin par gyur na de'i tshe rang gis ma byin pa 'phrog na shin tu yang nyes pa 'dir 'gyur dgos so //
translated: If giving to oneself were a factor in the offense, then the offense would be very great if one took back what one had not given to oneself.

original: de lta bas na 'di la rang gi byin pa nyid ni yan lag ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di la rang gi byin pa nyid ni yan lag ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, giving to oneself is not a factor in the offense.

original: 'on kyang gleng gzhi'i dbang gis gsungs te zhag bdun pa 'bral ba'i spang ba la dbyar gnas par dam bca' ba phyi ma nyid lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang gleng gzhi'i dbang gis gsungs te zhag bdun pa 'bral ba'i spang ba la dbyar gnas par dam bca' ba phyi ma nyid lta bu'o //
translated: However, the Buddha spoke of it in the nidana, just as he spoke of the later vow to remain in the rainy season retreat as a factor in the offense of abandoning the earlier vow.

original: khros pa ni 'khrugs pa chung ngus so //
analyzed: khros pa ni 'khrugs pa chung ngus so //
translated: Anger is a slight disturbance.

original: 'khrugs pa ni 'bring bos so //
analyzed: 'khrugs pa ni 'bring bos so //
translated: Disturbance is a middling disturbance.

original: rngam par gyur pa ni chen pos so //
analyzed: rngam par gyur pa ni chen pos so //
translated: Rage is a great disturbance.

original: yang na go rims bzhin du khros pa las byung ba'i lus dang yid dang ngag gi 'gyur ba yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na go rims bzhin du khros pa las byung ba'i lus dang yid dang ngag gi 'gyur ba yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Or, anger, etc., should be understood as the physical, verbal, and mental changes that arise from anger, etc.

original: yi ma rangs pa ni gnod ba bya bar zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: yi ma rangs pa ni gnod ba bya bar zhugs pa'o //
translated: Displeasure is the intention to harm.

original: 'phrog gam zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dis ni rang gi yin pa'i 'du shes kyis 'phrog na ltung ba 'dir gsungs so //
analyzed: 'phrog gam zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dis ni rang gi yin pa'i 'du shes kyis 'phrog na ltung ba 'dir gsungs so //
translated: The phrase if he takes it and so forth indicates that this downfall is declared if one takes it with the perception that it is one's own.

original: de lta ma yin na pham par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na pham par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow that there would be a root downfall.

original: khros zhes smos ba ni 'dir 'byung ba'i dbang gis gsungs pa yin gyi yan lag ni ma yin te /
analyzed: khros zhes smos ba ni 'dir 'byung ba'i dbang gis gsungs pa yin gyi yan lag ni ma yin te /
translated: The phrase if he is angry is stated here by the force of the context, but it is not a branch of the downfall.

original: gzhi med par skur ba 'debs pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: gzhi med par skur ba 'debs pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: It is like the case of groundless slander.

original: 'on kyang rlung sems med par rang gir byed pa dang 'bral bar byed pa la ltung ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rlung sems med par rang gir byed pa dang 'bral bar byed pa la ltung ba 'di yin no //
translated: However, this downfall does apply to one who takes it as his own or separates it from its place without the wind and mind.

original: 'am zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog ba'o //
analyzed: 'am zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog ba'o //
translated: The word or indicates an alternative.

original: lus kyi las byas nas /
analyzed: lus kyi las byas nas /
translated: Having committed the physical action,

original: ngag gi las dge slong khyod la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ngag gi las dge slong khyod la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he commits the verbal action by saying, Monk, give it back! and so forth.🔽The phrase give it back means bring it!

original: phyir byin cig ces bya ba ni khyer te shog shig pa ste /🔽'on cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phyir byin cig ces bya ba ni khyer te shog shig pa ste /🔽'on cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means bring it!

original: brgya zhig la 'phrog par byed pa'i dge slong de'i chos gos de spyad de zad na spang ba'i dus su ji ltar spang bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: brgya zhig la 'phrog par byed pa'i dge slong de'i chos gos de spyad de zad na spang ba'i dus su ji ltar spang bar bya zhe na /
translated: If the monk who steals the robe uses it until it is worn out, how is it abandoned when the time for abandoning it arrives?🔽The text says, “If there is a remainder,”

original: lhag ma yod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: lhag ma yod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: yod ces bya ba'i sgra ni bdog pa brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: yod ces bya ba'i sgra ni bdog pa brjod pa yin no //
translated: The word “is” expresses possession.

original: na zhes bya ba'i sgra ni yang zhes bya ba brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: na zhes bya ba'i sgra ni yang zhes bya ba brjod pa yin te /
translated: The word “if” expresses repetition.

original: de ni srin la sogs pas zos pa dang spyad de rnyings pa'i lhag rol dum bur gyur pa yod pa gang yin pa de'ang slar sbyin par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni srin la sogs pas zos pa dang spyad de rnyings pa'i lhag rol dum bur gyur pa yod pa gang yin pa de'ang slar sbyin par bya ste /
translated: If there is a remainder of the robe that has been eaten by worms and so on, or used until it is worn out, and it is in pieces, then that remainder should be returned.

original: ma byin na nyes byas so //
analyzed: ma byin na nyes byas so //
translated: If it is not returned, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is as follows.

original: de la chos gos spyad pa'i lhag rol yod pa gang yin pa de yang dge slong de la phyir sbyin par bya ba ste /
analyzed: de la chos gos spyad pa'i lhag rol yod pa gang yin pa de yang dge slong de la phyir sbyin par bya ba ste /
translated: If there is a remainder of the robe that has been used, then that should be returned to the monk.

original: de lta bu'i tshul du 'dir spang bar bya'i /
analyzed: de lta bu'i tshul du 'dir spang bar bya'i /
translated: It should be abandoned in this way.

original: spyad de zad pa dang 'dra bar sbyin bar bya ba nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: spyad de zad pa dang 'dra bar sbyin bar bya ba nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not like the exhaustion of what is given.

original: gang gi tshe spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: When does it end?

original: btang na zhes bya ba la sogs ba smos te /
analyzed: btang na zhes bya ba la sogs ba smos te /
translated: The text says, “If it is given up,” and so on.

original: gang gi tshe chos gos de lus las @305a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe chos gos de lus las @305a * //
translated: When that Dharma robe is given up,

original: btang zhing bral bar gyur pa de'i tshe spang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: btang zhing bral bar gyur pa de'i tshe spang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: when it is separated from the body, then it ends.

original: 'dir 'bral ba ni 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir 'bral ba ni 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: Here, separation is to be done like this:

original: gang gi tshe 'phrog par byed pa'i dge slong gis chos gos de dge slong gi lus las phral bar gyur cing logs shig tu byas pa de'i tshe 'di la 'phrog pa'i ltung ba 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'phrog par byed pa'i dge slong gis chos gos de dge slong gi lus las phral bar gyur cing logs shig tu byas pa de'i tshe 'di la 'phrog pa'i ltung ba 'byung ngo //
translated: When the monk who is stealing it separates the Dharma robe from the body of the monk and makes it his own, at that time the offense of stealing it occurs.

original: spong ba byed pa ni chos gos spyad pa'i lhag rol ji tsam zhig lus pa de kho na slar byin nas spang pa'i ltung ba spyad par bya'i /
analyzed: spong ba byed pa ni chos gos spyad pa'i lhag rol ji tsam zhig lus pa de kho na slar byin nas spang pa'i ltung ba spyad par bya'i /
translated: The one who is giving it up should give back just the remainder of the Dharma robe that was used, and then commit the offense of giving it up.

original: spang ba gzhan sbyang ba lta bu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: spang ba gzhan sbyang ba lta bu ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not like giving up another offense.

original: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas mtshan gyur na nyes byas su gsungs pa 'di ni mtshan tha dad par byas pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas mtshan gyur na nyes byas su gsungs pa 'di ni mtshan tha dad par byas pa'i phyir te /
translated: The Venerable states that if a monk changes sex, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: de bzhin du dge slong ma mtshan gyur na yang de nyid du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dge slong ma mtshan gyur na yang de nyid du shes par bya'o //
translated: This is because he has a different sex. Similarly, if a nun changes sex, she should be understood in the same way.

original: 'phrog pa'i spang ba gan la dbab pa'o /🔽// / dge slong gis zhes bya ba ni chos gos sbed pa ste /🔽dge 'dun rnams gyis btad pa las byung ba'i chos gos grub pa la chos gos sbed pa la bskos na de kho na ltung bar byed pa bstan pa'i phyir chos gos sbed pa'i dge slong bskos nas ltung ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phrog pa'i spang ba gan la dbab pa'o / // / dge slong gis zhes bya ba ni chos gos sbed pa ste / dge 'dun rnams gyis btad pa las byung ba'i chos gos grub pa la chos gos sbed pa la bskos na de kho na ltung bar byed pa bstan pa'i phyir chos gos sbed pa'i dge slong bskos nas ltung ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The section on the downfall of stealing.🔽A monk who conceals robes means a monk who hides robes.🔽If a monk is appointed to conceal robes, he is not faulted if he conceals robes that have been assigned to the saṅgha and that have been made into robes.

original: gang la chos gos sbed pa ma bskos pa de ni dge 'dun kho na la ltung bar brjod pa'i phyir de dag gi nang nas dmigs kyis gcig kho na ltung bar 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang la chos gos sbed pa ma bskos pa de ni dge 'dun kho na la ltung bar brjod pa'i phyir de dag gi nang nas dmigs kyis gcig kho na ltung bar 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: If a monk is not appointed to conceal robes, he is not faulted if he conceals robes that have not been assigned to the saṅgha.

original: rnyed pa dge 'dun thams cad kyi thun mong yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnyed pa dge 'dun thams cad kyi thun mong yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the acquisition belongs in common to the entire Saṃgha.

original: gzhan dag na re brtad pa las byung ba'i chos gos grub pa la dge slong gis zhes smos pa ni gnas gcig na dge slong 'ga' zhig gnas pa'i dbang du mdzad pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re brtad pa las byung ba'i chos gos grub pa la dge slong gis zhes smos pa ni gnas gcig na dge slong 'ga' zhig gnas pa'i dbang du mdzad pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that the statement “a monk” refers to a monk who is in a single location.

original: ston zla tha chungs nyer bzhi zhes bya ba ni ston zla 'bring po'i tshes bcu drug dang nye bar 'dug ba ston zla 'brir po'i tshes bco lngar zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ston zla tha chungs nyer bzhi zhes bya ba ni ston zla 'bring po'i tshes bcu drug dang nye bar 'dug ba ston zla 'brir po'i tshes bco lngar zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The twenty-fourth day of the last autumn month refers to the day that is close to the sixteenth day of the middle autumn month, which is the fifteenth day of the middle autumn month.

original: zhag bcu ma tshang ba zhes bya ba ni zhag bcu ma lon pa de zhag bcus bar du chod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhag bcu ma tshang ba zhes bya ba ni zhag bcu ma lon pa de zhag bcus bar du chod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase “less than ten days” means that less than ten days have passed. The meaning is that ten days have not elapsed.

original: ston zla tha chungs nya ni dbyar phyi mar gnas par dam bcas pa rnams kyi dgun zla ra ba nya'i dpe ste /
analyzed: ston zla tha chungs nya ni dbyar phyi mar gnas par dam bcas pa rnams kyi dgun zla ra ba nya'i dpe ste /
translated: The full moon of the last autumn month is an example of the new moon of the first winter month for those who have taken the vow to remain in the later rainy season.

original: de skad du yang nyel 'khor ji ltar gnas bar dam bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs ba 'chad bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de skad du yang nyel 'khor ji ltar gnas bar dam bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs ba 'chad bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus it is said, “The robe is to be worn as long as one lives.”

original: brtad pa las byung ba'i gos ni phongs pa'i dus kyi gos te nad ba dang de'i ched dang 'chi pa dang de'i ched dang / 'gro ba'i sbyin pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa lnga po zhes bya ba'i @305b tha tshig go //
analyzed: brtad pa las byung ba'i gos ni phongs pa'i dus kyi gos te nad ba dang de'i ched dang 'chi pa dang de'i ched dang / 'gro ba'i sbyin pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa lnga po zhes bya ba'i @305b tha tshig go //
translated: The robe that arises from begging is the robe of a time of scarcity. It is of five types, due to the particularity of the gift of going.

original: blang bar bya ba ni bdag gir bya ba yin gyi bgo ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: blang bar bya ba ni bdag gir bya ba yin gyi bgo ba ni ma yin no //
translated: One should accept it, but not wear it.

original: de nyid kyi phyir blangs nas chos gos sbyin pa dus kyi tshe'i bar du 'chang ngo zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir blangs nas chos gos sbyin pa dus kyi tshe'i bar du 'chang ngo zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: For this very reason, it is said, “Having accepted it, one should keep the robe of gift for the time of need.”

original: gal te de bgo bar bya ba yin na ci ste chos gos sbyin pa'i dus kyi tshe'i bar du bcang bar gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te de bgo bar bya ba yin na ci ste chos gos sbyin pa'i dus kyi tshe'i bar du bcang bar gsungs te /
translated: If it is to be worn, why is it said that one should keep the robe of gift for the time of need?

original: bcang ba cung zad kyang mi dgos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcang ba cung zad kyang mi dgos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not necessary to keep it at all.

original: de la chos gos sbyin pa'i dus kyi tshe ni dbyar gyi dus zla ba gsum gyi tshad kyi dgag dbye'i rjes ston zla 'bring po'i mar gyi nyi ma dang po tshes su gyur pa'am /
analyzed: de la chos gos sbyin pa'i dus kyi tshe ni dbyar gyi dus zla ba gsum gyi tshad kyi dgag dbye'i rjes ston zla 'bring po'i mar gyi nyi ma dang po tshes su gyur pa'am /
translated: When is the time for giving the Dharma robe? The time for giving the Dharma robe is the first day of the waning moon of the first autumn month, or the first day of the waning moon of the last autumn month.

original: ston zla tha chungs mar gyi nyi ma dang po'i tshes su gyur pa'i tshes gcig ni bgo ba'i dus so //
analyzed: ston zla tha chungs mar gyi nyi ma dang po'i tshes su gyur pa'i tshes gcig ni bgo ba'i dus so //
translated: The first day of the waning moon of the first autumn month is the time for distributing the Dharma robe.

original: de rang gi ngo bo'i tshe'o //
analyzed: de rang gi ngo bo'i tshe'o //
translated: That is the time for its essence.

original: de ni chos gos byin pa'i dus te de phyin chad ni dus ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni chos gos byin pa'i dus te de phyin chad ni dus ma yin no //
translated: That is the time for giving the Dharma robe. After that it is not the time.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dge slong gi chos gos btsal ba'i dus gang lags /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dge slong gi chos gos btsal ba'i dus gang lags /
translated: For that reason, what is the time for a monk to seek a Dharma robe?

original: sra brkyang ma bting ba'i gnas su ston zla 'bring po'i bar dang / sra brkyang bting ba'i gnas su ston zla 'bring po nas bzung ste /
analyzed: sra brkyang ma bting ba'i gnas su ston zla 'bring po'i bar dang / sra brkyang bting ba'i gnas su ston zla 'bring po nas bzung ste /
translated: In a place where the rainy season retreat has not been entered, it is from the first autumn month until the first autumn month. In a place where the rainy season retreat has been entered, it is from the first autumn month until the last winter month.

original: dgun zla tha chungs kyi bar 'di ni dge slong gi chos gos sbyin pa'i dus ma yin no //
analyzed: dgun zla tha chungs kyi bar 'di ni dge slong gi chos gos sbyin pa'i dus ma yin no //
translated: This is not the time for giving the Dharma robe to a monk.

original: lhag ma ni dus yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: lhag ma ni dus yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: The remainder is the time.

original: 'dir ni gnas par khas len pa phyi ma nges par mdzad nas ston zla 'bring po'i bar dus ma yin par gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dir ni gnas par khas len pa phyi ma nges par mdzad nas ston zla 'bring po'i bar dus ma yin par gsungs so //
translated: Here, the latter period of the rainy season is definitely accepted as the time for staying, and the middle month of autumn is stated as the time for not staying.

original: 'dir gnas par khas len pa dang po rnams kyi dus ni ston zla ra ba'i bar yin no zhes bya ba de ltar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir gnas par khas len pa dang po rnams kyi dus ni ston zla ra ba'i bar yin no zhes bya ba de ltar shes par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that the time for staying for those who accept the former period of the rainy season is until the middle month of autumn.

original: 'dir ni rnam par dbye bar mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir ni rnam par dbye bar mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, the middle month of autumn is stated as the time for not staying because it is divided into two.🔽If one keeps it past that time, it is definitely not the proper time.

original: 'das par 'chang na zhes bya ba ni thams cad du dus ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bya ba ni dgag dbye ma byas pa dang / dngos gzhi'i dgag dbye tshun chad dbyar gyi nang logs su brtad pa las byung ba'i chos gos bgo bar mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'das par 'chang na zhes bya ba ni thams cad du dus ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bya ba ni dgag dbye ma byas pa dang / dngos gzhi'i dgag dbye tshun chad dbyar gyi nang logs su brtad pa las byung ba'i chos gos bgo bar mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir /
translated: This is because it is said that until the formal lifting of the restrictions, and until the end of the basic lifting of restrictions, one should not wear a Dharma robe that has arisen from a dispute during the rainy season.

original: brtad pa las byung ba'i chos gos kyi spang ba gtan la dbab pa'o /
analyzed: brtad pa las byung ba'i chos gos kyi spang ba gtan la dbab pa'o /
translated: This is the determination of the offense of a Dharma robe that has arisen from a dispute.

original: // / gnas mal dgon pa ni dgon pa'i gtsug lag khang ngo //
analyzed: // / gnas mal dgon pa ni dgon pa'i gtsug lag khang ngo //
translated: A remote dwelling place is a temple in a remote place.

analyzed: grags ba ni gang dag tu seng ge la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa lan cig byung ba'o //
translated: Those that are known as having fear are those in which there is fear of robbers, etc.

analyzed: 'jigs su rung ba ni kun du 'khrug pa'i rgyu mtshan sha sbrang dang sbrang bu mchu rings la sogs pa ste /
translated: Those that are known as having fear are those in which there is fear of robbers, etc.🔽Those that are known as having fear are those in which there

original: snga ma rnams skrag par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma rnams skrag par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the former frighten.

original: gang dag la 'jigs pa tha dad pa dang 'jigs su rung ba yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag la 'jigs pa tha dad pa dang 'jigs su rung ba yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Those who have different fears and who are frightened are called that.

original: dbyar phyi mar gyur pa zhes bya ba ni dbyar gnas par khas len pa'i dbyar phyi mar gyur pa la gsungs mod kyi 'on kyang ltung ba bstan ba las 'di yan lag nyid du rten pa med pa'i phyir 'di yan lag nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dbyar phyi mar gyur pa zhes bya ba ni dbyar gnas par khas len pa'i dbyar phyi mar gyur pa la gsungs mod kyi 'on kyang ltung ba bstan ba las 'di yan lag nyid du rten pa med pa'i phyir 'di yan lag nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: The latter part of the rainy season means the latter part of the rainy season in which the monk agrees to stay for the rainy season. However, because it is not a branch in the teaching on downfalls, it is not a branch.🔽Thus it is said:

original: de skad du'ang ji tsam du dge slong dgon ba pa zhag drug las 'das par chos gos gsum po dag las chos gos gang yang rung ba zhig dang mtshams kyi phyi rol du 'bral bar byed na thams cad du spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs🔽pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de skad du'ang ji tsam du dge slong dgon ba pa zhag drug las 'das par chos gos gsum po dag las chos gos gang yang rung ba zhig dang mtshams kyi phyi rol du 'bral bar byed na thams cad du spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i phyir te /
translated: To the extent that a monk in the wilderness separates from any of the three Dharma robes for more than six days, he commits a downfall that requires relinquishment.

original: 'di ni 'di'i yan lag nyid yin pa med do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ni 'di'i yan lag nyid yin pa med do zhes bstan to //
translated: This is taught because it is not a branch.

original: ci ste gal te ltung ba bstan pa las 'di la brten pa med na ci'i phyir mdo dang rnam par 'byed pa dag las zhe na gleng gzhi'i dbang gi phyir ro //
analyzed: ci ste gal te ltung ba bstan pa las 'di la brten pa med na ci'i phyir mdo dang rnam par 'byed pa dag las zhe na gleng gzhi'i dbang gi phyir ro //
translated: If you say: “But if it is not a branch in the Sūtra and the Vinaya, why is it mentioned in the teaching on downfalls? ”🔽It is mentioned because of the context.

original: gleng gzhi'i dbang gis ni yan lag tu ma gyur pa'i don rnams smos par gyur pa yang yod de /
analyzed: gleng gzhi'i dbang gis ni yan lag tu ma gyur pa'i don rnams smos par gyur pa yang yod de /
translated: There are cases where a meaning that is not a branch is mentioned because of the context.

original: dper na bla mar gyur pa smra ba la de dus gzhan zhig na dris kyang rung ma dris kyang rung zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bla mar gyur pa smra ba la de dus gzhan zhig na dris kyang rung ma dris kyang rung zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, in the story of the elder who said, “Whether asked or not, at another time…”

original: dbyar phyi mar gnas par khas blangs pa rnams gnas bzhin du 'gror mi rung gi gzhan dag ni yin pas de'i phyir 'di dag kho na la zhag drug gi 'bral bar rjes su gnang gi gzhan dag dbyar phyi mar gyur pa nyid yan lag kho na ma yin
analyzed: dbyar phyi mar gnas par khas blangs pa rnams gnas bzhin du 'gror mi rung gi gzhan dag ni yin pas de'i phyir 'di dag kho na la zhag drug gi 'bral bar rjes su gnang gi gzhan dag dbyar phyi mar gyur pa nyid yan lag kho na ma yin
translated: Those who have accepted the later rainy season retreat are not allowed to leave while they are staying, but others are. Therefore, only they are allowed six nights away.

original: nam zhen ma yin te /
analyzed: nam zhen ma yin te /
translated: It is not a branch.

original: rgyu gzhan pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is another reason.

original: 'di ltar 'jigs pa dang bcas pa'i gnas yongs su mi btang pa la ni rgyu dbyar phyi mar gyur pa nyid 'ba' zhig tu ma zad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jigs pa dang bcas pa'i gnas yongs su mi btang pa la ni rgyu dbyar phyi mar gyur pa nyid 'ba' zhig tu ma zad do //
translated: Thus, the reason for not abandoning a place that has dangers is not only the later rainy season.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What else?

original: lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems shin tu sbyangs pa dang / lus gzi mdangs nyid dang / chos kyi longs spyod dang zang zing gi longs spyod dang @306b gtsug lag khang bskyang ba dang / gtsug lag khang stong pa nyid yongs su spang ba dang /
analyzed: lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems shin tu sbyangs pa dang / lus gzi mdangs nyid dang / chos kyi longs spyod dang zang zing gi longs spyod dang @306b gtsug lag khang bskyang ba dang / gtsug lag khang stong pa nyid yongs su spang ba dang /
translated: Physical pliancy, mental pliancy, physical luster, enjoyment of the Dharma, enjoyment of material things, maintenance of the monastery, and avoidance of an empty monastery.

original: sbyin bdag gi dad pa nyams pa yongs su spang ba yin no //
analyzed: sbyin bdag gi dad pa nyams pa yongs su spang ba yin no //
translated: And avoidance of the loss of faith of benefactors.

original: 'dod na zhes bya ba 'dis ni ci dgar zad pa ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'dod na zhes bya ba 'dis ni ci dgar zad pa ston par byed do //
translated: If one wishes shows that one may do whatever one wants.

original: chos gos gsum las zhes bya ba ni snam sbyar dang / bla gos dang mthang gos rnams las so //
analyzed: chos gos gsum las zhes bya ba ni snam sbyar dang / bla gos dang mthang gos rnams las so //
translated: From among the three robes means from among the patched robe, the upper robe, and the lower robe.

original: khyim gyi nang du gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dgon pa'i gtsug lag khang gi nye spyod du gyur pa'i grong nye bar gzhag par bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: khyim gyi nang du gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dgon pa'i gtsug lag khang gi nye spyod du gyur pa'i grong nye bar gzhag par bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Should be placed in the house” means that the house should be placed near the monastery.

original: de dang zhes bya ba'i khyim gyi nang du gzhag pa'i chos gos de dang ngo //
analyzed: de dang zhes bya ba'i khyim gyi nang du gzhag pa'i chos gos de dang ngo //
translated: “That” refers to the robe that is to be placed in the house.

original: mtshams kyi phyi rol ni dgon pa'i gnas dang chos gos kyi rten gyi gnas de'i nye spyod 'dom gang la sogs pa gang yin pa de'i phyi rol du gyur pa'i mtshams gang yin pa ste der ro //
analyzed: mtshams kyi phyi rol ni dgon pa'i gnas dang chos gos kyi rten gyi gnas de'i nye spyod 'dom gang la sogs pa gang yin pa de'i phyi rol du gyur pa'i mtshams gang yin pa ste der ro //
translated: “Outside the boundary” means outside the boundary of the monastery and the boundary of the place where the robe is kept, which is one fathom around.

original: de lta bu'i rkyen ni dge 'dun gyi 'am sangs rgyas kyi ched do //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rkyen ni dge 'dun gyi 'am sangs rgyas kyi ched do //
translated: “Such a condition” means for the sake of the Saṅgha or the Buddha.

original: zhag drug gi mtha' tshun chad ni zhag drug kho na ste /
analyzed: zhag drug gi mtha' tshun chad ni zhag drug kho na ste /
translated: “Up to six days” means exactly six days.

original: zhag bdun bar ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
analyzed: zhag bdun bar ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
translated: “Seven days” means seven days.

original: ; bar chad brgyad las zhes bya ba ni bgegs brgyad las te /
analyzed: ; bar chad brgyad las zhes bya ba ni bgegs brgyad las te /
translated: “From the eight obstacles” means from the eight hindrances.

original: de dag kyang rgyal po dang / me dang / chu dang / chom rkun dang / seng ge dang / mi ma yin pa dang / mi dang / sdig sbrul zhes bya ba'i bar chad rnams so //
analyzed: de dag kyang rgyal po dang / me dang / chu dang / chom rkun dang / seng ge dang / mi ma yin pa dang / mi dang / sdig sbrul zhes bya ba'i bar chad rnams so //
translated: These are the obstacles of kings, fire, water, thieves, lions, non-humans, humans, and poisonous snakes.

original: 'di dag kyang srog dang / tshangs par spyod pa'i bar chad du gyur pa'i nad la sogs pa gzhan dag gi dpe yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag kyang srog dang / tshangs par spyod pa'i bar chad du gyur pa'i nad la sogs pa gzhan dag gi dpe yin no //
translated: These are examples of other illnesses that are obstacles to life and pure conduct.

original: kha cig ni bdun pa re zhig bsnyen par ma rdzogs par bya ba la sogs pas bdun pa 'don to //
analyzed: kha cig ni bdun pa re zhig bsnyen par ma rdzogs par bya ba la sogs pas bdun pa 'don to //
translated: Some recite the seven-day rule as the first rule, saying it is for those not yet fully ordained.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: But that is not correct.

original: 'di ltar bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ni bsnyen par rdzogs pa kho na dang 'brel pa yin gyi bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa rnams ni bag cam yang khongs su gtogs pa med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ni bsnyen par rdzogs pa kho na dang 'brel pa yin gyi bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa rnams ni bag cam yang khongs su gtogs pa med do //
translated: Because this training rule is only connected to full ordination. Those not fully ordained are not even included in the category of negligence.

original: de lta pas na 'don pa 'di ni nor ba bshad pas 'phen pa'i dbang gis sgro btags pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta pas na 'don pa 'di ni nor ba bshad pas 'phen pa'i dbang gis sgro btags pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, this recitation is an exaggeration due to the power of the explanation of the mistake.

original: zhag bdun pa'i spang ba la yang de kho na bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhag bdun pa'i spang ba la yang de kho na bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood in the same way for the seven-day relinquishment.

original: re zhig dge slong gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas mtshan gyur na nyes byas su gsungs pa'i 'dul ba mdor bsdus par gtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: re zhig dge slong gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas mtshan gyur na nyes byas su gsungs pa'i 'dul ba mdor bsdus par gtogs pa yin no //
translated: The Vinaya-matikâ states that if a bhikṣu changes sex, he commits an offense.

original: dngos kyi tshul du ni dge slong ma rnams la zhag drug 'bral ba'i spang ba nyid rnam par ma bzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos kyi tshul du ni dge slong ma rnams la zhag drug 'bral ba'i spang ba nyid rnam par ma bzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But in the actual rules, the offense of separation for six days is not established for bhikṣuṇīs.

original: 'di ltar dge slong ma rnams la ni dgon par gnas pa bcom ldan 'das kyis bkag ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar dge slong ma rnams la ni dgon par gnas pa bcom ldan 'das kyis bkag ste /
translated: Thus, the Bhagavān prohibited bhikṣuṇīs from living in the wilderness,

original: 'di ltar bud med @307a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar bud med @307a * //
translated: because the bodies of women

original: rnams kyi lus ni zas dang skom grub pa bzhin du skyes bu 'phyon ma rnams kyis don du gnyer bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / nyam chung ba'i phyir dgon par gnas na skyes pas gnas pa dang / mngon bar 'gro ba la sogs ba nyes dmigs yang dang yang du 'byung ba kho nar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: rnams kyi lus ni zas dang skom grub pa bzhin du skyes bu 'phyon ma rnams kyis don du gnyer bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / nyam chung ba'i phyir dgon par gnas na skyes pas gnas pa dang / mngon bar 'gro ba la sogs ba nyes dmigs yang dang yang du 'byung ba kho nar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de 'dra ba yin no //
translated: are like food and drink that are sought by men who are prostitutes, and because they are weak. If they lived in the wilderness, the problems of being overtaken by men and so on would occur again and again.

original: de med na yang der gtogs pa'i spang ba yang rnam par mi gzhag go //
analyzed: de med na yang der gtogs pa'i spang ba yang rnam par mi gzhag go //
translated: If it does not exist, then the offense belonging to it is not established.

original: gal te na dge slong mas 'das te spyod par ni mi byed pas de'i phyir 'dir gtogs pa'i nyes byas su gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te na dge slong mas 'das te spyod par ni mi byed pas de'i phyir 'dir gtogs pa'i nyes byas su gsungs te /
translated: But if a bhikṣuṇī does not engage in sexual intercourse, then the offense belonging to it is stated here.

original: mi rung ba'i phyogs la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rung ba'i phyogs la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is based on an improper side.

original: zhag bdun du 'bral ba'i spang ba gtan la dbab pa'o /
analyzed: zhag bdun du 'bral ba'i spang ba gtan la dbab pa'o /
translated: The determination of the offense of separation for seven days.

original: // / so ga rnams kyi zla ba gcig lus ba na zhes bya ba ni dbyar zla ra ba'o //
analyzed: // / so ga rnams kyi zla ba gcig lus ba na zhes bya ba ni dbyar zla ra ba'o //
translated: When one month of spring remains means in the first summer month.

original: dbyar gyi gos ras chen ni dbyar rnams su dgos pa ni dbyar gyi ras chen te /
analyzed: dbyar gyi gos ras chen ni dbyar rnams su dgos pa ni dbyar gyi ras chen te /
translated: The rainy season cloth is necessary in the rainy season, so it is the rainy season cloth.

original: dbyar bgo ba'i gos so //
analyzed: dbyar bgo ba'i gos so //
translated: It is the cloth to be worn in the rainy season.

original: gos de nyid du rung ba dang / kha tshar gcad ba dang / kha dog ngan par byas pa ni dbyar gyi gos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gos de nyid du rung ba dang / kha tshar gcad ba dang / kha dog ngan par byas pa ni dbyar gyi gos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That very cloth is suitable, the fringe is cut, and the color is made bad, which is the meaning of the rainy season cloth.

original: btsal bar bya ba ni khyim bdag gam khyim bdag gi chung ma dag las bslang ba 'am de'i yin sbyin du 'jug pa'am /
analyzed: btsal bar bya ba ni khyim bdag gam khyim bdag gi chung ma dag las bslang ba 'am de'i yin sbyin du 'jug pa'am /
translated: It should be sought from householders or their wives, either by requesting or by having them give it.

original: dbyar gyi ras chen sbed pa la bslang ba la sogs pas btsal bar bya'o //🔽dbyar dag zla ba phyed lus bar byas nas bcad bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni zla ba bzhi'i tshad gang dag la lhag ma zla ba phyed dang ston zla tha chungs yar gyi ngo yod pa de dag ni dbyar gyi zla ba phyed lus pa ste /
analyzed: dbyar gyi ras chen sbed pa la bslang ba la sogs pas btsal bar bya'o // dbyar dag zla ba phyed lus bar byas nas bcad bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni zla ba bzhi'i tshad gang dag la lhag ma zla ba phyed dang ston zla tha chungs yar gyi ngo yod pa de dag ni dbyar gyi zla ba phyed lus pa ste /
translated: One should seek it by begging for cloth for the rainy season, and so on.🔽One should keep it until the end of the rainy season.🔽The rainy season is the four months during which the moon moves north.

original: de dag byas na bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag byas na bcang bar bya'o //
translated: One should keep it until the end of the rainy season.

original: de la don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is as follows.

original: dbyar gyi gos ras chen ni btsal nas dbyar zla ba bzhi'i tshad las zla ba phyed lus par byas par gyur pa ji srid pa de srid du bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: dbyar gyi gos ras chen ni btsal nas dbyar zla ba bzhi'i tshad las zla ba phyed lus par byas par gyur pa ji srid pa de srid du bcang bar bya'o //
translated: One should keep the cloth for the rainy season until the end of the rainy season, which is four months long, having sought it and having used it for half a month.

original: gzhan dag na re dbyar gyi gos ras chen btsal ba'i phyir phyi ma zla ba bzhi'i tshad de dag zla ba phyed lus nas bcang bar bya ba yin bar dbyar gyi zla ba bzhi'i tshad zla ba phyed lus par byas shing zla ba phyed ma tshang bar byas🔽par gyur pa ji srid pa de srid du bcang bar bya ste /🔽zla ba phyed 'ba' zhig lus par gyur gyi /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re dbyar gyi gos ras chen btsal ba'i phyir phyi ma zla ba bzhi'i tshad de dag zla ba phyed lus nas bcang bar bya ba yin bar dbyar gyi zla ba bzhi'i tshad zla ba phyed lus par byas shing zla ba phyed ma tshang bar byas par gyur pa ji srid pa de srid du bcang bar bya ste / zla ba phyed 'ba' zhig lus par gyur gyi /
translated: One should keep them for the remainder of the four months of the rainy season, for as long as the remainder of the four months of the rainy season lasts, and for as long as the remainder of the half month lasts.🔽It is said that one should keep them for the remainder of the half month alone.

original: gzhan ni zad par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan ni zad par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The remainder of the four months has ended means that the remainder of the half month has not been completed.🔽For that very reason, the Bases of Discipline declares:

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par 'byed pa las dgag dbye byas nas zla ba phyed do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par 'byed pa las dgag dbye byas nas zla ba phyed do zhes gsungs so //
translated: “The invitation ceremony is performed for half a month.”

original: gal te dge slong gis so ga rnams kyi zla ba gcig lus pa de'i @307b sngon rol du zhes bya ba ni dbyar zla ra ba'i sngon rol dpyid zla tha chungs la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: gal te dge slong gis so ga rnams kyi zla ba gcig lus pa de'i @307b sngon rol du zhes bya ba ni dbyar zla ra ba'i sngon rol dpyid zla tha chungs la sogs pa la'o //
translated: If a monk does so before the last month of summer has passed means before the last month of summer, the last month of the rainy season, the month of Kārttika, has passed.

original: dbyar gyi zla ba dag zla ba phyed lus par bya ba'i 'og tu 'chang na zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten na grags pa'i dbyar gyi zla ba bzhi po'i tshad de dag las ston zla tha chungs yar gyi ngos ma tshang ba phyed dang bzhi pa'i tshad bzlas
analyzed: dbyar gyi zla ba dag zla ba phyed lus par bya ba'i 'og tu 'chang na zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten na grags pa'i dbyar gyi zla ba bzhi po'i tshad de dag las ston zla tha chungs yar gyi ngos ma tshang ba phyed dang bzhi pa'i tshad bzlas
translated: If he keeps it after the summer months have been determined, but before the last half month of summer has passed, then he should recite the measure of the four summer months that are well known in the world, subtracting the waning part of the last autumn month, which is one fourth of a half month.

original: te / gal te dus phyi ma zla ba bzhi pa ston zla tha chungs yar gyi ngo dang bcas te 'da' bar byed na de'i tshe 'di las spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: te / gal te dus phyi ma zla ba bzhi pa ston zla tha chungs yar gyi ngo dang bcas te 'da' bar byed na de'i tshe 'di las spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If he lets the last four months of the year, including the waning part of the last autumn month, pass, then he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: pho nya las zhes bya ba ni btsal na nyes byas chung dur shes par bya'o //
analyzed: pho nya las zhes bya ba ni btsal na nyes byas chung dur shes par bya'o //
translated: If he searches for a messenger, he should understand that it is a minor offense.

original: tshol ba sngon du 'gro ba'i rnyed pa 'chang na ni spang ba kho na ste /
analyzed: tshol ba sngon du 'gro ba'i rnyed pa 'chang na ni spang ba kho na ste /
translated: If he keeps the robe after searching for it, he must relinquish it.

original: 'di 'chang ba gtso che'i tshol ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di 'chang ba gtso che'i tshol ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But if he does not search for it, he does not commit an offense.

original: de'i 'og tu 'chang na spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'chang na spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: If he keeps it after that, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: ji tsam du dge slong cung zad shin tu rings par tshol zhing shin tu ring du 'chang na thams cad du spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba 'dzin pa rnams na re tshol ba dang bcas pa'i 'chang ba ltung ba byed ba🔽nyid yin bar bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ji tsam du dge slong cung zad shin tu rings par tshol zhing shin tu ring du 'chang na thams cad du spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba 'dzin pa rnams na re tshol ba dang bcas pa'i 'chang ba ltung ba byed ba nyid yin bar bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so zhes zer ro //
translated: The Vinaya masters say that the Buddha taught that keeping a robe with seeking is a downfall.

original: btsun ba re zhig dge slong gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas mtshan gyur nas /
analyzed: btsun ba re zhig dge slong gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas mtshan gyur nas /
translated: The Blessed One said that if a monk changes sex, he becomes a nun.

original: nyes byas su gsungs pa ni bag tsam 'dra ba la brten ba'i phyir de'i khongs su gtogs par gyur ba ste /
analyzed: nyes byas su gsungs pa ni bag tsam 'dra ba la brten ba'i phyir de'i khongs su gtogs par gyur ba ste /
translated: The statement that it is a misdeed is included in that, because it is based on a slight similarity.

original: 'dul ba mdor bsdus pa las gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dul ba mdor bsdus pa las gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is stated in the Vinaya in brief.

original: 'di ltar dge slong ma rnams la ni rnyed ba chung ba'i phyir dbyar gyi ras chen gyi bslab pa ma bcas pa ma tshang ba ni tshad du mi ldang ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar dge slong ma rnams la ni rnyed ba chung ba'i phyir dbyar gyi ras chen gyi bslab pa ma bcas pa ma tshang ba ni tshad du mi ldang ba ste /
translated: Because nuns have few possessions, the training on the rainy season robe is not prescribed for them.

original: dbyar gyi ras ni srid du khru dgu'o //
analyzed: dbyar gyi ras ni srid du khru dgu'o //
translated: The rainy season robe is nine cubits long.

original: zheng du khru gsum dang sor brgyad kyi tshad yin pas de'i phyir 'di yin no //
analyzed: zheng du khru gsum dang sor brgyad kyi tshad yin pas de'i phyir 'di yin no //
translated: Since it is three cubits and eight finger-widths in width, it is this.🔽In some questions, it is said:

original: zhus pa la la las ni 'di skad du btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis dbyar gyi ras chen rung bam lags ba zhig zla ba phyed dang lnga'i 'og tu 'chang na ni cir 'gyur lags /
analyzed: zhus pa la la las ni 'di skad du btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis dbyar gyi ras chen rung bam lags ba zhig zla ba phyed dang lnga'i 'og tu 'chang na ni cir 'gyur lags /
translated: Venerable, what if a monk keeps a rainy season robe that is not suitable for less than five and a half months?

original: nyes byas so zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: nyes byas so zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: It becomes a misdeed.

original: de la don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:

original: rung ba ma lags pa zhes bya ba ni ma gtogs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rung ba ma lags pa zhes bya ba ni ma gtogs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Not suitable means excluded, and so on.

original: zla ba phyed dang lnga'i 'og ces bya ba ni zla ba gang dag la snga ma zla ba byed yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: zla ba phyed dang lnga'i 'og ces bya ba ni zla ba gang dag la snga ma zla ba byed yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: For less than five and a half months means in those months where the previous month is not a rainy month.

original: zla ba bzhi po phyed dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zla ba bzhi po phyed dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means the four months with the half.

original: des tshol ba'i dus dang bcas pa'i zla ba bzhi po phyed dang bcas pa'i 'og rol @308a * //
analyzed: des tshol ba'i dus dang bcas pa'i zla ba bzhi po phyed dang bcas pa'i 'og rol @308a * //
translated: After those four months with the half, which are the time for seeking,

original: gyi dus su 'chang na rung ba ma yin pa'i phyir nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gyi dus su 'chang na rung ba ma yin pa'i phyir nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because it is not suitable to possess it at that time, it is a wrong action.🔽Also, it is said in another text:

original: gzhan las kyang 'di skad du dbyar gyi ras chen dengs pa zhig zla ba phyed dang lnga'i 'og rol du 'chang na nyes byas so //
analyzed: gzhan las kyang 'di skad du dbyar gyi ras chen dengs pa zhig zla ba phyed dang lnga'i 'og rol du 'chang na nyes byas so //
translated: If one possesses a rainy season cloth after the rainy season retreat for more than five months, it is a wrong action.

original: de bzhin du dbyar gyi ras chen seng ras shig shin tu rings bar tshol na nyes byas so zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbyar gyi ras chen seng ras shig shin tu rings bar tshol na nyes byas so zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Similarly, if one seeks a rainy season cloth made of coarse wool, it is a wrong action.

original: de la don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: dengs pa ni mi sri ba ste zad la thug ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dengs pa ni mi sri ba ste zad la thug ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: A worn out cloth is one that is old and worn out.

original: seng ras ni srab mor btags pa'o //
analyzed: seng ras ni srab mor btags pa'o //
translated: Coarse wool is cloth made of coarse wool.

original: dbyar gyi ras chen gyi spang ba gtan la dbab pa'o /
analyzed: dbyar gyi ras chen gyi spang ba gtan la dbab pa'o /
translated: This is the determination of the rainy season cloth.

original: // / bsdos pa ni dge 'dun la dbul ba'o zhes de ltar nges par byas pas so //
analyzed: // / bsdos pa ni dge 'dun la dbul ba'o zhes de ltar nges par byas pas so //
translated: The term “to offer” means to offer to the Saṅgha.

original: rnyed pa ni gos kyi rnyed pa'o //🔽shes bzhin du bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis rig pa'am /
analyzed: rnyed pa ni gos kyi rnyed pa'o // shes bzhin du bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis rig pa'am /
translated: “Gain” means the gain of cloth.

original: gzhan dag gis bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis bstan pa'o //
translated: “Knowingly” means to know it oneself or to be informed by others.

original: gang zag la bsgyur du 'jug na zhes pa ni sgrub par byed na'o //
analyzed: gang zag la bsgyur du 'jug na zhes pa ni sgrub par byed na'o //
translated: If one causes a person to change, then one causes a person to be established.

original: gang la zhe na bdag la zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gang la zhe na bdag la zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: With regard to whom? It is stated, “with regard to oneself.”

original: bdag nyid la bsgyur du 'jug pa yin gyi gzhan la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid la bsgyur du 'jug pa yin gyi gzhan la ni ma yin no //
translated: One causes oneself to change, not another.

original: de la ni nyes byas su gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la ni nyes byas su gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is stated that there is an offense for the other.

original: bsgyur du 'jug pa ni nyes byas yin la thob nas ni spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de ltar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bsgyur du 'jug pa ni nyes byas yin la thob nas ni spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de ltar shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that causing a change is an offense of wrong conduct, but after obtaining it, it is a downfall of a partially concordant offense.

original: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas mtshan gyur na nyes byas su gsungs pa ni mtshan tha dad pa'i dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa yin pa'i phyir 'di yin te /
analyzed: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas mtshan gyur na nyes byas su gsungs pa ni mtshan tha dad pa'i dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa yin pa'i phyir 'di yin te /
translated: “Venerable, if a fully ordained monk” and so forth states that there is an offense of wrong conduct if one changes sex. This is because the property of the Saṅgha is different from one’s own sex.

original: de bzhin du dge slong ma mtshan gyur ba la'ang de dang 'dra ba kho nar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dge slong ma mtshan gyur ba la'ang de dang 'dra ba kho nar shes par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, it should be understood that if a fully ordained nun changes sex, there is the same offense.

original: gnyi ga'i dge 'dun zhes bya ba ni dge slong gi dge 'dun dang dge slong ma'i dge 'dun no //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i dge 'dun zhes bya ba ni dge slong gi dge 'dun dang dge slong ma'i dge 'dun no //
translated: “The Saṅgha of both” refers to the Saṅgha of monks and the Saṅgha of nuns.

original: de la 'dir gnyis su gsungs pa ni mtshan tha dad pa'i phyir dang / thun mong yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la 'dir gnyis su gsungs pa ni mtshan tha dad pa'i phyir dang / thun mong yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, the two are mentioned because they have different names and are common.

original: gzhan dag na re mdo dang rnam par 'byed pa dang zhus pa dag las dge 'dun nyid kyis khyad par ma smos pa'i phyir bdag nyid la yongs su bsgyur na spang ba kho nar gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re mdo dang rnam par 'byed pa dang zhus pa dag las dge 'dun nyid kyis khyad par ma smos pa'i phyir bdag nyid la yongs su bsgyur na spang ba kho nar gsungs te /
translated: Others say: In the sutras, the Vinaya, and the questions, the Saṅgha itself does not mention distinctions, so if one changes it by oneself, it is said to be a downfall.

original: de'i phyir 'di dang snga ma btsun ba re zhig dge slong gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas mtshan tha dad pa la yang spang ba kho nas brjod par bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dang snga ma btsun ba re zhig dge slong gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas mtshan tha dad pa la yang spang ba kho nas brjod par bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, here and in the previous one, the Venerable One says that even if they have different names, such as the one beginning with “for the time being a monk,” it should be stated as a downfall.

original: bsgyur du 'jug pa'i spang ba gtan la dbab pa'o /
analyzed: bsgyur du 'jug pa'i spang ba gtan la dbab pa'o /
translated: This concludes the determination of the downfall of causing a change.

original: // / phan pa ni mthun pa dag ste /
analyzed: // / phan pa ni mthun pa dag ste /
translated: Beneficial means suitable.

original: nad kyi @308b gnyen por gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: nad kyi @308b gnyen por gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: It means becoming the remedy for a disease.

original: dper na rlung gi gnyen por gyur ba ni til mar ro //
analyzed: dper na rlung gi gnyen por gyur ba ni til mar ro //
translated: For example, sesame oil is the remedy for wind disorders.

original: mkhris pa ni zhun mar ro //
analyzed: mkhris pa ni zhun mar ro //
translated: Clarified butter is for bile disorders.

original: bad kan ni sbrang rtsi'o zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bad kan ni sbrang rtsi'o zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: Phlegm is honey.

original: gang dag ces bya ba 'dis ni sman rnams las gang gi khongs su gtogs pa nyid ston par byed de /
analyzed: gang dag ces bya ba 'dis ni sman rnams las gang gi khongs su gtogs pa nyid ston par byed de /
translated: “Which” indicates the category of medicine.

original: des na sman gang dag bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dul ba las gsungs pa de dag ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: des na sman gang dag bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dul ba las gsungs pa de dag ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, the Blessed One has taught in the Vinaya that those medicines are called “which.”

original: bka' stsal pa ni rab tu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bka' stsal pa ni rab tu bstan pa'o //
translated: “He has declared” means he has taught.

original: sbrang rtsi ni sbrang ma'i sbrang rtsi'o //
analyzed: sbrang rtsi ni sbrang ma'i sbrang rtsi'o //
translated: Honey is bee honey.

original: bu ram gyi lbu ba ni bu ram dang / hvags dang / sha kha ra la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bu ram gyi lbu ba ni bu ram dang / hvags dang / sha kha ra la sogs pa'o //
translated: Sugar candy is sugar cane, molasses, and sugar.

original: rang gis byin gyis brlabs te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rang gis byin gyis brlabs te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Having consecrated it oneself” means

original: lag pa bkrus te byin len byas nas lag pa g-yon par bzhag la lag pa g-yas pas bkab ste /
analyzed: lag pa bkrus te byin len byas nas lag pa g-yon par bzhag la lag pa g-yas pas bkab ste /
translated: having washed one’s hands, having received the food offering, having placed it in the left hand, having covered it with the right hand,

original: dge slong zhig gi mdun du 'dug la snga dro byin gyis brlab pa'i sngags kyis so //
analyzed: dge slong zhig gi mdun du 'dug la snga dro byin gyis brlab pa'i sngags kyis so //
translated: having sat down in front of a monk, having recited the consecration mantra,

original: zhag bdun par zhes bya ba ni zhag bdun pa kho nar ro //
analyzed: zhag bdun par zhes bya ba ni zhag bdun pa kho nar ro //
translated: “for seven days” means for seven days only.

original: gsog 'jog gis yongs su longs spyad pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsog 'jog ni gsog par byed pa ste /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: gsog 'jog gis yongs su longs spyad pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsog 'jog ni gsog par byed pa ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this: Hoarding means to accumulate.

original: sbyin pa dang / len pa dang / sbed pa dang / za ba dang / 'jog pa dang byi dor byed pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang / len pa dang / sbed pa dang / za ba dang / 'jog pa dang byi dor byed pa'o //
translated: It is the act of giving, receiving, hiding, eating, and keeping.

original: 'dis yongs su spyod par byed pa'i phyir de nyid yongs su spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis yongs su spyod par byed pa'i phyir de nyid yongs su spyod pa yin no //
translated: Because one enjoys by means of this, it is called enjoyment.

original: gsog 'jog gis yongs su spyod pa ste /
analyzed: gsog 'jog gis yongs su spyod pa ste /
translated: It is enjoyment by means of hoarding and storing.

original: rang gis byas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang gis byas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means done by oneself.

original: des na yongs su longs spyad bar bya ba ni rang gir byas nas bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: des na yongs su longs spyad bar bya ba ni rang gir byas nas bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, to be enjoyed means to be kept after having been appropriated.

original: de las 'das par yongs su longs spyod par byed na zhes bya ba 'di'i don ni 'chang na zhes bya ba ni yin gyi /
analyzed: de las 'das par yongs su longs spyod par byed na zhes bya ba 'di'i don ni 'chang na zhes bya ba ni yin gyi /
translated: If one enjoys beyond that, etc. means that the meaning of to keep is intended here,

original: za na zhes bya ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: za na zhes bya ba ni ma yin te /
translated: but not the meaning of to eat.

original: spang ba mi srid par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spang ba mi srid par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it would follow, absurdly, that it would be impossible to abandon.

original: btsun pa sman dgung bdun las zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sman mi rung ba ni mi tshil la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: btsun pa sman dgung bdun las zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sman mi rung ba ni mi tshil la sogs pa'o //
translated: Venerable, if it is medicine that is not suitable, such as human fat,

original: mi rung ba dang 'dres pa ni mi tshil la sogs pa dang 'dres pa'o //
analyzed: mi rung ba dang 'dres pa ni mi tshil la sogs pa dang 'dres pa'o //
translated: or if it is mixed with what is not suitable, such as human fat,

original: rung ba la ni byin gyis brlabs pa dang / spang ba nyid yin na de la yang rung ba nyid med pa'i phyir spang ba mi slong ngo //
analyzed: rung ba la ni byin gyis brlabs pa dang / spang ba nyid yin na de la yang rung ba nyid med pa'i phyir spang ba mi slong ngo //
translated: if it is suitable, then it is consecrated and discarded. But if it is not suitable, then it is not discarded.

original: 'o na ji ltar zhag bdun 'das pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar zhag bdun 'das pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Then how is it that it is said to be beyond seven days?

original: la la mi shes pa'am 'das nas @309a * //
analyzed: la la mi shes pa'am 'das nas @309a * //
translated: Some, not knowing, or having passed,

original: kyang byin gyis rlob par byed bas de'i phyir de'i dbang du mdzad nas 'di gsungs par rnam par gnas so //
analyzed: kyang byin gyis rlob par byed bas de'i phyir de'i dbang du mdzad nas 'di gsungs par rnam par gnas so //
translated: consecrate it. Therefore, it is stated from that perspective.

original: spang bar bgyi'am /
analyzed: spang bar bgyi'am /
translated: Should I discard it?

original: nye ba 'khor ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ma shes pas smras par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ma shes pas smras par rig par bya'o //
translated: Upāli, it is not. This should be understood as spoken out of ignorance.

original: 'di ltar mi lta bar spangs pa yang phyir len pa'i dus na lta ba dang bcas nas nyes byas su bshad de /
analyzed: 'di ltar mi lta bar spangs pa yang phyir len pa'i dus na lta ba dang bcas nas nyes byas su bshad de /
translated: Thus, even if it is discarded without looking, when the time comes to take it back, it is explained as a fault with looking.

original: mi lta bar lta ba la lta ba dang bcas na phyed nyid do //
analyzed: mi lta bar lta ba la lta ba dang bcas na phyed nyid do //
translated: If one has sight and looks, one is half.

original: shes bzhin du mi blang ngo zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes bzhin du mi blang ngo zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: One should not accept it knowingly.

original: sog 'jog bgyis pa ni gsog 'jog byas pa'i ltung byed du gtogs so //
analyzed: sog 'jog bgyis pa ni gsog 'jog byas pa'i ltung byed du gtogs so //
translated: Storing is a downfall that requires confession alone.

original: dus las 'da' bar byed na zhes bya ba ni nyi ma'i gung la sogs pa las so //
analyzed: dus las 'da' bar byed na zhes bya ba ni nyi ma'i gung la sogs pa las so //
translated: If one uses it beyond the proper time, means beyond noon and so on.

original: dus su rung ba'i 'bras chan la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dus su rung ba'i 'bras chan la sogs pa ste /
translated: Proper for the time are cooked grains and so on.

original: nyi ma phyed kyi bar dus su spyad par bya ba dag go //
analyzed: nyi ma phyed kyi bar dus su spyad par bya ba dag go //
translated: They are to be used within the proper time, up to noon.

original: thun tshod du rung ba ni rgun chu la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: thun tshod du rung ba ni rgun chu la sogs pa ste /
translated: Proper for a watch is grape juice and so on.

original: thun tshod kyi dus su spang bar bya ba dag go //
analyzed: thun tshod kyi dus su spang bar bya ba dag go //
translated: They are to be used within the proper time, up to a watch.

original: dgung bdun pa ni zhun mar la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dgung bdun pa ni zhun mar la sogs pa ste /
translated: Proper for seven days are butter and so on.

original: zhag bdun gyi bar gyi dus su spyad par bya ba dag go //
analyzed: zhag bdun gyi bar gyi dus su spyad par bya ba dag go //
translated: They are to be used within the proper time, up to seven days.

original: ji srid 'tsho'i bar du bcang ba ni aa ru ra la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ji srid 'tsho'i bar du bcang ba ni aa ru ra la sogs pa ste /
translated: Proper for life are myrobalan and so on.

original: ji srid 'tsho'i bar gyi dus su spyad par bya ba dag go //
analyzed: ji srid 'tsho'i bar gyi dus su spyad par bya ba dag go //
translated: They are to be used within the proper time, up to one’s life.

original: bdag gir bgyid pa byin gyis brlab pa'i sngags med par rang gir byed pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gir bgyid pa byin gyis brlab pa'i sngags med par rang gir byed pa'o //
translated: One makes it one's own without the mantra consecration.

original: gsog 'jog gis yongs su longs spyad pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byin gyis brlabs pa med pa'i phyir gsog 'jog med de /
analyzed: gsog 'jog gis yongs su longs spyad pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byin gyis brlabs pa med pa'i phyir gsog 'jog med de /
translated: Because one uses it by storing it, etc.  means that because there is no consecration, there is no storing.

original: 'di ltar 'di dag byin gyis brlabs pa la gsog 'jog gis yongs su longs spyod pa rjes su gnang gi gzhan dag ni ma yin pas de'i phyir mi rung ngo zhes de skad du gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di dag byin gyis brlabs pa la gsog 'jog gis yongs su longs spyod pa rjes su gnang gi gzhan dag ni ma yin pas de'i phyir mi rung ngo zhes de skad du gsungs so //
translated: Because it is said, In this way, the use of storing is permitted for those who consecrate, but not for others, so it is not suitable.

original: de la byin gyis brlabs pa 'bras bu med pa'i phyir dus su rung ba la byin gyis brlabs pa med mod kyis /
analyzed: de la byin gyis brlabs pa 'bras bu med pa'i phyir dus su rung ba la byin gyis brlabs pa med mod kyis /
translated: In that regard, although there is no consecration of what is suitable for the time because consecration is fruitless,

original: 'on kyang gsog 'jog gis yongs su longs spyod pa'i zhar la 'di dag gi nang du 'dus so //
analyzed: 'on kyang gsog 'jog gis yongs su longs spyod pa'i zhar la 'di dag gi nang du 'dus so //
translated: nevertheless, it is included in this because it is used by storing.

original: re zhig dge slong gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa spangs pa'i byin gyis rlob na nyes byas su gsungs pa ni mi rung ba byin gyis brlab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: re zhig dge slong gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa spangs pa'i byin gyis rlob na nyes byas su gsungs pa ni mi rung ba byin gyis brlab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If a bhikṣu, etc. consecrates what is prohibited, it is said to be a misdeed because it is an unsuitable consecration.

original: byin gyis brlabs nas 'das par zhes bya ba ni gang dang gang gir rang gi dus su thun tshod kyi bar gang yin pa de las 'das par ro //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs nas 'das par zhes bya ba ni gang dang gang gir rang gi dus su thun tshod kyi bar gang yin pa de las 'das par ro //
translated: The phrase having consecrated it, if one passes the time means that one should not pass the time beyond the period of one watch, which is one's own time.

original: 'di nyid bstan pa'i phyir dus su rung ba yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di nyid bstan pa'i phyir dus su rung ba yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In order to teach just this, the root text says, If it is suitable for a certain time, and so on.

original: gal te yongs su spyad na zhes @309b bya ba la sogs pas ltung byed du gsungs pa ni spyad pa'i dus las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te yongs su spyad na zhes @309b bya ba la sogs pas ltung byed du gsungs pa ni spyad pa'i dus las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase if one uses it and so on indicates a downfall because one has passed the time for using it.

original: 'dir yang byin gyis brlabs pa las 'das par zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir yang byin gyis brlabs pa las 'das par zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: Here, the phrase having consecrated it, if one passes the time

original: ji srid 'tsho'i bar du bcad pa ma gtogs pa rnams la shes par bya ste /
analyzed: ji srid 'tsho'i bar du bcad pa ma gtogs pa rnams la shes par bya ste /
translated: means that one should understand that this refers to all the rules except the rule for as long as one lives.

original: de dag la byin gyis brlabs pa las 'das pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la byin gyis brlabs pa las 'das pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is impossible to pass the time of the consecration in regard to those rules.

original: gal te yongs su spyad na zhes bya ba ni ji srid 'tsho'i bar du bcang ba ma gtogs pa rnams kho na la shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te yongs su spyad na zhes bya ba ni ji srid 'tsho'i bar du bcang ba ma gtogs pa rnams kho na la shes par bya'o //
translated: The phrase if one uses it should be understood to refer only to those rules that are to be observed for as long as one lives, except for the rule on keeping medicines.

original: gal te byin gyis rlob na zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyes byas su gsungs pa ni mi rung bar byin gyis rlob par gtogs pa yin no //🔽dge slong ma la nyes byas su gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: gal te byin gyis rlob na zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyes byas su gsungs pa ni mi rung bar byin gyis rlob par gtogs pa yin no // dge slong ma la nyes byas su gsungs pa ni /
translated: The statement that it is a minor offense if one blesses with the thought “If I bless it, it will be suitable” is included in the section on blessing what is unsuitable.

original: gsog 'jog byas pa spyod par gtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: gsog 'jog byas pa spyod par gtogs pa yin te /
translated: The statement that it is a minor offense for a nun is included in the section on using stored goods.🔽Do not eat without receiving it.

original: byin len ma byas bza' mi bya //🔽de bzhin gsog 'jog bza' mi bya //
analyzed: byin len ma byas bza' mi bya // de bzhin gsog 'jog bza' mi bya //
translated: Do not eat stored goods.

original: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is stated in the scriptures.🔽This concludes the section on the seventh-day prohibition.

original: zhag bdun pa'i spang ba gtan la dbab pa'o //
analyzed: zhag bdun pa'i spang ba gtan la dbab pa'o //
translated: The section on the downfalls that require relinquishment is complete.🔽The section on the downfalls that require relinquishment is complete.🔽The section on the downfalls that require relinquishment is complete.🔽The section on the downfalls that require relinquishment is complete.🔽The section on the downfalls that require relinquishment is complete.

original: gzhung bla ma'i tshig dka' ba rnam par bshad pa rigs pa dang / slob dpon mdo sde 'dzin pa dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bkod pa las spang ba'i ltung byed rnams rdzogs so /🔽// / shes bzhin du brdzun smra na zhes bya ba la /🔽shes bzhin ni ma rig pa'i 'du shes nyams su myong ba yin no //🔽brdzun ni don phyin ci log nye bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: gzhung bla ma'i tshig dka' ba rnam par bshad pa rigs pa dang / slob dpon mdo sde 'dzin pa dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bkod pa las spang ba'i ltung byed rnams rdzogs so / // / shes bzhin du brdzun smra na zhes bya ba la / shes bzhin ni ma rig pa'i 'du shes nyams su myong ba yin no // brdzun ni don phyin ci log nye bar ston pa'o //
