original: smra ba ni brjod pa ste /
analyzed: smra ba ni brjod pa ste /
translated: The section on the downfalls that require relinquishment is complete.🔽The section on the downfalls that require relinquishment is complete.

original: shes bzhin du don gzhan du rnam par gsang ba la slu ba la sogs pa'i ched du gzhan du brjod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shes bzhin du don gzhan du rnam par gsang ba la slu ba la sogs pa'i ched du gzhan du brjod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said that one speaks in a way that is different from the meaning that one intends, in order to deceive others, with the intention of concealing something.

original: de'i phyir brdzun gyi ngo bo smra ba ni brdzun smra ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir brdzun gyi ngo bo smra ba ni brdzun smra ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the nature of lying is speaking falsely.🔽Lying with full awareness is lying with full awareness.

original: shes bzhin gyi brdzun smra ba ni shes bzhin du brdzun smra ba ste drug par tshig bsdu ba'o //🔽de'i phyir zhes gtan gyi lnga pa yin no //
analyzed: shes bzhin gyi brdzun smra ba ni shes bzhin du brdzun smra ba ste drug par tshig bsdu ba'o // de'i phyir zhes gtan gyi lnga pa yin no //
translated: The sixth case is used to indicate the reason for this.🔽Since it is a downfall for others as well, the text specifies, “if you lie to them.”

original: gzhan la yang ltung byed du gyur pas de'i phyir brdzun smra na zhes khyad par du byas te 'og ma dag la yang ci rigs par de kho na bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan la yang ltung byed du gyur pas de'i phyir brdzun smra na zhes khyad par du byas te 'og ma dag la yang ci rigs par de kho na bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: The same should be understood for the rest, as appropriate.

original: bslab pa phul ba zhes brjod par bgyi'am /
analyzed: bslab pa phul ba zhes brjod par bgyi'am /
translated: “Should I say that I have offered back my training?”

original: nye ba 'khor ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Upāli, it is not.

original: bslab pa 'bul ba'i bsam pa med pa'i phyir 'dir gsungs te /
analyzed: bslab pa 'bul ba'i bsam pa med pa'i phyir 'dir gsungs te /
translated: This is stated here because there is no intention to offer back one’s training.

original: 'di la nyams par rjod par byed pa dgos kyi tshig gi khyad par ni ma yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la nyams par rjod par byed pa dgos kyi tshig gi khyad par ni ma yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said that this is called a downfall, not a special word.

original: mi smra ba ni cang mi smra ba'o //
analyzed: mi smra ba ni cang mi smra ba'o //
translated: Not speaking is to remain silent.

original: khas len na zhes bya ba ni khas len par @310a * //
analyzed: khas len na zhes bya ba ni khas len par @310a * //
translated: If one admits is if one agrees.

original: byed na'o // brdzun smra ba'i ltung byed gtan la dbab pa'o /🔽// / mi'i skyon nas smra ba ni mi'i yon tan rigs dang gzugs la sogs pa brjod par 'dod pas dman pa nyid brjod par bgyid na zhes bya ba ni tha snyad 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: byed na'o // brdzun smra ba'i ltung byed gtan la dbab pa'o / // / mi'i skyon nas smra ba ni mi'i yon tan rigs dang gzugs la sogs pa brjod par 'dod pas dman pa nyid brjod par bgyid na zhes bya ba ni tha snyad 'dogs pa'o //
translated: This is the topic of the downfall of lying.🔽Speaking of the faults of a human is to speak of the inferiority of a human who is a monk, wishing to speak of his good qualities, such as his caste and form.

original: re zhig dge slong zhes bya ba la sogs pas mtshan gyur na nyes byas su gsungs pa ni mtshan tha dad pa'i skyon nas smra bar gtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: re zhig dge slong zhes bya ba la sogs pas mtshan gyur na nyes byas su gsungs pa ni mtshan tha dad pa'i skyon nas smra bar gtogs pa yin no //
translated: The statement that if one changes sex, it is an offense of wrong conduct, and so on, is included in speaking of the faults of a human with a different sex.

original: za ma dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la kha cig ni dge slong ma'i mi'i skyon nas smra na ltung byed du 'dod do //
analyzed: za ma dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la kha cig ni dge slong ma'i mi'i skyon nas smra na ltung byed du 'dod do //
translated: Some assert that if one speaks of the faults of a human who is a fully ordained nun, it is a downfall.

original: de dag gi bsam pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: de dag gi bsam pa 'di yin te /
translated: This is their thought.

original: za ma dbang po med pa yin la /
analyzed: za ma dbang po med pa yin la /
translated: The faculties of the neuter are incomplete.

original: de'i yan lag skyes ni bcad pa la sogs pas nyams pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i yan lag skyes ni bcad pa la sogs pas nyams pa bzhin no //
translated: The neuter is like one whose limbs are incomplete, due to castration and so on.

original: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di ji srid cig tu 'gyur ba mi bsten pa 'di srid du bskrad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di ji srid cig tu 'gyur ba mi bsten pa 'di srid du bskrad par mi bya'o //
translated: The Bhagavån has said, “As long as he does not take up the neuter state, he should not be expelled.

original: nam zhig 'gyur ba de'i tshe ni bskrad par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: nam zhig 'gyur ba de'i tshe ni bskrad par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: When he takes up the neuter state, he should be expelled.”

original: 'dis ni ji srid du 'gyur ba mi bsten pa de srid du dge slong yin la dge slong nyid yin na yang nga 'di la dge slong gzhan bzhin du rigs par ltung ba rnams 'byung ngo zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni ji srid du 'gyur ba mi bsten pa de srid du dge slong yin la dge slong nyid yin na yang nga 'di la dge slong gzhan bzhin du rigs par ltung ba rnams 'byung ngo zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: This means that as long as he does not take up the neuter state, he is a bhikṣu. And if he is a bhikṣu, then like other bhikṣus, downfalls occur for him.

original: gzhan dag ni khyad par khas ma blangs par spyir ji ltar ma ning dang mtshan gnyis pa dag sdom pa dang sdom pa ma yin pa'i zhing nyid ma yin pa ltar 'di dang 'dra bar khyim pa lta bur 'dod do //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni khyad par khas ma blangs par spyir ji ltar ma ning dang mtshan gnyis pa dag sdom pa dang sdom pa ma yin pa'i zhing nyid ma yin pa ltar 'di dang 'dra bar khyim pa lta bur 'dod do //
translated: Others say: Without accepting a distinction, in general, just as a eunuch and a hermaphrodite are not fields of vows and of immorality, so too this one is like a layperson.

original: de bas na ji ltar 'di dag zhing nyid ma yin zhing tha snyad du rung ba ma yin pa ltar za ma yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de bas na ji ltar 'di dag zhing nyid ma yin zhing tha snyad du rung ba ma yin pa ltar za ma yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Therefore, just as they are not fields and are not suitable for conventional vows, so too are eunuchs.

original: de'i phyir 'di sdom pa ma skyes pa dang 'dra bar rnam par gzhag pa shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di sdom pa ma skyes pa dang 'dra bar rnam par gzhag pa shes par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that this is posited as similar to a vow that has not arisen.

original: ji ltar dge slong ma sun 'byin pa la sogs pa'i mi'i skyon nas smra na ltung ba chung du byed pa nyid yin pa ltar 'di yang de dang 'dra'o snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar dge slong ma sun 'byin pa la sogs pa'i mi'i skyon nas smra na ltung ba chung du byed pa nyid yin pa ltar 'di yang de dang 'dra'o snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Just as it is a minor offense to speak of the faults of a human, such as a monk who is a corrupter of families, so too is this.

original: mi'i skyon nas smra ba'i ltung byed gtan la dbab pa'o /
analyzed: mi'i skyon nas smra ba'i ltung byed gtan la dbab pa'o /
translated: This is the conclusion of the downfall of speaking of the faults of a human.

original: // / dge slong phra ma byed pa ni dbye ba'i bsam pas dge slong gi yul la khyod la dge slong che ge mo 'di zhes bya bas 'di dang 'di smras so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: // / dge slong phra ma byed pa ni dbye ba'i bsam pas dge slong gi yul la khyod la dge slong che ge mo 'di zhes bya bas 'di dang 'di smras so zhes zer ro //
translated: A monk who creates discord speaks to a monk, “This monk so and so said this and that to you with the intention of dividing you.”

original: gzhung rgyas par ni pho nya las zhes bya ba la sogs ba'o //
analyzed: gzhung rgyas par ni pho nya las zhes bya ba la sogs ba'o //
translated: The extensive text is “through a messenger” and so on.

original: phra ma'i ltung byed gtan la dbab pa'o /
analyzed: phra ma'i ltung byed gtan la dbab pa'o /
translated: This is the conclusion of the downfall of creating discord.

original: // / chos bzhin du zhes bya ba ni chos dang mthun par ro //
analyzed: // / chos bzhin du zhes bya ba ni chos dang mthun par ro //
translated: “In accordance with the Dharma” means in accordance with the Teaching.

original: rtsod par ni 'gyed pa dang / mi gdams pa dang / ltung ba dang bya ba'i rtsod pa zhes bya ba bzhi po @310b 'thab pa'i byed rgyu dag go //
analyzed: rtsod par ni 'gyed pa dang / mi gdams pa dang / ltung ba dang bya ba'i rtsod pa zhes bya ba bzhi po @310b 'thab pa'i byed rgyu dag go //
translated: “Quarrel” means the four kinds of disputes: disputes about the Vinaya, disputes about the Teaching, disputes about the person, and disputes about the practice.

original: sbyangs ba ni nye bar zhi bar byas so //
analyzed: sbyangs ba ni nye bar zhi bar byas so //
translated: “To settle” means to pacify.

original: yang las kyi skyo sngogs byed pa ni yang las byed bas sngar byas pa'i las spong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang las kyi skyo sngogs byed pa ni yang las byed bas sngar byas pa'i las spong bar byed pa'o //
translated: “To reopen a case” means to reject a previously decided case by deciding it again.

original: gzhan dag na re legs par ma byas par brjod pa'o zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re legs par ma byas par brjod pa'o zer ro //
translated: Others say: It means to express it as not well done.

original: gzhan dag na re 'di ltar yang las kyi skyo sngogs byed pa zhes bya ba ni yang las byed du 'jug pa'o zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis mngon sum du mdo'i rnam par bshad pa'i phyir rang gi blo gros kyi dbugs kyis bshad pa ni don med do zhes
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'di ltar yang las kyi skyo sngogs byed pa zhes bya ba ni yang las byed du 'jug pa'o zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis mngon sum du mdo'i rnam par bshad pa'i phyir rang gi blo gros kyi dbugs kyis bshad pa ni don med do zhes
translated: Others say: The Blessed One himself explained the meaning of “to reopen a case” in the sutra: “To reopen a case means to make someone do a deed again.” Therefore, the explanation by the power of our own intellect is meaningless.

original: zer ro // re zhig dge slong gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas mtshan gyur na nyes byas su gsungs pa ni mchan gyur pa'i rtsod pa la skyo sngogs byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zer ro // re zhig dge slong gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas mtshan gyur na nyes byas su gsungs pa ni mchan gyur pa'i rtsod pa la skyo sngogs byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement First, if a fully ordained monk changes sex, it is an offense is for the purpose of discouraging disputes with those who have changed sex.

original: dge slong ma mtshan gyur pa la yang de dang 'dra bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma mtshan gyur pa la yang de dang 'dra bar shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the same applies to fully ordained nuns who change sex.

original: rtsod pa chos bzhin du sbyangs pa ni las ma nyams pa dang / dge slong dag las de'i tshad du tshang ba nyid dang las byed pa tshul khrims dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa chos bzhin no //
analyzed: rtsod pa chos bzhin du sbyangs pa ni las ma nyams pa dang / dge slong dag las de'i tshad du tshang ba nyid dang las byed pa tshul khrims dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa chos bzhin no //
translated: If a dispute is resolved according to the Dharma, it is not impaired in terms of action, the fully ordained monks are complete in terms of the number required for the action, the fully ordained monks performing the action are ethical, and so on. It is according to the Dharma.

original: bzlog pa ni chos bzhin ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa ni chos bzhin ma yin pa'o //
translated: The opposite is not according to the Dharma.

original: rtsod pa'i chos bzhin du ma sbyangs pa yin la nyes byas su gsungs pa ni chos bzhin ma yin pas nye bar zhi bar byas ba yang nye bar zhi ba nyid yin pas yang de la skyo sngogs byed pa bkag pa'i phyir te chos bzhin ma yin pas
analyzed: rtsod pa'i chos bzhin du ma sbyangs pa yin la nyes byas su gsungs pa ni chos bzhin ma yin pas nye bar zhi bar byas ba yang nye bar zhi ba nyid yin pas yang de la skyo sngogs byed pa bkag pa'i phyir te chos bzhin ma yin pas
translated: If a dispute is not resolved according to the Dharma, it is said to be an offense. Resolving according to the Dharma is also resolving, so engaging in that dispute again is prohibited, because it is not according to the Dharma.

original: nye bar zhi ba la yang skyo sngogs mi bya'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar zhi ba la yang skyo sngogs mi bya'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And do not be discouraged about complete peace.

original: khyim pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di la ni rtsod ba ni spyir 'thab pa tsam yin no //
analyzed: khyim pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di la ni rtsod ba ni spyir 'thab pa tsam yin no //
translated: In this case, “laypeople” and so on means simply quarreling in general.

original: skyo sngogs byed pa'i ltung byed gtan la dbab pa'o /
analyzed: skyo sngogs byed pa'i ltung byed gtan la dbab pa'o /
translated: This is the analysis of the downfall of discouraging someone.

original: // / tshig lnga 'am drug las lhag pa ni tshig drug ba'i ched kyi tshig dang / tshig lnga pa'i tshad kyi tshig las lhag pa ste /
analyzed: // / tshig lnga 'am drug las lhag pa ni tshig drug ba'i ched kyi tshig dang / tshig lnga pa'i tshad kyi tshig las lhag pa ste /
translated: More than five or six words means more than six words in a statement and more than five words in a verse.

original: de la tshig drug pa ni dper na mig mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: de la tshig drug pa ni dper na mig mi rtag pa'o //
translated: A six-word statement is, for example, “The eye is impermanent.

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: The ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind are impermanent.”

original: tshig lnga pa ni gzugs mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: tshig lnga pa ni gzugs mi rtag pa'o //
translated: A five-word statement is, for example, “Form is impermanent.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: Feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are impermanent.”

original: rig pa'i skyes pa ni khong du chud cing skad brda phrad pa'i skyes pa ste /
analyzed: rig pa'i skyes pa ni khong du chud cing skad brda phrad pa'i skyes pa ste /
translated: A man who understands is a man who is capable of communication.

original: de dang nye bas bag 'khums pa nyid kyis gnas ngan len smra ba'i go skabs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang nye bas bag 'khums pa nyid kyis gnas ngan len smra ba'i go skabs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the opportunity for the practice of sexual misconduct is absent due to the absence of women and the absence of desire for them.

original: pho nya las zhes bya ba ni blo ma byang ba'am rung ba ma yin pa las so //
analyzed: pho nya las zhes bya ba ni blo ma byang ba'am rung ba ma yin pa las so //
translated: “Through a messenger” means through an unrefined or unsuitable messenger.

original: gzhan dag na re bud med las so zhes zer ro //🔽de lta yin te pho nya skyes bu @311a * //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re bud med las so zhes zer ro // de lta yin te pho nya skyes bu @311a * //
translated: Others say: “Through a woman.”

original: nyid du grub na yang rig pa'i skyes bu zhas smos pa don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyid du grub na yang rig pa'i skyes bu zhas smos pa don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then even if the messenger is established as a man, it would be meaningless to say “a man who knows.”

original: gzhan dag na re pho nya smos pa ni bshad pa 'phangs pa gsungs par zad de /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re pho nya smos pa ni bshad pa 'phangs pa gsungs par zad de /
translated: Others say: “The mention of a messenger is just a rhetorical flourish.

original: 'di yan lag ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'di yan lag ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: This is not a subsidiary penance.”

original: rung ba bgyi ba ni rig pa'i skyes pa'o //
analyzed: rung ba bgyi ba ni rig pa'i skyes pa'o //
translated: “A man who knows” means a man who is suitable.

original: dben pa la dben par 'du shes pa ni rig pa'i skyes pa med na bud med yod du zin kyang dben pa yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: dben pa la dben par 'du shes pa ni rig pa'i skyes pa med na bud med yod du zin kyang dben pa yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: “One who perceives solitude as solitude” means that even if there is a woman, if there is no man who knows, it should be understood as solitude.

original: bud med dang lhan cig tu dben pa'i skyabs yod pa na zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bud med dang lhan cig tu dben pa'i skyabs yod pa na zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it says, “in a secluded place with a woman.”

original: re zhig dge slong gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas mtshan gyur na ltung ba med par gsungs pa ni nyes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: re zhig dge slong gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas mtshan gyur na ltung ba med par gsungs pa ni nyes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement that there is no offense if the gender of a fully ordained monk changes and so on means that there is no fault.

original: 'di ltar gal te dge slong ma bud med la chos ston par byed na mi mthun pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te dge slong ma bud med la chos ston par byed na mi mthun pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, if a fully ordained monk teaches Dharma to a woman, there is no offense because there is no incompatibility.

original: dge slong ma rnams rig pa'i skyes pa med par bud med la chos ston par byed pa ni ltung ba 'ga' yang ma mchis kyi /
analyzed: dge slong ma rnams rig pa'i skyes pa med par bud med la chos ston par byed pa ni ltung ba 'ga' yang ma mchis kyi /
translated: There is no offense if fully ordained nuns teach Dharma to women without a male present.

original: 'di rnams dge slong ma zla med par skyes pa la chos ston na mi'i chos bla mar gyur pa brjod pa dang / lhan cig nyal ba la sogs pa'i ltung ba rnams kyang bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa'i gang zag bzhin du 'di la lta bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams dge slong ma zla med par skyes pa la chos ston na mi'i chos bla mar gyur pa brjod pa dang / lhan cig nyal ba la sogs pa'i ltung ba rnams kyang bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa'i gang zag bzhin du 'di la lta bar shes par bya'o //
translated: If they teach Dharma to men without a fully ordained nun, they should understand that they commit the downfall of engaging in conduct unbecoming a human being, sleeping in the same place as men and so on, just as a person who has not completed the approach to the vows would.

original: 'di nyid kyi rjes su 'brangs te 'di'i gsog 'jog byas pa dang blangs pa dang / phyis blangs pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de gzhan rang bzhin du gnas pa la mi 'byung ngo zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi rjes su 'brangs te 'di'i gsog 'jog byas pa dang blangs pa dang / phyis blangs pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de gzhan rang bzhin du gnas pa la mi 'byung ngo zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the same is true of the accumulation and storage of this, the taking of it, and the taking of it later.

original: gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa za ma zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyes byas su gsungs pa ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad las 'das pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa za ma zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyes byas su gsungs pa ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad las 'das pa'i phyir te /
translated: The statement that it is an offense of wrong conduct to eat with a person who has not completed the preliminary purification, and so on, is for the sake of transcending worldly convention.

original: ma ning la sogs pa la yang de dang 'dra bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ma ning la sogs pa la yang de dang 'dra bar shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the same is true of a person who is a eunuch, and so on.

original: dge slong ma sun phyung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas ltung byed du gsungs pa ni bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa kho na'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge slong ma sun phyung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas ltung byed du gsungs pa ni bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa kho na'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement that it is a downfall that requires confession alone for eating with a person who has been ejected from the order, and so on, is because of the person’s not having completed the preliminary purification.

original: dge 'dun gyi dbyen bgyid ba zhes bgyi ba la sogs pas nyes byas su gsungs pas chos la ma gus pa yongs su spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi dbyen bgyid ba zhes bgyi ba la sogs pas nyes byas su gsungs pas chos la ma gus pa yongs su spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement that it is an offense of wrong conduct to cause a division in the order, and so on, is for the sake of abandoning disrespect for the Dharma.

original: de nyid du dge slong dge slong ma dang 'don na nyes byas su 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid du dge slong dge slong ma dang 'don na nyes byas su 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: If a fully ordained monk recites the scriptures with a fully ordained nun, it is explained that he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis dge slong ma dang mgrin gcig tu chos 'don par bgyid na zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyes byas su gsungs ba ni bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i phyir mgrin pa snyoms te tshig 'don par byed na ltung byed de /
analyzed: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis dge slong ma dang mgrin gcig tu chos 'don par bgyid na zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyes byas su gsungs ba ni bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i phyir mgrin pa snyoms te tshig 'don par byed na ltung byed de /
translated: The statement that it is an offense of wrong conduct for a fully ordained monk to recite the scriptures with a fully ordained nun and so on, means that if they recite the scriptures with equal voices, it is a downfall.

original: 'di ltar 'don du gzhug pa dang / 'don du 'byung ba ma gus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'don du gzhug pa dang / 'don du 'byung ba ma gus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the one who is made to recite and the one who recites lack respect.

original: gus pa nyams pa yongs su spang ba'i bsnyams na bsnyen par ma rdzogs @311b pas ma gus pa byas pa yang ma gus pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: gus pa nyams pa yongs su spang ba'i bsnyams na bsnyen par ma rdzogs @311b pas ma gus pa byas pa yang ma gus pa kho na yin no //
translated: If they recite with respect, then even if a fully ordained nun acts disrespectfully, it is not disrespect.

original: de bzhin du dge slong ma la dge slong dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang tshul 'di nyid yin no zhus pa las 'di skad du dge slong gis dge slong las tshig re re nas chos 'don du stsal na cir 'gyur lags /
analyzed: de bzhin du dge slong ma la dge slong dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang tshul 'di nyid yin no zhus pa las 'di skad du dge slong gis dge slong las tshig re re nas chos 'don du stsal na cir 'gyur lags /
translated: This is stated in the Kṣudraka Collection: “If a fully ordained monk recites the Dharma word for word with a fully ordained monk, what is the offense?”🔽“It is an offense of wrong conduct.”

original: nyes byas so zhes 'byung ste 'dir yang tshul ni bshad ma thag pa 'di nyid yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: nyes byas so zhes 'byung ste 'dir yang tshul ni bshad ma thag pa 'di nyid yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that this is the method explained immediately above.

original: dge slob ma la sogs pas bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang mgrin pa snyoms te chos 'don pa khyim pa dang yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: dge slob ma la sogs pas bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang mgrin pa snyoms te chos 'don pa khyim pa dang yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that a female novice and so on reciting the Dharma with a layperson who is not fully ordained and who is not equal in status is a downfall.

original: 'og ma gnas ngan len rjod pa la yang de dang 'dra bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'og ma gnas ngan len rjod pa la yang de dang 'dra bar shes par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as similar to the offense of reciting with a degenerate monk.

original: 'don pa'i ltung byed gtan la dbab pa'o /
analyzed: 'don pa'i ltung byed gtan la dbab pa'o /
translated: This is the definitive conclusion on the downfall of reciting.

original: // / bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gnas ngan len ni ngo bo nyid dang kun nas slong ba dang gi nyon mongs pa can te /
analyzed: // / bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gnas ngan len ni ngo bo nyid dang kun nas slong ba dang gi nyon mongs pa can te /
translated: Reciting with one who is not fully ordained and so on means reciting with a degenerate monk who is afflicted by the nature of the affliction and its motivation.

original: pham pa dang dge 'dun lhag ma'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: pham pa dang dge 'dun lhag ma'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the meaning of the words “defeat” and “residual fault.”
